Review_Content: This place is very nice to stay; close to the railway station. The owners are the best and will help you with all your questions. We would definitely recommend this place! We were there during teej festival; there is a place in the neighbourhood where you can celebrate.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Higher floors Corner suites are large and sunny

Review_Content: The staff was very nice. But the rooms are a nightmare. It wouldn't be SO bad if they simply cleaned. Rooms smelled like a sewer. Bed sheets had holes and were brown with use. The doors are odd too; they don't seem very secure.

We were here for a weekend with college friends. The place matched our requirements as it was remote (3+ kms from main road) and there is a natural waterfall on the side of the resort itself. That was the only good thing. Everything else was poor to terrible.1) Customer Service - very poor. There was no proper response for any requests. Everything arrived late or never.2) Cottages - not at all maintained. Rooms were not cleaned and bathroom had no soap but a stinking bath towel.3) Food was the worst part of it. Even coffee and tea was tasting really horrible. Everything was made just enough and of below average taste.Overall I do not recommend this place to anyone. Even if you want to booze out a weekend; unless the food and place to sleep is not good; you can't enjoy it. Stay away from this resort.

A decent place to hangout. Food is not all that great!! Leeches all around!! But the waterfall inside the area was the best part of the stay. Frequent power cut problems. Not to improve a lot. But can be made into a fantastic one. Staff are very nice. Price is quite affordable. + : Waterfall and location- : FOOD!!!

I had been to this place in July '14 for my first anniversary after seeing reviews in tripadvisor. It was on 4.5 stars then and at the time of writing this review; it has dropped to 4. Reason being; there is nothing great about this place. The accommodation is average; with lots of cobwebs in the ceiling. I first took the wood house for the first night & then shifted to the Bamboo house for the second because I didn't like the wood house. But the Bamboo house too turned out to be a dampener.The saving grace was the waterfall in the property & the excellent food served there. Apart from these things; I would suggest you to look at alternate resorts.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Don't even think about the honeymoon suite.

Review_Content: I will not recommend this for family trip .I choose this resort based on the rating from Tripadvisor but it is surely over rated .There was no security;no reception and not even proper staffs. Rooms were below average (Twin Cottage ) and not even having proper storage space and a ceiling fan . We checked in on a Sunday and checked out on a Monday . Since majority of their rooms were vacant they didn't prepare buffet food for us and prepared separate food which I will rate as below average .Only good thing about this resort is the waterfall which is passing through the plantation area.But I will not recommend anyone to choose this resort only for that Waterfall.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: I will not recommend this resort

Review_Title: “Not as good as review on TripAdvisor..”
Review_Content: I and wife had booked 2 night and 3 day stay. It was raining all the time. The resort is around couple of kilometres to the top from main road. They will take you in their Jeep. Food was very very basic. Plain rice; daal; chapathi and sabzi which looked like daal. Since it was raining lot of leeches around the resort. Had to be careful all the while. People were friendly and very nice.But seriously nothing great to write about it. Place looked mostly empty. Advice: pay bit more and go for vythri village; vythri resort or any other established ones..

The resort has a fantastic location - right in the middle of hundreds of acres of coffee plantations and forest. To reach the hotel; you have to travel 3.5 Kms on a dirt road; meant for SUVs / four-wheelers. Wild elephants often cross this dirt road and the management advises guests to return while there is daylight (which was 6.00 pm in May). The flip side is that you are forced to have dinner at the hotel which has limited fare; depending on the occupancy. The resort has a waterfall (tiny in May) within the resort premises. Surprisingly for a coffee plantation resort; the coffee served was hardly worth mentioning! The staff; while keen to help; requires training and has limited language range (unless you are familiar with a South Indian language!).Feedback for management: Need to train the staff on housekeeping (had to ask for towels - and when they were provided; had to ask once again for toiletaries which are pathetic for the room charges). Need to improve the quality of meals compared to the charges (Rs 200 per person for dinner) - excellent breakfast provided.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: If you like to sleep with a background noise of a falling water; choose cottages B1 / B2. If you are...

Review_Content: Had been to Coffea Aroma resort the first weekend of May and stayed for two nights in the Bamboo cottage.The resort lies inside a coffee estate and gives you this very good feel about being amidst nature. The Bamboo cottage added to this feel.Staff is very courteous. All you have to do is ask and they will be ready to help you out. It rained heavily one of the evenings we were there and we were served hot onion Pakodas on request. Dinner and breakfast were also very delicious. Limited variety; but tasty nonetheless. What more would you expect of a resort in the middle of the forest.The resort is about 4 kms away from the main road saw mill stop. The road to get to the estate is unpaved and a little adventurous. Might be difficult to do this stretch during peak monsoons; But on regular days; even a Maruti 800 would be able to do it without breaking a sweat. In case you are the type who wouldn't want to drive there; they will arrange for their jeep to pick you up and also provide for a parking spot near the main road.There is a stream running right next to the resort which would be an amazing sight to watch during peak monsoons. Water levels weren't really high when we were there as the monsoon hadn't set in yet.They also have a small open area with Carroms; TT and Shuttle cock to play with and a small trampoline for the kids. They also have a natural pool formed by the water from the stream.Perfect getaway from the city hustle.

Visited in end april'14. Very friendly staff and excellent food. They try to accomodate your requests for specific menu too. Set inside the coffee estate; and beside the water falls (though the water level was very low when I visited); this place is certainly for those who want to get away from the bustling city. Rooms are average and needs some maintenance; but they make it up with their excellent hospitality. Tips: It is 2-3 km inside the estate from main road and I had a tough time driving inside (boards are not well placed). The resort can arrange a safe parking on the main road and drive you to the suites by jeep. Use directions given by the resort website. I used Google maps which took me through a treacherous road.

It was an amazing experience at the Coffea resort with loved once.The refuge is located center of the coffee estate and forest with nature; music (by birds and wind flow through the trees). Nice and low water fall besides to the refugesFood was decent and tasty. And the service is fair and reliable.Ultimately; it was a memorable trip.

I had been to this resort for 3 days trip. it is awesome with lovely rooms and the service. Food was very good which was not expected. Employees of resort was very good and honest. Resort was located in between the coffee estate with colorful and pleasant nature.Service; Food and nature was very good. Thanks to Coffea Aroma Team.

Came for a weekend getaway with friends. It was a bit hard to find the place since sign board to turn off the main road was small; but a friend had come here before so he remembered the timber yard which was used as a waypoint. The resort is about 3km off the main road and in middle of coffee plantations. You might have trouble bringing smaller cars since the road leading to resort from main road is not paved.Once you reach the resort the good stuff begins. Resort is very peaceful and in middle of nature with a waterfall very close to it. The service from the staff is commendable; they did not hesitate to accommodate any of our requests. The rooms are fairly large but the quality is average but thats what you want staying at a place like this. Bathrooms were clean and hot water is available. Each cottage is placed at a distance from others so privacy is not a problem. They have a common area with some games to play like table tennis etc.Food was amazing!!! The staff was very happy to provide us with any dishes that we asked for.This would be my recommendation if you want to plan for a lazy getaway from civilization.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Get rooms next to waterfall and stream. The sound of water flowing itself is very soothing.

Review_Content: If you want to realx amidst greenery with nature all around in Wayanad; this is the place. We did a very last minute booking and got 2 huts very near to the waterfall - Note that they have a very beautiful waterfall inside their campus. From the main road; their resort is around 2.5 kms inside which is a beautiful and adventourous drive. Please dont expect this to be very luxourious - but you will get much better than what you expect for the price you pay. The staff is super awesome and always ready to help. The room service is also too good. We actually spent most of our time in the resort when we were in wayanad.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Rooms next to the waterfall are nice

Review_Content: I would recommend coffea aroma to anyone who wishes to escape to the blissful silence and beauty of mother nature! Every body in our group loved the experience and wish to go back once again. We were also quite impressed with the service and hospitality of the staff. However; the road to get there is a bit tough; but worth it!

Review_Title: “a very peaceful place to spend time :)”
Review_Content: i have been to many a place in wayanad and coffea aroma is one of the best there. the best feature is that the place is very peaceful. the food and rooms are good too. Sadly the waterfall was so not lovely because there was very less water. overall a good place and i would suggest.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: honeymoon or wood house!!!

Review_Content: Stayed in the wood house for 2 nights in Dec 2013 with family (including 2 kids 9 and 7). Approach from main road is rough so it is better to park your car in the church premise by the main road (the SUVs can take it easily). The pros-+ Resort facility is very good including the picturesque stream and small waterfall; play area with the trampoline (a hit with my kids); table tennis; carom; string tennis & shuttle; and watch tower and lots and lots of trees in the coffee plantations.+ wood house was well built with a sit out offering good privacy for peaceful reading on the porch or even meditation :)+ Akhil was very friendly and even showed the pets in the facility (dogs; birds) to my kids.+ There seems to be a good spa but we could not use it. You will have to plan ahead and book the service so that the management could arrange for the spa treatment accordingly. + The pick up and drop service in a Mahindra jeep from / to resort & church on the main road (about 3 KM) is dependable and well organized by the management.The cons-- Food was very average and the tables in the café could be kept cleaner.- The natural pool formed by the stream is clean but has a few mosquitos so beware. We spent an hour by the falls (there are 3 levels of the falls) and my kids enjoyed playing under the falls.- Prices of beverages are a tad higher so bring in your beverages including bottled water.- if you decide to spend the entire day in the resort lunch options are limited.Places we visited- Close to Pookut lake (less than 20KM); banasura dam (35KM). Overall - a great place to peacefully spend 2 days of your vacation.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Wood house is where we stayed;

Review_Content: We chose Coffee Aroma Resort for our stay just before xmas 2013.Coffee Aroma is a picture perfect resort in the midst of acres of coffee plantations and greenery.The resort has a beautiful n small waterfall which is captivating.Even if you don't go out for sight seeing; you can spend your days here.The staff are very courteous and amicable.They serve excellent food.Kids can play indoor n outdoor games.Our only regret was we could not spend much time at the resort.

Seeing many reviews we decided to go to Coffea Aroma; unfortunately it turned out to be a nightmare to spend a single night in one of claimed best cottage-The Honeymoon Cottage!It was the most expensive out of all they had on offer on their website. The room was extremely dirty and damp; the ceiling which must be originally white had turned black with fungal growth which resulted in a strong damp smell in the cottage and it was impossible to stay inside even for couple of minutes. Room spray did not help with the smell. There was a thin carpet which has never seen a laundry ever and had it is own addition of dust and aroma to add the cottage's cleanliness. The basic hygine and room service was poor. The outlet from the only wash basin leaked all the over the floor. The bedsheets and blankets were smelly and dirty!!!!!!Though the location was nice one could not enjoy because of inadequate maintenance and cleanliness. It was definitley not worth the money charged by the resort managers!Sorry! We cannot be more positive about the place. (We even have pictures taken of the dirty cottage.)

It was an amazing experience and I will try to explain it to the best of my abilities.First of all this resort is located very close to Chembra Peak and in the midst of the coffee plantation and greenery located there and they have all sorts of rooms here..Twin Cottages; Bamboo Suite and many many more...and the staff here is just amazing.. room service is just so spot on..and the place is magnificent in itself..The scenery is just amazing ..and it is indeed one of the best resorts ever..and the Manager Akhil is a wonderful man..always ready to lend a helping hand..If you are going to wayanad then this is the place to be..

1)Place is very good; in the midst of nature.Greenery all round;Loved the place absolutely.2) Rooms are well maintained.3)Staff members are very courteous and friendly.4)Good value for money.5)Food was good.We were non keralites and the staff over there took out their time at night to leave us to the right place for boarding our return journey. Akhil and his team is very responsive and responds immediately.Their hospitality and caring attitude was truly amazing.The resort was peacefull away from all traffic and other busy movements; the falls which runs in midst of resort was amazing feeling and we felt like we were in the lap of mother nature.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: We stayed in wooden house; it was both very comfy and it had the feel of a tree house.

Review_Content: Located amidst 6000 acre dense coffee estate; Coffea Aroma is a paradise; especially when it is raining. It is situated 3 kms from the main road and reaching the place is an off roaders dream. We were a family of 5 travelling from Bangalore; in a hatchback. So we were promptly advised by Akhil (The guy who manages the resort) to take their Jeep ride from the main road; instead of struggling in our vehicle on that bumpy road to reach the resort. Akhil is a very accommodative person; he allowed 5 heads to stay at the cost of 4; without charging anything extra for the stay or food. Akhil and Benny are always out there if you need them; EVEN if it is bang in the middle of the night; like it happened with us. My mum had trouble breathing (may be because of altitude change) and they rushed to us within three minutes of calling at like 3:30 in the night; very courteous of them. Regarding the stay; I believe that the Twin Cottages that we had rented requires maintenance. The cottage needs some renovation done; as the persistent rain that Wayanad has received during the last 5 months might have caused damage to the walls - they look damp and dull. The Rooms need some brighter shade of painting; which will definitely give a better look. Bathrooms were pretty well maintained though; with the facility of a Geyser; which is an absolute must during the Rainy and Winter seasons. Likes:1. LOCATION - Coffee plantations; Streams and Waterfalls 2. Jeep Ride to the resort3. Service - people were helpful4. Value for moneyScope for Improvement1. Room Maintenance – Cleanliness of the Cottages requires improvement 2. Food – A little more variety/spread of the buffet wouldn't harm with a slight improvement in quality as well3. Room lighting – Brighter lighting required

It was a nice experience. The stay was very peaceful away from all traffic. The resort also had good games which kept the kids occupied. we also walked around the resort to the nearby village. really good experience.The food; hospitality and personal care was truly amazing .

The stay was very peaceful away from all traffic. room needs to be little more clean but was quite good. service & food was also quite good & authentic. over all great stay. The resort also had good games which kept the kids occupied. we also walked around the resort to the nearby village. really good experience. Tips - must stay at the wood house. - Anisha

Please read the full review.I booked twin cottage. room was ok but need to bit hygiene in the bath room...Coffea aroam; as name suggest it is surround by coffee plantation. It is in good location no disturb of traffic.you feel like your in coffee estate. Near to coffee aroam their will be a stream of water flow that will give + pointfor the resort. Hospitality was good and staffs are polite. the resort is near to chembra peak you can do trekking from the resort the food is good only if you tell how you want it. if you like kerala type dish then its OK.Disadvantage: Its 4 to 5 km inside main road. the roads are humpty dumpty.Pick and drop: they charged 800 from us.They arranged cab facility for us 2 days and charged 3600.i feel that is costly because we didn't go more than 120 km from 2 days.first day they charged 1600 and second day 2000. i asked why ? they said you traveled lot in second day.without showing how many kilometer we traveled. i went for vacation with family so i didn't quarrel.If you have your own vehicle; this was the place to hangout and spend most memorable time with your family.

Visited the resort with my wife and kids. Awesome experience. The food; hospitality and personal care was truly amazing. Akhil the Resort Manager; Benny and the support staff were very helpful and ensured my stay was truly pleasant. Travelling with small kids was a concern; but the games; facilities in the resort ensured that they were kept busy. Many things to do within the resort itself - The Natural waterfall; Natural Pond; Rose Wood Park; indoor games like Archery; Table Tennis; Trampoline etc..And overall just breathe in the pure natural fresh air - Rejuvenating experience !!.Point to Note :- The Road from the main Kunnampetta to the resort is a forest road and not sure if the regular Sedans could handle it. Suggested for Cars / SUVs with High road clearance. Other than this there no negative points at all.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The Wood House; Bamboo Suite are very well maintained & have a sit out facing the Resort. Honeym...

Review_Content: I visited the resort once again with wife and my in-laws..It was a really awesome experience yet again. The food; hospitality and personal care was truly amazing.. Living in the midst of all the hassles; pollution and traffic problems of Mumbai; i found this resort experience really blissful; serene and pristine..I did some trekking after a long time to Chembra peak and enjoyed it thoroughly..My in-laws also had a great time..We stayed in the bamboo hut and wood house..The wood house is really great and the tv is a great addition..overall; if you love nature and adventure; dont miss this place!!!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: We stayed in the bamboo hut and the wood house..Both are really good...

Review_Title: “Lush greenery .. Excellent location..Unique in all ways”
Review_Content: We had a family get together at coffeaaroma resort Wayanad. It was an excellent location with green surroundings and cool climate. The main attraction in this resort is the Waterfalls through the majestic rochs and the stream below. We can have the view of misty Chembra peak from the stream. This view itself is worth. The rooms are good and unique. All made in differtent themes. We stayed at Twin cottages which was economical. The restaurent is facing the stream and the view of jungle opposite is a different experience. You will have the feeling of being inside a jungle with the sound of chirping birds and view of trees surroundings. Being inside the coffee plantation makes it look green everywhere. The staff arranged us a campfire and we really enjoyed our experience here. Kudos to all staff and we are looking to come here again
Room_Tips: Room Tip: There are different types of cottages.. Twin cottages are value for money and are good..

Review_Title: “The warmest welcome from the charming helpful staff”
Review_Content: We are a 4 ppl girl gang from essex who were looking for a fun time in wild wayanad with elephants and snapsand. Casual. We got all this and more. From the moment we called to enquire about the place; Akil was the most accommodating host who went out of his way to help us. Jamsind cooked us delicious food and was the most enthusiastic of room service providers. We had an amazing all day safari with Vibin topped off with a camp fire; music and a night walk with Jaguar- the greatest of great danes. What a hen night! The rooms have lots of character and are very comfortable. All in all; great value for money. One word of advice is to check beforehand if you want to go for the Ayurvedic spa; as when we went the regular staff weren't there so it wasn't quite up to scratch. Nonetheless overall boom time.

Onward Drive - I drove with my family and took the (Bangalore - Mysore - Nagarhole - Kalpetta) route. I covered ~330KM in about 8 hours. The approach from the main road to Coffee Aroma is a perfect off-roading track. So please watch out.What you'll find there:1) An enthralling location. Coffee Aroma is located amidst pure nature (hills; trees; coffee plantations; streams and water falls).2) Kids play area3) Dining place4) Office and Reception5) You will have to walk down a bit to reach the cottages.6) The Deluxe-Twin cottage had a double cot; a single cot; a small cupboard; dressing table; wash basin and a rest room. Nothing more and less.What's good there:1) Obviously; the location2) Streams; waterfalls; coffee plantations.. all within reach.3) Service - people were helpful4) Value for money; 5K per night.What's not so good there:1) Room tidiness/cleanliness2) Food3) No power backup - power cuts made us feel really unsafe.4) No good roofing for rooms - felt terribly cold during the night.5) Hot-water supply is not guaranteed.6) No proper lighting inside the rooms. No tube lights at all. Only CFL and zero-watt bulbs everywhere.Return journey: Took the (Kalpetta - Sultan Batheri - Bandipur - Gundalpet - Mysore - Bangalore) route. The roads were very good; especially from Bandipur to Gundalpet. It took 8.5 hours to reach Bangalore.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Please.. Please.. Don't ever go for Twin cottages.. I had a terrible; miserable experience. That...

Review_Content: We a group of friends from Mangalore; visited Wayanad in December..We shortlisted Coffea Aroma fro our two day stay. Stayed at Twin cottage ..There are two twin cottage in resort ; one facing the stream and other at a height. We stayed at the one facing the stream. The place was cool ..felt that we are inside a forest with the huge trees and sounds of birds in the forest opposite to the stream. It was a thrilling experience to be here . We made a short trek to Chembra peak view point through the pathway inside the resort..It took arounf 45b mns to be there. We have to walk along a hoge tea plantations with excellent views and a lot of places to take photois.. We had a campfire at night with music..The night was chilling ..The staff was very nice and explained us the importance of different places and a lot of stories regarding Wayanad..Though the resort is around 3 Kms inside frrom the main road; we didnt find any difficuly as there were sign board at every corner..We could reach the place easily; though we need to be little careful as it is a plantation road..The drive itself was an adventure..The restaurent serve homely food..Both veg and non veg;;The resort also has a farm and an Ayurvedic Spa...What makes this resort different is the presence of the stream with a natural pool and the different type of cottages for satay..The Twin house we stayed was neat and spacious..We really enjoyed the trip and are planning to come here again..
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Twin house is value for money..It is around Rs 3000 for two with breakfast included..Rooms are spaci...

Review_Content: We a family of 6 members stayed at Coffea Aroma during the last week of december 2012. It is a peaceful place to calm your nerves from the hectic city life. Few of my views on the resort are listed below :1. One has to travel for around 20 min from the main road(off-road) to reach the resort. The journey is through Coffee plantations and this is a different exp.2. The resort is situated within a coffee estate of around 12 acres; so there is no noise of vehicles and other things.3. The rooms are kept clean and the room services were good. There is no extension facility.4. There are facilities to play games like table tennis; caroms; badminton etc.5. The food is very good; its more like homely food.6. The resort has got natural stream with pools which are excellent; I pick this one to be the best facility at Coffea Aroma.7. A walk of around 30 min. through coffee and tea plantations will take one to the base from where the trek to Chembra peak starts. A walk to this place during the golden hours through the tea plantations will be really awesome.8. The people around for service are friendly and are really helpful to know Wayanad better.Overall it was really a great experience.

Frankly; Coffea aroma was chosen as a backup plan for Vythiri resorts as they were houseful when we went. A typical expected kind of Wayanad plantation stay with standalone huts and no concrete bricks to create boredom. Don't expect a luxurious family stay with kids or else you end up coming back sick. Go with friends or couple on a most rainy day; make sure to take your 4 wheel drive car; camera and lot of woolen clothes. Staying in that wooden house; stay awake till middle of night and enjoy the rain. Food was homely style OK. Nice river at the backside; could hear elephant roaring from the other side of forest in the night - really thrilling!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the cottage whichever feels you warmer as there are no room heater available.

Review_Content: Had a visit to Wayanad with family; where we stayed at Coffea Aroma resort. Has seen the website of the resort and we were interested in the waterfalls. Had a wonderful trip from Bangalore to the resort through the Bandipur wildlife sanctuary. It took around 6 hours for us to reach the resort from Bangalore.We reached the place after a brief off road drive to the resort. The place was tranquil with a jungle atmosphere and sounds of chirping birds. As it was not a rainy season; there mighty falls was reduced to a small cascade. But still it was a beautiful sight. We stayed at wood house; which was unique and completely made of wood. In front of it; there was a beautiful landscaped lawn surrounded by coffee plants. We spend a lot of time sitting in the sit out and enjoying the fresh air.Kids had a good time there with some unique playing items like a punch bag; turnball; kids archery etc. Resort manager offered us water rings for the kids to have a dip in their natural pool.We also had a good time in having a try at archery. Kids also had a view of the farm within the resort.We spend two days there and utilised one day for local sight seeing. You will not feel bored as you can have many activities there like just having a walk through the plantation road; a dip in the pool; spending time near the cascade etc.Overall we had a good experience staying at coffeaaroma and is recommended for a weekend family trip..
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Wood house is spacious and unique..There are tree house; bamboo suite etc.

Review_Title: “A real taste of Wayanad- Coffea Aroma”
Review_Content: Had a year end vacation at Wayanad with friends. The place for stay was selected was Coffea aroma resort; as we got a good feedback from a friend who has stayed there earlier. We drove through the majestic Wayanad Ghats connecting Calicut and Wayanad. The plantation road leading to the resort was an offroad experience. But we could drive our Wagor R through the way without much difficulty and was a different experience. We selected the deluxe twin cottage which is located in a separate area from the main entrance. These cottages were newly constructed one and was neatly kept. There is a sit out and is surrounded by greenery. The most beautiful part is to see the location early with thick mist in the area. The natural pool of the resort was also close to our cottages. We could also see a watch tower constructed to keep an eye on animals entering the plantation nearby. There are othr cottages where all cottages were built differently like wood housem; tree house etc. The cottage in farther corner named as Honeymoon cottage will be the best as it is located facing the waterfalls. The food was good and it was a buffet as there were many guests. The restaurent was large enough for the group. We could see the children having a good time at the Trampolene and punch bag in the indoor games area. We played badminton in the ground. The resort arranged us a Jeep as requested for our local sightseeing. We could cover the Pookode lake; Banasurasagar Dam and Soochippara falls. Had a campfire party with other guests with music lated at night. Overall it was an enjoyable experience. Kudos to the staff at Coffea araoma..
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The Twin cottages are value for money and ideal for families and groups. Based on location; the hone...

Review_Title: “Coffea Aroma Resort -\ Wayanad in a nutshell\"”"
Review_Content: We a small group from ICICI Bank stayed at Coffea Aroma ; Wayanad. It was a really enjoyable and thrilling experience. Will call the place as Wayanad in a nutshell; considering the coffee plantation in which the resort is situated; the waterfalls and stream within the resort; the tree house and other cottages spread in the plantation; the forest bordering the resort; the Chembra Peak at walkable distance etc. These are the variety of experience you can have in Wayanad; available at Coffea Aroma. The drive through the plantation trails to the resort was itself an experience. We stayed at Tree House; Wood House and the Bamboo Suite. We; a group of 11 people comfortably stayed here; where the resort staff helped with extra bed. The food served here is good and the restaurent is located overlooking the stream. We could see the brown coloured wild squirrel and a lot of monkeys in the forest area near the stream sitting at the restaurent. The rooms were neat and had coffee plants surroundings. The resort also has a spa; which we could not use due to time constraints. We made a short trek to Rose wood park which had a 400 yr huge rose wood tree. Yo can relax lying in the rocks and enjoying the panoramic view.We played some outdoor games like football; badminton and tried flying a kite in the resort ground situated in top hill. There are many indoor games as well.There are no such negatives about the resort. There are no intercom facility as the cottages are situated at distance apart. But you can call up Mr Akhil; the Manager who used to arrange for the room service immediately. The staff were corteous and helpful.Suggest Coffea Aroma resort for anyone who want to experience the variety of Wayanad in a single location. It will be a thrilling and enjoyable experience.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Wood house will be a different experience. The sitout is spacious and you will enjoy sitting here. T...

Review_Content: Located at a hill; it is damn difficult stretch on a swift to reach this place. 3 kms and more we were struggling on the muddy road to reach the place. The wood house r just average with the bathrooms a size of a pigeon hole( the WC/ kamod and the shower area is just on each other). There was old used tooth pick on the switch board; used tissues lying on the mat which did not seem like was cleaned or washed over years and full of dirt and dust. When you lie down all can see is the cob webs above on the fan and around. The dining area is messy with the basin leaking when we went and water flowing everywhere to the dining area. Rs. 5500 for this is over too much. You cant even head out for dinner cause they r up the peak which takes all ur effort to go even one way.Wood house is stand alone and has stairs to climb so when u r inside t room the naughty children get on to ur balcony and start screaming and shoutng disturbing ur nap or privacy. there is no gate to the balcony stopping this.n since there is no intercom you have to use ur roaming mobile phone to make a call to Mr. anil to shoo the kids away..
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Honeymoom suites look ok but no privacy as people going to the natural stream have to go cross the r...

Review_Content: Stayed here at CoffeaAroma during New Year along with my friends and their families. We were 5 families; 10 adults and 4 kids.Location (1 Star):Its located close to Kalpetta; between Chundale and Meppadi. You will have to do off-roading for about 2-3 KMs to reach the resort. Vehicles with lower ground clearance will have some problem climbing. Tourist spots like Pookote Lake; Soochipara Falls; Lakkadi View point are at about 30-40 mins travel. Very calm; pleasant place with the view of Forest; mountains. Rooms (0.5 Star):Since our plan got finalized just before 2 weeks from New Year; we didn't get the much wanted Tree house or Wood house. What we got is Deluxe Twin Cottage. This cottage is newly constructed and rooms were clean and decent. But one of my friend was not happy with the room given to him as it was not clean. Very basic room. Nothing fancy here. There were power cuts as well and i don't think this resort has any power backup. Sometimes in the evenings; power cuts was very annoying. Service (1 Star):Service was awesome. We asked for Kerala delicacies and they provided it for breakfast. They even arranged Kerala Sendai melam during New Year Eve. Folks were really helpful. Thumps Up.Food (0.5 Star):After reading all below reviews; our expectations very little high. But to be honest; the food was just average. Not much spread. Very standard; bland menu for all meals. Our Driver who has visited this place sometime ago told us that Food used to be very good. Looks like the cook has changed. Food was only good in parts. Veg folks didn't had much options. Coffee they served was absolutely without any Aroma/taste which was totally disappointing :( Overall; Its Just OK.Amenities (1 Star):Its a resort. That's what they call it. So; there has to be amenities right? :). There is. More of Indoor games like Chess; Carom; Dart board etc. They also have Shuttle; Cricket kits. But didn't find much open place to play.Highlight of the resort is the stream that runs close by. This place is absolutely wonderful. Just within few mins walk; you will find a small water falls where we took an amazing bath. The water was very cold. One extra star for this stream/Water fall.Overall; a decent stay at CoffeaAroma. CoffeaAroma is more of a Home stay than a resort. My rating would be 3 + 1 stars (+1 is for the stream/Water fall).

My husband and I zeroed in on Coffee Aroma resort for our much awaited weekend getway.. The concept and the cost suited us perfectly and we were on our way to coffee aroma on a friday. To be honest; getting to the resort is a bit daunting; as we have to do a little off-roading through a road which actually takes us through the coffee estate itself. People with cars with lesser ground clearance can request the manager to arrange for pick up from the main road. Once we landed in the resort; we were amazed at the lush greenery surrounding us. The rooms are very hygenic and the staff are quite friendly and helpful. Since we landed on a friday; we got to enjoy a lot of attention and the food was cooked as per our wish; which was quite tasty. There were more guests during the weekend; but still our privacy was maintained. They also have some indoor and outdoor game options. My husband and I had a great time playing badminton there. The resturant is next to a natural waterfall which makes the dining experience quite amazing as there is a continuous sound of flowing water in the background which was extremely relaxing and refreshing. There was a campfire arranged with some music to accompany it which was much needed for the December chill. The 'Nature walk' through the coffee and tea plantations upto the base of Chembra peak was quite adventurous and fun. All in all; its an enchanting experience who would love a quite getaway from the busy and noisy city life.
Response_to_Review: Appreciate the review regarding the stay at coffea aroma resort. We are happy to know that you have explored coffea aroma with many activities including trekking to Chembra peak. Coffea aroma has has options for many outdoor and indoor games. We have also added more games for kids and children including a trampoline. Thank you for the visit and wishing you a happy new year.

Review_Title: “A Place close to Nature's heart..Refreshing and Relaxing”
Review_Content: Visited this place in May..Had a great experience there. A place away from crowd surrounded with greenery.Rooms are neat and the interesting aspect is that each room has a different theme from the other. Staff is very helpful and friendly. They readily helped us in booking a cab for sightseeing. Food served won't disappoint your taste buds. Its delicious..All in all if you are bored with the fast and monotonous city life and need a break for some time then Coffee Aroma is \The Place\".."
Response_to_Review: Thank you for visiting coffea aroma resort Wayanad. Most of our guests are from Bangalore who wanted to have a break from busy city life. They have plenty to enjoy here with lush green surroundings and a stream spend time. We welcome you again with the friends and have a nice year ahead..

Review_Title: “Adventerous; reviving; refreshing and above all what an awesome natural pool they have !!!!”
Review_Content: We had a 2 day trip to wayanad . After a long research we chose this place . We had an excellent stay there ; this place is amidst a beautiful coffee plantation . what is more remarkable is the pool . it was really really awesome!!! no words to explain . A small water fall and a pool . Actually that was a surprise to us .Spectacular it was. We stayed in the tree house .First day we spent at resort itself . there are a lot to see in there. we trekked through the rocks . it was a spectacular view that anyone will never forget . Moreover you have lot of privacy there.Second day ;we went out for boating in dam ; and a few places out there. Another remarkable point is there hospitality ; very friendly ppl especially Mr.Akhil (manager) ;Binoy etc . and the food they serve is really mouth watering. The menu for the food is what we say .Pros: Very good ambiance ; excellent hospitality ; really close to nature ; Delicious food ;very reasonable price when compared to other resorts like vythri resort ;Cons : Nothing much to say ; one thing i found is the way leading to Coffea aroma is lil adventurous path . You have to travel some 5 kms off-road . but from the main to coffea aroma ; they will arrange the transportation . But if u are coming in sedan ; it would be lil difficult .
Response_to_Review: We are happy to know that you have enjoyed the stay at Coffea Aroma plantation resort at Wayanad. Many of our guests enjoy the natural pool; waterfalls and trekking through the rocky ravine. Coffea Aroma resort is priced affordable when compared to other resorts and hotels in Wayanad. We appreciate the review regarding the food and welcome you back ..

Review_Content: We spent a wonderful time in Coffea Aroma during June 2012; it was a college reunion!!!Certainly its heavenly piece of God's Own Country...Surrounded by lush green forest; a stream with waterfall ; and coffee plantation Coffea Aroma is atrue experience of its own.The food served was awesome..Staff is very attentive and good humoured.. This is a must place to visit in Wayanad...
Response_to_Review: We thank you for being our guests at Coffea Aroma Resort at Wayanad. Many groups have visited coffea aroma and have enjoyed the campfire party; dining at our stream facing restaurent etc. It is a different experience to stay in the middle of a coffee plantation with many natural settings. We welcome you and your friends to visit again and enjoy the unique experience of staying at Coffea Aroma Resort Wayanad.

Review_Content: I stayed with my family in Coffea Aroma.It was my third resort stay in kerala and this one was awsome!! Excellent kerala style food;Neat and clean rooms; pleasing and helpful character of all staffs; water fall within resort;streams;pond;different types of cottages;ayurvedic massage centre all are really amazing. some of happy and joyful days in my life. if anybody wants to experience resort stay; i strongly recommend Coffea Aroma.
Response_to_Review: Thank you doctor for being our guests at Coffea Aroma Resort Wayanad with your family. We are happy to know that you have enjoyed the stay here. Coffea Aroma is recommended as a perfect weekend getaway by many of our guests where thay can enjoy lots of greenery and fresh air. We wish you a great year ahead and welcome you again to Wayanad and Coffea Aroma Resort.

Review_Content: Surrounded by a stream this resort is a treat not only to the eyes but for the ears too..In the dining area you would be mesmerized by the sound of the flowing streaming..We loved the stream's sound so much that we even recorded it to listen to it again and again..The stream along with a pool and a small waterfall on the way were quite enjoyable..and the best part is that all of this is part of the resort. The food was good and the staff were very courteous..They were always ready to take pictures whenever we asked :)  Overall a wonderful vacation and a good break..our lungs were refilled with fresh air too.
Response_to_Review: It is nice to know that you have enjoyed the stay at coffea aroma resort Wayanad. What makes coffea aroma unique from other resorts and hotels in Wayanad is the presence of an inhouse stream and waterfalls. Most of the cottages and even the restaurent are located near the stream so that you can always hear the tinkling sound of the stream. We welcome you again and wish you a happy christmas and new year.

Review_Title: “Awesome resort in the lap of Mother Nature”
Review_Content: I stayed at Coffea Aroma and it was a wonderful experience...good food; clean rooms and nice staff...The lush green sorroundings; the waterfall within the resort were all amazing..The authentic kerala style food was finger licking good.....Over all a must visit place in Wayanad where one can indulge in natures beauty and can relax and enjoy the holidays....Peace to mind :)
Response_to_Review: We are happy to know that you had a relaxing experience at CoffeaAroma Resort Wayanad..Coffea Aroma has lush green surroundings being inside a coffee plantation surrounded by trees; natural stream and waterfalls..It is a perfect weekenf getaway from Bangalore..We welcome you again to coffea aroma and wishing you and family a wonderful year ahead..

Review_Title: “By far one of our loveliest holidays! - You guys rock”
Review_Content: Akhil & team; Thanks for helping us have a memorable vacation at Wayanad; Kerala. We loved being there and sensing nature at its best. Your resort; tucked away amidst streams and in the middle of the forests and coffee plantations provided the best getaway from busy city life.The service was absolutely great and having authentic kerala food after a long while was the highlight. You even took care of our 7 month old baby's needs by providing him well cooked; easy to digest baby food!Here's wishing all of you the very best!Highly recommended!Sharon
Response_to_Review: We are extremely happy to know that you have enjoyed the stay at coffea aroma resort wayanad..Coffea aroma is blessed with nature is an ideal getaway from the busy city life..Our guests from Bangalore really enjoy the place giving them a unique feeling..Thank you for visiting our resort and our greetings for you and family in the coming year...

Review_Title: “\An excellent resort in Wayanad- Feeling of a jungle village\"”"
Review_Content: Coffea Aroma is an excellent resort to stay in Wayanad simply because the variety of cottages they offer..It has different type of cottages to stay like Tree House; Wood House; Mud House; Bamboo suite; Twin Houses etc.. Though we stayed in the bamboo suite we made a walk around to see other cottages located at the various corners of a sprawling coffee estate..Surrounded by plantations and tall trees; a stream flowing and a waterfalls; we got the feeling of a jungle village...Resort has a farm within with goose; rabbit; country chicken etc..We were also lucky to see the giant red coloured squirrel and the group of monkeys across the trees...The restaurent here is overlooking the stream...Food served is delicious and could taste the kerala delicacies..We went for a one day trip to the Banasurasagar dam; Ghat viewpoint; Chaintree; Pookode lake and soochippara falls in the cab arranged by the resort..A full day trip cost around Rs 1800 which was reaonable..Recommed this resort; especially for Bangaloreans looking for a 2-3 days weekend trip...It can be a very different feeling from a busy city life...
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Bamboo suite was a nice stay..But other cottages are also different..Twin house will be a cheaper op...
Response_to_Review: We appreciate for reviewing coffea aroma resort wayanad...Indeed; it has the feeling of a jungle village with variety of cottages especially the tree house and wood house..The natural pool; stream; waterfalls within a coffe plantation makes it special..It is the best place to start trekking to Chembra peak ..You can have the nature walks through the plantation road to the watch tower which most of our guests enjoy..There is a rosewook park in between...Thank you and wish you and family happiness in the coming year..

Review_Content: I stayed at Coffea Aroma and it was a wonderful experience...good food; clean rooms and nice staff...The lush green sorroundings; the waterfall within the resort and the authentic Ayurvedic massage were all amazing..It is an awesome place to unwind and relax and recharge both mind and body..Highly recommended!!
Response_to_Review: We are happy to know that you have enjoyed the stay at Coffea Aroma resoer Wayanad..What makes coffea aroma different is the waterfalls and stream within the resort and and the full fledged ayurvedic spa set in natural surroundings..Thank you and welcome you again to coffea aroma resort wayanad...

Review_Content: I'm out of words ; awesome pool ; I spent hours in pool ; water was so clean and cold ;  superb food ( Bengali Cook Highly recommended) ;I had an amazing holiday ;Excellent location for creative writing ; feels very close to nature ;
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Wood House is simply the best .;.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience at coffeaaroma. Nice to see that you have a time at our natural pool. An inhouse waterfall; stream and a natural pool are unique to Coffea Aroma resort; Wayanad. We welcome you again and wishing you and family a great year ahead...

Review_Content: we had an awesome and memorable stay at Coffea aroma..A friend recommended this resort to us...we went without any inhibitions..the suprise awaiting was simply great..the ethnic cottages amidst the lush greens was really a retreat.As the name goes it is located in a coffee plantation.The nature has really gifted this place.The private stream is the highlight.The cottages are cosy and comfy.Staff were really helpful..will vouch for the personalised services..Had a perfect weekend getaway...highly recommended..Cheers to Coffea Aroma.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: you can choose the room type according to your budget...cottages are charged differently..we stayed...
Response_to_Review: Thank you for sharing your experience at Coffea Aroma resort; Wayanad..We are pleased to know that you have enjoyed the stay at Coffea Aroma. Coffea Aroma is gifted with beautiful surroundings the highlight being its waterfalls and the stream located at the foothills of Chembra Peak. We appreciate your feedback and welcome you again to Coffea Aroma.

Review_Title: “An Excellent stay in the midst of nature..”
Review_Content: Coffea Aroma is a place where one should to stay after going to a place like Wayanad. The resort is situated in the middle of green nature and coffee plantation. The resort manager Mr.Akhil will arrange jeep for drop/pick up and also for sight seeing. The workers at the restaurant are very polite and nice; We liked their hospitality. They will try to communicate and convey the beauty and importance of places around in English; even if they are not much fluent with. (we did not know Malayalam or Tamil)We stayed in \Bamboo hut\" which was a different experience. The cottages are very well maintained. Food at restaurant is also very nice(both veg and non veg). They do prepare evening snacks on request. When we returned to resort from sight seeing around 6 in the evening; and requested them to prepare some snacks; they were ready with hot onion pakodas by 10-15 mins when we came to restaurant place after getting refreshed. The natural water falls inside resort is a main attraction(only if you go in rainy season; I have heard from friends who went in Feb that there was no water at all). While we sit in open restaurant (with roof top) in the evening with hot pakodas; sound of floating water; and continuous humming of birds will just enlighten our minds. Though prices in the website are quite more; we can request/bargain and make it little less. Sight seeing changes were 1400 and 1900 for half day and full day(in jeep) respectively.. I am not sure whether it is ok or more. Only difficulty is the 3KM mud road with very much ups and downs to reach the resort from the main road. If one is taking elderly people this would be difficult. Also difficult to take own vehicles in this road. Better to go by their jeep."
Response_to_Review: We appreciate for sharing your experience at CoffeaAroma Resort Wayanad. Wayanad has many beautiful and important tourist spots and many are visiting the place which is around 6 hours drive from Bangalore. We are really happy that you have enjoyed our food at coffeaaroma. Having a beautiful waterfalls and a stream is unique at CoffeaAroma. It is a majestic view especially at rainy season where water gushes from Chembra Peak. The mud road to our resort have improved and guests can reach the spot in their own vehicle. Pick up and drop and also sight seeing facility is arranged upon request. Thank you for giving us your feedback and we welcome you again to CoffeaAroma...

Review_Title: “Had a very pleasant stay in Coffea Aroma!”
Review_Content: This place was recommended by a friend. The place is one of it's kind; pretty reasonable from the rest of the resorts around; suitable for both couples and families . Its a perfect weekend getaway. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The manager; Mr. Akhil helped us by picking and dropping us back to the bus stop. The place is more beautiful than it looks in the website.All the cottages are well maintained and you can choose from a variety like tree house; wood house; mud house; twin house etc. we stayed in wood house and was a comfortable stay. The best part about it is the waterfall and a stream located inside the resort! We went there for a weekend and it was a relaxing stay.Since we are pure vegetarians; we were worried about the food. But Binoy and the cooking staff made sure that we were served authentic Kerala veg food. I must mention that the food was really yummy. overall we had an awesome trip in Coffea Aroma and would recommend it to people going to Wayanad!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Wood house was spacious and comfortable
Response_to_Review: Thank you for sharing your experience at Coffea Aroma resort. Coffea Aroma welcome for couples and families where one can have the unique feeling of a jungle village with all modern amenities. Thanks for recommending CoffeaAroma as a perfect weekend getaway which is around 6 hours drive from Bangalore. What makes coffeaaroma unique is the variety of cottages and the inhouse waterfalls and stream. Really happy that you have enjoyed the kerala food served. Appreciate the feedback and welcome you back to Coffea Aroma resort..

Review_Title: “A beautiful resort with an inhouse Waterfalls and a Stream”
Review_Content: I recommend this resort which is situated inside a coffee plantation. The cottages comes with variety like a tree house; wood house; mud house; bamboo cottage etc. We stayed in a twin house which was situated beside a stream. The most beautiful part is that there is a waterfall and a stream inside the plantation.We could enjoy it like a private waterfall. The room was clean and spacious. Restaurant was also situated near the stream.There is also an ayurvedic spa in the resort. We made a trek to the view point of Chembra Peak which is a 40 minute walk from ther resort. For the more adventurous; they can go till the top of Chembra Peak; which will be around a 3 hr walk.It was a nice experience and a unique feeling staying at coffea aroma. The staff was courteous and helpful.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Twin house is value for money and good for groups. Staying in a Tree House or Wood House will be uni...

Review_Content: Pros:This is a lovely place nestled in a coffee plantation. The owner is a very simple and welcoming person. It is nothing very fancy but what especially impressed us was the care and attention that reflected in the maintenance of that resort. The cottages are very cute and creative; with different settings like two near the stream; one as a tree hut; a wooden cottage with very local architecture etc. It was also value for money at around 2500/- per night for a couple. For a resort in the center of a coffee plantation in the middle of rains; it was surprisingly clean. And the stream in the middle of the resort was beautiful. Cons:The one issue with this resort is the approach road -- which is a 2km gravel path; this can be a big issue if you are taking your personal car. The resort people did offer that we could park before the beginning of that approach road and they would come to pick us up; but we did not try that option so cannot say how that would have worked out. Also; that option may not be very convenient if you are planning to go in and out a lot. You should ask about the current status of that road before you go.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Wood house is the best built and most comfortable. If you are adventurous; you might want to check o...

Review_Content: Its a good resort….a unique experience…..good service and wonderful nature…..Room was very modern with all amenities…..Good quality food.... the spa in the resort is really rejuvenating …. will definitely recommend….
Good resort...and true value for money..can arrange for more tour packages..otherwise overall experience is good...all the best!

Review_Title: “Some experiences last a lifetime ..this surely is 1 of them :)”
Review_Content: If your looking for a perfect getaway .. by the sun n sands with some yum homely cooked local food ...then it can't get better than this; we stayed for 2 nights in Costa 1 which is a 5 mins walk from the beach and were blown away with the lovely surrounding n homely feel this place has ;I would term it more of a home stay where the host takes so much interest in keeping his guests happy ; we loved the NO television concept it makes you enjoy the place even more; Godbless u Mr Kurien...

We stayed in Costa Malabari 2; the one right on the beach on the weekend of Aug 17-18. For us; the lasting impression of this stay is Mr. Kurien; the manager. He is extremely helpful; un-intrusive and is a treasure trove of knowledge. Coming to the place itself; the location is excellent; the rooms were clean; the staff was very welcoming and food was very good (not a big spread; but we could eat to our hearts content). The transport and sight-seeing was arranged for us (and is pretty cheap; I must add) and we had no difficulty going to and from the bus station. The only thing that may have been improved is the landscaping at the resort; but then may be it was intentional. If you plan to visit Kannur; I would totally recommend Costa Malabari. Thank you Mr.Kurien.

We stayed two nights here (the one on the cliff; #2?) and enjoyed the tranquility; quiet; and natural setting. Our hosts and cooks were kind and helpful. Our room was spacious and comfortable; with a large bathroom and a ceiling fan. There were two entrances to the room; one at the back that went out to the back patio; where you could see the ocean and hear the waves crashing; and no one else was around. It was great.There is a somewhat rickety staircase that leads down the cliff to the beach; which has a lot of large boulders on it and a pretty strong current (at least when we were there). Not sure I'd swim; but it was fun to hop among the rocks and watch the sun set.We had dinner and breakfast on the covered patio beside the building; and it was always delicious. Our host helped set up a visit for us to a nearby temple to witness a theyyam (a religious ritual northern Malabar is known for; and Kannur specifically). He called a rickshaw for us and really arranged everything. That was a great experience; so definitely do it if you visit!The place is a bit of a ride from the train station; and the roads aren't paved once you get out of town. We took a rickshaw from the station; which was fine; but definitely bumpy.I would stay again!

Costa Malabari is a lovely place to stay. It is a house above a cliff on a beach. The house is spacious and clean. Food is served dutifully at the appropriate time. .Mr. Kurien; the manager is very nice and helpful. He booked my stay in the next town I was visiting; and also changed dollars into rupees for me at an excellent rate. He is an expert on Theyyam; and arranged a visit to a Theyyam ritual by auto. Clothes came back clean in a day. Food was excellent.That being said; I was under the impression that this was a homestay; but this is only a house in which you can stay. The only human contact I had was with the cook who dutifully called me thrice a day with \Saar; food.\" I was not given any pointers on places to visit; or a map. Not even directions to Thottada beach. I got lost in both Thottada and Adikatalayi village. All the roads look the same; narrow and winding through greenery; and nobody speaks English. I walked around in circles in the heat and somehow made it back to the house; thanks to some help from an elite-looking businessman in a white van. I didn't venture out again.I was not warned about the strong monsoon current in the sea. so when I ventured onto the beach bellow the house; I was swept to the ground by a giant wave that hurt my leg badly. There was nobody else in the house because Mr. Saar Food wasn't going to return till dinnertime. Mr. Kurien gave me ayurvedic ointment later; and the cook; when he arrived; gave me ice in a plastic bag; but I was lying by myself and groaning for hours; listening to the waves. I'm just glad didn't get swept into the sea; as nobody would have missed me for hours.So; Costa Malabari is for those who are really into Theyyam. It is also for people who want to experience what Nelson Mandela and other famous leaders must experience during house arrest. For someone single; or for someone on a regular vacation; even for someone who craves out-of-the-way experiences; Costa Malabari may not be an appropriate choice."

Costa Malabari was one of the best places i stayed in India.I stayed in Costa 1;located among lush vegetation;just five minutes from Thotadda beach.It is the perfect place to relax from the hustle and noise of India.My room was big;clean;comfortable;with hot water and mosquito net.The whole building is very tastefully and thoughtfully decorated and the meals cooked by the local lady are plenty and tasty.The little balcony outside is very pleasant to hang out.The manager Kurian is a very nice;educated man;a wealth of information for the area.And of course he is the one who can arrange for you to see the Theyyam ceremony.He also arranges transport (ricksaw) as well as everything else you need.I just wish i had more time to spend there and i would definitely stay again.

There are several hostels named Costa Malabari; we stayed at the one located at Thottada beach. If You have a choice I would recommend staying at Costa Malabari no 2 that is located on a cliff with a private strip of beach below. Meals are included in the price and are excellent. Nearby beaches are beautiful and completely deserted - don't expect to find any shacks here. They main attraction in the area is Theyyam and the manager is able to point you in the right direction to find the ceremonies. As the location is pretty difficult to find on your own it would be smart to phone the manager before arrival so he can meet you on the main road and direct you to the hostel.

I was at Costa Malabari on a yoga retreat. The rooms are clean and basic though this doesn't mean uncomfortable by any stretch. The food was amazing and the staff really wanted to make the stay the best they could. It got very hot on a couple of nights due to the electricity failing - these things happen. One of the assets of the place is Kurian - the owner and an amazing host. His passion is wanting to make your stay the best possible. He is very proud of the local area and obviously loves history. Kurian arranged transport quickly and is a mine of information about what to do; where to go and how to get there. The resort is near the beach and the village is a short walk away. The people there were incredibly welcoming and friendly - you'll have your photo taken all the time if you're from Europe. I wouldn't return simply because there is so much of India still to explore. For my first taste though; I'm grateful to the people at Costa Malabari here who made it so memorable.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Ask for on elf the corner rooms - they are larger.

Review_Content: Stayed there for just one night last month. The caretaker; Mr. Kurian was very helpful and provided proper guidance - the best route to/from bangalore / places to visit in town. He even mentioned the pros/cons of another hotel when we checked out :) . There are 3 costa malabaris - i stayed in no. 2 which is (almost) right at the beach. You only have to walk down through the stairs and the beach is there. Also; the beach is almost like a private beach. You can also enjoy the see breeze and the sound of the waves crashing the seashore lying on the hammock in the garden. As far as the food is concerned; having tasted kerala cuisine earlier; i liked all the 3 meals i had there. Note that even though the hotel we later moved to is supposed to be a \3 star\" one (Surya residency) and then we had dinner buffet in an even more plush hotel (Hotel Central Avenue); the food that i had here was easily the best. This we realized on day two only :). The biggest problem was the weather - it was way too hot and humid - nothing specific to this homestay obviously - but please do check out the local weather before you arrive here. Also; location wise there is a disadvantage that its quite difficult to access this location at night because of the somewhat remote location/lack of proper street lights."

Loved our room and the ocean breezes. Mr Kurian is a wealth of information about the Theyyam ceremonies and will make every effort for his guests to share that experience. The food was excellent and fresh. The ocean at the beach can be a bit rough; but it's a nice place to cool off.

We enjoyed our stay at Costa Malabari #1 (about 5 mins walk from the beach). The rooms were clean and comfortable; with mosquito nets (appreciated but unneeded). The food was mostly nice; though several times it had been cooked too far in advance and was served cold. Also; the serving style was a bit too formal for our tastes (a server went around to each guest to serve each dish). However; we appreciated that all meals were included (and mostly vegetarian!). The beach itself was ok; but we preferred to stay in the hammocks near the house instead. We went to a Theyyem ceremony; which was absolutely worth it. However; the owner had arranged for our transport but did not communicate with the driver about the price. He told us it should cost ~200-250rs and the driver insisted on 400rs. We had a similar issue when we took the rickshaw to the local weaving workshop (recommended); as the owner had not set a price in advance with the driver and we had to negotiate ourselves. As we only had to pay 200rs from the Kannur train station to the homestay; it was strange to pay much more for far shorter local journeys.Otherwise; the owner was helpful and talkative and the wifi was great.

We stayed at Costa Malabari 2 - that's the one perched on the cliff above the Arabian Sea. We throughly enjoyed the 4 days we spent here - wandering down to the different beaches; spotting birds; talking to the locals; walking the back way into Kannur (be sure to take in the early morning fish market); spending half the night and much of the next morning at a theyam. We enjoyed the cooking - lovely fresh vegetarian food; with generous proportions - and the efficient support of Mr Kurian; our kindly; gentle host. We just loved the way he scoots happily around between the 3 houses; helping everyone to sort out their plans; sharing information about theyams and advising on what things should cost.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The room at the top of the house in Costa Malabari 2 (Room F) is huge with small; shady windows all...

Review_Title: “One of our favorite stays in India”
Review_Content: When we saw the price; we thought twice about staying here. It was more than worth it; and affordable. Once we were here we didn't spend any other money. This place is awesome; off the beaten track and the food amazing. Staff was friendly an took very good care of us. The beds- super comfy and clean. Loved it. Stayed in costa malabari 1

Review_Title: “Good location on cliff top above beach”
Review_Content: We stayed at Costa Malabari II; there are also Costa Malabaris 1 and 3. Number 2 has a a great cliff top location with a good beach below. Ten minutes walk away is a longer beach - also undeveloped and there is another beyond that. The beaches are remarkably clean; given that they are or far from the city of Kannur. The meals were very good and Kurien helped us to get to Theyyam ceremonies in the area; which was a fantastic experience. The rooms are simple with ceiling fans. We found the area very friendly; welcoming and unspoiled by tourism.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The rooms at the front face the ocean and benefit from a breeze.

Review_Title: “Retreat with the very best of Anise's home cooking ”
Review_Content: We loved Costa malabari; perfect place to come and get away from it all. The home stay has three houses we stayed in number 3 and we would def recommend requesting to stay in this one; in might on be perched on a cliff but it has Anice who maybe kerelas best kept secret. Her food is amazing clean fresh food all veggie or fish dishes. I'm lactose intolerant and she took great care to make sure I could eat all the foods.The rooms r very simple but clean with mosi nets and we had a large showeroom with hot water. Situated about 5 main stroll to the sea along beautiful palm tree lined paths.We went to see two Thayyams very interesting rituals and both ones very different. but very early starts. Perfect place to hide away and relax

If you're ever in this part of Kerala; you should take a few days off and just chill here.I stayed in both their properties; the one on the beach and the one slightly inland; and they were both a good experience.The rooms and clean; but basic. The food is simple; but delicious. And the staff at each bungalow is prompt and courteous. The clifftop property (Costa 2) has a beach below that will feel like it's your private stretch of golden sand. While the Costa 1 is short walk away from a bigger and better beach.The real bonus of staying here is the gentleman who runs the place - Mr. Kurien. A soft-spoken man; he is a treasure trove on the Theyyam; a form of folk worship unique to these parts. Be sure to spend some time talking to him when you get here.

I stayed in the main building. It is a bit further from the beach than nearby accommodations; but the distance is not far and a levee built after the tsunami prevents any property from being truly beach front. The immediate surroundings consist of a coconut palm canopy and there are lots of nice walks in the area as well as the beach; which is relatively clean and unspoiled. Full board is included and the food is excellent and makes this a very good value. The location is about 20-30 minutes from the center of Kannur--there seem to be 2 routes depending on your destination: one goes through the old fishing quarter on rough roads; while the other cuts over to the road from Wayanad. I went to a Theyyam performance and also did a brief half day tour of Kannur (visiting weavers; the fort; etc. which was enough to get the highlights). The guesthouse is designed to promote interaction among the guests and this was on of the most pleasant stays I had in Kerala. The touristdesk in Kochi's emails suggest that prepaying should be done; but most people don't do this and I had problems with the using the account numbers provided for electronic payment;

This whole review must be taken in the context of what it is - a very simple guesthouse. Physically the 'hotel' is nothing much to talk about...very basic (yet clean) rooms. No amenities at all. There is wifi and hot water. The food is all home-made and was tasty but unremarkable aside from it being served on a banana leaf. The interesting thing here is the location (we stayed at the one on top of the cliff) and the people. It is situated on an idyllic cliff overlooking the beach (you can go down to the beach directly) with stunning views up and down the coast. Dinner is served with 'all' (9) of the guests eating together on one table which creates interesting conversation - i suspect that there is always an eclectic crowd here. The owner is the expert on the local Theyyam ritual which is definitely worth getting up early in the morning to go and see. I cant really understand why anyone would come here other than as a base to see the Theyyam ceremony (and then only once and for one night only) but it seems that there is a loyal crowd that returns year after year. \Aint as queer as folk\" as the saying goes. Main negative here is that we booked two rooms and when we turned up there was only one available so we had to add an extra bed to the double room. No disaster as it was a large room but mildly annoying. It is also located literally in the middle of nowhere so dont expect to find it without significant help from the owner on the telephone; asking locals; and getting one of the hotel staff to meet you half way and guide you there."

After coming back to Kannur this year and staying in a different (also very nice) place; I feel; I should tell people about this place too; although my stay lies some time in the past.Location: Great! They have 2 Guesthouses; I stayed in No. II on top of the cliffs.Food: Excellent! Vegetarian on requestStaff: Great! The Manager knows everything on Theyyam! Ask him!Only con: I tried to book into this place for this October (2013) but nobody ever replied to my emails ...
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Usually you can book this hotel via \touristdesk\" in Fort Cochin or online ... As this tim..."

Review_Content: Very good place to stay in if you are in Kannur; Kerala.Costa Malabari 1 and 2 are situated at Thottada beach.Deep forest feeling; 5 mins walk to the Beach.Mornings are superb.Only thing is that you have to tell the Resort owner for whatever you want to have in the meal as he will bring the required items only when you say.Half an hour journey from Kannur city where everything is available.Drinks to be purchased by the visitor only as per Kerala law.Pomfret & Chicken was excellent in taste.

I stayed here for a few days in December 2012 with my family.The rooms were clean; and yes; we had a cockroach on visit; but that is only something natural if you are in a hot humid area; and nothing that means that the location is unhygienic. Couldn't care less.The rooms were good. However; the rooms are not the main reason for me loving this place. Who will sit at the room when there is a utterly beautiful beach nearby anyway? You can return for lunch; and feel like HOME. That is something that is invaluable.I can not praise the food highly enough. It is not only tasty; you also get a lot of it and Annie (the sweetest lady on earth) always make sure that you get a refill. And one refill more. And one extra; just in case. There are always fresh fruit juice; lassi; fruit salad and tea served. And the deserts were just out of this world. The other person working there has the kindest smile on ever; if that mattes.I actually stumbled over several dishes that I did not found on any other place during my two month India trip. Also; prepare to make lots of new friends! The dining area is pretty small; so you will meet new people to have conversations with. I imagine you could travel to Annie all by yourself; and never feel alone.I plan on visiting again. No doubt about it. I regret only hugged her once for farewell.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: This hotel is split into two houses. If you want to eat Annie's food; chose the one with the lon...

Review_Content: I don't know where to begin with this review! Costa Malabari is fantastic. Kurien; the lovely manager; is so interesting and helpful. We were lucky enough to arrive while the local temple were performing their Theyyam ritual (see photographs) and it was truly incredible! Kurien is an expert in all aspects of the Theyyam so do ask him to explain the ritual to you.This was our first home stay in India and we were very impressed- the food was absolutely fantastic! We fell in love with Kerelite cuisine and as there are no restaurants in the area it really is the best and only way to stay! The best part of staying at a home stay is that you feel like you are part of the family and it is a great way to get to know the other guests. By the time we left we were all very close- it felt like a home away from home.The room was very nice and they even switched on our AC hours before we arrived so that the room was ready for us. I know this because I saw them do the same for another guest who arrived after us. So sweet.The beach is only a few minutes away by foot and is completely isolated and beautiful. There were a few men who stopped for a quick stare but in was very non threatening!Do watch for dolphins first thing in the morning. We were lucky enough to see a family of dolphins just past the break- there was even a little baby! The current is very strong so be very careful!I know we will be back next time we come to Kerala because I cant imagine how anywhere could be better! We were traveling on a shoestring budget so this was one of the more costly places we stayed but as all your meals are included it really is all you will spend while you are there so it is more than worth it!Thank you so much for everything Kurien! x

Ticked all the boxes. Great clean and spacious rooms; lovely surroundings; amazing Keralan food and thank you to Kurian for letting us know when the Theyyam performances were on and organising a taxi there.

Costa malabari is a very beautifull place by the sea; south from Kannur. rooms are big and clean. meals are home made and totally awesome!!!! Kurien is very helpfull to get you train tickets and to help you see a theyyam ceremony. value is really good. the only slight disadvantage is the location: you Will need a taxi to get there and as soon as you want to go somewhere else. but then you have 2 peacefull beaches just a round the corner!

Costa Malabari is a dream place to stay - perfect food; a lovely location and great people; who helped organise all of our various comings and goings. Highly recommend; especially the chance to see the local Theyyam rituals.

Review_Title: “A beautiful place next to the Arabian Sea”
Review_Content: Great food; private beach; good view of the sunset. What more can ask for?!We highly recommend this place to anyone who visits the area. The beach is calm; clean and private. The food is delicious and the rooms very clean and comfortable. The owner; Mr. Kurian is very knowledgeable of the area; its history and culture. We had great conversation over dinner with him and the other guests. We didn't want to leave.

We made a last minute booking here for New Years Eve and the agency who dealt with the calls were efficient and accommodating. Mr. Kurien greeted us at Costa Malabari; and we were immediately served lunch. The food here is really delicious; thanks to Anni who served up gorgeous Keralite cuisine for breakfast; lunch and dinner.The room we stayed at was quite basic but shaded and comfortable. However; there seemed to be some sort of rot problem with the wooden ceiling beams; as we noticed a constant trail of wooden grains on the floor; and sometimes the bed. That’s the only small complaint about the place. Step outside the house; and you can settle into comfortable deck chairs on the veranda. In five minutes; its possible to reach the beach; which was quite secluded and a lovely place to watch the sunset. It feels very safe and we didn’t face any trouble wandering back and forth from the beach to the homestay.During our stay; Mr. Kurien was also kind enough to arrange an evening where we watched ‘Theyyam’; which is a traditional ritualistic dance performed by local priests. And to top it all off; we met some fantastic people during our time there and spent New Year’s Eve on an empty beach (plus some curious fishermen!) setting off fireworks and relaxing till the wee hours of the morning. It was a great way to end our trip and we couldn’t bring ourselves to leave!!I highly recommend this place to anyone who visits Kannur and wants a truly relaxing stay coupled with amazing food.
