The location is perfect; in the old fort surrounded by palaces And temples. But this is not the most surprising thing. I never found a place where i have been treated so well. The hotel is run by a family that did even more than I expected to make my 4 days in jaisalmer unforgettable. I have never been treated in such a friendly and sincere way. Absolutely more than raccomanded. Don't miss it!!

My stay at haveli shreenath palace Jaisalmer was fantastic. The hotel itself is beautiful and very clean; the rooms are all lovely and beautifully decorated.maharani room is beautifully decorated. this place on recommendation of a friend.  Warm welcoming with Aarti; Tika & Cold towel at arrival. thank you to all
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your good review; are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks again.

Review_Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights even though we intended just one. We could y bring ourselves to leave. The place is a magical old haveli; as precious as the ones that are tourist attractions. The owner is a wonderful gentleman who was incredibly good to us; making the whole place seem like ours for the two nights. Definitely stay here to get a real taste of what it was like to live in one of these historic structures.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your detailed review and comments.We do hope you will come back to stay with us in the near future and we look forward to welcoming you again. Thank you for your thoughtful review.

Review_Title: “The special stay of the trip; one to remember!”
Review_Content: I have been pushed at every stay in India to write reviews for their hotel or service. However for Shreenath Palace; I had abslutely no hestiation to create an account and give the utmost positive review this hotel deserves The experience here was exactly the kind you want to take away from a foreign country. The experience of feeling welcomed; safe and \at home\" is something so rare in a country vastly different to your own. Omjee; his family and staff are incredibly kind and helpful. On top of the fantastic hospitality; the rooms were the most beautiful we stayed in whilst in India. With beautiful arhitecture and furnishings clashed with some dark and interesting history; I full-heartedly recommend staying here! We even changed our trip to stay longer!"
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your detailed review and comments.We do hope you will come back to stay with us in the near future and we look forward to welcoming you again. Thank you for your thoughtful review.

Review_Title: “Unforgettably magical stay in the heart of Jaisalmer”
Review_Content: Cannot heap enough praise on Omsee and everyone at the Shreenath palace for an all-round wonderful experience. The rooms alone are enough to make you never want to stay in another hotel again - hundreds of years old; Mughal-style architecture with ornately carved stone columns forming the four posters of your bed - but to top it off the service and hospitality given by the host is unsurpassed. We even got given a welcome gift on arrival. Would recommend booking early to avoid disappointment!
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your detailed review and comments.We do hope you will come back to stay with us in the near future and we look forward to welcoming you again. Thank you for your thoughtful review.

Review_Content: I had the opportunity to stay for 2 nights at The Shreenath Palace in Jaisalmer. The city is unique and if you stay inside the fort you can experience it in the evening and early morning with no tourist.I was received as a part of the family; given all the informations by Raj and even was given presents to my familly.The heritage rooms are large; convenient and let you savour the traditional Rajastan way of life.Really recommnend it
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your detailed review and comments. hope you enjoy stay in hotel Thank toy

Review_Content: I was torn between Shreenath and another haveli within the fort; but we absolutely made the right choice. Everything was perfect- the hosts were exceptional and the rooms were beautiful. It was my friend's birthday and the staff surprised her with a birthday cake; sweets; and rose petals everywhere. It was magical! They also helped whenever we needed a recommendation or a short ride. We would absolutely recommend this hotel!
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your good review; are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks again.

Review_Title: “You won't get a warmer welcome anywhere in the world”
Review_Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of my sister - who raved about the place - and were very glad we made the effort to do so. The building; once the home of a 16th century prime minister; is completely unchanged and unspoiled with exquisite stone carved pillars; window and door fittings; and traditional furnishings of red velvet; silks and regal family photos. Added to these joys are discreetly installed modern comforts like wi-fi and bathrooms with lashings of hot water on demand. The owner Omjee and his charming family will bend over backwards to make your stay utterly memorable. When it comes to breakfast; all diets and personal tastes are catered for. We had delicious fresh and dried fruit; nuts and muesli with wonderful home made yoghurt and honey; and lots of hot buttered toast. Omjee and his wife; both highly respected local teachers; recommended places to visit; organised reliable and well informed guilds to take us around and warned us off the kind of tourist resorts where we were liable to get ripped off. Their care and concern was deeply touching. We we could not have been made to feel more welcome; with wonderful garlands and deliciously scented red roses for the room. We arrived as strangers in the night and left feeling like family friends having found a warm and loving home from home in beautiful India.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: All the rooms are equally lovely but the Mogul suite is the largest.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your good review; are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks again.

Review_Title: “Very nice heritage haveli in perfect location”
Review_Content: Our room was heritage and like a small palace with old stones and carvings. Tasty breakfast every day. Location was perfect inside the fort and the family who runs the haveli is sincerely friendly. We would recommend the place to anybody.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your good review; are so happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thanks again.

Review_Content: Thanks a lot Om uncle; Raj and Rinku bhai for doing everything to ensure our stay was most memorable one ever. Never felt like we were staying in a hotel but it was a like a home where everything was at our disposal.Jaisalmer Fort is the only fort in India(or maybe the world) which is inhabitated by over 400 families to date. Shreenath Palace is a 400 hundred yaers old haveli located close to the Dushera Chowk(Palace) ;next to the Jain Temples with total 5 rooms. It is itself a sightseeing spot for folks going towards the Temples.We were picked up from a Railway Station at 5:30 AM in the morning and ushered quickly to our room to ensure we had some sleep before the day start for sightseeing.Though we had booked the Maharani room ;we were upgraded to the Mughal room upon arrival; considering we were the only one staying.We were amazed at the beauty and the old world charm of the room; neat and clean;stained glass windows; curtains and drapes;vintage furniture and everything giving you a Royal feel. It was a dream come true to stay in a 400 years old haveli inhabited by the Royals once.Bathroom was clean to every inch with hot water readily available; weather was cold and a hot water bath was a great respite from an almost 24 hours travel fatigue.Bed was nice with Spring mattress and ample of pillows and cushions to support.Breakfast was too good; Rajasthani delicacies paired with continental stuff. Great varierty and awesome taste.It was our marriage anniversary the next day and we had planned for a Desert Safari and stay overnight in the camps.Om uncle got us a nice deal and ensured we were treated at par and ensured we felt special on the day. It was due to him and his family that we didnt miss ours on the day :)We even got parting gifts upon our check-out :)For both of us; we would definitely go back to Jaisalmer; not for a tourism but just to stay in Shreenath Palace.\They are not selling the Rooms; they are selling the Culture\" Ankita and Ankit KhareChandigarh"
Room_Tips: Room Tip: All rooms are great though Mughal Room is the larger one with bigger bathroom and a better decor

Review_Title: “I can't recommend this place highly enough...”
Review_Content: I arrived at this haveli after a crazy awful night on a really terrible bus - I was sick; cold; and tired. The minute I stepped in the doors - I started feeling better. Within 10 minutes; Omjee had me ushered to a soft chair; wrapped in a warm wool blanket; and drinking delicious masala chai - with a hot water bottle. All this before we even checked in!The hotel was beautiful; clean; and historic; the staff was helpful; kind; and very very good at creating a great stay (Hindu is the best!); and the family who runs this place showed us the best hospitality I've ever seen outside the place I grew up (the Southern U.S.).Seriously - stay here. Omjee; his haveli; and his family are lovely. You will feel right at home in a very far away place here. Plus they will set up your onward trips for you at great prices and with no trouble for you.

Recommend this boutique historic home in the fort at Jaiselmer. The host with the most Omgie fed us breakfast and regaled us from his day bed in the foyer. Overlooking the Jain temples and set in Clean Laneways ( yes! You can walk around without watching your step - for the one and only time in 4 weeks in Rajasthan). Also highly recommend Raj the camel man for a unique camel safari 09602582442. Two nights sleeping under the stars in the Thar Desert ... A once In a lifetime adventure.

I have stayed at this hotel on my many trips to Jaisalmer (usually room 4); so many times that in fact; Omgee and Manoj consider me part of their family. From the very first when the toilet was downstairs and outside in a shack on the verandah to the beautiful en-suite rooms of today the atmosphere has always been exotic (Think Arabian nights) and the service and advice has always been discerning; truthful and very helpful. This advice covers just about anything one wants to do or buy around the area. Omgee's school is worth a visit and school materials are welcome. I cannot recommend this hotel (Home) any higher; and will really give memories that remain forever.The Jain Temple close by is interesting; and the views of the town from the rooftop at Shreenath is wonderful especially at dusk.Treat yourself to a wonderful experience that will never fade.I will be back again!

We arrived sick after a hellish night bus ride and were pampered beyond our wildest imagination. It was like being at your grandparent's house. They also helped make onward travel reservations which was also great.

The hospitality will be beyond anything you have experienced in a hotel. The owners are concerned for their guests every need and genuinely committed to your having an extraordinary experience in the city that has been their home for generations. The rooms provide you with an authentic experience of what it must have been like to live in a palatial home 400 years ago in one of the most remarkable cities in India. Om-ji the Brahmin owner and his son; nephew and staff are kind humorous and warm in a way that one rarely finds in a hotel. Have traveled extensively throughout the world over the last 40 years; I can say that this hotel stands out as one of the most remarkable and unique experiences I have had. I cannot recommend it highly enough.

We spent three days here and found the hotel to be utterly perfect and faultless. From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed the hospitality and kindness of the hosts was outstanding. They made us feel as though the haveli was our own home. The house absolutely reeks with history and atmosphere. It is wonderfully decorated and full of atmosphere. Location could not be better up on the fort and directly across from the Jain temples. We had the Mughal room which was large and decorated out of the Arabian Nights. There is a roof terrace to watch the sunset. Water is hot; showers are very good. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was whatever you wanted. Night time was unexpectedly peaceful given the location right at the heart of the old town. We would love to come back to Jaisalmer and wouldn't stay anywhere else than this now. It really is faultless. Don't hesitate to make a booking
Room_Tips: Room Tip: They are all fabulous.

Review_Title: “Beyond one's most expansive dreams of India”
Review_Content: From the moment you enter the Shreenath Palace you know that this is no ordinary hotel. It is; as you soon find out; the home of a family who have lived there for generations and now opened their home to some privileged guests. And believe me you are privileged to be there. The rooms are exquisite - original Rajastani furnishings and wooden shuttered windows looking over the the Jain temple. Marsala Chai in your room on on the roof or downstaris basking in the hosts' hospitality. Om -ji - the father and his sons and cousins - will do everything within their power and then some more to ensure you have an experience that is filled with all that is wonderous about Jaislamer. If you were to ask me two hotels to visit in India - one would be the Imperial Hotel in Delhi and the other would be this one. The only down side is the ache in your heart when you leave.

My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at this haveli on our honeymoon. We really enjoyed our stay. The owner is a lovely man with a big personality and is very helpful and welcoming. Hindu also looked after us extremely well and nothing was too much trouble. We had delicious indian breakfasts in our room each day. Our room was beautiful and very traditional (a little cold but the cold snap was unusual for Jaisalmer and the havelis are not built for cold weather!). We felt like we experienced true indian hospitality during our stay. I would highly recommend staying here if you want an authentic; friendly and un-flashy Indian experience.

we stayed three nights at shreenath palace and it was truly wonderful & home feeling experience. OM uncle ; the owner is wonderful & nice person. As a parent he advised us what to do and not do. The food was great. The room was beyond our expectation and i could rate it above 5 STAR property.Hindu the service boy is a great human being; Raj bhaiya always took care of small small thing. It was like we are staying in home.The breakfast ; everything was fantastic. I will recommend this home.Geetanjali & Amit
Room_Tips: Room Tip: ALL the rooms are great

Review_Content: This is the first time to live in a havali hotel. My famiy lived in this hotel 2days. the room is clean and the service is perfect. even if you require extra service; the ower of hotel will give you the service what he can. The room is very clean. Compare to 4star or 5 star hotel; I prefer to live in this hotel

We stayed six nights at Shreenath Palace and it was truly wonderful. Omjee the owner is a man of charm ; generosity and wit. His wife is a wonderful cook who cooked up fantastic surprise breakfasts every day. Hindu is an adorable young man with a wealth of knowledge who looked after all our needs. The rooms are spectacular. I really enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend this palace to anyone.

After running away from Desert Haveli guest house we found this wonderful haveli just next door!The owner is a teacher; very kind and attentive to make us spend a good stay.The room was big although cleaned the indian style we did received cleaned sheets and had warm water for the shower!The location; view and very nice environment of a real haveli made the stay excellent!

We were lucky to stay in Shreenath Palace because it was if we were at home! It was so friendly; the owner even invited us for Diwali in his family to share the prayers and the good dinner. Moreover; the Haveli has a lot of charm and is very well situated; do not hesitate to come in this place; you will not regret it.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The rooms are big and the decoration very nice

Review_Content: Hotel Shreenath Palace is the you want to stay when being in Jaisalmer. First of all; the place is a shinig jewel in a town not short of gems; speaking architecturally. But this one will take your breath away. Being roughly 450 years old; it unifies beautifully decorated rooms with modern amenities. It would open a book of epic dimensions to name all the tiny details you can explore in your room. I had the opportunity to see all four rooms with my very own eyes and each of them is a world of its own. Coming from Europe you could maybe feel like in a desert version of a medieval house; coming from the States you probably have never seen anything like it. And here you have the chance in a place that could also easily work as a blueprint for a Jaisalmer haveli. Apart from that; my hosts gave me an incredibly warm welcome and make me feel like a friend; not as a paying guest. This may seem like a common saying; especially since a lot of people will try to sell you stuff when you are in Jaisalmer. But this is more than a refugium from the carpet sellers; this place will make you feel like being really welcomed.

we fell in love with this beautiful haveli and with the family! the decoration is authentic;the rooms are individually furnished and the family really cares and they try to make you feel like family members and not like tourists. a fairytale in stone!

Me and a friend decided to go to jaisalmer without booking a room; we called and luckily they had one for us. We felt like home and not in a hotel. They were so nice; helpful and very caring. We loved the experience and the amazing rooms. Strongly suggested!!!

Stayed in this hotel in the first week of October 2013 for 3 days and 2 nights. Overall had a very comfortable and pleasant stay. And the owner – Mr Giriraj made our stay all the more memorable. The only downside for some people might be that there is no TV in the room but for me personally; I preferred it that way only. Mr Hindu; the assistant; was also very helpful and cooperative. Would highly recommend this place.

We were recommended to stay at Shreenath Palace; a converted haveli; and it did not disappoint in its charm and character. The owner makes you most welcome and distributes small gifts and advice on arrival. The family do all they can to make you feel at home. Excellent position in one of the small alleys which twist and turn inside the fort.The rooms are dotted with small alcoves and colourful drapes hang between pillars making it very atmospheric.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: We had the two upper rooms with views of the temples.

Review_Content: Raj (the owner and generous host) is a legend! Nothing was too much trouble and he (together with his friendly staff) made our stay entertaining as well as very comfortable. The rooms are unique and exquisite in equal measure and the views from the roof top are the best in the walled city. Breakfasts are delicious (ask Raj if he can make you some puri).Many thanks for making our stay so special.

we decided this hotel after seeing good review from net but got utterly disappointed after visiting this hotel. It is a private place with some rooms converted into a heritage type hotel and room allotted to us is found to be stuffy and not spacious and bathroom diappointing. The hotel is in the jaisalmer fort itself with the 2nd largest bldg after the palace and terrace view is good. Though breakfast is included but there is no provision of lunch or dinner and has to arranged from outside. Frequent low voltage problem observed with lights getting dimmed and AC not working. The only positive side is the owner and staffs being very courteous and helpful. Over all we would not recommend this hotel.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: nothing but experience of staying in a fort is to be recommend about this hotel

Review_Content: Last week; we ie. me; my wife; my 5-yr old son and an attendant had visited jaisalmer. A close friend of mine had asked us to stay in this particular hotel. So without any further enquiries; my wife made a reservation for two nights with Giraj (hotel owner) over phone. Right from day one of her telephonic conversation with Giraj; he was extremely cooperative and helpful.On the day we reached Jaisalmer; we were picked up by an auto rickshaw from the station (as cars are not allowed inside the Fort where the hotel is located). As soon as we reached the hotel; Giraj's father (Uncle) was there to greet us. And what a man he is!! He is so full of life. A real joy to be with and very well respected by everyone in the fort. And so is Giraj. They went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. The entire family used to be there for our every whim and fancies.We stayed in two different rooms - and both the rooms are very tastefully done and have split air-conditioners. Though none of the rooms have televisions; we never felt its absence as we would all be chit-chatting late into the night with the entire family. They did not even charge us for the nimbu-paani; tea and snacks which we had everyday inspite of us offering to pay. Their large-hearted hospitality was the reason that we extended our stay there by one day. Special mention to the hotel staff Mr Hindu. Always smiling and ready to serve. In short; henceforth we cant even think of staying anywhere other then this Haveli. This is our home away from our home.................!!

Review_Title: “Hotel ;owner; staff  all fine but room need updates for amenities .”
Review_Content: The hotel room and owner; staff were fantastic.great care of us throughout our stay; making helpful suggestions; Spent 3 nights here on a jaisalmer  tour. We had the Maharaja room but   room The furnishings however were inadequate; with only a bed; no table or chairs no tv;no phone. the way to the Hotel  can get a little crowded since it is right on the path to the  Jain temples.we  want convenience and fancy; hotel is old haveli.If you want conveniece ans fancy please stay another hotel.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest ;We are also disappointed to READ about your experience just in TripadvisorWhen did you book room and ask me about tv; phone etc. We told you that this hotel is not fancy hotel it is old haveli. Then you say it is OK we like to stay this place. 2ed nights we offer you if you don’t want to stay in hotel we only charge for one night but you say on we like to stay on room and look this people How visit jain temple and jaisalmer life. When you check out room I you ask you about experience; you say it is very nice and best hotel in our tour.About crowd I hope you can understand that it is not one of our amenities .your stay was during the high season.Thank you

Review_Content: last week i went to Jaisalmar along with my parents ; trust me it was truly amazing .i would really like to appreciate our all the arrangements done by Mr.Raj to make this trip a memorable one. Such a not expensive and relaxed place where I always feel at home.I took my breakfast at the rooftop and I could see there the rising sun.The room was clean and they helped me with information and everything I needed .

Review_Title: ““Good view and location; but that's all .. simply great”
Review_Content: I have been to this hotel twice.. Both the times my stay was pleasant and comfortable..The staff was good as well as food . .Very nice and comfortable stay - would like to recommend it for other's ...

14-2-2013 beautiful vaulted rooms; small balconies with stunning views of the lovely streets;sculpted figures and Christmas balls on the ceiling. Hooks on the wall for the oil lamps in the old time. It was a fairy tale. The roof terrace has a spectculair view of the temples. We were given a scarf and were invited to drink chai tea at the family across the street. Very sweet; welcoming and helpful owners.The owner had to go to the hospital with heart trouble in Bikaner; he would remain there for one night and the son or cousin Raki made serious abuse of this situation. He show me the rooms and told me that he was waiting for a bride. He was bothering me and told that he already had had sex in the hotel with a woman who was 65 years old. It is terrible that by the behavior of him this family business becomes a bad name. I hope for those sweet; nice family; that he never becomes the manager of this wonderful family business. (especially Hindu; was very helpful)

Stayed here in August 2013 and would highly recommend. The owner and his staff made us feel like part of the family they were so welcoming. As for the rooms....truly amazing. It was like stepping back in time to another world. You will not be disappointed if you book this place...it is wonderful.

At the corner of an eventful lane in Jaisalmer; stands a proud historic structure called the Shreenath Palace. It is a beautiful ancient palace that is now run as a palace hotel for the tourists who visit the city of Jaisalmer. I visited Jaisalmer with my family in the month of December. It was extremely crowded being a peak tourist season. The Shreenath Palace is astoundingly peaceful and a quiet luxurious get away from the bustling events of the day in the city. There are only 5 rooms in the entire Palace; which makes this place all the more exclusive! The sooner your book them the better it is; its a limited edition/luxury hotel.The interiors and architecture have been retained as they were which really enhanced the authenticity of the place; it takes you back in time. Ofcourse; there are some minimum necessary changes to make your stay more convenient and comfortable. The Rooms and restrooms are splendid; clean and well maintained; without any problem in the support services. The narrow; circular stairway and really high steps are an excellent workout to get to your room! Walking into the room; I was amazed at the ambience; as I had only read about such high ceilings; lavish bed spreads and elaborate architecture in my history textbooks; however thanks to Shreenath Palace; I was living my dream. The walls; steps; windows have not been changed wee bit; and that is what makes this place so special. The ancient large windows and galleries provide you with a beautiful view of the small city; it is indeed a treasured experience to sit there and enjoy the quiet and the winds. Considering the hectic lifestyles that each one of us have; this place really calms you down and allows you to spend quality time with yourself and your family; moreover you can really connect and be in sync with yourself here. Winter vacations to this place are highly recommended. It has an amazing terrace with a view of the city that will amaze you; totally worth it! There is no television; telephone or wifi in your rooms; you may receive those services by contacting the staff. To order your tea or breakfast; you have to open the window of your room; stick your head out and shout out to Mr. Hindu; the support staff; to tell him what you want. This is a once in a lifetime experience! You will live like the people lived in history! Go ahead and pamper yourself :) Hot tea with warm buttered toast in the cold mornings brought to your room; are simply wow! Couple of minutes from Shreenath Palace is a rooftop restaurant called Sagar; which has mouth watering Indian cuisine; with a really welcoming service staff. This place is a must; especially in the cold! All the important historic monuments are within walking range from Shreenath Palace; adjoining is the market for interested shoppers. The owner; Mr. Raj Vyas; is an incredibly warm host supported by the efficient room and other services of his employee Mr. Hindu. Also; feel free to ask Mr. Raj about the variety of events and places that you could explore during your stay. Apart from being a wonderful place to stay; it is also an important historic structure; one of the spots you would halt at with your tourist guide; as it belonged to the financial advisor of the king at a time in the history of Jaisalmer; who are the ancestors of the owner; Mr. Raj. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable and luxurious experience! Don't forget to sit by the window/gallery and enjoy! This place is highly recommended by me and my family members; will definitely visit again! <U+F04A>
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go for the Mughal and Maharani rooms!

Review_Content: My husband and I stayed in Shreenath Palace for 4 nights in March and were made so welcome by everyone there that it felt like we were leaving old friends when we departed. Rakesh told us that Shreenath was our home while we were there and it really did feel like it! We stayed in the opulent Maharajah suite and in the morning when we were ready for breakfast we opened our window and shouted down to Hindu who brought it to our room. We enjoyed beautiful sunsets from the rooftop and also a sunrise on our last day when Hindu served us breakfast on the roof. Raj also gave me beautiful sumptuous sari fabric for a gift before we left. The family are among the warmest and most hospitable that we have ever had the pleasure to meet. And what a hotel! It is an ornate sandstone haveli in the middle of the fort; intricately carved; a real work of art; as lovely as any tourist attraction in the town. It is a two minute walk from the Jain temples; the main square and many bars and restaurants. I could not recommend the hotel highly enough and I sincerely hope we will return again in future years; both to beautiful Jaisalmer and to our friends at Shreenath Palace.

A spectacular room in this tiny; four room hotel in the heart of the old city of Jaisalmer. Original rooms. If a little more care was taken on sheets etc. we could not have asked for more. There is not a restaurant in the hotel but breakfast is brought to your bedroom in the morning. No roof top seating but a great view over the city and the adjoining Jain Temples with a plentiful choice of roof top cafes nearby.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book the best possible.

Review_Content: We arrived here on the overnight train and our driver was waiting for us. We were very weary from the trip; and this was all taken care of when we arrived at the hotel. We were shown to a room while ours was being made ready. Spiced tea was brought to us and we could relax and get a snooze. On the day of our departure; the manager let us stay in the room well past checkout time as our train was late in the evening. This made it one of the best places we stayed in India.

I loved this place; in every way….for its great location; its rooms and most of all for its personal care. I felt as though I was really staying in a palace out of some medieval novel. Actually; this is a five room hotel; created by the family who owns this old merchant’s mansion in the heart of the walled city. Everyone here was just great….Hindu; who was the rooms attendant; was a delight…always happy to assist with anything. He brought breakfast up in the morning; accompanied me to the markets; made sure the laundry was done; helped me bargain; and was such a font of information about culture and the city. The whole family appeared from time to time; making this a delightfully personalized visit. Though this may be a ‘palace’ do not expect 5-star accommodations. Beds are probably two short for anyone over 6 feet; there is no TV; Wifi is available in the lobby; and by western standards; the bathroom may be a bit primitive.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: There are only five rooms...If you have trouble climbing steep stairs; ask for a room on the second...

Review_Content: My friend and I had the good fortune to stay in this lovely place for four nights. Omsey (sp?); Raj; Rakesh and Hindu looked after us very kindly and thoughtfully provided us with everything we needed. Hotel Shreenath is fascinating from an historical point of view and the life in the narrow streets is amazing. The overnight train trip from Jaipur was daunting but was made worthwhile by the warmth of the welcome we received and the richness and comfort of our surroundings. We had evening drinks on the rooftop of Hotel Shreenath and also at Krishna's Boulangerie nearby. The views of the plains of Rajasthan from both places is spectacular and the food at Krishna's Boulangerie is wonderful. I can highly recommend this as a marvelous place to stay.

This family run historical place was the best hotel experience druing our trip in India. We stayed in room 5 where you can adore a fantastic view of the Jaina temple. The staff were super friendly and very helpful. If you like a historical haveli with truly genuin warm hospitality; this would be the place to stay.

We stayed at Shreenath Palace for for three nights in December. It it one of the few fort havelis still owned and run by the same family that originally build the house some 400 years ago. Our room was full of character and the owners and staff both friendly and helpful; we were made to feel very welcome. The views of the sunset from the hotel roof was excellent. Breakfast was toast and honey and not much of a highlight; served in the bedroom as the hotel has no dinning area. Wifi can be accessed from reception. The shower water was always hot for which the staff took much pride. We enjoyed our stay here very much and have recommended it to other travellers.

We stayed one weekend in this hotel and it was a good experience. I looked for many guesthouses and think this had really good value for money; service was excellent and helplful. Rooftop was also pretty high; so it's nice to see some views. We had overall no worries at all during our stay. Nice people; interesting place and good rooms made this weekend really a special one!

The Shreenath Hotel is the perfect choice for being pampered! My friend and I were picked up from the train station and; once we got there we noticed a lovely welcome note which stood right at the entrance; which made it a very special welcoming. The rooms are exactly what one expects; an old haveli which takes you back into time and makes you feel like you're part of the maharajah's court. Raj and his dad made us feel so welcome and have treated us so nice - even let us rest in a room after coming back from our 2 day camel trek cost free. We spend time chatting and Raj's dad made us feel like part of the family. I'd definitely go back there and recommend it to anyone looking for a hassle free; cozy; yet princy treatment.

This 450-year-old haveli is filled with character and charm: sandstone walls; neat alcoves and tiny windows; carved archways and columns; beautiful decor; and a fantastic rooftop to sit with chai and watch the sun set over the Jain temples...just the kind of place I love! Of course; with that comes the challenges of an old building: mustiness; inconsistent hot water and wifi; and very uncomfortable beds; just things that you accept are part of this unique stay. After some initial challenges discussing pricing and room availability (as compared to our reservations); Raj and his father; along with their houseboy Hindoo; became some of our favorite people we met throughout our trip. They are warm; energetic and fun; and they took great care of us throughout our stay; making helpful suggestions; providing sleeping bags for our overnight camel trek and especially when I got a bad cold at the end of our stay.Jaisalmer is a wonderful place; filled with friendly people and amazing history; and a stay at Shreenath Palace is a must!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: We stayed in two rooms (before and after the camel trek)...the Rajasthani room is on the top floor a...

Review_Title: “Probably not for everyone; but amazing if you want a unique stay.”
Review_Content: This is perhaps one of the most unusual places we've stayed in; anywhere. For starters Jaisalmer is unique in that people have lived continuously inside the fort for many hundreds of years. Staying here; you become one of them. If you prefer Hiltons and Hyatts; this is probably not for you.Since cars are not allowed inside the fort; to get to the hotel you'll need to transfer to a tuk tuk (3 wheel motorcycle taxi) or else walk through the narrow lanes.The property has been in the same family for generations and in reality; this is more of a guest house than a hotel. The rooms are historic and though simply furnished; are comfortable; though everything (pillows included) are old. There is no elevator and it is a bit of a hike up the stone stairs.The best part of the stay was the people - the owner; his son; and their \boy\". They genuinely cared for our well being and did all they could to make us comfortable. For instance; my sons and I went up to the roof to watch the sunset and they came up after us with a blanket and water. Also; when we arrived; they pulled out a selection of scarves for us to choose as gifts.We were here in the midst of summer; when it is incredibly hot. Although our rooms had a/c units; they really couldn't chill enough and we didn't get much sleep the first night. Also; like many parts of India; regular power outages are the norm and this place does not have a backup generator; so when the power goes out; only the fans keep going. When my wife was upset the next morning and chose not to have breakfast; we later learned that the owner refused his own breakfast in sympathy. When we returned; he did everything he could to cheer her up. When they found out the problem; they brought in swamp coolers to help bring the temperature down. While not what I would call cold; the room was cool enough for us to get a good night's sleep.If you want convenience and fancy; go elsewhere outside the fort. If you want a unique experience and to meet some fantastic people; stay here."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: If staying during summer; make sure the A/C is sufficient; else ask them to bring in some swamp cool...

Review_Content: We were collected by car at Jodhpur airport by an AC car and arrived at the Palace 5hrs later.Be warned; despite the distance and how long you think it should take if you were driving; it takes twice as long because of the road quality; cows and the fact that the owner of the Palace tells the driver to drive us foreigners slowly no doubt due to scare stories you can read on here from some people about high speed near misses and head-on collisions. So...slow but safe is nice if not a tad frustrating.We were met by Hindu; the hotel helper who carried our luggage from the main square within the fort to the short walk to the hotel.The hotel itself is in a 450yr old 4 storey haveli. As with all authentic palaces like this; its a little rough around the edges but full of charm and delight.We had a welcome cup of tea with the owner who excitedly told us about all the famous and important guests he'd had and checked with us what our plans were for the next few days. We met his wife and his other helper and were immediately made to feel we were staying in his house rather than a hotel.The rooms upon initial entry were 'wow' with stunning carved stone walls and porticos with majestic beds and carpets and curtains. Closer inspection and its a little more shabby chic but the views from your own little balcony of the Jain Temples make up for it.On the downside; the bed is rock hard and for someone in their 40's as opposed to a backpacker in their 20's; I'd have preferred more comfort. The bathroom with shower is basic but works and there is nowhere to hang clothes but we are in Jasailmer and this has retained its original charm as opposed to being sanitised by a Hilton or Ian Schrager. You could wipe it clean and wipe out its character to produce a perfect boutique hotel but that's not the point.The best part of this place is the owner and the staff. Hindu was a delight to chat to over breakfast on the roof terrace with his tales of life in his home village and ans for his life. The owner was a complete charmer. A real friendly uncle who you wanted to hug. He personally took us out to the desert for camel riding because he liked to personally check the quality of the camels. He was always telling us not to buy anything without asking him first because he could get us a better deal with the same person and the cynic new arrival from London in me didn't believe it was anything more than a typical ruse to get me to buy from his friend instead; but I was wrong and he really does know everyone and really could get you a better deal on everything. We were late back from the desert so missed the Jaisalmer Palace opening times but he knew the Commissioner and offered to open the Palace up for us specially to have a night time view.So: loved Jasailmer; loved the fort; the desert and the amazingly friendly shopkeepers and tuk-tuk drivers everywhere in the town; loved the haveli but really loved the owner so it didn't matter if I liked; loathed or loved the room.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: make sure you ask if any room has AC and if it does (not just a fan) choose it!

Review_Content: We stayed one night in the Shreenath Palace as a wee treat after our camel safari.The place is really fantastic. A 450 year old mansion house in an ancient fort. Our room seemed to consist entirely of elaborately carved; honey-coloured sandstone.The beauty of the building is only half the appeal too. The warmth of the welcome and generosity of the hosts would make even the most ordinary hotel a great experience.I would not hesitate to recommend the Shreenath to anyone visiting Jaisalmer.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Both AC rooms are gorgeous.

Review_Title: “Requested this Haveli to be specifically added to my Tour”
Review_Content: My tour company did not add Jaisalmer so I had to ask for it to be added; and when I did; this was the only place I wanted to stay. I was not disappointed for second. This place is an exciting; living bit of history that welcomes you to rest your head in the past. Don't expect cold modernism...embrace uniqueness that throws you into the center of everything. Even if you can only stay a night; you should try this place.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The Mughal Suite is the way to go!

Review_Content: On my third visit to India; I made sure I visited Jaisalmer... we hired a car from Bhuj in Kutcch and drove all the way to Jaisalmer. We were welcomed and hosted like Royals . The hotel owner had made perfect arrangements for us for sightseeing the palaces within the city walls and also a camel desert safari with musical and dance entertainment over the evening dinner on divan style seating. The accommodation was something to remember .... after all we dont get to stay in 450 year old havelis anymore. The mornings were an absolute charm allowing sunrays passing the arched small windows. Best time to visit November to Feb.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: find the one with as many windows as possible facing the temple.

Review_Content: We want to thank and recomend this place; we were in India 5 months; a family of six; and this was the best service and most autentic place to stay for far... we thank you so much for your lovely family attention and for your breakfast; that for our sourprise they didnt want to charge us! so many more resason to recomend this place...
Room_Tips: Room Tip: original 450 years Old Haveli inside the fortress; original rooms.

Review_Content: We stayed two nights at The Shreenath Palace; it is an old haveli; which is close to all the major sights within the fort. The Jain temples were almost within touching distance of our bedroom window. The Palace a 2 minute walk away. Our room was large; clean and comfortable; the mattresses are hard but I actually prefer a hard mattress. It is an old building (450 years old) the stairs in the hotel are narrow and steep; would not be suitable for people with mobility problems. Be careful with the door frames as they are really low; my poor husband hit his head so many times...Hindoo the person for everything; was really very helpful; always smiling and could not do enough for us.There is no restaurant in the hotel; this for us was not a problem as there are enough places to eat within walking distances.As another reviewer pointed out; the rooms are a little dusty; there is no glass in the windows; just shutters; all these small things did not matter for us; staying in this wonderful bit of history was what mattered.I would definitely recommend this place.

My wife and I stayed for 7 nights as part of a month-long trip around northern Rajasthan in celebration of our 40th wedding anniversary.The haveli is close to the major sights within the fort - the Jain temples were almost within touching distance of our bedroom window while the Palace was a 2 minute stroll away. As is frequently the case with such an old building; the stairs are steep but the ambience is well worth the physical exertion - if you want characterless comfort pick an antiseptic alternative provided by one of the global chains.The real stars of the haveli; however; are the people. Hindoo; the general factotum; was always on hand to help and (on demand/free of charge) made the best masala chai that we have ever tasted throughout our many trips to India. Raj; the owner's son; was ever helpful and smiling. As for the owner; Rakesh; l struggle to find words to describe his friendliness and generosity - from the arrangements he made to celebrate our anniversary; through his booking of a sunset camel ride on the dunes at Khuri (including snacks and drink that he provided) and his obtaining a luxury car to ferry us beyond Jodhpur. In each case; his actions went well beyond any reasonable expectation.Referring to some of the comments contained within other reviews - yes; the mattresses are hard (but this is India); yes; the room was slightly dusty - a reflection of the fact that the windows have no glass but loose fitting shutters and the town is in the middle of a desert; and yes there were no chairs but rather cushions and mats on which to sit/lie.In conclusion; a lovely; atmospheric building with great people - I would suggest that only the inflexible of mind and body should reject the haveli as a possible haven of rest.

Reading the previous reviews I kept thinking: what’s the point of visiting India; if tourists don’t give a chance to themselves to be a part of India; to enter in the deep ethos of India and its people; their routines; their flavors; their colors; smells; religion; respects; culture after all. In Rome; be a roman.When we went to Shreenath Palace Hotel we felt we were home; at our Indian home. Every single detail was a kind; tender and touching gift from a family who run a business; like a family carefully run its own house. It’s not about the staff; which actually is absolutely helpful and careful; it is about the way you relate with this family. And our experience gave us the best memories of India. Everything was as expected. They arrange us massages in our room; desert experiences; city tours; great rickshaw drivers; shopping tips; the best flavors in town; even clothes (we have lost a backpack in the airplane company; and they help us to got it back); internet; rooftop view chai; friendship; unforgettable memories.Our room was a comfortable; clean; pleasant and a traditional Indian room from an ancient haveli; which; in fact; the hotel is.Our location; the best in town; was just in the center of the fort; two steps away from the temples; the palace and the doors of the fort.Beyond doubt we sincerely recommend this hotel. And we only hope we go again soon.

Nice friendly very atmospheric historical hotel and room but for the high price we would like it to be cleaner; better maintained and with softer mattresses. Also wi-fi is extremely weak. Also; we thought Jaiselmar was a major tourist trap ... What a shame.

Spent two nights here on a Rajasthan tour with my wife and daughter.We went to Jaisalmer expecting a rough and ready frontier town; but it is in fact just a tourist trap with no other reason for its existence. Full of tat shops and italian restaurants. The old fort is pretty much spoiled by all this; and doesn't really bear comparison with Mehrangarh in Jodhpur.This hotel; I guess like many others; makes much of the fact that it is inside the fort; and this certainly adds to its charm - although I don't believe this should be an excuse for the lack of facilities generally available. I think they just want to keep up with the 'out there' backpacker expectations (not that they'll get any at the prices they charge).Shreenath palace is an old haveli; and the rooms are fantastically decorated; all carved sandstone; archways and balconies. The furnishings however were inadequate; with only a bed; no table or chairs; and the bathroom while reasonably clean was in poor condition.The young chap; Hindoo; who did all the running around for the owner did a good job of breakfast; and arranged rickshaws to and from where our driver had to drop us off outside the fort.If we found reason to go to Jaisalmer again (can't think of one at the moment); we might stay again - but only for the sake of amusement rather than luxury!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The stairs are very steep; but are round such tight corners you couldn't fall very far.

Review_Title: “Not just visiting a historic monument - sleeping in one!”
Review_Content: There is apparently a lot of debate (controversy) about staying in the fort; so much so that Lonely Planet doesn't review hotels and restaurants there. I don't agree with this - these people have to make a living as well - so we booked a room here without regret. We didn't regret our decision afterward either. The hotel is quaint and historic. The kids loved it from the first moment - they said it was like being in an Indiana Jones movie. Plus; the doors were their size. Adults have to be very careful of this; especially the first night trying to get to the bathroom. The owners (a father and son team) were very hospitable; and the location was perfect. The only criticism I can think of was that there were small details that somewhat spoiled the experience - liked exposed wires hanging from the ceiling and things like that. I understand that it is hard to make a hotel out of a 450-year-old building; but the experience would be much better for travellers if they tried a little harder to cover some of these things up.

Absolutely amazing place to stay. Rakesh said treat this like your home and he meant it; nothing was too much trouble from moving rooms when the air con failed; taking me to the ATM on his motor cycle; spending the night looking at three albums of a recent family wedding such genuine and friendly people. We also had a great evening in conversation with the owner about our respective families and grandchildren. Brilliant i can't speak highly enough of the staff and the place.Raj. Rakesh and Hundu; thank you for making our stay special!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: All of them are fantastic and excellent value for money but the stairs are steep

Review_Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We found it comfortable and the staff very helpful. Our room was large with one king size bed. The hotel is small and atmospheric and all the walls are made from the same sandstone as the fort. The hotel was clean but lighting was poor on the stairs and door frames are low which we were warned about. There is no restaurant and food inside the fort can be expensive so we usually had to walk for about 10 or 15 minutes down to the town for breakfast and lunch which we did not mind but it was very hot and it was a steep uphill walk back to the fort. This might not suit older people or those with a disability.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: We found some of the expensive hotels outside the fort much cheaper to eat in than restaurants of lo...

Review_Title: “by far the most authentic; charming and luxurious place i've stayed in in india”
Review_Content: From the warm and gracious owner and his son; who still live in this 450 year old haveli; to my charming room and bathroom; great service and wonderful rooftop view; my experience in this place has been amazing. I'd recommend this place to anyone; and can only hope that you are as transported in time as i was; and truly feel like a guest in someone's home. I'm a conservator for historic buildings; so this was right up my alley. Jaisalmer is also the only living fort in India!

As many have mentioned; the owner of this hotel is very friendly and tries to be as helpful as possible. I was sick upon arrive and the whole staff was helpful and caring-even fetching hydration salts; biscuits; and water for me. The one staff issue we did have was that the young man on staff stares at the female guests. At one point; we sat waiting for our friend to finish checking her email and he sat and stared at us for a good 20 minutes. It was awkward to say the least. Hopefully some feedback to the owner will help this issue. The rooms are beautiful but need to be kept cleaner since the hotel is in the dusty; dirty fort. Beds were very hard and we didn't have hot water for the two nights we stayed. My room stayed comfortable but my friends' room with a vaulted ceiling got quite hot. They were also a little unnerved by the fact that the staff room on the floor above them opened up into their room. With the problem with the staff staring at us; we weren't sure if there was any \peeking\" going on or not. Overall; the owner is a good guy who has a beautiful home he has opened up to travelers. His kindness overshadows the downfalls of this place. Would I stay there again? Probably not; but I appreciate the experience I had."

This hotel is in an excellent location; right in the midst of the key attractions within the fort. The hotel staff are very warm and make you feel at home. Would definitely recommend staying here if you want to experience a traditional way of living.

Stayed here for 2 nights. Raj and company do their best to make you feel comfortable. We stayed in the blue Mughal room. They brought breakfast to us in our room each morning. The rumor is that there are several shady hotels in the fort; but this one is not. The staff really go out of their way to make you feel at home. If staying in the fort; this is a great choice. The only minor complaint I have is that the mattress was a little uncomfortable; but I got used to it after 1 night.

Review_Title: “Great Stay in the centre of the fort - atmosphere and nice rooms”
Review_Content: Stayed with my wife and sister. We had the maharaja and the Mughal Room. Both rooms are very spacious; have a great atmosphere and were very clean. The hotel is in the centre of the fort - that's where you want to be when in Jaisalmer. They picked us up at the railway station. We booked a camel tour trough them and it was very nice. We had a private tour just for the three of us and had 1;5h camel ride (and no other tourists were to be seen or heard) and a nice night around a log fire. The owner is very nice and is really looking for his guests to have a good stay. When in Jaisalmer I would always go the again.
Very nice view of the entire city and gr8 ambience. would recommend visitors to stay and enjoy..... its eccentricity...No wonder jaisalmer is the only city where so many families live on FORT.

We stayed three nights here in Nov 2010; two nights in the RED room and 1 night in the BLUE room (sorry; forgot the actual names). The rooms are very well decorated and give a genuinely unique experience in this part of Rajastan. The prices are not cheap (about $75-80 USD per night) but this is worth it for 2 or 3 nights if you are visiting Jaisalmer. The location is deep within inside the fort making it very easy to visit the fort museum and nearby Jane temples; both well worth spending some time. The staff are friendly and not pushy which is important I think in India. They were always available to answer questions and help give information for further transportation and purchase items but they never tried to push their own camel safaris or other services. Overall; we were very happy with this hotel; happily recommend it as a genuinely unique travel experience and will certainly return to this very establishment if/when we ever return to Jaisalmer.

We stayed three nights in this beautiful Haveli. Our experience was the best! We were treated like family; in fact we were invited to Raj's son's second birthday. Omji; my newly adopted younger brother was so kind; they look after you as honored family; not paying guests. We wouldn't have missed the birthday party for anything; a beautiful warm; welcoming family. What a fabulous experience! The room was beautiful; the staff; Hindu especially; were incredible; could not have been more helpful or nice. What a unique; rich experience; which is why my husband and I travel. I hate to admit this but I cried upon leaving. If you are not interested in becoming absorbed in the rich; warm; elegant history of Jaiselmer; don't stay here but I promise you; it will be your loss.
I hightly recommend this hotel. You will feel like a maharajah/marani :)Great location; great service. I will go again!

The hotel was lovely - really old style india. The building was beautiful and we went up onto the roof at night. The manager and the staff were excellent. The staf couldn't do enough for you and got us extra fans; water at night towels etc. The manager was also lovely - arranging for us to visit his fathers school. He also paid for the tuk tuk to and from the station. It seemed he was more interested in us having an enjoyable stay than then money. Excellent location - right in the fort.

Location - Inside the Fort; Near the Jain Temple (Excellent)Service - Homelike (Excellent)Value for moneyRooms - Hotel is a old haveli; Rooms have been maintained to have old glory and grandeurSleep Quality - Very comfortableHotel staff is courteous and helpful

I was very well welcomed in this hotel which is also very well situated in the town. The owner (as well as his family and staff) is very concerned with the well being of people staying at the hotel and the decoration of the rooms is very nice. Thanks again.

The Shreenath Palace Hotel was the worst place we stayed during our 2 week trip around northern India .Whilst the hosts are charming and helpful; and the building itself is part of an ancient fort - the two do not successfully combine to create a comfortable hotel.We stayed in the ‘Maharajah Suite’ on the second floor – and earlier photos posted on TripAdvisor conceal much - for example. - a commercial air cooler only 300mm from the bedhead; - bathmats used in lieu of pillowcases; - no bathroom toiletries except a collection of used soaps - presumably left by other guests; - towels/toilet roll placed in bedroom as nowhere to locate in bathroom except on the floor ( the available shelf space being used for toilet cleaning tools !).- dire view thro' ill-fitting (probably original) bedroom 'window' shutter - no glass fitted !.and not least of all - an absolutely rock-hard bedAccess to the hotel is by foot or ‘tuk-tuk’ thro’ very narrow lanes which are also inhabited by a mixture of dogs and cattle ! !……(the nearest taxi access is almost 1km away)In summary – despite the hotelier’s efforts - a thoroughly grim experience !.

Where to start? The room was royal; with spacious comfortable beds (I have a bad back; so a hard mattress is heaven for me; when I find a soft one I have to put it on the floor to survive the night) and part of it was made into a marble bathroom. The bathroom was a bit chilly in the mornings because it has no glass windowpanes; but it was enough to make sure you had your shower in the afternoon; when it was sunny. There were pigeons on the arched windows; and you had a choice of a number of wonderful views. Such peace and beauty that cannot be conveyed. The owners were; as also written by other people; really kind and polite; they were helpful only when needed and didn't intrude in the least when not needed; always ready to share useful tips (on how much things should cost outside; for instance). They never ever pressured us to buy a camel tour or anything from them. When my daughter and I were sick because of flies on the food in a restaurant; the owner came up with fruit and biscuits; knowing we hadn't been out for a couple of days and probably were hungry. I mean; such a sweetie!And the price was incredible value. I would definitely go back there. Maybe there are other havelis as beautiful as this one; so one is tempted to go and experience another one next time; but I would surely consider going back to the same one; just because I know these people; and this makes a difference.

Review_Title: “Wonderful stay at the dream city of Jaisalmer”
Review_Content: Our stay at the Shreenath Palace Haveli in Jaisalmer has been a very pleasant one. Raj and his family made our stay unforgettable. The dates coincided with my birthday and they did everything - from sending bowls of roses to getting me a birthday cake and presents - to make me feel at home. The rooms are designed to give the guests a taste of how it was like to be maharajas and maharanis :-) I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay at Jaisalmer.

Review_Title: “Feel like a Maharaja for a few days.”
Review_Content: There are many varying opinions on \staying inside the Fort\" versus \"staying outside the Fort\". We (whether it be right or wrong) fell in love with Hotel Shreenath Palace; and stayed for 2 nights in November 2009 (Maharaja Room). Built in the 15th century; descendants of the original family still live here today! The owner is a delightful man and very willing to share with you his wealth of knowledge of the local area. The haveli is intimate (5 guest rooms); features many intricate carvings and is a treasure trove of gorgeous archways; delicate alcoves; varying sized balconies and winding staircases. Our room overlooked the nearby Jain Temples.Despite the plethora of shops selling camel safaris and Rajasthani handcrafts; it's hard not to be enchanted with Jaisalmer. The imposing Fort rises magically like a multi-turreted sand castle. It is a spectacular sight during the day; but when floodlit at night; it take on a whole new appeal. Jaisal Italy offers brilliant views from their rooftop restaurant; and they serve excellent pizzas too! An intricate web of narrow streets meander their way through the insides of the Fort. The sacred cow wanders freely. Take care as you approach corners; you may run into a set of horns or there may be a fresh cow pad waiting for you to step in! Make sure you visit the Old City; in particular; several of the lavish sandstone havelis. We visited Khuri Sand Dunes (approximately 40km southeast of Jaisalmer) for a sunset camel safari. Do your homework regarding \"fair and reasonable price\" before you arrive! There are plenty of operators willing to overcharge!! We had a very pleasant experience though you are not alone. The night we visited; there were possibly 30-50 other tourists also experiencing the dunes. We travelled alone (not as one big group) but you can still see and hear the other people on the dunes. From the research I did; Khuri is much less touristy than Sam Sand Dunes (also 40km from Jaisalmer but different direction); so you can expect even a less personal experience there. Khuri is a small village where many of the locals live in mud huts with straw thatched roofs."

Upon arrival; we were given flower garlands and taken to the most beautiful room I've ever seen which held me in wonder for the 2 nights we spent there. Perfect location for checking out Jaisalmer. We were brought chai each morning and our lovely hosts arranged a camel trek for us; as well as looking after our bags on our day of departure and allowing us to return to the hotel before our train in the evening to have a sit down and a shower before leaving the town; even though we had already checked out! You must stay at this haven of a hotel

Review_Title: “Like a real palace for the place and for the way the owners make you feel”
Review_Content: The family could not be nicer and more welcoming in a very natural way. The house and the rooms are beautiful; colorful decoration; very well maintained. They helped us with everything we needed and had great details with us. Located inside of the fort; streets with authentic ambiance. Right next to the spectacular Jain Temple. Could not think of a better place for Jaisalmer.

We had the 2 suite rooms on the top floor for my wife and myself and our 3 young children. Service and arrangements were excellent. No complaints. And staying right in the fort is a once in a lifetime experience. The owners are just outstanding people. We couldn't have been more pleased. But being 500 years old; it is not the most comfortable hotel in the world (very hard beds).

We only spent one night in this hotel but all four of us (two couples) appreciated our stay! The rooms are beautiful; the building also (a haveli). There are pillows on the floor to sit and read; next to the windows with view on the Jain temples. The mattress was very hard but that was the case in most of the hotels we stayed in during our two week vacation in Northern India. We were nicely surprised by the kindness of the owner and of Hindu; the person that does everything in there! He came all the way outside the fort to help us carry our luggage and was always there when we needed something. The owner offered us breakfast in the morning and a silk shawl to every one of us \a new year's present\" as he said. Its a pitty the roof is not available to sit or eat. Hindu showed us the rooftop area when we took the rooms but there is no protection and going up there at night is not recommended..."

The first impression of the location; the hotel and the rooms was \wow!\" (Located in the middle of the fairy-tale Fort Jaisalmer in an enchanting old building). The impression at the end of our stay was even better. The owners are so personal and hospitable; they satisfied any of our wishes and were so caring about us. The breakfast impressed me also. They have a very good choice (considering overall Indian standard) which was very deliciuous even for us; Europeans. The owner organized a camel safari for us and it was really charming - sunset in the dunes and the dinner at the fire; surrounded by sand and the camels. So simple things can taste so good if you are at the right place with right people!!!"

We travelled to Jaisalmer with a big group of family & friends. The group mainly comprised of senior citizens and hence while planning the trip; we were very apprehensive about the hotels that we would choose. Shreenath Palace is a quaint hotel inside the Fort and the hospitality that we experienced was something we will never forget. For the 3 days that we stayed; the hotel was almost like a home to us. Omji (the owner) and Raj (his son) are fantastic hosts and they ensured that all of us were comfortable throughout our stay.

Wonderful place for anyone who will like to stay in a warm; friendly and homely environment. Situated right inside the Jaisalmer fort and at stone throw-away distance from the palace and Jain temples; this is the best place that one can get. Clean; no standard cookie cut type hospitality is what I will describe as the place.The best part are the owners who got extra mile to ensure that the guests are comfortable and all reasonable requirements are met.Additional benefit is that the owners have been natives of the place and practically know every person that traveler will require.And - for all adventurous diners; do try their food. It has lots of Indian cow ghee....as happens in Rajasthani food...yet is tasty. We did not feel any guilt of having consumed so much. The owners wife specially cooked breakfast herself and the taste was excellent.Lastly; it is a heritage havelli; with minimum possible alterations to the building.

Located inside the Jaisalmer fort; Hotel Shreenath Palace alone is responsible for making our trip to Jaisalmer so enjoyable. The owners were very nice and friendly; we felt like we are staying at home away from home. The room was just like what we have always wanted - Big rooms & royal Interiors. The hotel is actually a Haveli in its original form. We were traveling with our two kids; 6yr & 7yr old and they had enough space to play. We were lucky to get this accommodation just before starting of rush season. They also have a restaurant just outside fort's gate and the food was tasty and vegetarian. It was sad we had to leave. It was for few days but it seems that we knew them for so long.In all true sense they believe as mentioned in the Taittiriya Upanishad \Atithi devo bhava\""

The Shree Nath Palace was one of our best experiences during our trip to India. The rooms were very nice; especially the large ones; with beautiful Indian furniture and decorations. The location is unbeatable. But most importantly; the hospitality was OUTSTANDING (better; in fact; than some five star hotels that I have stayed in); and the people were exceptionally nice; especially the owner. Although they don't have their own restaurant; they delivered a meal from a local restaurant to our room. And they even went out of their way to retrieve my digital camera; which I had accidentally left in a taxi (they called the taxi driver at home). I can't say enough good things about this place.

Review_Title: “Most amazing rooms I've ever seen; great hospitality”
Review_Content: This was the most amazing hotel I've stayed in. The owners live on the ground floor and they only have about seven very large rooms in the building so its more like a homestay than a hotel. The service though is excellent - the rooms; as I said are the best I've ever seen and easily worth five times the amount I paid for one night if they were in a five star hotel. The bathrooms are large; clean and fitted with modern amneties. The hosts are very welcoming; knowledgeable and a charm to make conversation with. There is no rooftop restaurant but there is one next door and is very good. The hotel rooftop does offer very very good views of the Jain temples and the king's palace. You can also see miles into the start of the desert from this rooftop. Overall; I would like to rate this as highly as I possibly can and there is absolutely nothing wrong that I can find there. Our host; Raj hired an auto-rickshaw and came to pick us up from a restaurant in another part of the city at close to midnight. This is an absolute recommendation. Anyone who wants to stay in a large; beautiful; traditionally decorated room in a 400 year old 'haveli' with top class cleanliness and top class hospitality for amazingly affordable rates should definitely check out Shreenath Palace as their first option.

Review_Title: “The best place in a 2 weeks trip with the Imperial Hotel in New Dehli”
Review_Content: Shreenath Palace in Jaisalmer is definitely the best hotel we have had in this trip in Radjastan; with the exception of the Imperial Hotel in Dehli. It has only 5 rooms but they are very nicely decorated with an excellent taste. You will not regret this choice. Omji; our host; is a wonderful caracter that you should not miss to enjoy.Best regards to Omji and his familyJean-Michel and Patrice

What a gorgeous and special place to stay. Inside the fort walls is this beautiful little haveli (only 4 rooms). The room was all sandstone carvings and space with views over the Jain temples. Shreenath Palace was our favourite stay in 3 weeks; so much character and a great place to hang out in the heat of the day. No restaurant but that's no problem with so many places around (Jisal Italy at the main fort entrance is terrific if you want something other than Indian food). Also; if you are doing the overnight train back to Delhi (Jaipur or Jodphur) the restaurant next door to Shreenath will make a dry curry and paranthas takeaway; yum! We can't recommend this place enough. The only reservation is the impact that tourism is having on the fort.

Review_Title: “A perfect base for a perfect trip!”
Review_Content: We had really pleasant and satisfactory trip at Hotel Shreenath Palace in the Fort; Jaisalmer and left the place with big smile on our faces. We had booked the Mughal room which was probably the best value for money hotel room I’ve rented in my travels. The room was large; luxurius; tastefully decorated in the ethnic manner and full of atmosphere and period feeling. We had a great view of the neighboring ornately carved Jain temples and another view looking right out of the fort (the roof top view is worth mentioning also). The bathroom was spacious and comfortable.Most significant for us was the helpfulness and friendly demeanor the staff and the owners. The Owners (Omji and his son Raj) went out of the way to make us feel like honored guests to their own home rather than hotel guests). They also gave us great inputs about our plans in Jaisalmer and helped us negotiate a good rate for our overnight desert safari. They even voluntarily offered us to use a room after our return from the safari to refresh and change even though we had checked out the day before. And there was also a constant supply of delicious spicy chai!All in all; Shreenath Palace was a very memorable experience and I heartily recommend it to anyone travelling to Jaisalmer.Cheers;S.Majumder

We booked early to ensure the best 2 rooms - the Mughul room and Maharaja and we were not disappointed. They were huge rooms with original sandstone carvings and really atmospheric. The bathrooms were however modern with every facility. They were incredible value only $65 and $71 Australian dollars.We booked through hostelbookers and paid less for our better rooms than a French tourist paid through a travel agent;There wasn't a restaurant but we found great places to eat nearby. We enjoyed Little Italy and it gave our daughters a break from Indian food. You can order breakfast to be delivered by a nearby restaurant ( I can't remember its name) but we chose to walk there to eat and sit on the roofop restaurant.

Was welcomed like a queen and soothed with the best chai in India after a traumatic road trip after my plane from Jodhpur was cancelled. Was told \This is your home; not a hotel\" on my arrival; and that's really how it was. I was taken around the city not once but twice by members of the family; garlanded with a silk scarf; treated to unlimited amounts of my by now favourite chai; and even; once; to breakfast. Have never seen hospitality like this; nor a more beautiful place to stay - the Maharajah and Maharani rooms transport you back to a time long gone with their stone-carved walls; porticoes and sunken central areas; not to mention the largest bathrooms I have seen in an age. Everything is spotless and nothing is too much trouble. Add to this the proximity of the miraculous Jain temples and the palace... well; what more could one possibly ask for? Sadly; my flight from Jaisalmer to Udaipur was also cancelled; so I lost nearly a whole day in the city - would have stayed and stayed if I could have done. Do yourself a favour and sample the delights of this terrific home away from home!"

As everyone else has already made clear; it would be hard to find a hotel where you are treated more considerately than at Shreenath Palace.Raj and his wonderful crew totally pampered us during our stay in Jaisalmer. We especially enjoyed the ginger tea served to us in bed every morning by Hindu; an especially nice young man who seemed to take care of just about everything for the guests.The hotel is very well situated; inside the fort and literally a stone's throw from an amazing Jain temple; whose spires were visible from our room -- quite a romantic setting.Shreenath Palace has to be the best value in Jaisalmer. While it does not have the overall polish of some of the more expensive hotels in town; it's rooms are big; comfortable; well-kept and full of the character that only 450 years can give. And the intimacy of having only 5 rooms allows for an even more personal touch. Personally; a big plus (not shown in any photos I found) were the large modern bathrooms with very good water pressure and full time hot water; a luxury you can't always count on in Indian hotels.Jaisalmer is an amazing city full of some of the most remarkable architecture I have ever seen; including the Shreenath Palace itself.

Namaste Omji; Raj; Indu! We miss you all already! We spent 5 lovely days in Jaisalmer at the Shreenath Palace and I can say without reservation that it was our favorite experience in our three weeks in India. Raj & Omji are wonderful; gracious hosts and you will feel that you are staying with dear friends or family. They are terrifically helpful if you need advice about seeing sites; travel arrangements; etc. The haveli itself is magical - so beautiful! Our room; the Mughal Suite; was a dream. Large; airy; lots of french door windows opening on superb views of the city and the Jain temples next door. The bath was large and atmospheric and complete with hot water. We loved the room decor and bedspread so much that Omji helped us arrange having one made for us to take home. Raj; Omji; Mrs. Omji; and Indu - we hope you have a lovely new year and we look forward to our next visit to India!Sky & Patty WilliamsonDurham; NC USA

Review_Title: “Incredible experience! The rest of our holiday paled into insignificance±”
Review_Content: The Shreenath is so much more than a hotel. Raj; his beautiful family and wonderful staff made our experience; one that I shall never forget! I can honestly not fault anything about this treasure. The rooms are stunning; comfortable and clean. Many an evening was spent on the roof watching the sun set over the nearby temples. Set in the middle of the fort; overlooking the surrounding desert - my experience here was superb and I will definitely return on my next visit to India. We were made to feel very welcome and part of the family. Nothing was too much trouble; from collecting us from our train; organising the camel safari (I highly recommend staying in the desert overnight); helping to book future hotels and transport. We planned on staying only 2-3 nights but found it impossible to tear ourselves away and stayed for 5 plus the safari!! We stayed at two other hotels in India and were disappointed both times due to our amazing time at Shreenath. I honestly cannot recommend it enough!! I suggest early booking as I know I am not the only person to think this!! Hindu's Masala Chai is unbeatable!! I can't thank them enough for making my first experience of India so memorable!

We were impressed by the pics we had seen of this hotel and the reality does not let you down ! Our host Raj was helpful and hospitable from the word go. He fetched us from the entrance of the fort; showed us our rooms and even had hot steaming cups of flavored tea sent up.His uncle who stays on the property as caretaker takes his role seriously. To say he took care of us is an understatement! Just a bit of reality check before yo book this property. It is beautiful and breathtaking; but owing to the fact that it is located right IN the fort- it involves a little bit of walking. Families with young ones need to be extra careful as the balconies can be a problem.Older travellers may also consider giving it a second thought since the stairways are both narrow and steep.
