But if you are fit and fancy a taste of an authentic haveli; head here.

Review_Title: “One of the very best stays in India”
Review_Content: Third time in Rajastan; first in Jaisalmer...we found Shreenath Palace on the web and we absolutely recommend it. From the very first e-mail contact the manager; Raj; has been extremely efficient and quick in answering. At the end we relied on him also for the car transfer in the whole state: the driver picked us up in Jodhpur; dropped us in Bikaner and a few days later brought us to Jaisalmer. Everything went absolutely smoothly; but the best was yet to come. The hotel is very small but very special. Each of the five rooms is a marvel carved in stone; it's like living in museum; with the difference that it is your room. It is also very clean; and located just in the center of the fort; which means you can enjoy the hectic market streets in the day; packed of tourists and shops ; and the peaceful strolling in the incredible surroundings in the evening. There are quite a number of heritage properties around the state; and we visited many of them over the past years; but this has the added value of its familiar dimension; and Raj and his family are delicious guests; who really make you feel a warm hospitality. They will not feed you with continuous shopping suggestions nor push you for a camel safari; but if you ask for anything their advice will be precise and reliable. My own advice is: consider spending in Shreenath Palace a few more than the two-three days strictly necessary to all the major attractions and landscapes of the city. Where the general tendency is to make a tourist out of you; this hotel is an island where you can feel yourself a traveler and a guest.

Booked through Hostelbookers; as it looked really interesting and had the highest rating. Thought we had arranged a pick up from the station; but in the end made our own way there. It costs about rs.20 tourist tax each to get out of the station! then another rs.20 to go to the gate of the fort. They then make you take another rickshaw up into the fort for more money; but we got them down to rs.30 for that journey up the hill.Arrived at the hotel to be greeted by the beautiful Raj; who runs the bookings and checkins. We were then joined by Omjee; his father and owner; who was very interested to meet us; particularly when we mentioned we used Tripadvisor!! The house has been in their family for years; but they now live over the street. There is a room downstairs where Omjee stays; and where we would sit and chat with him. He even offered to let us watch the TV when my husband mentioned the football.When we arrived they took us up to our room; gave us a menu and arranged for the restaurant next door to cook us thali; then brought it up to our room. A nice touch; after travelling for hours on the train to get there. We didn't settle the bill for that until the day we left! The room was beautiful - the Maharaja suite - a large room with double bed; mattress and cushions on the floor around a small table; large windows looking out onto the Jain temple; a fan and a large water cooled fan; and a good sized clean bathroom with hot shower. We loved the room. Because its so hot there; you need to keep the windows open for a draft; but they gave us insect repellent plug-ins and offered us a mosquito net if we needed it.Omjee was also a teacher at the local school; and asked us to come and see it one morning; as we are teachers too. His son brought us breakfast that morning to our room; tea and toast; to help us get up! He was very helpful giving us tips on the places to buy things; what prices we should be paying; where to go; etc. He was very generous to us; and even helped us out bargaining with the local shopkeeper for a tshirt and cushion cover.Omjee was very interested in technology; particularly our Ipods. He was willing to buy them off us; and we eventually gave him our broken speakers; which seemed to make his day. We had a great time at this hotel; made more interesting because they were easy to talk to and very helpful. It was the best place we stayed while travelling around Rajasthan. I think its worth paying for the larger rooms on the top floor. The restaurant next door has good food; and we spent our last afternoon there; sat on mattresses under their fans; waiting for our next train. Omjee then paid for our taxi back to the station. If you fancy a beer you can get them at the restaurant for rs.90 and sit on their rooftop to watch the sunset. And its definitely better to stay in the fort; particularly as its empty of all the tour groups in the evenings; and people not hassling you.

Review_Title: “Not a Review but an experience that left a bad taste”
Review_Content: This is probably the most peculiar review as we never actually stayed at the Shreenath Palace. My initial experience booking the place was fine. Unfortunately; when my husband; daughter and I got to Jodhpur 2 days before leaving for Jaisalmer (a remote border town); our daughter had become so sick and dehydrated that there was a good chance she may need hospitalisation. After agonising in Jodhpur for a day; and seeing no particular improvement in her condition; we called a decision on Jaisalmer and decided it was wiser to cancel...we felt we should return to South India and her regular pediatrician's care. We called the Shreenath Palace immediately to cancel (with many apologies and explanations) and was treated to a furious diatribe by the owner/manager. I knew that he would probably fill our room at a moment's notice as it was high season; but still offered to send him compensation for our short notice; which he angrily refused.It was really disheartening and somewhat scary (with some details which I feel disinclined to share in a public space). It was the first time in our 20 adult years of travelling over the world we had ever cancelled plans in an emergency; and this added to the disturbing experience. I thought I should share it.

We had the Maharaja room for three nights and it was a delightful experience. The owner is very conversable and of great help. Our room was almost an other-wordly experience; like staying in another century. from our room we looked right at the nearby Jain temples. You must be prepared for a hot stay though; because there is no A/C and the top floor gets quite hot. People in the fort live side by side; so it's not quiet either. We also thought that the room could have been cleaner. All in all highly recommandable. Since the owner does not serve breakfast we also recommend the Sagar Restaurant next to the guesthouse which serves fantastic vegetarian dishes and has the nicest cook we ever met.

Our first impression on arrival in Sreenath Palace early morning at 0600hrs was not very encouraging. We had confirmed with the host pick up from Rly station and were thoroughly disappointed that we were left to find out the way to the hotel. We had to change from a jeep (which took us from station to fort entrance); then to an auto (which took us hardly a minute distance to the fort junction) and finally was helped by some guys taking the luggage and walking to the hotel. The host was apologetic enough about the pick up not turning up but the early morning fiasco did spoil our mood.Having said that rest everything was fantastic. The owners of the property truly believes in the Indian saying \Guest is like god\" and even opened their private bedroom for us to sleep till the room got vacated and ready by 1000hrs. They even arranged breakfast for us (fantastic parathas; potato dry bhaji and curd) for which the next day Mr.Vyas gracefully declined payment the next day. We stayed in the Maharani room- a large room with period furnishing and interiors. The property has only 4 rooms -each done in a unique style and if you fancy heritage hotel this has lots of it - 400yrs of history. Of course you cannot expect the conveniences of a modern hotel- no TV;no room service or phone. And you would have to be careful not to bang your head on low doors. But to offset it ; you have the thrill of staying in real heritage property.The bathroom is big and has all the convenience of any modern hotel bathroom. The housekeeping although done in 10mnts between check out and our check in was more than adequate- the room was clean.Above all the hosts are gracious people- they don't push safari operators and only recommends when specifically enquired. Both are teachers and their son Mr.Raj Vyas is the one who manages the net correspondence. All of them are extremely helpful and they saw us safely thru a boisterous crowd of holi revellers the next day when we visited them (although we had checked out).The minuses- the way to the property can get a little crowded since it is right on the path to the famed Jain temples of Jaisalmer fort - so no privacy on the balcony when the tourists are around. Getting to the hotel with lots of luggage can be a little tricky since the path is too narrow to be negotiated by even auto rickshaws.However we would happily recommend this property for the hospitality of the owners and for the uniqueness of the rooms"

Review_Title: “The best I have had in India so far”
Review_Content: Although a little more expensive than many other options I stayed in two different rooms here (I stayed once then came back after a safari) and both rooms were excellent. Stunningly decorative interiors- both rooms had pillars around the bed and nice views; aswell as a large bathroom.There are no ceiling fans so huge AC units are supplied which are not the best (and sound like jet engines) but it is only a minor fault and totally excusable when you see the room and facilities.I would not hesitate to recommend it.

I stayed in Hotel Shreenath from Feb 22nd to Feb 24th; 2008. It was our first anniversary and we decided to celebrate it in Rajasthan since my better half has never seen desert. We started off our journey from Jaipur to Bikaner and then to Jaisalmer. The stay at this hotel was both homely and royal: homely as the hotel owner Raj and his family took good care of us; royal as the room we stayed was amazing; though I would definitely comeback to stay at the Maharaja's room. Let me start with the facts first:The breakfast; dinner is outsourced to Hotel Sagar which also delivers the food at your room. The food was excellent rather amazing as after hearing a lot about spicy food in Rajasthan and Jaisalmer; we were able to find a place which had great food with very little spice and in very OK price too!! Also the hotel is few steps(literally) away from the famous and beautifully crafted Jain Temple.The Safari which we went was good but not great. Try going to a night safari (I've heard good reviews about it). Also when we went to the sand dunes; we were told that we would be served tea (not told that the milk used would be of a goat). The fort does not require a guide (due to a audio tour available) and stay at Jaisalmer with visit to different locations is not more than 2 days. The room where I stayed was not to huge; with three balconies; all opening to other balconies or walls (so dont expect a breath taking view from the balconies). Having said that ; the room were royally decorated and the toilets were clean. Also ; the hot shower facility was availableI accidently missed my train but Raj was very accomodating in taking care of my luggage while I went for stroll the other day. Thanks for the wonderful stay Raj and given a choice in staying inside the fort ( and just few steps away from the famous Jain temple) ; I would recommend Hotel Shreenath.Rameshwar Nigam

I spent a wonderful night at Shreenath! I arrived there after a long and horrible overnight bus and was delighted when I was shown my princess room. It was the nicest room of all my trip in Rajahstan; with its nice pink-red curtains; its ancient columns; carpets and its view on the jaïns temples.The familly is really friendly and you can have delicious meals in the restaurant next to the Shreenath.The rooms are quite expensive; but if you arrive without booking and if some are available you can ask for a better price.

The two nights we spent at Shreenath were unbelievable! We arrived after a long; harrowing overnight train and were delighted when we were shown our amazing room! We truly felt like royalty for two nights. The staff at Shreenath were really helpful and organised flights and put no pressure on us to take Camel Safaris; which can be a problem in Jaisalmer. If you do decide to go on safari I highly reccomend Mr Desert who can be found just outside the fort. The Shreenath is even more delightful than it looks in the pictures; it is a Rajasthani dream and brilliant value.

We have stayed at Shreenath twice; in 2005 and in 2007. Each time our highest expectations were exceeded. The owners are as impressive as is their Haveli. This is the best of Jaisalmer; the best of Rajasthan and the best of old India. We hope to return many times. Our only concern is that it will become so popular that we will not find rooms available!

Staying at Hotel Shreenath palace was a memorable experience. It is a beautiful; charming heritage building. The Hotel Shreenath Palace building is big and it has large and clean rooms with fully Western style toilets and golden marble flooring. Maharaja room was awesome with great view of jain temple. The best thing about this hotel is its hospitality and service. It owner and his son Raj are so generous that you feel privileged. They suggested me best way to purchase and book camel safari. It was like staying with your own family. Staying with them was the best thing of entire India trip.

A wonderful haveli set inside the fort at Jaisalmer. There was no problem that the hotel didn't serve food as we loved the restaurant next door! Our 4 night experience at the Shreenath Palace made our holiday complete as we felt like we were part of the family! Our room was exquisite! everything was perfect! Thankyou!!!!!

If you love warm; charming heritage properties this one is it! The Hotel Shreenath Palace is over 400 years old; however; the amenities (ie. bathrooms) have been fully updated (ie. Western style toilets; marble flooring; clean everything!). Every room is uniquely charming; however; I recommend the Maharaja style rooms on the top floors with richly carved sandstone columns and colorful silk curtains giving it a true regal flair. From our window we could see a beautiful Jain Temple; and the roof top of the hotel was accessible providing terrific views of the fort interior and beyond (did I mention that the hotel is INSIDE the fort!?!). The hotel is owned/managed by Raj and his father and uncle. It is worth a stay just to meet and be around their family. Everyone was exceptionally generous; kind and friendly; and; incidentally; all could speak perfect English. You feel that you were immediately welcome and taken in as part of their family. Raj's uncle; would boil us fresh coffee every morning and deliver it to our room with toasted bread and fresh fruit. This hotel and our experience was definitely a highlight of our entire trip to Rajastan.Also; if you are interested in a camel safari; which I recommend highly; Raj can set it up if you don't already have an arrangement.

i cannot recommend this hotel enough to you. the welcome we had was so warm and friendly we immediately felt at home. our room was breathtaking and the balcony was an added bonus where we spent hours sitting there reading :) oh; and i must mention the hot showers - WOW! they were HOT! HOT! HOT! we had a wonderful stay in jaisalmer and we cannot recommend the place and this hotel enough - were sad to leave.

I stayed at Sheenath Palace in mid-Nov and had an incredible stay! The Mughal suite is beautiful and the family is wonderful. Raj (son of the owner) invited me to his wedding celebration and went out of his way to make our stay comfortable (even during such a busy time).Highly recommended!

I found this hotel on Trip Advisor; and they lived up to their positive reviews. The rooms were great--very atmospheric & comfortable; with great views--and the staff/owners were super friendly and helpful. It's also perfectly located...

We stayed at Shreenath during the one of the hottest months and we had a great time! The room was beautiful and clean...we had our own bathroom and shower which had both hot and cold water. The family was very helpful and nice. They had all kinds of advice for shopping and camel treks that was useful and not one sided. We had a lovely time at this hotel...a big bonus is the rooftop deck where you can sit and watch the sun go down and see the tops of the jain temples!

Review_Title: “We stayed at this wonderful hotel during our honeymoon holiday.”
Review_Content: We had a wonderful stay at this gorgeous haveli. We looked at several rooms and all had fantastic sandstone arches and columns. Our room had a balcony overlooking the Jain Temple.The family are very friendly and so helpful. They organised the perfect camel trek for us. We were completely alone in the dunes and saw some very interesting villages.Zoe & Martin.

I miss this gorgeous little place where we were welcomed like family and looked after like princesses. Oozing with charm. Balconies to view the temple and sit and watch the cows and people pass in the alleys below.Fabulous location. Great value. Easy to email direct and arrangeyour stay. Always happy to help.I was recommended it by a good friend and so happy I stayed there. It holds my fondest memories of India.Enjoy your stay;Natalie

The hotel room and location were fantastic - right in the heart of the fort in an old haveli. It offers rooms in an atmospheric old family home rather than a luxurious hotel . It was all fairly clean and the staff were good although the bed was pretty hard and bedding pretty old.

Review_Title: “A wonderful historical family home converted into a peaceful hotel.”
Review_Content: This is a wonderful historical family home converted into a small peaceful palace hotel. It is clean efficient and friendly. It feels more like a homestay as one must pass through the familys front room to reach the rooms above. Room # 4 is spectacular with 4 balconies and intricate arched stonework. There are nice views from the windows including the Jain temple and narrow cobble stone alleys below. When a breeze filters through the colorful gauzy drapes suspended from the inner stone arches dance and sway. Very exotic and dream like!

This is the worst hotel I have ever been to.As it was a sudden trip to Mussourie we unfortunately didn't get any available rooms in our preferred hotels and landed in Sunrise hotel.The charges of the room were high so we thought the rooms would be decent.Upon entering the room I felt like puking.The rooms are depressing;dingy;very dirty and unhygienic.The terrace was full of vomits and liquor bottles.Since we had no option left we thought of spending most of our time outside the hotel and return just for nap.My husband ordered tea ;toasts and omlette for breakfast.The tea pot was so dirty that we didnt even dare to drink it.I and my husband had the most horrible experience in our lifes staying in such a pathetic hotel.I would advise everyone not to ever visit this pathetic hotel.The owner of the hotel is a cheat who is charging high for such pathetic rooms....

Review_Title: “Location is good but maintenance is poor!”
Review_Content: 1.Conveniently located when you are travelling in your own vehicle.2.Parking space is ample and away from the rush of town.3.Though structure is reasonably good; maintenance requires more attention.4.Room service fellow seems tired as there are too many floors to look after.5.Rooms were good; especially those facing valley.6.Nothing was available at eatery. We had to go else where for the breakfast too which was very tedious as it is slightly away downwards from the main town.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the ones facing the valley; they have spectacular view!

Review_Content: Kairali had hosted myself and my yoga retreat group here for one week. I have to say that it was yet another amazing experience. The staff has been very helpful from before we even reached there- with answering emails promptly; arranging airport transportation; and accommodating to all of our guests' needs. Once there; we had an amazing time. The treatments are excellent. The therapists really know what they're doing and treat us amazingly. We really got pampered. The food was incredible. So tasty; not spicy; and very nutritious and filling. We had a lovely cooking session too! Most remarkable about the resort is the staff. They are so friendly; helpful; and very accommodating. It really stands out! I will keep coming back again and again; with more groups and retreats to be hosted here! Thank you!

I spent 5 days here and i felt i am in nature's lap; the sound of frogs; drops of rains was enough to keep away from my daily busy routine. I enjoyed almost every hour of my stay here. The food was the real taste of south India. The staff was very polite and were treating like family. Though we were here for company workshop (Media India Group) i wish to visit again with my family for the spa and relaxation.Apart from daily morning yoga you have the option to play lawn tennis; billiards and go to the pool too.Worth coming here. Will come for ages :)
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the royal room; next to the pool :)

Review_Content: I spent my 5 days at Kairali Health Resort and it's amazing. I feel very relaxed after visiting there. We have a very great memorable moments. We have organized a workshop at kairali and the staff of Kairali has supported us alot not like a guest but like a family member. We also have a massage session and found very fruitful. The food was very healthy according to our daily diet and very simple. Kairali is very greenery and has a great climate. Wish to visit again.

The Ayurvedic doctors and therapists are absolutely excellent - my treatments were so relaxing and very calming. Good yoga class and meditation classes daily. Beautiful grounds; so many palms and coconut trees and beautiful greenery everywhere. Every staff member without exception was helpful; friendly and professional.The bathroom in my cottage was very poor - bath had crack in it. However; it didn't matter too much because the showers in the treatment centre are great and you showers there after all treatments anyway. The food is nice; but not overly flavourful. However; you can feel that it is doing your body good.Well worth a stay if you're after quality ayurvedic treatment in a very relaxing setting. Would have given 5/5 if the bathroom was nicer and they had in-room wifi.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Room 303 is very dark; I saw other rooms with better lighting that felt more bright and inviting.

Review_Content: Worth coming here This is my sixth visit. Every time I feel young then my ageI always come for 10 to 14 days and from third day start feeling light. Good experience. Nice placeTalking with nature lots of greenarygood hospitality.

I visited Kairali health resort this year in February.Spread over a vast expanse of land;nice neat and clean atmosphere.The food was simple and the atmosphere was suitable for holistic and traditional Indian healingExtremely hospitable staff and some amazing ayurvedic treatments.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Greetings from Kairali – The Ayurvedic Healing Village; Palakkad !Thank you very much for your feedback appreciating the professional services of my team; the resort ambiance; and your dining experience. We value your time in sharing your experiences with the travel community which is indeed very kind of you. Looking forward to your continued patronage and assuring you the very best of our services in the true tradition of authentic health care through Ayurveda.Yours Cordially;RAYMOND.P.JGeneral Managergm.hv@kairali.com

Review_Title: “Kairali Palakkad is a year round destination”
Review_Content: I spent five days at Kairali undergoing shirodhara for relaxation. The staff were friendly and courteous; aymond. Rohini Menon and Chef Ravi were great help too.The therapists were cordial and nice. However; there are too many activities in the day including meditation; lectures; yoga ; cooking etc which makes it difficult to enjoy the serenity of the place. Just go for relaxation; rest; rejuvenation and forget your clock or wrist watch at Kairali and you will really enjoy the pampering by the staff. As a vegan I got 100% vegan food served to me throughout and the coconut milk with bananas topped the food menu.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the rooms away from the water bodies if you want to switch off the ac and open the windows in...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Greetings from Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort – Palakkad !Delighted to learn that our property and services have exceeded your expectations and thank you for your time in sharing your amazing experiences with the travel community around the globe.We look forward to your continued patronage with us and assuring you the best of our services at all times.Sincerely;Manager – Public Relations

Review_Content: This was my second visit to the property. It's so calm and the treatment is just great. The doctors are so experienced like no other. The Restaurent staff are impeccable very helpfully assisting at all times. The massage is done by some of the most experience therapist; the products used and sold are manufactured under very high standards trust me I got a chance of visiting the manufacturing plant.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Greetings from Kairali - The Ayurvedic Healing Village ; Palakkad !Thank you for being very kind in taking the time to post a great review on trip advisor appreciating kairali team & services. The staff at the restaurant are been trained to ensure that all our guests experiences fine dining every time and I am delighted to read that their personal care and attention to details have exceeded your expectations during your recent stay with us.It was a compliment to know that you had been to our factory where I am sure you would have noticed that our medicines are being manufactured with high standards under the guidance’s of experts who are with us for more than 3 decades. Looking forward to your continued patronage and assuring you the very best of our services in the true tradition of authentic health care through ayurveda. Cordially;RAYMOND.P.JGeneral Managergm.hv@kairali.com

Review_Content: It was 2 day trip to this resort. Since i have done a couple of resort trip in southern india ; so i was expecting the same thing here. but i am totally amazed with the hospitality and the friendly behavior of all the management people overhere. This place absolutely fantastic with its atmosphere and once you reach here it is definite that the health level with impove ; the metabolism will definitey increase as this place is surrounded by ample trees and is covered with nature's . The food is great and the way they prepere the food ; i would like to thanks the chef here Mr Ravi for his great varity and food combination .... Must visit place in India ....5 star to kairali ....ThanksSanjay Agarwal..
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Greetings from Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort – Palakkad !Delighted to learn that our property and services have exceeded your expectations and thank you for your time in sharing your amazing experiences with the travel community around the globe.We look forward to your continued patronage with us and assuring you the best of our services at all times.Sincerely;Manager – Public Relations

Review_Content: i was there for 4 days.. it was really an amazing feel of natural environment..it was so relaxing that i was upset while leaving d resort..i had the best 4 days of any trip yet in lifetime. Ayurvedic massage was the best part as it was so relaxing and it felt it energized me from within.will definitely plan more trip here..& would even suggest my friends...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Greetings !Extending my gratitude for your feedback and happy to read that you had a pleasant stay during your short visit to Kairali – The Ayurvedic Healing Village; Palakkad.It was indeed very kind of you in sharing your amazing experiences with the travel community on our resort and healing services; which is our earnest endeavour to ensure that our guests enjoys their stay and departs with cherishing memories every time.Looking forward to your continued patronage and assuring you the very best of our services in the true tradition of authentic health care through ayurveda as always !Yours truly in service;RAYMOND P.J.General Managergm.hv@kairali.com

Review_Content: I highly recommend Kairaly for the ones looking for quite and peaceful place with opportunity to think and learn about of healty life style. The team of professional and dedicated people will be taking care of all Your needs. I would suggest to spend at least 2 weeks in order to adapt yourself; relax and feel the benefits of the ambience and treatment.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Greetings from Kairali – The Ayurvedic Healing Village – Palakkad !Thank you very much for you feedback appreciating our property; ambience and services which was indeed very kind of you. Guest comments on trip advisor are a motivation for us as most of our guests who are patients by nature of their stay; reluctant to share their memorable experience with the travel community instead they prefer to write in our guest comments book displayed at our service outlets. Hence we extend our sincere gratitude for your time in sharing your experience with a portal such as trip advisor !Yours very sincerely;RAYMONDP.JGeneral Manager

Review_Content: One of the most relaxing destinations I have ever been to; my husband and I enjoyed every moment and had a wonderful stay What I loved: Fabulous property lush green; amazing views of nature all around; I have never before been at one with nature for 24 hours when at the retreat. The staff are seen working very hard on the grounds and they were very polite and helpful. We liked the authentic kerala style food and real ayurvedic therapy. Overall totally amazing experience and we would love to go back!
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Greetings from Kairali – The Ayurvedic Healing Village – Palakkad !Thank you very much for your feedback appreciating our resort; ambiance and services which was indeed very kind of you. Also extending our gratitude for your valuable time in sharing your views with the travel community around the globe. Looking forward to your continued patronage and assuring you the very best of our services in the true tradition of authentic health care through ayurveda as always !Yours truly in service;RAYMOND.P.JGeneral Managergm.hv@kairali.com

Review_Content: Myself and my wife stayed at kairali ayurvedic resort pallakad for 3 nights from 29th nov 2013 Cottage rooms were quite spacious; clean and comfortable. Doctors are good in listening our requirement and also the treatment centre is good.The quality of the food is good and the staff was very attentive and smiling with willingness to serve. But the worst part is security arrangements inside the resort.There are only 2 persons at the gate taking care of the resort.and there is quite a long distance from the main gate to the cottage rooms. I saw hardly any professional security guards even at night which makes environment very scary. Management shld pay attention to this urgently to avoid any unpleasant incidents like the one which happened at poovar island resort last week.At the time of checkout we saw this news on TV about the horrible incident at poovar island resort due to lack of security This incident shld be an eye opener to all resort owners in kerala !!!!We hope kerala government and tourism dept will wake up to enforce security measures if kerala has to remain in the tourism map and calling themselves 'GOD'S OWN COUNTRY \ D GopinathanManaging PartnerNarmada HolidaysChennai/Mumbai"
Response_to_Review: Dear Mr. Gopinathan;Greetings from Kairali – The Ayurvedic Healing Village – Palakkad !Thank you very much for your feedback; appreciating our property - cleanliness & comfort of our cottages and also on the professionalism of our healing services for which my team and I would remain grateful.We have also noted your concern on our security services which we would be pleased to keep you posted that we have patrolling duties performed by 2 security guards during odd hours at night and is effectively in place. Furthermore the neighbouring acres of land are a part of the resort and also the close inhabitants are associated with the resort as a part of our ongoing CSR. Hence you may kindly be noted that guests staying with us are secure and safe with in the vicinity of the resort.Extending our gratitude for your valuable time.Yours very sincerely;RAYMOND.P.JGeneral Manager

Review_Content: We had been there as a long weekend getway of 3 days but the time spent in the resort was simply mesmerising. We were so glued to the attractions within the resort that we hardly went out for timepass.The place is well maintained; completely green and refreshing. The rooms are spacious; give a touch of little ancient type of construction. The facilities are well enough for a very comfy living.The staff is well mannered and they are always there to help and assist for anything. The food is good though you can not expect something more flavoured as it is an Ayurvedic resort. The resort has a swimming pool and has a lot of place wherein you can walk together and enjoy.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: All the rooms are good so anything they give holds good.

Review_Content: The resort is located slightly interior; but access roads are excellent; and rustic.Once you are in the resort; the ambience is just divine; positive energy at every corner; water flowing and lush green. The approach to cottages is well lit; and the resort is very well planned.All basic facilities are available on site; including a gym; pool table; and an excellent swimming pool; which is very well located. The resort is full of beautiful plants and trees; which sooth the mind. The Ayurvedic spa is really excellent; the masseurs are experienced; and polite.The doctor is a very senior Hakim; very knowledgeable; and communicates in south and north Indian languages. His understanding of our health and problems is unmatched.The restaraunt is excellent; serving a good variety of organic Vegetarian only food; to cater to all pallets. Even our special requests were supported. If the visitor is not on the obesity/weight reduction package; food is more than sufficient! Even the desserts were really good. Fresh juice; buttermilk etc. were always fresh; and excellent.A must visit; though there may be some limitations for children; as presently; they do not have any common/group activities. Meditation and Yoga sessions are also there; morning and evening. The check in and check out is well planned; and very fair dollar exchange rates. No alcohol / No Non Veg permitted. Smiling faces everywhere. Really refreshing and rejuvenating.

It was a very good trip from our hasty nasty busy city life.You must try it.

Review_Title: “I will keep on coming again & again... Nandan Sawaikar;Goa”
Review_Content: We arrived at the resort & we were greeted by the friendly & helpful staff. After getting fresh proceeded to Ayurvedic canteen for breakfast. The canteen was nice & had pleasant atmosphere. Coming to food; the breakfast was wholesome & complete consisting of many varieties. Lunch & dinner were really nice; clean;hygienic; not oily nor very spicy; just the perfect food for your body & mind.The ayurvedic massage was amazing & felt really rejuvenated after the massage. The oils & herbs which were used were of excellent quality.The weather was really nice & you can just walk around the resort to feel the beauty of nature.I must say a place that everyone should go at least once just to relax;rejuvenate & to feel blesses in the laps of nature....Hats off to Kairali management & their team....

Review_Content: I recently returned from kerala after doing the Detoxification & Rejuvenation treatment at Kairali's Ayurvedic resort in Palakkad. It was a 7 night 8 day programme and how I wish I had booked for a longer Stay!!! Immediately upon arrival I was examined by the Wonderfull Team of Doctors there; who very quickly picked up all my ailments; and I was set on a course.....the days that followed were filled with caring and healing. The Magical doctors there Dr. Chandra Shekran; Dr Saravan and Dr Priya; so kindly followed my everyday routines; customising every day to the needs of the required treatment....I had a shoulder injury; and my stress levels where flying off the charts when I got here.....but upon arrival I felt calmed ; ....the whole resort has been built on the science of Vaastu Shastra -(the Vedic mathematic of architecture) I could feel the tranquility in the environment! It's almost magical! I have to mention the staff at the Restaurant and other department too......they don't just serve you....they do it with Love.....The Chef K.P.Mohanan was very happy to cater to any special needs I requested during my stay.Highly Recommneded to anyone who is looking to travel for the purpose of Healing the bOdy and Mind! KAIRALI continues to maintain a tradition that is Authentic! I have retuned from there ; totally refreshed and feeling almost as good as new and am already planning my Next Trip to LEARN this science of Balancing the Body thru Ayurveda. We all have heard that a Healthy body keeps a Healthy Mind!!!! Thank you Kairali for helping me heal my shoulder injury! Even 4 months of physiotherapy didnot bring me the relief ; I got in a single sitting durin my treatment! I was soo surprised to see how quickly we can heal when we Do the Correct treatment! Look forward to returning soon!

The doctor on duty is compassionate; engaging and an expert in delivery of service.We had no hassles as we had pre booked d tour and headed Munnar after this 3 days layover. we would love to come back again to this place again and i strongly recommend this resort to every one..

Review_Content: i read reviews before visiting this place and my view is its certainly not a value for money .positives are - 1] good ambience and serene place and helps us to relax. 2] treatments and massage are of very good quality . 3] service is decent.NEGATIVE POINTS.1] over priced and over rated for example food they charge 3000 rs per day per couple so if u stay 3 days it will come 9000 rs and food is very bland and simple and u can't go out and eat because its 20 km away from town so u have eat there only.2] rooms are ok but it was smelling fungus due to rains and they won't do anything my wife got itching problem.3] they say discounts but its all very tricky be careful if some one has sold u the coupons.4] nothing is there for entertainment for youngsters avoid this resort.summary - if u are old and and have loads of money to spend and have some chronic problems then visit this place and certainly not 5 star stuff as what they claim.

Review_Title: “Beautiful getaway in the greens of Kerala. Excellent treatment!”
Review_Content: My mother and I stayed here for 7 nights during July; rainy season; and absolutely loved it. It's located outside of Palakkad; surrounded by many ricefields; coconut trees and forest. It's so beautiful!!! Even the ride there was enjoyable.The treatments at Kairali are excellent. You are in total love and care under the doctors and nurses.The ladies/nurses take such good care of you all the way; before treatment; during; and after! They are really highly qualified and do an excellent job. After the treatments you get to wash the oil off with a paste made of green gram; its just so wonderful. You feel all the more connected to nature when you are there.The food is excellent too. Its a set menu; depending on your treatment; but it was all very tasty; healthy and wholesome! The staff is very friendly; helpful; and eager to make your stay there more enjoyable.Because of the climate in Kerala; the rooms were a bit humid and dark.. but we still managed to sleep here very well.All in all; we loved our experience here; and would definitely come back again. Rainy season is said to be the best time for ayurvedic treatment and i can see why! If you are looking for a beautiful; authentic; traditional treatment center; then Kairali is the place to go! Away from the busy city; cars and noise; and totally one with nature....

Review_Content: We spent two days in this very special place.Very Quiet; very good prestations and services; The food was excellent and the staff always at our disposal with a big smile.Unfortunately; it was rainy.If you are looking for a relaxing place; you have to stop here.We not fail to come back at this resort for the next trip.

Review_Content: After staying for 3 weeks at the kairali ayurvedic health resort in kerala I can give only the highest rating. Arriving totally worn out and heading for a burnout I was received and treated with uttermost care and attention ; feeling immediate friend - ly with really everybody from the staff .Dr Sharavan ; literally always ready for a talk or question ; proved to be to be very capable ; very clear and also self- confident about the treatment ; and he was rightfully so :frozen shoulder : 98 % better\neck and shoulder tension : more or less goneWeight loss( without intention ; just as a side-effect) 8 poundslower back : 90 % better heartache : more or less goneskin : like 10 years agodigestion : I cannot remember when it was that good the last timesleeping problems : feels better now ; I have to see on the long run.....and ; most of all ; I am back to having better nerves and extra energy ; looking forward meeting my loved ones and starting to work again.Food was always prepared very nicely and was being served by a very friendly ; and also attentive staff.The whole kitchen and restaurant area was that clean that I totally trusted also in eating raw food which I rarely do in India.Of course food in variety and ingredients was not often as it is with my favourite indian restaurant at home ; but then I considered it a medicine ; what it really was.This is related to the 2 weeks of panchakarma( detoxifying ) treatment.In the last week I could enjoy almost everything the ayurvedan cook served.Accomodation and surrounding gardens including an artificial river are just inviting to relax and recreate.There is also a yoga morning class and a meditation evening class.The meditation hall is unusually dark and not very inviting although the acoustics there are great ( I enjoyed siiging there ).There also is a beautiful pool ( area) ; and I even saw a tennis court . but not in use now.There are also a few work out machines.By the way ; this resort was chosen amongst the world`s top 50 wellness destinations by The National Geographic Traveller Magazine.What else to say than I intend to come back.

Review_Content: Kairali at Palakkad was one of my most memorable holidays. The resort was not only picturesque; lush and green; filled with trees; water bodies and adorable cottages; but its high levels of personalized service made you feel right at home. From a health angle; the resort was exceptional. I had been suffering from a stomach infection for over a month and a few days at Kairali finally put me out of my misery. The massages; early morning yoga sessions and the clean; fresh air is good enough to cure one of many ailments. To top it off; the food went perfectly with the surroundings. Healthy; light-on-the-stomach and surprisingly scrumptious. The resort is a little isolated but for someone looking to spend some me-time its perfect. In all; Kairali is the best option if you are looking for a quiet getaway; with the advantage of living a very healthy lifestyle while you are there; healthy enough to make you look radiant as you head back home.

Review_Title: “Prince of Palghat offers rejunevation +fun albiet power cut issues”
Review_Content: We reached the Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort as a part of our trip to Palakkad in our holiday in Kerala. Travelling with family involves some planning and we decided to pre book our travel through the online travel agents Goingkerala.com. The travel agency has an extensive network in Kerala and helped us with our air travel; planning as well as the hotel stay there. The Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort was booked for 3 days and 2 nights. We reached the Coimbatore Airport and the cab was waiting for us and as we reached the resort; which was about 60 odd km from Palakkad or Palghat as it was previously called; we admired by the beauty of the structure of the resort. Moreover the journey itself was through some lovely narrow country lanes and we enjoyed the surroundings and climate of the new place. My kids got enthused seeing the big TV and hopped onto the lovely bed. A whole many number of cushions are provided to ensure a comfortable stay. It was raining slightly and the windows provide a nice view of the moist surroundings which look quite verdant and vibrant given the lawns and gardens. The room had a brick wall like appearance and was clean and well maintained. The wardrobes were of the best teak wood and looked classy. The low lighting at night suited the mood perfectly for a couple and was not too out of place for family as well given that we were on a holiday.There were multiple things to do at the resort. Early morning yoga classes; meditation rooms; the swimming pool and obviously the famous Ayurveda treatments of the resort were quite in vogue and catered to all sections of age group. Thus the Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort is recommended.light goes frequently here but nonprobs as such coz of pleasant weather

Review_Content: We have visited twice since we find the resort too good . well spread out ;full of greenery and those meandering pathways immensely satisfying.Children like the swimming pool maintaied wellThe cottages are good and welcoming.As a family we had wonderful timeThe service of the staff is excellent.Food of course is only veg and the lunch anf dinner need to be ordered well in advance to be included in their arrangements.If Non veg is needed one needs to go out .the reception staff are also very couteousWill like to visit once more

Review_Title: “Very Good for ayurvedic remedies but they should tk care of adequate power backup”
Review_Content: I recently visited the Palghat municipality in southern India with my partner. Located near the Palghat Gap; the place is now called Palakkad and the natural pass through the Western Ghats ranges is a favorite amongst tourists who are keen on trying out new places. We booked Package thru Antilog Vacations and they also arranged for our stay at the Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort in the Olassery area there for a period of 3 days and 2 nights & remaining tour at decent rates. I would like to discuss some positives and negatives about the place in my review here:Positives:1. The location though not in the conventional road but is just 1-2 kms inside and the locales should help you spot the exact position if you say Kairali. We reached in late afternoon and the serene location provided us a view of an amazing sunset upon arrival. 2. The resort has an in house doctor for emergencies.3. If you're really into following Ayurveda; then this is the place for you as the medicinal practices are quite renowned here and the spa and therapies are also rejuvenating and relaxing.4. The rooms are generally named after a star or nakshatram as it is called here and are available equipped with various facilities. 5. The resort keeps in house umbrellas given that it rains frequently and hence its ok even if you land up without any rain protections as we did.6. The pool was large and furnished with a small steam Jacuzzi.Negatives:1. The place is haunted with frequent power shedding and hence there were some periods of darkness. The backup inverter worked but then again you could not switch on all the appliances.2. Mosquitoes are quite high in number in the area and you would be advised to bring your own coils or repellants to keep these at bay.

Review_Title: “The worst resort i have ever seen !!”
Review_Content: Never fancy away with the pictures and information given at the resort site..They lack the most basic facilities of a resort..A 3 star hotel will provide you with good services that this resort..Here is my detailed anwer why you should never book this resort1.cleanliness- The cottage was poorly maintained..the bed and pillow had a odd smell when i arrived and i could sleep at night.Bathroom is a big disaster.I wonder how foreigners who visit this place stay at such a cottage..You need extra strength to even push the flush in the toilet as they are very old and dirty..2- Breeding place for mosquitoes- there is a big fountain that spreads across the resort which is now filled with green algae all over it with dirty water floating on them..This is an excellent place for mosquitoes to breed and you cannot go across the resort at night due to mosquitoe bites.3- Irresponsible staff- When i was residing at the staff; i saw a foreigner complaining regarding few employees at the resort to the front office desk person..they failed to even give him a reason or apology..Instead both the employee and the front desk staff laughed as soon as he left with disappointment4-The worst restaurant - They have only fixed menu for the morning ; afternnon and evening.It sucks big time..I can gurantee you 3 kg weight loss in three days because of the untasty; bland food here..As there is nothing around the resort to eat..For sure you will end up starving ..This big resort employs only three waiters for such a big place..5- Big marketing team for the worst resort- The resort has a big marketing team in delhi which sends many people on vacation..Dont get carried away by the marketing team..I gurantee you even the people working in the resort would think twice before staying at the cottage here due to poor maintenance.But the marketing team is never concerned about any of this ..6- the management has a spare key and they will open ur room at any point of time for room service without informing you..We came to know only at the end when we saw the person walking out of the room.Pls keep ur belongings safe7- huge Price for bad service - Pls do not pay such a huge price for all the bad service.U might waste your time like i did;;There are better resorts and treatment centres in kerala which are worth the money u payThe only thing good is the spa .but that too pls be careful as i found the windows open during my therapy..I request the MD fo kairali resort to stay here for two days and see..I bet they will not be able to be here even for a day..I request the management to stop all the marketing and instead do some renovation work ..
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Never ever visit here and waste your time

We wish to keep you posted that the resort now is operated by a new management team ;who had succeeded to make a tremendous improvement on our property and allied services and would be more than happy to have yourself back to our healing centre once again where you could experience the authentic health care through Ayurveda in its natural glory as stated in our website. Assuring the best of our improved services & attention at all times. Sincerely; The Management

Review_Content: Back last Tuesday after a trip to Kairali resort; Palakkad as part of a promo voucher that we bought last year.First about reaching this place - its a drive of approx 8 hrs(comfortably without rush driving) - never mind the distance by kms and doing a basic math of D/T. And 8 hrs IF you leave Bangalore early say by 6 AM. We live in Domlur - so took the Bangalore-Hosur-Krishnagiri-Dharmapuri-Thoppur (took a deviation here)-Mettur Dam-Bhavani-Coimbatore and finally Palakkad. Now about quality of road. Bangalore-Hosur(Toll road - good - via elec city);Hosur-Krishnagiri (WAS good; now cut at various places some construction going on. It was raining in the morning with some truck traffic -this section was annoying); Krishnagiri - Dharmapuri -Toppur(very good - maintained average of 110 kmph - touched 130 top); Toppur-Mettur-Bhavani (average to bad - state roads you would pass via some small town/villages in between. Scenic than Salem route but looking at the quality I would recommend Salem route to anyone; though Salem has heavy truck traffic); Bhavani-Perundarai (Excellent - can maintain average 110 kmph); Perundurai - Coimbatore (Pathetic - roads under construction - full of potholes and deviatioin at multiple places); Coimbatore - Palakkad bypass (Pathetic again - Walayar checkpost is just disastorous especially after rains). From Palakkad ask for a place \Pulpuli\" from locals. Resort is about 10 kms from Palakkad. Resort is in a very very remote place. You would just be under \"resort arrest\" if not going by your own transport. You would need car for movement. After sleeping for few hours (it was sole driving with just one stop - had left B'lore at 6 AM reaching resort at 1:30 PM!); we walked around resort - its full of coconut and few other trees. As we were to leave back on Monday; we decided not to waste whole of Sunday again driving too much - and just visit nearby Palakkad city including Tippu fort; Malampuzha dam and back. It was not too bad - quite hot in the morning though. On Sunday evening I had a good oil massage in the resort - quite relaxing. Early dinner on Sunday night at resort (food is average -of course its more for \"treatment\" than suiting taste buds. It included few phulkas; cabbage sabji; herbal soup; curd rice (no dal or sambar - dont ask for it); one coconut sweet. After discount food costed about 225 pp - not bad. Anyways; only other alternate is drive for 15 kms and reach Palakkad town!!To be honest; we went there ONLY because we bought this voucher last year for some reason. On our way back; we drove via Conoor; Ooty; Bandipur and Mysore -because of bad roads from Palakkad to Coimbatore; ghat section and a tree fall to our ill luck the whole drive took 10 hrs. O/N at Mysore and again drove back to Bangalore the next early morning. It was very tiring trip and felt like taking another holiday after this trip.Now about the resort - I've already mentioned about the food and its location. Resort is OK. Rooms good. Each unit is named after a star (nakshatram). Frequent power outage - but they have back up. It rained very heavy with thunder and lightning every evening. Resort has umbrellas - but good to carry your own as they've shortage at times and you would need to depend on someone to get it. Phones were out of order - I understand after a heavy lightning few days ago phones went off - for every thing I had to physically walk up to reception. There are NO shops nearby - so please make sure you carry all your medical needs and snacks. Rooms have both AEH and regular power points. Beds and linen are clean - not too great; not too bad either.All in all -this is a trip if you happen to be like one of us who has ended up buying the voucher OR have got nothing else to do OR got a ayurvedic treatment out there. Its not a place to exclusively look forward to - but anyways if you want to go try to spend at least 2-3 days staying in the resort else would end up as a very tiring trip if you are driving all the day. Also; make sure you have your own transport as there is absolutely nothing you can do sitting in the resort - unless; of course the only thing you want to do is eat all your 3 meals in resort; just be lying on the bed and read a book.Cheers;Sunith"

Visited The Westin Sohna Resort and Spa last weekend ...Ayurvedic treatments at Kairali were just so relaxing and amazing!A weekend retreat after a stressful week brought back new energy & spark.Feel so refreshed after a fun filled weekend.

The Kairali resort is situated in beautiful surroundings; very green and tranquil. We were not there to participate in any of the treatment sessions it was just a stop over to relax in tranquil surroundings for 1 night. The cottage was average; although; the bed clothes could have been cleaner; not sure it the sheets had been changed. Lots of mosquitoes around; they did spray at night. Menus are fixed; fixed price no change. Nothing in the rooms to say if they do snacks; room meals etc. Very disappointed with that. Maybe if undertaking their courses it would be different. Expensive for what you got.

A radio contest prize gave us a complimentary stay at Kairali Resort. We included a stop at the resort on the route on a road trip and headed there last week. The resort is idyllic and situated in the heart of a village. So there's no option for alternative dining options in the vicinity. The quality of highways across Kerala is terrible so if you are driving there factor in additional time to deal with narrow streets; heavy truck traffic; village and town life pouring onto the highway and potholes every few meters. The resort is sprawling with beautiful cottages across the expanse. Every cottage has a name and each one is unique. Our cottage named Chothi was comfortable and clean. What was funny were the Mangalore tiles on the ceiling that were heart shaped cut outs amidst an otherwise white ceiling.All meals are served at the dining hall that overlooks green from every window. The menu is printed and pinned onto a board at the entrance. We did not see an a la carte menu but did not miss it. The efficient waiters served each course with warmth and a smile. Every meal has herbal warm water; a soup; salad; papad; two vegetable preparations; a pulse preparation; curd; pickle; chapatis; rice and a desert. Most of the ingredients are sourced off the property itself and the entire meal features very little oil. It's health food and detox that are the highlights of the resort.The yoga and treatment sessions seem expensive and when on a treatment package there are a list of guidelines that have to be followed: No swimming; no sex; no non veg; no alcohol......the list is long and every room has a copy of the do's and dont's. We opted not to go in for the treatments and so thoroughly enjoyed the large; clean swimming pool set amidst towering trees and flowering plants.A man made narrow river runs through the entire undulating property and when the motor is turned on; the water flows around gurgling and ending in a fountain. However when this is off and there is inadequate water within each section you do wonder about mosquitoes. The water in certain areas does give off a peculiar odour too.At dusk the mosquito problem is dealt with by an incense fumigation and it would be best to stay indoors until the mosquito hours have passed. The property has a gym; a billiard room and a library all centrally located near the dining hall.This resort is excellent for anyone who wants to do a complete albeit expensive detoxification in the lap of nature. However if you are planning a fun vacation with family and friends this resort would be inappropriate.

We visited the resort over long weekend from Bangalore and not for any Ayurvedic therapy. The resort has lot of greenery; that was one thing that I was expecting and I liked the most. We paid 3000 for 2 nights and 3 days; (only cottages); got some discounts on B/F; lunch; dinner (Not on other food we order). some of the cottages are smaller even with one small kid; but otherwise are cozy. We did not plan to do lot of activities or sight seeing. We spend 6-7 hours for going around. Malampuzha Dam is worth if you are with kids 5-12 years of age. They can definitely improve w.r.t. the food service; i.e. we had to wait for Breakfast; and after that also the service took quite longer.Moreover the options in restaurant are very limited.Overall not very good; not very bad experience. Okay place even if you do not want to do any ayurvedic treatment; provided you want to sit back; relax; and are not too fuzzy about food.Note: Resort is about 15-20 KM from palakkad railway station.

Completely ayurved focused resort.Simple; basic cottages.Excellent; smiling serviceCalm; remote and secluded environment. Perfect for a complete retreat to slow down time.Expensive but cost includes daily ayruveda treatment; guided meditation; yoga and health food. Be ready to completely immerse in healing your body and mind..
Room_Tips: Room Tip: it is a bit out of the way and not easy to get to. Make sure you arrive in daylight hours to help yo...

Review_Title: “Got to be into Ayurveda to make the most of this place”
Review_Content: Booked this 2 night stay through Groupon - perhaps a little naively as they're renowned for their misadvertisements. I'm not especially into Ayurveda; but I like massages and thought this would be a nice place to relax and start our Kerala exploration. It was an OK experience; but a little bit non-eventful compared to the rest of our amazing trip to India.The resort is a little awkward to get to; so it was a taxi ride from Calicut. It's set amongst some lovely country lanes and we enjoyed exploring the walkable surroundings. The room was in a small brick house; clean. Quite atmospheric at night with the low lighting. The resort itself was a little dated and lacked soul or indeed much to do full stop. A yoga class at 6.45am. Meditation at 7pm. Three meals per day. A pool. And Ayurveda treatments. We were tied into to cafeteria food; which luckily was plentiful and very wholesome (if sometimes a little on the bland side) though we had expected this to be included in the price considering there were no other eating options in the vicinity and therefore there was no choice but to eat there. The kitchen/waiting staff there were absolutely lovely and probably the best thing about the resort. They clearly put a lot of thought into every meal.My husband and I each enjoyed a 4-handed massage followed by the steam machine and lazed by the pool for several hours afterwards. The Ayurvedic staff were also very pleasant and seemed good at what they did. The gym was very small and uninviting and I decided to skip a short workout because of this.Felt very relaxed after 48 hours at Kairali but were ready to leave and get on with our trip onto which it felt like a pause button had been hit. We might have gotten on with our trip sooner had it not been for the misguided advice given to us on how to reach Munnar: the front desk staff advised us a journey time of approximately 2.5 hours with 2 changes. In the end; it took us 9 hours and we had to change 5 times! As for Kairali Health Resort itself; go if you're really into Ayurveda. If you're after a few days of relaxation at a nice resort but not that bothered about Ayurveda; I suggest go elsewhere.

Review_Title: “Can't imagine a more relaxing place to stay”
Review_Content: Well sorry; I tried to think of something I didn't like about the resort. Maybe just one; that my stay was to short. We where there for a a relaxing week and loved the treatments; the friendly service and great food. The price for our family was very good and well worth our money. It's really nice to walk around the rice fields in the morning and late afternoon.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Most cottages are nice; some are a little dark.

Review_Content: Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort is located in a nice and quiet area in the middle of the rice plantations. The garden and pool are relaxing. BUT the rooms are getting old (the bath room seems to be 10 years old); the doctor's advice (we had the lady - the old man seems to be much better) was not automatic and did not really give a professionnal feeling. The massage was done in a hurry; so did not at all relax me. In conclusion these negative aspects are not catastrophic; but compared to the price of around 18000INR (300euros) for one night; there is a total mismatch. It is far TOO EXPENSIVE.

I went to the above resort as it was highly recommended. My goal was to lose some weight and relaxation. As soon as I entered the resort I was totally enchanted by the surroundings and each day that I was there; I was in awe of the lush greenery and I was in \God's Own Country\". I was impressed by all the staff on the resort especially the therapists and the kitchen staff. Some of the things that affected my stay was the condition of the swimming pool. I was assured that there was a good filter system. I wanted to swim but there was a smell in the pool. Sometimes I noticed frogs in the pool and the workers; upon request; fished them out. I believe the pool was being fixed so may be in better condition now. There was a gym with only one threadmill. This caused problems as there were three of us and were not able to work out together. I also noticed the lack of a good jogging/walking track. For a decent walk; we had to go outside the resort. A facility of this calibre perhaps needs to assess the fitness portion and make it available to the guests through series of classes/upgraded equipment. However; a yoga class was available every morning which was a great start to the day. This resort is so beautiful and I am positive that it would be beneficial to the managment if they upgraded the villas and provided facilities like internet and wifi. In conclusion; I met my goals and reduced weight.....and I would go back."

I came to Kairali with a mixed bag of expectations. I left the place feeling that I could not have made a better choice than Kairali. The management; staff; therapists; and doctors are superb. Like it usually happens in any resort setting; hospitality; quality in service thins out in a day or two after you check in. But; here; the consistency in service and quality remained the same throughout my stay. Positive vibrations in this property is something that should be experienced. It provides an ideal cathartic atmosphere for receiving ayurvedic treatment and relaxation thereafter. If you want a resort that focuses on ayurvedic treatment delivered in its pristine form; this is the place for you to be; That said; wish the liibraries were equipped better; It gets a tad boring when the sun goes down. One suggestion is to have a cultural evening that showcases Kerala's art and culture. Have a bonfire evening etc. Other than this shortfall; Kairali has got what it takes to keep guests coming year after year. I sure will be one of them.!

Our 6 night / 7 day stay at this health resort was most enjoyable. The particular aim was to seek treatment and obtain advice about ayurvedic herbal medication.The resort is beautifully landscaped; with lush gardens and coconut trees and makes it an ideal atmosphere for relaxation. The food is excellent; with attentive restaurant staff who are always smiling. All staff members at the resort are very helpful and make you feel very welcome; including the gardener who cannot speak English; but his smiling face makes you smile.The advice from the onsite ayurvedic doctors is very good and they take time to explain the different treatments and the range of herbal medicines. The massages are also excellent. We highly recommend this resort if you are seeking herbal ayurvedic treatments - we are planning on coming back next year!

Review_Title: “liked it a lot; went back and plan to come back again”
Review_Content: I came to Kairali with the goal to reduce my weight and in the process I discovered the most beautiful and enchanting place to rest and service my body. It is like emersing into the paradise on Earth with the most attentive and caring staff responding to all your wishes so you feel as if you part of Kiarali family. The most outstanding here is the trearment centre where extremely professional and kindest doctors and therapists were so helpful. The equation between the price I paid and the results were really satisfying no end. The only comments I can make - don't bring children here and the top management has to take more care on rooms and bathrooms modification; they are tired.

This place is for the ayurvedic treetment purpose not for the family to spend the life; I have got some 3000 gift voucher for 2 night 3 days; i went by car from bangalore; if you dont have car please dont go...; we drived around 400km and found the place palakkad; we thought its hilly station but its not that..after we asked for the Kairali which is 10km from palakkad; once we reached there we felt we have taken wrong decision; food was worst like patients serverd kind but you need to pay 300 for that; the resort guys only intersted in foreign people as they come for ayurvedic and pay handsome money like 60k for 1 week; if indian goes they wont care tall; we got bored and though to go out we came to know there is falls in place DHONI after driving 25KM from resort; we came to know they are not allowing people to go fot the falls. and there is no much places to see and also food is worst and language problem; there people cant speak hindi also; so you can servive if you know malayalam only.please dont go to this place;

My search for an Ayurvedic resort started few weeks back on the internet and also through some friends from India. I was looking for a 2 Week long ayurvedic treatment for my back pain. My friend at trawellindia gave us the best service in this area and most reasonable prices. They facilitated all changes we had to make before and during our stay. The recommended resort was an amazing choice and had the services we were looking for. Exceptional services with exceptional quality of doctors. I was truly cured of my back problem.This ayurvedic resort was truy amazing. I would come back next year for a rejuvenation program.

It is the second time that we come back to the Kairali Resort for treatments.the treatments are very good; you fell completely strong from the body and the spirit when you live the Kairali Resort.Everything is done to have a wonderful stay.People are so nice; able to offer you the best service any timeI really recommend this Kairali Resort
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The doctor is a magician

Review_Content: Very friendly people; twice a day a good treatment and helpful waiters in the restaurant. I enjoyed the days here very much.

Review_Title: “Kairali resort is really good place for relaxation.”
Review_Content: Its huge green lush area with palm tree was awesome and gives a fresh feel to mind. A place that is far from crowded and polluted cities like Delhi.Their ayurvedic treatments like panchkarma; sirodhara; sirovasti and other treatment about that I never heard were really nice. All ayurvedic herbs and oil used for treatment and massage were completely chemically free and natural; also prepared form their own plants. Doctors were well experienced and trained.Deluxe room was well cleaned and had royal looks. Room services were very good. Food was delicious. Staff was very dedicated and polite.Modern facilities like internet; TV; games court; children activities and cultural tours also available. And the best thing is cost that was under my budget. After staying of 7 days I felt a change in myself was felling more fresh and more energetic

The Kairali resort is unique and a great place to relax and unwind. They have a huge property with a stream running by each cottage. Regular yoga classes; fresh and healthy meals and a wonderful staff makes the whole experience wonderful.The resort offers wellness packages; which includes a check up with the resident Ayurvedic doctor; massages and a diet tailored for you. The meals are cooked suing vegetables that are grown in a nearby organic farm (you can request to visit the farm; which is really nice). The rooms are classified based on Indian star signs and are very spacious and spotless.The manager and the staff are very friendly and go out of their way to ensure that you have a great stay. Although we went during the summer; we never felt any discomfort as the trees and the stream in the property keep the temperature down. A great place to relax and get away from the city

Kairali is a wonderful spot if you look to relax; destress and be away from it all. it is the 5th time I am coming here for an ayurveda cure and every time I am more than pleased with the services; mostly of the quality of the treatments. The Ayurveda Center is very genuin and reflects calm and well being. the quality of the massages are top and the advices of the senior physisian are of great knowledge. The services of the hotel and the restaurant are very good and the staff is very professional ... serving you with a smile. The rooms are also very genuin;all different in style and size; proving everything you need. Personally I feel very relaxed in my room. The only backdrop I can mention are the bathrooms and the shower faciities at the Ayurveda center. They have should be renewed; as well as some of the rooms. One who looks for a healthy stay and wants to get well being from Ayurveda; Kairali is the perfect place!

Having met the family member who does the overseas marketing for the property at a Kerala Workshop; I was encouraged to stay.On the whole; the property is very good. Lovely gardens and pretty location; very welcoming staff throughout and a wide range of good; well executed Ayurveda treatments. I booked a 14 day 'Rejuvenation and Detoxification' Package and was very pleased with the overall results. I felt much more refreshed at the end of my stay than I had when I arrived! I also took advantage of the Yoga and Meditation classes and found them very worthwhile.My biggest disappointment was the food. There was nothing wrong with it as such: it just became so monotonous for the second week of my stay. I was of course on a 'strict diet' but that does not mean the food has to be boring! In the end; I lost my appetite as I was not enjoying the food. There needs to be a choice and there needs to be much more variety.The property advertises that it has a swimming pool: yes it does but the water was so cloudy that I did not use it once during my stay. The whole pool area is very tired as is the tennis court. If any hotel offers these facilities; then they have to be usable! You should be able to see the bottom quite clearly of any swimming pool i.e. the water should be crystal clear. This needs to be rectified as soon as possible as the pool area badly lets the hotel down and unless guests are happy to swim in cloudy water; then they will not use it!The 'Business Centre' is OK but again rather tired. It suited my purpose in that I could access my office e-mails via the Internet but the equipment is quite old although functional. For the prices the property charges; I think that use of the Internet should be free of charge to guests as it is all on Broadband anyway.The property is VERY isolated so unless you want to have a complete break doing very little and just relaxing; this will not be the property for you!

Review_Title: “a special place to relax and calm down”
Review_Content: This was my first experience in ayurveda and I loved it! The tratments are very relaxing and the staff member at the clinic area are so friendly and can possibly \look into your heart\". The doctor is very warm and well experienced and he has a big sense of humor as well.The staff (at the reception; in the restaurant; the therapists; the yoga teacher; the room maids; the gardners etc.) are so kind and friendly. Everyone is taking care for the guest.The rooms are nice; not very modern but clean. The bathroom was ok and clean as well!Food was very tasty; enough for everyone (!!!) and matches for every dosha. The surrounding garden is beautyfull and well-tended. Yes; lights are off at 10 p.m. but this ist ok for everyone who is there for recreation.For everyone who is expecting a \"spa\" this place might be the wrong ressort. Everyone who can get into a change: This is the perfect place!"
It is great place to stay peacefully with full of trees; rivers surrounding. But no no non-veg and you need to adopt their ayurvedic kind of foods. room service is good. Can try massage there.

Every single member of the resort staff was very warm and kind. The rooms were pretty basic on the inside but the property itself was very nice. It was in an isolated area but I didn't feel like I had to leave the resort because of how nice the grounds were. They had a nice swimming pool and tennis court and there were alot of activities offered. My favourite part of my experience was being able to try new things.
I travelled to Palakkad at the Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort. Its fantastic and you can travel by train.Excellent diet food for your health.

Review_Title: “If you know what you're letting yourself in for; then fine...”
Review_Content: This was booked for us by a travel agent as part of a trip around Kerala. I thought that the sound of a spa was great part way through our trip; but I didn't realise that the resort took the Ayuverdic concept so seriously - we arrived in the early evening and had a choice of 2 set vegetarian dinners (diet or non-diet!) with no alcohol allowed.The lights are turned off at 10pm around the resort as everyone is expected to be in bed early to get up for yoga and/or meditation. There was no hot water in the showers; and the in-room guide suggested that you don't use the pool as it might contravene the therapies.Having said this; the cottages were nicely located and furnished; and the massage was great and luxurious - a real highlight of the stay (although 10 times the price that we paid for a similar massage but in far simpler and less clean surroundings elsewhere in Kerala). The doctor/therapists seemed very experienced; competent and friendly.If you are an Ayuverdic guru then I'm sure that this place would be great for you; but if not I'm not so sure that I would recommend it.

I visited the Resort in Feb; 07 & I loved it. It is definitely one of Kerala's highlights; a boon for people looking for Ayurvedic treatments & you must visit this place if you are going to Kerala.I would say when you are looking for Ayurvedic treatments this is the place for all Ayurvedic enthusiasts. Also the murmur of flowing waterbody; shrill cry of birds; greenery all around makes it an ideal setting for experiencing a true Ayurvedic Holiday.

I happened to stumble upon this resort while on my trip to India recently; and was very glad I did. It was a peaceful almost soul-calming experience. The lush green gardens; the wonderful staff and the great overall environment was a big positive. On top of that the ayurvedic spa treatments were also an amazing experience. Having been to many different resorts across the country I fell that Kairali definitley is in the top 2-3 as far as enjoying a great peaceful holiday in one of the gems of the Indian Subcontinent i.e. Kerela. This is not one to be missed by anyone.

Kairali was an experience that one cannot forget. They provided the best of services which one can ask for. The place is a great relaxation spot that is well placed. The beauty of the natural scenary brings out Kairali resort and makes it an amazing place to go to. I personally had a splendid time and would recommend others to experience the beautiful resort for the services it has to offer. The resort was everything i expected it to be and more. The rooms are very clean and spacious. There were little touches like flowers in the bathroom; bedroom and on arrival.The massage itself was a feeling that is indescribable. The warmth of the oil and its fragrances brings out a soothing massage.The staff are courteous and very helpful. Everyone at the resort went above the call of duty which is a lovely touch.
