I am so glad I had a Kairali experience.

I visited Kairali Ayurvedic Health Resort in February 2006 and I really need to emphasize on the rejuvenating experience I had there. First of all; Kerala is one of my favourite states in India partly because it is so lush and green – and Kairali Resort is situated in the most ideal location; Palakkad. Initially; I came across the resort through a recommendation from a friend. I recall my hesitancy when I first browsed the resort website; making me wonder how ‘nice’ the location could be if you can’t even see the ‘tiny’ pictures on display! But the site claimed that it was a “perfect place for a discerning traveller” and having crossed my fingers; I thought I should be adventurous enough to pay it a visit!Now that I look back; I should admit it was one of the most “marvellous” risks I have taken. India is a diverse land and variety is what it offers best! Unfortunately with the Indian economy opening up; we see more commercialisation and foreign-tourist attractions taking over. You will see high-rise and non-environmental buildings propping up as world-class 5 Star Hotels; but not one has the unique Indian services at offer. If you plan to be pampered; please go to the 7 star hotels where food will be served at your convenience and hotel managers will appease you at the sight of your cash-flow. But; if you want to encounter and experience raw culture and traditions; then let Kairali mesmerize you. Though; I really wish the resort named itself a “health farm” as it states in its website; for that is what it is – truly invigorating. The resort has allocates rooms according to one's zodiac signs (they believe that your characteristic attributes will be in co-ordination with your zodiac sign; hence put you in the right correlations with nature). It has the most eco-friendly atmosphere and is perfect to relax and unwind (I got to spend my time rather fruitful and undisturbed).You wake up to a healthy life of yoga; followed by specially designed health massages and served with food in its purest form. You have time to idealise and meditate…you have the leisure of walking through nature and being at peace within. And as one reviewer mentioned; you come across a diverse group of visitors and make some lasting friendships (two of the people I met during my stay are going back to visit Kairali and I plan to do the same ritual).A quality of thought is a state of mind. I highly recommend Kairali for the traveller who has seen imperfection and understood it in the global world. Once we comprehend and digest the fact that imperfection is only a human condition; I think in a deeper sense; Kairali will fulfils one's desires. And; I truly have high respect for the team who work at Kairali for they do not advertise themselves with deceiving intentions (namely publicize things that they are not; or can not offer).During my stay; I came across individuals who were not content…the reason: it’s a vegetarian resort?! There is no entertainment?! The variety of food is restrictive?! The massage oils stink?! The lakes/water streams look muddy and dirty?! And my response – absurdity! Nature is not perfect.It’s a vegetarian resort because it is a health farm designed to cleanse your system and annihilate your health problems. Ayurvedic treatments depend on certain strategies which need to be followed and practiced.If there is no entertainment; it is because it permits you to not rely on materialistic possessions but rather use nature as your source of comfort. If the massage oils stink; it is merely because they are not flourished with chemical scents but herbs that will ultimately alleviate your health problems -- (it did a lot of good to my lower back problem!)And finally; must I comment on why the lake/ water streams look muddy and dirty?! For I have never come across an ocean green and see-through one.I wish Kairali and its team the best‘est’ of luck in their future endeavours and I am certain that if they continue to service their customers in genuineness; they will flourish into a world-class health farm...irrespective of reviews that diverge into various perspectives.PS: before I left; I had the chance to meet the owner and as a humble suggestion; I requested if they could focus more on improving their online website; especially the extremely tiny pictures which were not pleasant to the eye. To my surprise; I received an email in April thanking me for my views and how the website is being retransformed to offer better resources online (even translations in other languages).There is always room for improvement; if it’s expressed in an amicable way.

I stayed im Kairali 10 days im January 2007.Almost everyone was complaining about everything .I changed my room 2 times because: the first time was the room not quite at all (I could ear everything from the neigbourroom; they watched TV very loudly).The second time the badroom was very bad; very old and the water didn't run all day.I had problems with the room service: the waiter came in my room at 22.00 in the evening bringing me water; and he wanted to have a talk to me; looking at me in a strange way;but I didn't want at all. So I told him: \Goodbye\"; but he still kept staying in my room; so I became frightened and I strenghtly opened the door and I pushed ihm out. After that I talked to the manager; he apologized and fired the boy. And he told me: \"Please forget it; don't tell it anyone; you can have every drink complimentary.......\".But I can't forget.And I can't forget the catastrophic reception service.They woke me up 2 times at 5.30 o' clock; but I didn't ordered the wake up call!!!!1 time I ordered it; but they forgot to call me.I waited for 2 or 3 important e-mails; they couldn't find them on their computer; and this is not an exception. It happened the same to some other people .My husband called me in the evening; they didn't pick up the phone.......And at the end the bill was not correct; and I had to complain again......So; even if the garden is beautiful (the pool side has only 4 deck-chairs; and you have to reserve one already at 8.00 o'clock!) I couldn't relax very well because everyday another problem was expecting me........The hygiene in the treatments rooms is not very good. Sometimes I asked them to change the towels where I had to sit or where I had to put my head for the treatment because they were VISIBLY dirty. In a really good center it shouldn't happen.So; I can't recommend the Kairali Ayurvedic Resort at all.Beware of Kairali."
very bad service; poor food; but high prices for india. choose somateeram or travancore resort. you even cannot compare!!!!

This is a two-star resort at the most. My husband and I went there to get a week-long ayurvedic treatment and to relax. I am also a journalist and travel writer and was hoping to write a story on the resort. But my own experiences and those of most of the guests at the hotel made us leave three nights after we got there. We had paid in advance and were refused a refund; but I made a call to the owner of the resort who lives in Delhi and threatened to sue him if he didn't give us back our money. We managed to get our money back and leave. And I want other travelers to know our Kairali saga so they never go to this resort.First; the treatment was terrible. The two doctors are clueless and massaged me with an oil repeatedly even after they found out I was allergic to it. I developed a bad rash and my husband; a doctor; had to run around all night to try and get me to the nearest hospital. We never made it to the hospital because Kairali has no means of moving guests out during a night emergency. To make matters worse there is no first aid kit onsite and the night I suffered a rash the resort water supply was shut off so I could not wash off the oil.The rooms are just ok and the bathrooms terrible. The kitchen is good but the options are limited. Other services are below standard as well.What saves the day are the beautiful gardens but that is the last thing you notice when you are sick and unhappy! Strangely; we made some great friends while we were there because everyone was bonding in the face of Kairali misery. In fact; we all vowed to put up a website trashing the resort. But we feel sad for the local employees at the mercy of an owner who has very little business sense and fewer ethics....So BEWARE of Kairali.

As a hotel; this resort does not get a high rating from us; but as an Ayurveda Center it offers a lot. Treatment start with a consultation; then you are prescribed some sort of ayurvedic massage. This massage is done by using lots of oil with long strokes. Two therapists massage you at the same time. It was relaxing but hygiene of the massage bed and the oil created lots of questions in my mind. Food is fresh; clean and very tasty. I should also mention that it is strictly vegetarian and ayurvedic. Days start with a yoga class under the coconut trees and end with a meditation session. It can be quite relaxing here. But then again this depends on your expectations and personality. Resort area is nice with coconuts and lawns around the brick cottages. Rooms are not as nice. Uncomfortable beds; lots of concrete; tasteless decoration. Resort is surrounded by beautiful paddies and sweet little village houses; but don't expect to see these unless you step outside. High walls cut the connection of the resort from its beautiful surrounding.

Lotus Nikko hotel is about 1st walk to the Mahaboddhi Temple; there's many shop on right and left side road. Especially souvenirs like stones ; rings; necklaces and many more with Tibetans style or Indian. Pasmina is everywhere on small shop or huge shopping mall. There are many street vendors also selling many thing's. The hotel's staff are very friendly and nice. Rooms is big but not so clean. Very simple bed sheets not clean make sure to bring our own pillow sheet. Hot water not working well. But breakfast is a lot of choices asean styles. Of course Indian food are dominated. Don't do laundry here because they do it natural way ;; no laundry machine. The result our clothes become smells because it's not wash and dry properly ; no iron as well. Overall is quite nice choice for stay with big group

The hotel is ok; but has no character. The rooms are comfortable enough but the air con is so noisy we had to turn it off at night & use the fan; which was also noisy. Although it has wifi you have to pay 100rps per day to use it & it only works in reception; if you have 2 devices they try to charge you for both but if you complain they won't. On the upside; the restaurant is excellent; the food was always very good & the waiting staff are charming; nothing was too much trouble for them. That is the reason I gave it 4 stars.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Although near to everything the town has to offer it is very basicThe restaurant however is excell...

Review_Title: “Restaurant staff amazing - wifi fee ridiculous - hotel is ok”
Review_Content: Location - great. Restaurant staff - incredible. Seriously - Michelin caliber service. Front desk managers; not the most informed - at all really. Rooms - decent. Bed sheets - crisp and clean smelling. Shower - amazingly hot water at all times (rare in India). Biggest issue? More on a principle front than anything - wifi fees. 100 rupees; per person; per device; and the stinger? It only works in the lobby. You feed me 3 meals a day; your rooms aren't the cheapest; and yet you still charge me 100 rupees a day? Very very lame. Huge demerit. Especially since I have to sit in the lobby to use it. All in all I'd stay here again just for the amazing restaurant staff. But I'd check to see if they are still nickel and diming people for wifi. It really is preposterous.

A terribly designed hotel;cold and sad;but in a very good position ;very near the centre.The staff;expecially the restaurant manager; try their best to be helpful.The hotel is clean and silent; simply needs some forniture and some decorations....but if you want to go to the main temple late in the night or at the dawn; this is it.

We were booked for three nights as we were doing the Bodh Gaya - Nalanda - Rajgir circuit. We were out of the hotel by 9 every morning; and back in time for dinner (included in the tariff) and bed. I think the hotel management knows that this is the case with most guests; as it offers the basic amenities for travellers and ignores the rest (the 'garden' was just an overgrown patch of land).From this perspective; the hotel was adequate: clean (though not sparkling); the bedlinen fresh and clean-smelling; and most important; plenty of hot water even late at night. We didn't need to use the a/c; for which I'm grateful given that other reviewers have said that it is quite noisy. The fan as also mentioned only worked on the highest speed; but given that the weather was quite pleasant when we went; we did without and just opened the window.It is very close to the Maha Bodhi temple and the several other temples erected by other Buddhist nations.The menu for breakfast and dinner was adequate; though the buffet offered every night was certainly lacking in imagination.The staff are friendly and helpful; especially in the restaurant; which we much appreciated.The hotel seems to be a favourite of groups of pilgrims from Southeast Asia and the Far East. They tend to be quite noisy; and their early-morning comings and goings did disturb my sleep. It might be better to ask for a room on a floor on which such groups haven't been booked.On the whole; given that there are few options for decent hotels in Bodh Gaya; this one offered an adequately clean and comfortable stay.

There are not many hotels in Bodh Gaya so this review should be taken in that context.This hotel provides a very basic room to stay in. Facilities are dated and barely working. The air conditioner makes a racket - so much so that we decided to turn it off and use the ceiling fan. Turned on the ceiling fan and it goes into maximum speed straight away - the speed control switch turns but does not have any impact on the actual speed! It was like sleeping next to a turbo prop plane. Food is very ordinary.However; on a positive note; the staff were great - very friendly and tried hard to make it better for us.

Our first visit to bodhgaya with helps if tripadvisor forum we reach Hotel early morning with our group. They are responding us following us and even gives the tips for sight seeing. The early check in Nd provided us breakfast at 4 am shows us they are toward responsible tourism . the sector is not yet in good form but expect good tourism in future. Hotel is very close to mahabodhi temple and walking distance from Hotel. It is without swimming pool . Swimming pool is purposed. And it is religious place thats why No Bar.Food was just up to the mark as expected by us. we will definitely stay back to Hotel in our next visit.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: New Rooms when they will finished should be very good ask about these rooms

Review_Content: This was by far the most \uninviting\" hotel we stayed in throughout India and Nepal. There are substantial renovations going on; but there are not a lot of choices available thoroughout the Buddhist \"Pilgrimage\" areas. There was no one else staying at the Hotel when we checked in for our 2 day stay; ( a family of 3 checked in later that evening) but we were put into a ground floor room that frankly was disgusting. The bathroom was putrid and smelt of raw sewerage; the bed and the room itself also smelt worse than anything we had discovered in the streets anywhere we had been and the AC did not work. We didn't even have the bags put down before I was in the foyer demanding another room. I was already beginning to dread this part of the trip; knowing we were already booked into 2 more Lotus Nikko Hotels in Kushinighar and Lumbini and we had heard they were not very good. Fortunately both were in better condition. The one in Lumbini was actually very nice.Management; did not even blink; quickly apologized and put us in another room on the 2nd floor which was at least reasonably clean with working AC. Makes you wonder why; with all the choices of rooms available in the Hotel; they didn't think to put us in this room in the first place; but this is the sort of thing that happens in India; where even though they are great people and it is a fantastic country to travel in; they haven't quite come to grips with thinking about the best and most logical options first for the welfare and comfort of their tourist guests.Anyway; the staff were very gracious and could not do enough provide good service; were very friendly and certainly made a good attempt to make up for the bad start. We ate in the restaurant here; for breakfast and supper as this was included in the price. Food was actually pretty good as we stuck to basics; chicken curries; soups and Kingfisher beer and again the service was very good. No king or double beds here and no credit cards. Also very hard to get any change or small notes from reception; but that is true throughout India. Took 2 days for them to get change for 1000 RP which is less than $20.00; so while we had meals included in the price for the Hotel; buying water and beer was a problem. But we just ran a tab and tipped the staff at the end of the stay. Garden; if you can call it that are very poorly maintained.Was much worse than any other hotel we stayed in throughout India and Nepal; but once we got into the new room; I have stayed in worse in other places including US.In the end we came here for the Buddhist experience and the Hotel served it's purpose; but it is badly in need of an update. Really couldn't recommend right now; but when renovations are complete and things are back to normal; may be better."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Right now; I would only stay on the 2nd floor. When renovations are complete; this might change

Review_Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in. They charged Rs 6000 during off season; when better hotels were available (as we discovered later) were charging Rs 4000 with good breakfast. There was practically no food; and their card machine does not work. And when I wanted to take the car and go outside to draw cash from the ATM; they locked the gates. I had to lodge a police complaint before they let me go out to withdraw cash.Dingy; dark and weird place. definitely cheating foreign tourists. Please avoid.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Fitness? Ha; ha! Swimming pool; a bigger Ha; ha

Review_Content: Situation very practical.Renovation works were a problem for the rooms on the left side of the corridor - the direction of the temple - .Clean ; practical...and no charm at all.Food only for veggie-lovers and moreover a very poor choice.Of course; no alcohol but water and water.Bathroom with bath but warm water was a problem : present at 5 PM but not later...No lift but we were helped as there are two floors .
Room_Tips: Room Tip: In February; the right side of the corridor.Anyway; while waiting at the reception take a look at th...

Review_Content: This one place can leave one with a mixed feeling. But blame it to oUr urban lifestyle of instant fun and pleasure. This is a farm house so basically it has to be in a farm and that is exactly where it is .. Off a single lane dirt road winding through the woods not a drive for the faint hearted and the final climb indeed makes us wonder whether our city cars used to elevators in parking will make it .. Yes they can .. I took my Zen Estilo and it did a good job .. The farm house has large accommodation .. however we found the new ones are more suitable for families with kids .. reason being it has TV .. rooms have quite a exotic feeling with furnishing and choice of colours .. room service is minimal but food is excellent .. tasty and minimal to avoid wastage .. The dogs on the farm are super friendly .. especially Jack .. who escorted us to various parts of farm and even walked us down to the sea .. beach was out of bound due to high tide.. The road being dirt track gives enough excuses to stay away from the nearby sight seeing .. This place would be best for young group of people wanting to have a group picnic .. place certa inky would shock if not scare a family with kids dur to he abundance of farm creatures like ants ; lizards and various bugs .. so one would like it more of a nature tour .. which I also did for my kids.. overall would say be prepared for an off beat experience ..

Based on TripAdvisor reviews; we narrowed down on Mahua Bagh given its off-beat location and the fact that it wouldn't be a very touristy place - boy what a mistake that was. The place clearly needs an overhaul!!!Our woes began right from the time we stepped on the property. We were a family of 5 and booked the new cottages; one of our cottages was unkempt and the bed linen seemed like they were not washed for days. Moreover; our cottage had a shared door with the staff quarters thus totally violating ones privacy - we immediately asked to move to another room. Most of the staff was new; untrained; clueless and displayed total apathy in servicing the guests. Complaints of poor service and unclean rooms seemed to resonate from all visitors over that weekend - I hope the management has duly taken note!!!Most of the meals were delayed - breakfast wasn't served until 9:30 am and lunch until 2 pm. Food was served in the open garden (not a good idea in the scorching Oct heat and moths hovering at night) and very average. Clearly; the property wasn't prepared to serve guests for the opening weekend after monsoon. Although the reviews did warn us about the power cuts; the place clearly has water shortage issues as well. We were required to flag the staff several times to notify that there was no water in the rooms. The place does not offer potable water as well - one is required to purchase packaged water at Rs. 30 a bottle.The current manager; Manish Singh (who claims to be a naturalist) gave misguided directions to the nearby Phansad sanctuary. It is sad that after such good reviews and pleasant experience from past visitors; Mahua Bagh is not living up to its reputation. It charges mid-segment rates for poor quality service. I will never visit this property again.

I visited this place with family on 2 October 2014. The first downer was the approach road to the property which is a 1.5 Kms patch of single car width jungle trek path. Was hoping to find something scenic on the other side of this treacherous drive but found nothing but a shabby fishing village. The property is not really a resort. It is a farmhouse which they are trying to turn into a resort.As this was the opening day of the season the facility was not at all in top shape. All the guests were had some or the other complaint with housekeeping.The food was OK; nothing to complain about. Staff was quite helpful.Once you reach here there is absolutely nothing much to do. There is no beach within walking distance where you can go and enjoy. So basically if your idea of the vacation is to just to go somewhere and not do anything at all; the place is OK. Otherwise you will have to risk you car every time you wish to move around.

ur stay at Mahua Baugh from 12-14 April was really wonderful. I would comment on three specific points1. Beautiful location - This is a 25 acre farm of mango; chikoo; banana...plantations making you feel relaxed and away from city life. You can walk down to the beach from here in five min.2. Accommodation -there are two sets of 6 cottages - old and new. Old ones are build on a minor hill. Day 1 we stayed at the top most old cottage which has an excellent view of the entire farm and is onlooking sea. Day 2 we stayed at the new one all of which are at ground level and have an open shower; solar water heater and TV. Both types of cottages are really big; neat and well maintained. You can choose either of them.3. Food and Staff Excellent food; cooked only for guests and served in open air arrangement adding to the farm feel. Staff is very courteous; Shival Jain- farm incharge; Shyam; Kaka; Michael; Kisan and others made our stay comfortable along with three pet dogs Gypsy; Jap and Sheru made us feel secured.We will certainly visit again.

Review_Title: “Awesome place to spend a weekend; Service is really overwhelming”
Review_Content: Awesome place to stay over a weekend; Very clean rooms; great view and food is awesome too one thing you will be surely impressed about is service of staff members; they will treat you like family you will feel like king of the world; Totally recommended!!!!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the old rooms they have private balcony and great view

Review_Content: We had a most wonderful time at Mahua Bagh. Location: It is in between Kashid and Murud. The beach is about 5 mins walk from the resort. The resort is at a pretty isolated location; so other than a few local kids playing cricket; you have the beach to yourselves.Service: Service is excellent; with Sudeep and team catering to our every need immediately. Food :We stayed for 4 nights; but no dish was repeated. Every meal outdid the previous one. The food was healthy; tasty and made with produce grown at the bagh. It was served under a mango tree making for some very relaxing meal times.Rooms: We stayed at the old rooms for their view; they are big and comfortable with an old world charm. The new rooms have open showers and TVs. Though the power cuts were frequent; there was no problem with the AC as the resort has a generator. The resort needs to add some amenities like a swimming pool; children's play area etc.We would definitely visit it again.

We visited this place at the peak of summer but the service offered by sudeep and his entire team made the trip worthwhile. New rooms are nice; spacious and comfortable. Although bagh needs to improve on indoor activities or arrange some local sightseeing; you will not regret the stay due to the excellent service provided by the staff.

Lovely & Quiet location next to a 5 minute walking distance from the sea. At location Sudeep along with 2 helpers really took awesome care of all our Food & Beverage needs; its a wonderful way to break away from the commercial lives that we lead.The warmth & hospitality extended was out of this world & rare to find even in best of hotels in the country today
Room_Tips: Room Tip: All rooms are at par

Review_Content: Mahua Bagh wouldn't suit your idea of an ideal resort with 24 hours of A/c;room service facilities etc but goes much beyond that; in the warmth and affection that the limited staff present provide you with.If you are too accustomed to sitting and chilling out in the confines of your room then this isn't a place for you;definitely not in the summer's. But if you don't mind sitting out in the open and just relaxing out this is definitely the place for you. Not that they don't provide you with A/c in the rooms;it's present but for a limited period in the nite after dinner and in the noons after lunch.This is due to the frequent power outs in the area. And though we were a group of 8 persons with small children including my 7 month old son; we didn't find it so much of a drawback but others might not find it appealing; specially in this heat. This and the approach road are probably the only drawbacks that anyone can encounter here. We reached the place late on Friday Nite after a long Drive from Mumbai and it might get a little difficult to spot the place in the dark due to absence of sign-age on the last 1 km stretch but if you contact the local in-charge;he will not only guide only but also comes out on his bike to assist you.He did this for all of us since all of us couples were traveling separately and all of us got a littlelost towards the end and also did the same for my friend who came alone early morning at 2 am.The food at the Bagh was amazing;the veg fare included. Never enjoyed veg food so much including their home made pickles Quite a few of the vegetables that they use are grown in their own farms. Moving on to the rooms we stayed in the 4 new cottages and quite preferred them over the old cottages. The old cottages have a nice view of the beach but the new ones allow us a lot of space for the children to play and move around. which wud'nt be possible at the old cottages. The old cottages therefore would be preferable for couples more than families according to me. Room nos 5&6 have an open shower included which is pretty cool.All the new cottages have a television set and a fridge. There are 3 very playful dogs on the farm;Gypsy the biggest of them all is a darling. And I can't complete this review without mentioningthe Hospitality of the staff Mr Shivlal; Micheal; Mahesh; Sudeep and all included. They really made us feel at home and gave us service which was better than a 5 star hotel. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants to escape the hustle and bustle of city life and is prepared to let go a few frills of luxury. After all not everything in life can be perfect.

If you like rural simplicity; delicious home grown food; the sound of the sea and a cool breeze blowing through coconut palms this is the place for you. If you prefer 5 star luxury and all mod-cons then maybe think again. Mahua Bagh is a peaceful retreat; beautifully furnished and tastefully decorated. We stayed in one of the newer a.c. rooms which had a fantastic modern bathroom with regular hot water and a sunken shower area; a cool veranda where sometimes our meals were served by the very friendly and helpful staff; and also where the lovely dogs would snooze in the heat of the day. Mostly; meals were served in the shade of the mango trees whilst the chickens scratched around us. The food was freshly prepared and some of the best we have eaten whilst in India; indeed anywhere. Taking a break from the heat; noise and busy city life of Pune where my husband has been working; we were exploring this part of the coast and didn't know what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. The beach which you can walk to when the tide is out is long; silver and mostly empty. The road is winding; potholed and the place hard to find but it is worth it. The only complaint is that the curtains; mats and bed spreads were not clean and I used my own scarves and throws to sleep under. For a place at this price and wanting to encourage visitors; it should be a priority to keep it clean and the bins in the rooms emptied sometimes. That said however we still recommend the place very much. The positive elements far outweigh the few glitches. It is one of the most beautiful places we have been and we returned to Pune refreshed and rejuvenated.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The older rooms which are higher up have the best views and more privacy. The new rooms have good ba...

Review_Content: We visited Mahua Bagh based on the high recommendations of our travel agent and guess what. It exceeded our expectations!!! Although; its not a joyride to this place; its definitely worth the time and energy. Unlike all commercial resorts and hotels this home like property is a perfect place to unwind and just BE. The tiny villages adorning the the property which were extraordinarily simple and beautiful. Although short staffed due to the Holiday season; the villagers cum room service help were way too polite and courteous. This enriching experience in Solitude cannot be described by words alone. You need to see; feel it and then believe it. Make sure you call the Manager / Agent to find out the best time to visit this place. DO NOT rely on Google maps for this location. It lands you in Kashid ; whereas this place is Mazgaon which is close to Nandgaon.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Rooms number 2;3;4 are known for the overlooking bay view; however I'd place my bet on 6;7;8 (th...

Review_Content: My husband and I visited Mahua Bagh for a 2 night stay from 21-23 March 2014. It is situated at Nandgaon; mid-way between Kashid and Murud. We were very happy with the service; food and ambience at this place.On arrival; Mr Shival; their manager and Sudeep; one of the staff welcomed us with a refreshing drink of home-made limbu pani. Since we were the only guests on that day; we were shown all the rooms to choose whichever one we liked; we finally decided on one of the older rooms; as it was at a slight height; and with a view of the beach. All the rooms were basic; but very airy; bright and cosy. Linen and bath towels were clean; and basic toiletries were provided. A couple of the newer ones even have open-to-sky showers.I must mention the food: all meals were included in our package; and we thoroughly enjoyed them. Since this is a farm; a lot of the vegetables & fruits are grown on site; and they make their own pickles and chutneys from the fresh produce. Meals are served outdoors; on the lawn; under the shade of huge mango trees. Fresh fish is available on request. All the dishes we were served were freshly cooked and very tasty with huge portions. Service is really excellent; and Mr. Shival; Sudeep and the other staff were very attentive to the guests' needs and made one feel completely at home. We were offered tea and evening snacks too; which is very rare in most package deals. Everyone was always very courteous and friendly.Pet lovers will really enjoy this place; as there are three loving dogs on the property; Gypsy; a huge but gentle giant; Sheru; the quiet one and Jap; the most energetic and mischievous of the lot. You can even get your own pets to this farm; they are welcome here. As dog lovers; we were very happy to have the three dogs around us to play with. The dogs even guided us to the beach; which is about 5 minutes away from the property.The only (minor) negatives were lack of a paved access road to the property (which is apparently because it is near the Phansad sanctuary; and the government doesn't allow construction of paved roads) and the electricity problem which the region faces. There are frequent power cuts; and though the resort has a generator; it is not always sufficient to power the entire resort. This could be a problem in the summer if the ACs and fans don't work.Overall; it is a great place for a weekend break for couple and families. The fresh air; yummy food; superlative service and playing with the dogs will rejuvenate you for the gruelling week ahead. We highly recommend this farmhouse-hotel.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The older ones have a beach view; while the newer ones have slightly better (i.e. less worn) furnish...

Review_Content: We went for a weekend holiday; saw the review and booked it. The place & the resort - Truly Awesome !! We have booked 3 new cottages; very very big rooms with Open shower and nice interiors. They served home cooked food; taste was really good specially Dal Fry and Sevaiya ki kheer. They have their own farm; so you will get fresh veggies for lunch & dinner. Serve lunch/dinner/breakfast in open garden restaurant.Resort is located right next to Rocky beach and they have nice view from old cottages with huge terrace. Service was really good. Only thing which needs to improve is the \Last km road\" which was very raw. Main Road work is in progress which will take sometime; I think 5-6 months.Special Thanks to Mr. Shaiwal Jain; Sudeep; Michael & Kaka for their splendid hospitality. Keep Rocking !!"

We were a group of 10 families and booked the whole resort over a long weekend. And what an amazing time we had. The last one kilometer which is a kaccha rasta gives you a fair idea about a rustic hideaway.The rooms are big and very comfortable. Food was great and not to forget the personal touch to each and every service offered by the staff.Its not a traditional hotel; its a resort amidst a farm and lots of open space for kids and adults to play. A secluded beach is just round the corner.Highly recommended for a large group with kids.

The place is located right next to the beach and its got an amazing ambience with the best home cooked kind of food.the hospitality of the staff is really goood and they are all very helpful.the cottages are well maintained and simply stunning with some old antique furniture.the old cottages are better with a larger balcony than the new ones.its an amazing place for a get together with family or friends.P.S. just carry your own alcoholExcellent is all i can say..Please do visit
Room_Tips: Room Tip: choose the old cottages on the slope as the balconies have a view of the beach.

Review_Content: Wonderful hospitality at the Mahua Bagh coupled with some excellent food & well kept rooms.A big thank you & well done to Sudip;Michael & Kaka for taking care of us - We were well fed & very well looked after. Beautiful property & a blissful location.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The Rooms on top have a great view & the rooms below are more accessible to the sea.

Review_Content: We stayed at Mahua Bagh for 2 nights and 3 days in mid-Feb. Reaching the resort was fairly easy as we were informed in advance (by zarahutke.in the site we booked our stay on) about the last one kilometer being an unfinished road.That part of the road wasn't as bad as we expected and very short. The farmstay's location is perfect if you want a secluded and quiet holiday. It's barely a minutes walk from the beach and the farm itself on which the cottages are located is lovely. The pets are friendly; the staff is courteous; the rooms are minimalistic and clean. The place is well kept and inviting. They have lots of games including board games and badminton. They have solar powered geysers; which means 24 hours hot water in the shower!During our stay; the staff promptly arranged a bonfire and a moonlight boat ride for us; which was beautiful! And they also didn't hesitate to bring us some supplies we needed from the market.The food was home cooked delicious; especially the alu parathas. The staff generously offer to give their guests their farm grown vegetables and fruits; which is fantastic. The only things we missed were mirrors in the rooms (there was just one in the bathroom) and no telephones to call for water/ guests in other rooms.We look forward to staying at Mahua Bagh again and have already recommended it to all our loved ones. Thank you Mahua Bagh!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The cottages on top have a great view; but the rooms closer to the entrance have additional open sho...

Review_Content: I along with my family visited Mahua bagh on 16Feb 14 and i must say this was an awesome place.Travelling with 2 kids aged 4 and 10 months is always a task; but the hospitality extended by Mr Shival Jain was really commendable.We reached late; but there were no hassles of checking -in.We took our own time to freshen up and lunch was served to us(time was around 3 but no hurry).They provided masala free food to kids which is thumbs up from me.Rooms were absolutely neat and clean and spacious rather very spacious.Hot water was available at all times.yummy food non greasy... thumbs up for the food; vegetarians are always at loss but not here.Evenings were pleasant with bonfire...enjoyed it thoroughly.Lots of trees....and greenery..palm trees...Breakfast in the bagh under mango tree is an experience in itself.Choice was provided for breakfast which is seldom the case with other hotels.There is a beach near by totally secluded and you can have fun times with your family.My kids thoroughly enjoyed the stay._ves: Approach road to the place is in fact a no road...(only mud).No one likes to see lifebuoy soap in bathroom :(I am definitely going to come again here...

This was my second visit to the Bagh and I was delighted to see that this place has managed to preserve its elegance and calm. Mahua Bagh's distance from the more commercialized places like Murud and Kashid provides you exclusivity and quietness which I find as its best qualities.However; I fear that the new construction (cottages towards the coastal end of the property) and a host of other upcoming hotel-like facilities/developments (TVs in all rooms; Indoor Dining Hall; Swimming Pool etc.) at this rustic farmhouse would rob its old-world-close-to-nature charm which I have so much come to love and adore.This time again; The hospitality has been amongst best I've experienced along the Konkan coast and the staff performs beyond their duties to provide you a great service. (I have had a great experience at their Mahua Vann resort at Pench as well.) The staff gladly arranged for a bonfire at night and an early morning boating trip on a local fishing boat on our request.Their home-cooked style of food has always been easy on the gut and full of flavors. Would love to see more of a local influence on the food though. Local Konkani food would be more suited for this sort of setting instead of the regular North Indian menu. Non vegetarian food (Chicken) however has lost its edge as compared to my last stay here in 2012. The culinary highlight of this stay was the specially ordered and beautifully cooked Fish Fry. Looking forward to visit Mahua bagh again in the Mango season!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Suites at the top of the old set of cottages give you a great view of the coastline.

Review_Content: Stayed with group of family members for 3 days. If you are looking for peaceful secluded place with idea to relax; you are at right destination. Good people to take care of you. Pleasant evenings with bonfires and eating out below trees; being close to nature. Overall good experience.Negatives - Last mile road is a extremely bumpy journey. Limited resources/ options for food and other things (though good quality food).
Room_Tips: Room Tip: New cottages made are good to stay as compared to old cottages (though with a good view).

Review_Content: Mahau Bagh is a very quiet farmhouse; off the main road connecting kashid with murud. A top a quiet hill with lot of mango trees. The rooms of the resort are quiet spacious. Unlike a conventional resort; this farmhouse has lot of trees and greenery. Just 5-7 min walk from the resort; one can get down to the rocky beach with just quietness and wilderness.

I chanced upon this place while browsing for a weekend getaway. I visited Mahua Bagh in the month of May 2013; when summer is at its peak; and thinking of a beach getaway at that point of time is practically uncalled for. Yes; Mahua Bagh is located along a beach; they have their own private access to a beach. This place is full of mango trees; infact the welcome drink was a mango panna; which was so refreshing.... I asked for another serving!!! The food was different; cooked the north Indian style; so if you expect the local cuisine; you might have to specifically ask for it; I did not. Incidentally there were no other guests; and we had all the place for ourselves. There was a lot of mango in the food; be it pulp; be it juice; we truly enjoyed being the 'Mango People' that time. The rooms are spacious enough; please remember you are in the midst of a large plantation and you'd find pests and cattle around. Don't be afraid; they mind their own business. There is a problem with the power supply though; they have to keep switching to the generator on and off; and it gets quite unpleasant and humid in the summers. Mornings and evenings were pleasant; before I forget they have a set of adorable dogs whom you are sure to miss for a day or two.....
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The higher rooms have a good view of the sea.

Review_Content: We chanced upon Mahua Bagh on tripadvisor; while searching for a quiet place to spend this new year’s eve at - away from partying hordes and reasonably close to drive to; from Mumbai. The hotel website made the property look inviting and we got a prompt reply to our online query. A little back and forth with the contact person got us a confirmed package (all meals inclusive) for 3 nights. We specifically asked for a ‘new’ room; based on tripadvisor reviews. It took us about 4 hours to drive down from Mumbai. We had been forewarned by Mahua Bagh and other tripadvisor reviewers about the ‘kachcha’ dirt track to approach Mahua Bagh; once we steered off the state highway after Mazgaon village. A rough; 1 kilometre-long-ride later; we were fetched by Sudeep – one of the smiling; eager to help staffers. The entrance is on a slope and is easy to miss. We noticed a lot of other guests needed help with locating the place; so a signpost along the dirt track will definitely help! Mahua Bagh has 6 cottages in a cascade on a small hillock and a large connected complex of 5 cottages on the ground level at the entrance to the property. We were shown 2 options of rooms to choose from the set of ground level cottages and we opted for room number 3; which had basic; vintage wooden furniture; a very noisy little fridge and no wardrobe. The bed-cover and curtains were a little grubby; but the rest of the bed linen; towels and blankets were fresh and spotlessly clean. A door at the end of the room opened into a delightful little open courtyard; through which we could access the airy bathroom which had lots of natural light. There was a sunken bath; moderately heated water from the solar heater; basic toiletries (1 sachet of shampoo and 1 small Lifebuoy soap). The toilet seat could do with fixing. On our second day there; we moved to room number 5; which had a nicer layout; was airier; brighter; had better furniture; a private sit-out and a charming open air rain shower; as well as a better bathroom. The simple; delicious meals here are served alfresco under the breezy shade of Alphonso mango trees and cooked home style. Lunch is a completely vegetarian affair and there is a chicken curry for dinner (on request). We were very disappointed that there was no sea food on offer; despite the property’s proximity to a fishing village and the coast. There are different dessert options in every meal like kheer; custard; rasgullas; gulab jamuns. The alu parathas at breakfast deserve a special mention – they are simply terrific. Eggs on request are also done well and tea time is great; with a robust ‘adrak’ chai and crisp potato-onion pakodas. We noticed a lot of recently planted coconut palms and some old mango trees; but didn’t come across any vegetable patches or fruit trees; though the website and staff claim the meals are cooked from fresh produce off the land. While Mahua Bagh is close to the coast; the beach nearby is rocky and you would need to drive up to Murud (20 minutes by car) for a rustic beach experience. The fishing boats across the creek from Mahua Bagh make interesting subjects for photography and in the stillness of the night; one can hear engines of fishing boats juddering out to sea to set out their nets. There is no TV and both the internet and mobile connectivity are dodgy. This works splendidly well if you are looking for a truly disconnected break and we did a lot of reading in the beautiful open verandahs or slung in the hammocks; since there isn’t much else to do. The electricity situation was well under control and we managed to keep our phones and tabs charged. The staff; particularly Michael; Sudeep and the manager Sheval Jain take special care to cater to all requests and the three super friendly dogs Gypsy; Jimmy and Jack kept us company. If you are looking for a property that is literally away from the madding crowd; this is it! We've rated this as 'very good' for the absolute tranquility and home style comfort; which this place offered.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Room number 3; 4 or 5 are among the newer rooms on the ground level and are better maintained.

Review_Title: “A very pleasant atmosphere! Nothing was too much trouble”
Review_Content: Mahua Bagh is a very interesting property it belongs to a very famous Bollywood Actor how use to live in this property but and has now decided to rent out it out as holiday rental. There are 4 very big private villas with have fantastic views...over the rolling hills with lots of mango trees. We actually decided to stay in the new cottage block built 3 yrs ago (there is a conference area; along with a total of 4/5 seperate cottages) We enjoyed relaxing on the balcony outside our cottage... the kids enjoyed playing on the swinging chair so did i! We also made friends with the two dogs that sleep in the shade of the balcony. My favourite part about Mahua Bagh was it was full of surprises we had lovely Diwali fireworks the kids even had a go at lighting the fireworks which were they thorughly enjoyed!!!! I think what made Mahua Bagh a great location was down to the staff in particular the Manager/Chef/staff we thought you were exceptional.... nothing was too much trouble very helpful indeed. The Manager would ask us everyday if we would like any prefered food for our evening meal ie fresh pomfret...everytime we returned from a trip one of the staff would ask if we would like any fresh snacks cooked and brought over to the balcony along with drinks for the kids. The manager and staff we also so helpful in directing us to the right place to go on our trips;;; and too beaches. I think without the fantastic staff there wouldnt be such a great atmosphere at Mahua Bagh and the staff seemed happy in their work!. I particually liked the outside dinning area alongside a very nice hammock placed amongst the shady trees my only concern is that i have three kids and there was only one hammock;;;; it was quite amusing to see three kids squashed in the hammock like peas in a pod!!! we are looking forward to returning again for the next Diwali break and thanks the staff for making this the most memorable enjoyable trip one we wont forget :) thanks everyone

If you have GPS reaching the place is easy; however it's only the case with Mapmyindia. Google maps will leave you stranded. Entry to the resort is a difficult drive but once there it's a beauty in itself. Lush green lawns spread with interspersed palm gives a warm welcome. The two dogs especially the great dane offer you another angle to happiness... The food is so home made and fresh and tasty and so congenially served. We reached pretty late as were delayed during the travel; but the gesture of the manager to call us up and confirm our lunch was quite warm...not to mention that had our lunch around 3:30pm. The morning walk through the forest with someone guiding us (the great dane) gave us such a comfort. The beach was so close which gave us easy access at our times..but was always guided with the limited people around.. Rooms were excellent and hats off to the service provided...homely and very happy..but sad as we missed the cottages right by the forest due to the monsoons...will visit many more times...

Mahua bagh is a tucked away property ... A little hard to find as they don't really have too many sign boards. The road leading to the property was actually no road indeed. Once we crossed the stone road and entered the property it was just breathtaking... A beautiful location covered with millions of mango trees and 4 rooms right at the entrance. They also have some other rooms a little further away; but due to the rains they were not functional.We stayed in one of the rooms right close to the entrance. The room was a pretty room though not very well maintained (moist walls). The washroom clean and big; with an open shower... Loved the way the rooms are constructed. You can see a million fireflies in the night which is good sight... Service: Brilliant!! The warmth of the staff and always eager to help attitude was amazing.. The service is very personal and every guest is treated well.Food: Home cooked; fresh and simply yummy ... The food is freshly cooked and served with warm chappatis at the time you want ... The property needs to be a bit well maintained structure wise; overall a good property to do just nothing....

Review_Title: “Good views; great access to the beach; simple and tasty food”
Review_Content: Mahua Bagh...we kept searching for the road signs and when we found the 1.5 km dirt road leading to the resort...we became sceptical. All of us prayed that the resort lives up to our basic expectations....and yes it definitely did. Daljeet Singh the manager was very hospitable; food was very good; rooms were nice and spacious. Absence of TV was a boon; lovely green surroundings; lots of mango trees; big vegetable farm; big lawns to walk around. Coming from Mumbai; this place felt like a dream....this is the kind of a home which each Mumbaikar aspires of. Ofcourse it didnt have AC throughout the day; ofcourse sometimes it took some time for our requests to be catered to; but ofcourse it provided it peace and tranquility. The access to the beach is another stunner...tucked away from prying eyes...leads directly onto the pretty secluded Nandgaon beach.......better to access this now before it falls prey like Kashid and Murud.Special mention abt the 2 dogs on the property........they were super. Had a great time playing with them.Location is very off the track; but thats the idea...........
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go for the big cottages at the top...provides the view of the sea and excellent breeze

Review_Content: The road to the hotel is no road. Its not more than a jungle track. You need a good car to reach there. The first impression was shocking and it did not get better after seeing the bungalows. Ripped Bed sheets; dirty rooms and very poor overall condition. After 10 Minutes we left this place again as it was not even 1 Rupie worth.The owner should invest a few rupies in the houses and rooms and should not only rely on the nature around.p.s. Never pay in advance !!

I would like to really thank each and every person at the Bagh for absolutely fantastic hospitality. We felt like were living in our own home. The food was fabulous and so beautifully laid; the surroundings of the bagh are very very nice. Mr Daljeet Singh did everything possible to make our stay absolutely fantastic and our two sons enjoyed the dogs immensely and still talk of gypsy and bono fondly. warmth from the staff was really felt and we felt completely at ease. Really whoever the owner si really should congratulate their staff for such wonderful service. We got milk for our baby when we wanted it the food was there at the time we required we got an auto arranged to go around the city; the generator was switched on through the night whenever the electricity went off. We had a great stay; thank you very much. The reason why it does not get a rating of 5 is that small things like the bathroom not having pegs was uncomfortable; also the fact that the particular room we stayed in could have been better done up. It suited us as we had kids who wanted to run around but a peep at the room beside showed better decor so this can also be touched up.......; its great value for the rate they charge...thanks once again antara sen dave and nitin dave
Room_Tips: Room Tip: describe the size like for us the large suited us as we had kids running around

Review_Content: This was my second stay at Mahua Bagh; the first was as part of the Natural History Society on a trip to Phansad. And it was an event to do with birding which got me to the park but it was the idea of a stay at Mahua Bagh again that had definitely has something to do with it as well! And to be there in a mango orchard; in the mango season sounded perfect!! It is a very comfortable stay and the rooms are cool; clean and spacious. Huge sliding doors and windows give a beautiful view. Having a separate room as dresser for all the bags and equipment keeps the room clutter free. The food too is amazing but still homely. We got to have mango in various form and perpetration. A sweet/spicey mango chuttney was just super. The chef is really excellent and the idea of using seasonal and locally available foods is refreshingly fresh!!It is a beautiful lush green orchard fairly large and very natural which adds to its beauty. In fact there could be very interesting walks and picnic spots in the orchard. We were told that there was a naturalist there on weekends who knows the area well and would accompany guests to the park or even in the property and tell about the natural flora and fona and bird life around - something which is much needed for the city dwellers!! I could hear the jungle foul when there and could also make out about the nocturnal visit of the wild boar in their organic vegetable patch. Highly recommended for all out door and nature lovers.

Review_Title: “good property but not so good hospitality ....”
Review_Content: its said ....\customer is next to god\"....but the management at Mahua Baug thinks otherwise...The property has good infrastructure with clean rooms and equally good food... Also the serving staff is co-operative but the owner's behaviour left us with bad taste in mouth.... In support of the above comment; would like to mention a few incidents like ...1. arrogant behaviour of owner by disturbing the serene silence of the nature with loud filmy music with no consideration for the guests privacy...2. since there were extra guests than capacity; we were asked to provide the sofa from our room while we were enjoying dinner...3. ohh yes....we were also asked to accomodate two guests in our family room...as there was shortage of space... 4. We were also requested to use A/C preferably while sleeping only; though the room tarrif included A/c."

When our carefully crafted plan for a weekend family-getaway to Diveagar went haywire at the very last minute (literally!); we turned to Mahua Bagh and boy did we love it there! I had heard about Mahua Bagh straight from the horse's mouth; the owners Mr. and Mrs. Singh; during my stay at their Mahua Vann property at Pench National park earlier this year. They described it as a quaint little Mango Orchard nestled amidst the Nandgaon hills on one side and the mighty Arabian Sea on the other. True to their words; I found this place simple yet amazing.The property is situated about 13kms from the oh-so-popular Kashid beach. When driving from North i.e. Kashid to Murud; watch out for roadside signs for Mahua Bagh. When you arrive at the T (rather a K) junction roughly 4kms after crossing Nandgaon village; take the road which looks more beaten up (yes I have tried them both and yes it was a real pain both times). About 1.5kms of bumpy ride and you will be at Mahua Bagh; not at all friendly to your eco-sensitive Prius. The property is divided into 2 clusters of suites. The newer cluster has about 3-4 suites equipped with modern amenities whereas the old one has 6 larger rooms built in a cascading fashion and with an ethnic finish. I was there with my family (8 people right from the age of 3 to 63) and were put up in the older rooms. The rooms are spacious; painted white from inside and the upholstry matches the theme. There are parts where their age becomes obvious though (like bath fittings; noisy extra bed and withered drapes to name a few) These rooms have a direct access to the two levels of lawn and plantation (the newer rooms don't). Lunch; dinner and breakfast is served on this lawn in a buffet. You can relax on the vintage chairs in the lawn or go for a stroll along the mango plantation. My favorite place was the sit-out under the foliage right at the top of the cascade of the rooms which gives you a great view of the property. And the stairs leading to it is a great place for a family portrait. For those travelling with kids; the hammocks and the pet dogs will surely keep the kids occupied. To sum it up; Mahua Bagh is like a home we all dream of. It has a perfect blend of nature and luxury; and is a perfect backdrop for those long lasting memories. And remember; its a farm living experience i.e. simple living. Don't expect extravagant luxury for your money.

Hello; this hotel is well located on the city road to main market and very close to mansa devi temple and har-ki-paudi; its a budget hotel with simple but good neat and clean interiors and spacious rooms; the room service is also good according to the standard of this hotel; the food quality is also good; and there are many good restaurants near to this place on the main road; for any other details needed for the area or site visits the owner mr B M Sharma; is very helpful for the same; rest the other staffs are also very polite and courteous for any of your needs; as this place is on the main road you can find all your needs very easily; like shopping; travel agents office; snacks; dhabas; medical stores; tea stalls ETC. overall this place is decent enough to stay for few days as for the value of the money...
Room_Tips: Room Tip: the rooms on the first floor are good; and prefer room with the balcony..

Review_Content: Hi; I am from Kolkata. I went to Haridwar for the 1st time with my family members and I stayed for 3 nights. I took 2 rooms and they are exactly the same as it is given in the photos here in this site.The staffs behavior is also very good. Before booking I was a bit scared because in a review I read that it is a student mess type hotel; extremely crowded with students. But after reaching there I found absolutely false. The staffs are good behaved and genuinely honest; by mistake I left a small hand baggage in the wardrobe with an Ek mukhi Rudraksh; chain and money inside it; but after calling them they said they will check the room for it. Latter they informed they have found it and everything is intact in it. Then they asked for my home address and they couriered it to me and not only this they did the packing so nicely; I was just amassed. They didn't even agreed to take the courier charges. Sonu Ji; a person from hotel's management replied \ Athithi Devo Bhava; we can't take money for this thing. It's our pleasure that we got the chance to serve you \" So you people can trust in my review and can book this hotel. I would request all the users to write a genuine reviews for the hotels you are staying. This will help us to select a proper hotel."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: You can book any room.

Review_Content: Stayed during Aug-14. Got discount due to Off Season Rates negotiable; (got AC room for 800) particularly during week days only. On Holidays and Festival Season; including Sundays/Saturdays; rates are normally high everywhere around these places. Sometimes; very hard to get good hotels. Rooms are neat and Services are also up-to the expectation. Only problem is that it do not have parking lot for vehicles. But Location-wise; it is ideal (Rly Stn & Har-ki-Pauri are about 1.5 km).
Room_Tips: Room Tip: AC Rooms are better.

Review_Content: I booked one AC room @1600/- for three adult for one Night through Phone on reviewing the comments on this very page. I must inform you all that they do not have parking facility; in the morning you will find pigeon \beet\" on the car roof top; and service boy will demand money for cleaning it. Secondly; their AC was not in working order; on my complaint in the night I was told it is due to light fluctuation and every thing will be functional after midnight. We had to pass our night under fan and we was forced to pay AC room rent. So; I do not recommend this Hotel; there is no 2-star type facility at all; and entrance is from narrow street; off course; management staff speak softly. Not value for your hard earned money"
Room_Tips: Room Tip: On first Floor Room No-12 is small and not worth for the money; rest are on second floor I used 14 w...

Review_Title: “An affordable luxury in the heart of buzzing city; with lion hearted people ta your back and call.”
Review_Content: I went to Haridwar in the first weak of this month with my family members from Mumbai by the so called SUPER EXPRESS which has been assembled from the discarded rest while coaches of Rajdhani express; hence despite high fares lack facilities. The train has no proper arrangement for catering or any service.Any after reading some remarks in Trip Advisor and after my old acquaintance I landed in the Hotel .there was warmth in the reception of the guests;and the curtesy extended by the reception staff was so overwhelming that we had just to utter the plan and the solution was presented forthwith. It was the busy period of NAVRATRI ;the hotels; the roads; were choke a block by people from all corners of India; still because of the managerial skills of Mr. Brig Mohan Sharma ; the manager of the hotel we could complete our YATRA of Shri BADRINATH DHAM without any problem despite Natural calamities faced by UTTARAKHAND STATE this year.. Such People and such hotels are the real ambassadors of goodwill of the state .

This hotel is centrally located and all the important places such as railway station; Har ki Pauri; Main Bazaar and Mansa Devi Temple are located within a radius of 1 km.We were shocked to hear from reception executive that our booking was received from travelguru just a day before our arrival even if we booked our stay a month before. Hence; all the rooms of our category were full. But hotel staff/management upgraded our room category and provided us the room immediately.Rooms were kept neat and clean (specially bathroom). Only problem with this hotel was privacy as one could hear the noise of other guests as well as hotel staff moving on the corridor. Otherwise; this hotel is good and recommended to all the budget travelers.

Review_Title: “Terrible hotel more like a student's hostel”
Review_Content: I booked this hotel from Cleartrip and the pictures were really impressive on the website; but when we reached the hotel there was a huge queue of young men from the front stairs who were checking out. There were a huge number of people staying in the hotel who had come for some professional exams and sharing rooms as 8-10 person per room. The hotel looked more like a boy's hostel than a tourist hotel and I was traveling with my family. There were other rooms too which were used for some type daily tuition classes with students coming in regularly through the day. No hot water in the baths with the room service boy carrying buckets of hot water on request. The room conditions were also pretty average.

Mid Town is a Good Hotel; really it is located in Mid of the town; at Maharishi Balmiki Chowk; Rooms are neat and clean; and very spacious; staff is very co operating; Fooding is also so; so; but you have lots of other option; as it is in the main market area ; you will get lots of Hotels; Restaurent near by. In my my openion; it is a good Hotel and Value for money.

The hotel is ideally located. Railway station; many of the attractions; eateries; market place are within walking distances. The rooms are spacious and clean. However; the rooms are without any view and windows are better kept closed.The staff are very helpful but not the management. One has to rely on the room attendant for information on sightseeing; etc. The food is okay but there are several restaurants outside which are cheaper and offers variety. However; the attendant was very helpful and arranged for milk; non - spicy Maggi etc for our children. There are many tour operators in the near vicinity who offer tour services at a very reasonable price. We felt a little uncomfortable since there was no other family on our floor and groups of boys were staying who were very loud and noisy.

Review_Title: “Excellent place of stay in the heart of Haridwar - Vijay Kumar Bhatia; Delhi”
Review_Content: I had been to Haridwar last month and stayed in this Hotel. It was a wonderful experience of staying in this Hotel. The maintenance of the rooms are really excellent - clean and well-maintained - and gives a feeling of a starred Hotel. The behaviour of attending staff and room-boys are really appealing. Even the food being served at Hotel is very hygienic The Hotel is placed at a very convenient place - very near to Har Ki Paudi; Mansa Devi roapway and moreover near Railway Station as well as Inter-state Bus Stand. The Hotel is situated within the market area. It is so well-known Hotel that even Rickshaw-wallah or auto wallah can drop you at the Hotel. Really really a wonderful place to stay and worth recommending others to stay during visit to Haridwar........

First and most importantly this Hotel is close to all!!!! Railway; Ghat; Mansa Devi; Bazaar etc..... Hotel can also provide you with your own personal Taxi service. Hotel staff is very knowledgeable and professional. I felt like I was at Home. Food was Excellent as well. You don't have to look far to get a Excellent service!!!! Midtown Hotel has it all. It was a wonderful experience staying at this Hotel I love to stay here with my family; and we had always a wonderful time there. Highly recommended hotel!!!!

Check authenticity of other reviews. I needed a one night stay nr the station for my 6am train. I wish I had slept at the station - it would have been nicer. Hotel is not that close anyway and is in a very bad alleyway.No shower - broken. Toilet broken. Had to change rooms due to dirty bathroom. Very very noisy from other guests who keep doors open or sit in corridor.Extra charge for my 2nd room. 3 times people entered my room while I was inside.... had to lock doors.A terrible experience.

I was little apprehensive initially to be booking a hotel room only by reading the reviews etc (as I was travelling with my mother); but to my surprise (and relief!!) MidTown turned out to be quite nice. It is very economical; rooms are big; carpeted and clean (see pics). Only the cable TV was not working but it didn’t matter to us because we were already too tired at the end of the day to be watching the TV. The staff was very courteous and helpful. The location is also good (>1km from the rail station). We didn’t order anything from the kitchen so can't comment on the food. Definitely I can recommend this place to anyone and everyone without any hesitation.

I have visited Haridwar many times and stayed in many hotels but this time Mr. Sumit Nath of Himgiri Plastics arrange for my stay at Hotel Midtown. Firstly; the location of hotel impressed me. It is centrally located; in the heart of the city very near to famous Har ki Paudi. The room was spacious; neat & tidy. Overall ambience is excellent. The hotel staff was friendly & very helpful. Last but not least to mention; the Food. Food was tasty & homely. Don't forget to have the special Dal & Tawa Roti.

Location of Hotel is good. The rooms are good and the cleanliness is good. Rooms had all the amenities.. The service provided was good and the staff was also good. Only we didnot get warm water when we needed as they had their own timings for providing warm water.. Over all good value..

Me along with my family has visited in this hotel in the month of September 2012; the service and the staff members are very understanding with the requirement of the guest. My personal experience about this hotel is very excellent.( Rahul Kumar; Himachal Pradesh.)

Very good service with good food(veg). Neat and clean room;centrally located ;easy to locate;homely atmosphere;good value for money;rent is quite reasonable.This was my first stay at Midtown hotel and I am sure I would like to stay again in my next trip.I was on the way to Srinagar(Garhwal) to attend a personal function and stayed only one night but it was quite memorable.I could visit the temples and the ghats in Ganges which is so near

Hotel Midtown in Haridwar; Uttarakhand is ideal for pilgrims who value quality services. The Hotel offers you comfortable stay; sumptuous and hygienic food. The guests regal in the genuine warmth of the staff who value their clients and serve them in their humble might in the best possible manner. Being centrally located; Midtown is ideal for Ganga devotees. Of course; the Hotel is devoid of unnecessary frills as offered by many luxury Hotels but its definitely worth the Money. I have had a memorable experience and will always come back to this Hotel again.

I am a regular traveller and every time i stay at Mid Town in Haridwar to explore new destinations. Haridwar is a gateway to many many place to explore;where as most people go only for the \holy snan\" in the sacred Ganga.Stayed for many times for last many years ; Wether we had gone for the Tungnath Yatra at Chopta; or gone to Massourie or Pauri Gharwal ; Himkund Sahib or Badrinath ; pilgrimage to Kedar nath or trekked to Valley of flowers Every time we began our journey from New Delhi. First stop at HARIDWAR always put up in The MidTown Hotel. I had always stayed with my family; the rooms are good; and we had always wonderful time there.The rooms are spacious and clean; few are typical inner design.The location of the property is great very close to the station. The bazaar is beautiful;many famous eat out points and the ghat and the river Ganga is very close to this hotel. There is a space of parking in street of hotel . There is a provision of driver room at the property. The property is well maintained; well looked at the centre of the city. the staff did all they could to ensure our commute with in and outside City - right from sending bottles of water on our arrival or hot tea every time we return back to hotel after tiring local walks. also tasty Vegetarian food on demand. The Staff very helpful; nice. The greatest thing about this hotel is the location! It feels at home every thing is available with in 2 minutes walk whether it is early morning breakfast or late night hot milk of traditional KULLAR. It was a wonderful experience staying at the property.; 'THE' best way to experience Haridwar.I love to stay here with my family; and we had always a wonderful time there.All in all a good stay; and a good staff. Highly recommended.A special thanks to Mr. Sonu Haryani and every body who made our stay so special.Thanks again ;we will certainly be back.Highly recommended !!"

i just came back to dubai from hardwar ; and we stayed in hotel midtown for 2 weeks ( good budgeted hotel ) ; the best part of this hotel is ; it is in the middle of the city everything is stone throw away ; very homely atmosphere ; staff is very freindly . good food ( food if you want anything from outside restaurent they will arrange that also with no extra cost ) ; power backup ; travel desk ; railway reservations .....;you name it they will arrange it with ; i recommend if anybody planning to visit hardwar stay in midtown hotel

Review_Title: “Budget hotel with clean rooms; excellent service with lip smacking vegetarian food”
Review_Content: Going to Hardwar with the family almost every other year to take a dip in the ganges and for last 10 years we have been stating in Hotel Midtown. What I like about this place is; its very conveniently situated. You can take your car right up to the hotel (it has its own parking with their guards; which is luxury in Hardwar close to Har ki Paudi. Most other hotels ask you to park in general parking and once somebody stole my car stereo from this general parking) and yet you are just one minute away from ganges. Its a very good budget hotel. You get clean rooms for the price you pay. But what I really like about the place is great food. If you are not looking for a swimming pool with a spa then this is the place to go. And by the way if you are looking for a swimming pool; then whats the point going to River Ganges.Great place and I absolutely recommend it.

Review_Title: “I came with my family and i really loved the service over here... It was a real nice experience”
Review_Content: We stayed in this hotel for two days and trust me it was a real nice experience to have.... We stayed in the A.C room that we got at a much affordable price of Rs. 950. The room was well embedded with all the things of need as well as luxury....on top of that the service was damn good...whatever we needed was just a phone call away...The hotel staff was really very good...they were well at their hospitality...The location of this hotel is very much accessible (1/2 kms from railway station and harkipauri is also the same distance away).....trust me guys its saves a lot of money..There is also a travel desk integrated in the hotel which provides a real ease to the travellers....Altogether it was a real nice experience staying in this hotel....

Review_Title: “not at all worth the money they are charging”
Review_Content: we went for our baby's mundan and were told that midtown is gud hotel. my baby was 7 months old and they did not had evenhad hot water for her bath. we had to ask for 1 hot water bucket from the staff. food is gud here but the chrges they are charging are much too high as per luxury. cleaniness is not upto the mark. beds are is very bad form and pillows very dirty. i wud not recommend this hotel at all if u are looking for some gud and luxurious place to stay and hv gud vacations. and staff is also not that gud so i wud say a NO to it.

The Hotel is ride of about 15 minutes from the Rourkela station and is located in a scenic set up right at the heart of the city. The Indira Gandhi park is located right in front of it and if one accesses the roof of the hotel; the view of the surrounding valleys is nice.Myself and a group of my friends had stayed in this hotel for a day. The rooms were OK and hygiene at acceptable levels for the price. Room service was average. Considering that the stay in this hotel is of a low budget one; the returns from the stay are not much.If you are planning to visit the city for a day or two and looking for a cheap accommodation; this is a decent option.

Yes; unforgettable in a very bad way. They have complementary breakfast for Rs. 200 but have a strange way of billing. Make sure you check how it has been calculated. Its not a big amount but its a matter of principle.This place is appalling; I hope I don't go to a worse hotel.

Situated in a picturesque surrounding; I always enjoy my stay here. Well appointed rooms and tasty food are its forte. Wash-rooms are OK; but there is scope for improvement. Room Service is good; but should improve. The tariff is quite moderate; for an Industrial City and I will definitely recommend this Hotel for individuals as well as families. Ample car parking area is another advantage.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: You are likely to enjoy the suites in the independent building; in the front.

Review_Content: The hotel is located right in middle of the city next to Indira Gandhi Park. I had gone to Rourkela to attend a business seminar and stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights. The hotel is more like a low budget lodge and the rooms were of very quality.There were roaches in my room and the glass in which water was served wasn't even clean. The bed was hard and I didn't mind that. I switched to Mayfair hotel after a couple of nights. Mayfair is far on the outskirts of the city but definitely much more comfortable and seemed heaven when compared to Panthnivas.

Review_Title: “Awesome place to stay in PANTHANIVAS- Rourkela”
Review_Content: I went for a wedding to rourkela and was made to stay at the hotel. In the morning I woke up to see some wonderful scenery. Hills and wonderful about everything. The hotel belonged to the OTDC Govt. or Odisha sposored agency. I find this hotel to be one of the best in the state to stay for an outing. Rourkela surrounded by beautiful places like Darjeeng; Rajgangpur; Pitamahal; Ushakothi; etc add to the importance of Rourkela as one of tourist hot-spots of the state. If tourism in these areas is developed in a planned manner then it would emerge as one of the best tourist places. And about the hotel I liked everything about it. And that made me even ignore the small improvements needed in it. The staff as should be are decent and educated. Cuisine is also liked by me.
this is an excellent place to live in ;a lot of greenery good air with a feel of freshness.
