I always prefer to stay at Panthanivas during my travel in Orissa. Value for Money. It was a nice experience at Panthanivas ; Rourkela also.

the service has been par excellence.all thnks to raj bhai for being so friendly and cooperative.it has become a secnd home after nit.nottyy rocks.i enjoyed with my friends as well as a couple.more offfers should be placed to attract more customers

Review_Title: “Clean; well located; Apt service and value for money.”
Review_Content: I had been here for a day. The hotel is neat and clean and food is good. The Main USP is its location. Its walkable from the railway station. Has all the basic aminities. i would have Given a 5 star but the four star is because the hotel is very old and rooms are renovated but not up to mark. there a few eliments which if renovated would be a bang on hotel to stay. Still it is a very good value for money hotel for Business and family. One thing i would like to recognize is the staffs are very courtious and the room service is very prompt and right on time.Overall it was a good experiance.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Please renovate your rooms aptly.

Review_Content: A combo of serene environment along with the best cuisines and of course the best hospitality in any of the hotels/restaurants anyone will ever get in rourkela..!!The pub is too good with best staffs and services..!!Whether be a party or business meeting; this place has it all... !!Just one word for this place -- awesome. :)

Review_Title: “great service and awsome place to be”
Review_Content: the restaurant and to be specific the bar is the highlight of the place. so if u need a place to get to really worthy of what you pay its the place to be. special mentions bar manager; mr. raj. thanks bro. u and your staff are really the best one can expect. so in a nutshell; its surely a place to be to get drunk and even otherwise. :P

very clean &worth hotel in center of city.the room are enough long;quick respose of hotel staff & supportive.if you going to travel full day need to keep beloing and need place rest then this hotel.service is very excellent.we well come back again.

this hotel is growing towards best hospitality . This is my 3rd visit to this hotel this year and i found every staff and management is running towards best hospitality . This time i have g8 satisfaction with housekeeping ; excellent cleaning and service . Bathroom supply ; linen are nit and clean .My wife was very particular about cleanliness ; she was very happy with housekeeping service and morning breakfast . this time lot of change with breakfast menu & regular change of south Indian ; idle & utapam etc . cut fruits are very fresh and good quality .  Hotel has developed a small garden in front of hotel looks beautiful .As we are visited during festival time ; hotel was looking excellent . I am surprised after my check out a sms & a mail of thanks came to my mail and mobile . Good customer care . good development ; we will come back again .
Room_Tips: Room Tip: all rooms are beautiful . But i like to recommend super deluxe room . It is a inter connected roo...

Review_Content: Just what a business traveller would look for- comfort! Yes; Radhika Regency provides you all the comfort of a perfectly clean room; a nice bed; good food and smiling staff catering to all your needs. Situated at a stone throw distance from railway station; the free cab service provided by the hotel for pick up-drop is an added comfort for late trains. The rooms; even basic ones are very spacious and very neat and clean. The furniture look slightly worn out but very much acceptable. The washroom was perfectly clean with good fittings and wide range of toiletries. Complimentary breakfast was delicious with variety of platters and very helpful staff looking after it. In a whole; it was a really nice experience especially for a single lady on a official trip and I look forward to my next visit.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: higher floor rooms preferred

Review_Content: Very nice hotel. Just at walking distance from hotel. Food quality is also very good. Rooms are also very spacious. Overall very good experience at hotel. During check out; I was late for my train; they have provided quick cab; which has helped me to take the train.I recommend this hotel.

Review_Title: “Radhika a name for Quality and Courteousness”
Review_Content: In a very small Place they are providing great service. Staff is helping and they have many options in food ......... ready to serve you at anytime with best of their ability.....If you are there for long time you can try 7PM thali as well cheap and best.

Review_Title: “A PERFECT example of a Great Hotel”
Review_Content: I was on a business trip to Rourkela. I stayed in Radhika Regency for more than a month. Without any doubt; i can say that it is one of the Best Hotel.Rooms are great; Food is excellent; Service is good...Overall its awesome.It's a value for money hotel.

This is simply the best place in the town!! I along with our friends are regulars and simply keep coming back.beginning from frequent casual visits to organising big parties; this place perfectly caters all our needs. the hospitality is simply awesome. The restaurant is great great food also great value for money.the bar is the best in town; the bar manager Raaj is quite friendly also all the other staff. overall the experience is awesome.we will continue to visit the place as many times possible.

Review_Title: “Radhika a name for Quality; Class and Courteousness”
Review_Content: The hospitality rendered by Radhika Regency collective was excellent. We had a very pleasant stay (me and my family) at Radhika. The room; decor; service and food was quality and class. From Railway station pick up to check in to Wi Fi to complementary break fast and finally checking out; the proficiency shown by the staff is exemplary. My association with Radhika dates back to early nineties and it remains my favourite place of stay at Rourkela. I wish them the very best in all their endevours.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Corner suites are large and sunny.

Review_Title: “Perfection is the word for Customer Service at Radhika Regency”
Review_Content: Myself with myy collegae had visited Rourkela for a short san of 3 nights 3 days and we had booked the rroms at Radhika Regency as we had got a good feedback from our counterparts; to be frannk the services; courteousness; warm homely atmosphere in rooms and all at Radhika Regency were much beyond are expectation. It was one of the best hotels I have visited till date; surely recommended for stay if you visit Rourkela and for myself mine is the fixed stay over there when ever I visit Rourkela.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Any room you select is going to excel your expectations.

Review_Content: I was on a business trip to Rourkela and was booked in Radhika Regency. I checked in on 20 Jul 14; Sunday afternoon and checked out on 21 Jul 14; Monday late evening. I stayed there last time a few years ago. The hotel under new management has improved a lot. I was thrilled to discover new Radhika. Starting with complementary car pick-up from the railway station; fast check-in; staying in a well furnished room; complementary Wi-Fi and breakfast; quick check-out and finally car drop at station - a wonderful experience in totality. They have a very good restaurant for lunch and dinner. They also have a nice restaurant for vegetarian snack foods. I really enjoyed my stay at Radhika and look forward to visit again.

It's a value for money hotel in the industrial town of Rourkela. Located very close to the railway station ; steel plant and main market place. They have the facility of complementary pickup and drop from the station. The best part is checkout time is 24 hrs from check in. Complementary breakfast is good. Staffs are good . Overall a decent hotel.

Radhika regency is one of the top most hotels in Rourkela. The rooms are spick and span and extremely comfortable. They are no less than a 5 star hotel rooms.They have a bar called cloud 9. The bar has offers on drinks all round the year. It is a great value for money. Hookah is also served here. Mr. Rajnikant who is in charge of the bar does a great job. He is very friendly and amicable and makes the guests feel at home. He caters to all needs of people and makes sure that they are satisfied always. Other staff members like Mr. Sujit; Mr. Sudhir; Mr. Manoj etc. provide absolutely amazing service. If you are in the mood for some hookahs be sure to ask Mr. Sujit to make it. He makes awesome hookahs. Apart from the bar; they have a family restaurant called Nottee. The ambience there is also great.The hotel boasts of two conference centres where parties are also organized. There is one party area called DJ adda where parties take place regularly. Overall I would rate this hotel 5 on 5 especially for the amazing service here.

had a nice stay at radhika regency. excellent staff service especially by raj bhai. rooms are spacious with all facilities. food is awesome with variety of cuisine. moreover had a pleasant experience of the lounge. cloud 9 has very nice ambiance with all kinds of malts and beverages available. staff was managed very nicely. i am very happy with service and support extended by mr. raj(manager). i would recommend everybody to book this place for a pleasant stay.

Rooms are big enough and maintained neat and well. Restaurant is also good with all types of food. the service is provided with smile which makes much more happier. the rate is also much more acceptable. Internet is wifi and its ok.--Gokul

Actually i am a regular visitor to Rourkela . This is my third visit to this property & i love to stay with professionals . This Hotel is improving a lot ; every time i found something better than before .They have nice Bar CLOUD 9 ; first time i enter to a Bar in Rourkela and surprised there was no place to seat ; totally crowded . Young leadies and jents are fulled . They have a nice lounge bar and i found most of the time it reserved for guest . Excellent snacks preparation ; I had ordered for prawn masala ; excellent taste . pomfret ; lobster & crabes available all time . Nice food preparation recently they have started MatiHandi Mutton & Matihandi Dum Biryani . Have not tasted this type of food in my life ; lovely taste & quantity . If you ordered one Biryani no need to order anything else . I am surprised to see the Restaurant crowed ; I have stayed 3 days & every time i found restaurant is packed . I had asked to FOM Mr.Khan what is the occupancy rate . surprised Radhika is running 70 % occupancy . I agreed because location is the adventage & professional staff taking care of each and every guest properly . I really love to stay this place . It is my 2nd Home even I feel best Hotel i ever stayed .
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Does not matter which room you stay . But service is excellent .

Review_Content: It is a good hotel which provided comfortable stay to me during my last visit to Rourkela.It ishardly 5/10 mts walk from the Railway station which is a locational advantage to visitors.The rooms have been done with in the recent past and are in good condition.Service was alsoprompt & the staff were all very courteous.In fact when I phoned Room Service to place order for my breakfast;I was very politely told to come to Restaurant and take complimentary buffet breakfast which I found to be reasonably good.My over-all experience of 2 days' stay wasvery good.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: I stayed on the 3rd floor in the first room next to lift which was a suit room and very good.

Review_Content: This is one of the 2 best hotels I have stayed in India (another one is Shamrock hotel in Raipur).At 2000 INR per night; you cannot imagine anything else.Complimentary food coupons; excellent food quality; great hospitality for Indian standards; clean modern comfortable rooms; bathroom amenities of great quality; gym; complimentary breakfast with ample options; free wifi; tea/coffee making facilities and convenient location (just 5 min from Rourkela Steel Plant).This hotel exceeded my expectations. Stay here without slightest doubt.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: I guess all the rooms are great!

Review_Content: Hi friend's I suggest you that do any type function;Program;Meeting in HOTEL RADHIKA REGENCY because I have recently do a meeting in this hotel the service they Provide;Food quality and arrangement every thing is excellent as compare any other hotel.I personally thanks to Mr SUDARSAN BARIK(Asst F & B Manager;7205097773) who arrange everything very well.Friends Contact this person for getting best service in HOTEL RADHIKA REGENCY.

Review_Title: “Would like to stay again with you...”
Review_Content: Had a wonderful stay. Great and reasonably priced food. Nice accommodation. Superlative service. Even Wi-fi speeds were excellent. Overall a great experience. I would like to stay there as often as I can.

Very near to Railway station; I never thought I will land in such a good hotel near Railway Station. Excellent location on Main Road of Rourkela; Staff is always caring and listens to your needs. Hospitality of high standards. Rooms are neatly done; well maintained and cleanliness is given due importance.Food is awesome; I had wonderful experience of Non-veg food; along with one of the best \Pineapple Raita\" of my life!!! Hotel has got good spa and massage facility also. Best place to stay in Rourkela!"

This property is nearest good property to rourkela railway station. you can easily walk down or take a rickshaw. Rooms are nice well maintained; clean; Rooms are quite Big as well. Breakfast & other food was good; but the quantity was not enough.Once you take one item & if you need the same item again you need to wait for some time. At least it happened with me. Staff at Service are not much well trained.

Excellent choice if you are visiting Rourkela for a couple of days. The rooms are spacious and clean. The service is prompt and the hotel staff is extremely courteous. The food is also very good. Simply excellent..

Review_Title: “excellent rooms within budget near railway station”
Review_Content: This is a very good property near rourkela railway station. services are very impressive compare to other options here. breakfast and other foods are good. rooms are sufficiently furnished. economy rooms are having window AC which not a comfortable one. upgraded my stay there in deluxe room and found a good sleep. large LED with one another LCD there in the room with moderate sofa. value for money.

I had visited this property in Nov-13 . I can not believe this property has developed so well . People are same but the standard of service developed . From station i found driver with white uniform & nice placard stand to receive me . Instead of small car it was innova . When i entered to reception staff welcome me with welcome drinks and wet towel . warm welcome with friendly speaking staff & important think is way they speak and the way the escort me to my room . This time it was elaborate breakfast menu & restaurant was decorated well with new crockery & cutlery . Restaurant staff are also found more caring ; suggestive and friendly than before . Taste of food was also better than before . In my dinner i had ordered Fish fry ; it was excellent and first time i had such a nice fish fry .  Over all this time hotel was developed all the way . I was surprised and asked to a Captain Mr.Ajit Pradhan ; what is the secret of this change \ he told me it was due to good professional management & continuous practical training and staff motivation .  I love to continue with Radhika Regency . Keep it up ."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: I had stayed in a Deluxe room in 2nd floor .

Review_Content: Stayed two nights with this Hotel on 12th and 13th March 2014. Food and breakfast were very good. The restaurant requires additional people to serve efficiently. Ms. S. Sahu who was at the restaurant at Breakfast & Dinner Time needs to appreciated for her good work. Rooms and toilet were clean.High time Hotel installs a water treatment plant as the water smells of Iron. But the Hotel is value for money.B R Swaminathan
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Rooms on the 3rd Floor - in the middle are good

Review_Content: Good things first: Decent rooms and hotel is located near Rourkela Station and very close to Rourkela Steel Plant. This is one of the two-three hotels in the area that you should stay if you are for business at the Steel Plant. The stay is more economical than Regency Hotel which is very close.Bad: Bad food and chaotic access to reach the hotel. It is located in the Main Market of the city.

This is one of the best hotels in Rourkela; who needs Mayfair when you have Radhika and its arch rival Central Park. Located in the heart of Rourkela; very close to the station it is an excellent choice for a business trip. Almost all companies prefer this over Mayfair due to its proximity to the main hub of the city.

centrally Located - Walking distance from railway station.Room are really good in this price range.You get all type foods and taste is also good.Hotel team is very energetic and service minded.Rooms are spacious.

It is the best hotel in Rourkela for business trip . Location wise good next to Railway station & near to Bus stop . Rooms are quite spacious and cleaned . Spacious bathroom and individual hot water system . So many out late for food . 7 am restaurant for all verity of food ; south indian; marwari; jain food; Chinese & chart with a huge sweet counter . excellent internet connection facility good speed ; which we need for business trip . they have a small but healthy GYM . Good morning buffet breakfast a combination of indian; American & continental . Good friendly staff .  I will back again .
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Deluxe room with king size bed

Review_Content: Hotel is located in close proximity to Rourkela Railway Station and is also near to Main Market. Food in general OK but a bit spicy. Room service is good.No hard mattress so spongy bed is a letdown. Room size & Cleanliness is OK. No swimming pool & the area around hotel is a bit cramped.

good place to stay; centrally located and having connection to all the places. top of it a nice energetic team cares for all the needthe food quality is excellentthe location of this place is areal for business trip as well as to get in in odd hours as its proximity to railways station

We stayed in Radhika Regency for 3 days and from railway station pick up to check out it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel has a good gym; nice bar; ok children's play zone etc.Getting inside the room; Large room with a good space; one of the largest bathrooms that i have seen in hotels. Very clean & well maintained. The house keeping was very helpful & friendly. Breakfast spread is not great but good enough. Food & service in restaurant id good. The bar provides excellent service & nice Ambiance. The car park area is unique with a car jutting out through the wall and each wall having a model of a gun with name & basic specification. Considering this being a small industrial city; the facility & service offered is excellent. We are planning to go back again to this hotel.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Rooms at lower levels do not have good view due to adjoining buildings; so ask for higher floors. Th...

Review_Content: Advantage of this hotel is that it is very near to railway; preferable location for those who are having break journey at rourkela.one more plus point is pickup and dropping for railway stationambience is ok. Drawbacks are food is not that good

FOOD is good and decoration is perfect and station is nearby 5mins. It was great to have special packing for our trains. Restaurant is perfectly design and have many types of cutlery models gun models etc; A.C is fine.

I have been to Rourkela several times but my stay this time was very satisfying. For the first time; I stayed in this hotel. I was accompanied by two colleagues and arrived from Barbil in the morning. The hotel arranged for a car for the day very quickly. We took a small bite which was quite tasty. The rooms were quite spacious and clean. It had complementary mineral water & tea maker.Returning from work; we had some snacks in their restaurant on the other side of the sideway. Before returning to our rooms; we went to a children's play area and healthcare zone where they have a fish spa. This was quite unique for a small town like Rourkela.For dinner; we went to another restaurant of the hotel serving mainly snacks. To our pleasant surprise; we found a large variety of dosa. We chose different varieties and enjoyed the good taste of the dosas served.The breakfast spread was also reasonable but perhaps there was room for betterment. The staff members were very attentive. Overall; it was a satisfying experience.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: It is better to have rooms in the lower floor as we experienced non working of lift

Review_Content: Me and my friend were passing through Rourkela and had to wait for our connecting train which was 2 hours away.As we always like a tipple while on a trip we went down to the Cloud 9 bar of this hotel;highly recommend this place for a drink.3 beers and a biriyani will set you back by Rs.800.Good service and pleasant staff but place is dimly lit though.

A REALLY GOOD HOTEL WITH SATISFACTORY SERVICES IN ALL RESPECT..Food quality is very good..co-operative staffs..neat and clean spacious rooms...very near to station..for business purpose this hotel it is one of the best cost effective hotel..

Review_Title: “It will be a good idea to spend the weekends in Radhika regency”
Review_Content: Radhika regency a three starred hotel in the vicinity of railway station ; and you don’t need to take any pain to search for it ; there is a counter just inside the railway station to contact the hotel for accommodation. A lot of rooms are there with a well managed theme based parking space .There is gaming zone which include bowling; video games and many other such games . Pedicure (fish) also available. Excellent food ;good taste ;comfortable cozy beds ; well behaved and organized staffs altogether they make a memorable stay at Rourkela the steel city which don't have many options .Moreover It will be a good idea to spend the weekends in Radhika regency with your kids . The nearby places are Hanuman batika ; Bedabyas ; IG park and Mandira dam .

Just very close to Rourkela Railway Station. 3 min walkable. Neat and clean spacious room. Good helpful staff. Good choices in breakfast table !!The bar is also spacious and well decorated.AC room is must for most of the season.Best in all respect considering other local options.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Better to book in advance.

Review_Content: Rourkela being a small town doesn't really pose big challenges in terms of connectivity. But; this hotel is located right in middle of the city and a small stroll from the Railway Station. Rooms are decent and food is alright. The parking at the basement is a little cramped and might require some good driving skills to park the car.

I visited there on my business tour. Its Good hotel to stay food is good. staff behavior is average. Hotel have internet faculty but if you want to use it they will refuse you and asked you go out side. overall good hotel to stay there.

Happened to stay there twice last year as part of business trip.. Very nice supporting staff. Food was excellent . Everything was on time . They have very good infrastructure All services are excellent .. Would recommend to anyone

The first thing when we noticed as we got off the train and outside the station was that the Radhika Regency had a small glass room for its guests at the station.That was really something and we really loved the whole concept even the place was just 5 mins from the station. The basement packing is a bit weird with a Maruti 800 bursting out of the wall and a different range of guns painted on the pillar made me think what were they thinking. But even though the hotel is in the middle of the city i was pleasantly surprised by the silence inside the lobby and hotel in general. We stayed on the second floor and there was no view to speak of the room was spotless. We loved the fact that the room was extremely clean. Bathrooms huge with both hot and cold water and again clean.But we hated the fact that everytime we left and told the reception to get our room cleaned it never got done. Once we had to remind them 4 times that our room needs cleaning and they finally sent someone up to do that. And the second floor has a huge auditorium at the end of the hall which gets very loud at the day time and evenings. Not recommended. Now service is amazing and i have no complaints there. Every person from the staff refused tips at any given point of time and the 24 hour room service was top notch even at 2 in the night. Everyone including the drivers were very very conteous and made us feel at ease. The food is also very good and a wide variety as well. The bar on the other was very loud and not in the nice way. Very dingy and shady. Bartender very rude. We just had one drink and didnt like it at all. The manager at the bar was very helpful and we truly appreciate his attention towards keeping his guests happy. All in all a good experience with a few complaints which can be improved upon. Pick up and drop service is amazing.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Higher Floors are more quiet. Avoid Second floor at all costs.

Review_Content: Sitated close to the railway station; this is one of the better options to stay in Rourkela.Rooms are up to the mark and all amenities required by a business traveller are available.Food is of the highest quality and it was a pleasure to have my meals here.Would definitely stay here on my next visit.

It was a pleasent surprise for me during my first visit to rourkela to find such a decent hotel operating there. The rooms are big & neat; the service is great; complimentary breakfast is good enough; front office is helpful but the food is the best. I had a diff. dal on their suggestion & it was better than what i have tasted anywhere. Their dry fish was also excellent. Keep up the good work.

I had been there once for business tour. Located very near to the Rourkela Railway station. Rooms are big and so as the bathrooms. Buffet breakfast is pritty good. Food quality is commendable. Its a good budget hotel to stay on. Nice clean and well maintained hotel in the city of Rourkela. Highly recommended

A good hotel for stay if you are on a business trip; with clean nicely done up rooms in the new portion; priced moderately; buffet breakfast has limited options; hospitality is good; overall a good experience.

It is a good budget Hotel ; very nearby to rly stn. rooms are bigger and clean with all modern amenties. Wi-Fi is also there free of cost. Food quality is also good. Morning buffet break fast has good variety.Stn Pick up and drop is there. Tea sipping is expensive for single. No window choice is there. Good room service and laundry too.

The hotel situated very close to rourkela railway station ensures a pleasant stay as provides ample facilities to the customers. The hotel is neat and clean and very freindly staff and the restaurant with bar is also very clean and they serve delicious food in rourkela. also there are good conference room facility and for business travellers this hotel suits a good budget hotel in rourkela.

Review_Title: “Having problem with power cut and WIFI”
Review_Content: I stayed here at Radhika Agency 10 to 12 June 2012. I have observed that Power problem after each one hours power is going for 2 to 3 minute for 1-2 time which irritate you as it is often.WIFI is also not working continuously for two days I have observed that in one hour WIFi connection cutting 2-3 times.as WIFI and power are the most important thing now a days which irritate you if it do not work properly.If you don't mind with above then other thing are OK.Room cleanliness and design :- goodStaff communication:- GoodFood: good

Always I prefer to stay in Mayfair but this I tried this Radhika regency and found it a very good choice as compare to other and value.The rooms are well maintained and service is very good.Bathrooms are clean.The food quality is average.

Very nice hotel with reasonable price in Rourkela; with good amenities. The location of this hotel is near to Railway station. Radhika hotel offers nice food; supportive staff. pick up & drop facility available.

Undoubtedly the best hotel in all counts at Rourkela. Rourkela does has a Mayfair but Radhika Regency is better than Mayfair. Rooms are a bit small and the surrounding locality of the hotel is not good. But very courteous behavior of the hotel staff combined with excellent food and service would make you forget any negative thing you would observe.Room tariffs are not expensive.When I offered tip to one of the hotel staff; they denied accepting it and replied that sir our tip would be your next visit to Rourkela and stay at our hotel again. Do try this hotel if visiting Rourkela.

Review_Title: “great place for business traveller in Rourkela”
Review_Content: stying with this properlty regulerly since 2007. Great location. just 2min walking from Rourkela Railway station - that was the usp of the hotel initially. Later in 2009/10 it got major facelift and now one of best property in Rourkela and service was always excellent with great cooking.if you are taking early morning train; they will just pack a nice breakfast for you and hand it over at the railway station while dropping - even u did ot ask for it.present menu card is very widely spread from typical speciality food of Orissa; Jharkhand & Bengal to exotic continental focusing International guest.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Any room is ok

Review_Content: One of the finest Hotels in Orissa. Very Good Location and the service is excellent.Good place to have Business Meeting with Corporate parties.Good food & has a very good Bar...Has a bowling ally on the ground floor .. excellent.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Ask for Free Cab Service for local transport

Review_Title: “The basic business hotel; good for short business trip”
Review_Content: We had just one night stay; this offered budget hotel; with good amenities; at rasonable prices and a decent breakfast; the rooms are just Ok and comfortable stay; located close to market place; the room service is good can also go down and have food at restaurant; the restaurant is good and big; the rooms are also clean ; tiled floors. Good for a business short stay.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Preferably towards the entrance

Review_Content: I stayed at Radhika on business and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel. A small town small hotel but is excellent in its standards of order; cleanliness; service and staff behavior.The dinning hall and general restaurant is superb; probably the best in the town.Tariff is highly reasonable in the face of high standards of service & facilities. Unlike in the cases many good hotels; prices of food and drinks are quite reasonable  Secured arrangement of car parking in the ground floor of hotel-building and assured  accommodation for our car-driver at a very low price.One aspect that I did not like is that no staff of the hotel is allowed to accept any tips in spite of good service.Hopefully they are given excess salaries to make up for such losses.This hotel has one intrinsic drawback. Compared to its standards of service; it has insufficient land area. So; it has an unimpressive frontage and no back area at all. So; its outward look doesn’t indicate its high standards otherwise.The reception area of the hotel is; therefore; not as impressive & spacious as it should be; compared to its quality.Overall; a very pleasant stay. Probably the best hotel in town.

Review_Title: “An outstanding hotel in a small town”
Review_Content: The most unique hotel I have encountered so far. My experience with Radhika:(i) Clean and hygienic room(ii) very friendly staff; and the manager as well (Mr Shahid Khan-we were traveling from Malaysia to Kolkata; took 6 hr train (a 'creepy' one) from Kolkata to Rourkela. Hotel staff were there to pick us up from train station at night without any extra charges (but just a short distance; about 200-300 m).(iii) doesn't implement custom of tipping-after they carried luggages to our rooms; I gave tip to a staff. He immediately rejected it and said it is not their practice here. I warned my other colleagues not to give any tips worrying that other staff might be waiting for tips. Eventually we found out all staff implement the honest attitude. Great!(iv) Food-delicious; worth the money; big portion; friendly waiters; clean environment(V) Sent us to conference venue everyday (about 10-15 min by car). Very disappointed with the organizer's poor arrangement. (v) On the last day; they sent us to train station and negotiated with some guys waiting to carry our big luggages to the opposite platform. Impossible to carry on our own. We felt the price was too low and willing to give extra money (poor workers there). Mr Shahid was smiling and got a headache at the same time (after bargaining for us; still we wanted to pay more). Life is difficult here; earning single cent is tough. Small kids were begging around.

My collegues have booked this hotel for me for a business trip. The hotel is located very close to Railway station (walkable distance) and is in City centre. Right from Security; Receptionist and upto the Room service boys; each and every one is very friendly. You will be get a warm welcome from everyone. The rooms are clean and Kitchen is very clean. Food quality is good and fish is a speciaility here.We have organised an informal party at thier party hall. The hall is not so attractive but OK. Cost of stay is reasonable for a clean and neat room.

We went to this place not expecting much from especially with a name like that. However we were in for a nice surprise. This place is located a stone's throw away from the rail station. I've seen several places near the stn that jack up the price without justifying for it either in service or quality of rooms. Radhika however is very clean; upmarket and the service was good what with the boys refusing to take tips. The receptionists are always ready to help and are courteous. Except for a partially clogged drain in the bathroom everything else was perfect including the complementary breakfast.

I had been to Rourkela for official tour. I choose to stay this hotel because it is near to Railway station and nearer to my site. Rooms are quite comfortable. The veg. restaurant and the other multi-cuisine is very good. This seems to be the one of the best hotel in Rourkela. Service is quite good. The only drawback of the hotel is the room rent also some time delay for service either for room service or house keeping.Overall I had a quite pleasant experience during my stay.

Review_Title: “Awesome; felt like I am in different World.”
Review_Content: I am really impressed by the services provided by the hotel staffs adding value to the hotel's advantage i.e.1) Its location - 2-3 minutes from Station (pick-up facility by the Hotel)2) Business Centre in the hotel itself3) Variety of restaurants i.e Nottee and 7AM(fast food) with many arcade games parlour.4) Most spacious rooms in the city with great bathroom furnishings. (24hr electricity with aircons)5) MOST IMPORTANT - Waiters; Bell boys and Watchmans do not accept Tips from anyone- 1st time ever seen in this industry and even in the whole world I have ever been to.6) Even after being in the heart of city; no sound (horns;etc) can disturbed your sleep which I believe is because of its special window fittings; etc.Thank You Guys for making my stay wonderful. I wish you long long prosperous life and I would definitely recommend you guys. This hotel deserves to be known. :)

I booked a vacation starting 1st Nov 2014-4th Nov 2014. Let me take u from the ground up .The website was very slow n erratic. The hotel should have a direct availability policy at the time of booking; They took the full payment but we were not sure whether we would get the place or no..again leaving our vacation in a limbo.But the best part was we got the room and the view from our room no 211 was amazing a 5/5..They have the best location...The check in was a smooth affair nd the coincerge staff was helpful with our luggage too..The rooms are well appointed..but signs of ageing are well seen..The rooms could have a mini fridge; nd the towels could smell aromatic...THE ROOM SERVICE FOR LUNCH N DINNER is not available except starters n soups..This is very annoying as to after a whole days sightseeing I didn't have the strength to visit the restaurant. but no choice. The restaurant is very thinly staffed..Just 1 capt to take d orders in a whole of the melting pot..it took us 25 mins to get the attention of the waiter to order our dinner.The food is good..could be improved however.The continental kitchen is closed..so missed out on that. The gym is fantastic but could do with more lighting.. Didn't use the other facilities like swimming pool etc..so cannot comment on the same..THE view ing deck is fantastic so are the tennis courts n the child play area.Overall a good stay.THE house keeping staff is excellent & very helpful indeed.. Overall I will still recommend this place...don't look at the lacunaes if you are a ardent nature fan....

I stayed in Hotel ravine for 2 days with my family a valley view plus amazing and wonderful experience. Beautiful location and valley view & hotel staff are very cooperative.Dinning hall in hotel is superb I don't have words to say. Overall one of the best and lavish hotel in that region.Visit again very soon during rainy season.

Review_Title: “Experience good ... but cant say the same about booking and billing”
Review_Content: Let me start my review with two events that did not go down well with me1. I wanted to book a \Valley Plus\" room for three nights. Before booking; I called up the reservations and they told me that Valley Plus was booked out; and Valley Side rooms were available. I booked the same on the web site immediately. At night; another person called me saying that Valley Side rooms are not available and wanted me to shift to East Side room. I referred to the discussion earlier in the day basis which i had booked. During discussion; he slipped that the Valley Side room was not available for all three nights. So I asked which night it was not available. He said the third night it was not available. So i booked valley plus for two nights and east side for the third night. While checkout; I was told that rooms are booked two months in advance .. .at the same time the person next to him was noting a booking for the next week. 2. During checkout; my bill showed AC usage. I had specifically booked for non-AC rooms. The lady at the reception told me that the room had AC fitted and the remote was in the room. So that means; AC was used. I told her that my family stays in Mumbai where temperatures rarely drop below 24 and the Panchgani temp was in the range of 14 to 18. So we are not even using the fans and there was not question of using the AC. Finally; they \"reluctantly\" agreed to cancel the AC charges. Apart from the above two event; the stay was very pleasant and comforting. The hotel is located at the start of Panchgani. It is far from the city center and market; but that is also a boon as there is less noise more space around. The tennis courts are good. The play area for kids are well maintained. One of the rare occasions where I found that the play areas was clean and all items well maintained and in working conditions. The game zone in the basement is also good with a TT table; table football; carrom; pool table; air hockey. couple of items are charged per game but most are free. The gym is well equipped... though i did not use it but just had a peek. The in house restaurant serves good food. Barring a couple of personnel; the others are very helpful and pleasing to serve. We learned which tables to keep away so we can avoid the rude guys. They also have a mini-theatre; but we could not use it since there was a Devrai art exhibition going on in the same room .The rooms are spacious and clean. Overall a good experience and would definitely stay here again. A TIP: Check if AC remote in room. If it is there; do return to the reception to avoid point 2 situation described above."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose Valley Side or Valley Plus.

Review_Title: “Superb view from the Room..Service..Huh..Could have been better.”
Review_Content: We booked a valley view plus room and stayed in this hotel for 2 days. As I mentioned; the location of this hotel is too good; one can enjoy a beautiful view from the room. Room size is good enough for two people. The interior of the room was pretty good; which made the stay pleasant and relaxing. We did not try the swimming pool as it was cold in December; but the pool was neatly maintained. However; it was very small for such a big hotel. Now; let me put the facts straight:1. The hotel meets expectations if you are going with your spouse/family as you will get privacy to spend good quality time.2. The food is very good. If you are non-vegetarian; then you must try crispy chicken.3. Amenities such as table tennis and carrom are available free of cost whereas you will have to pay a little amount for using the billiards table.Cons:1. The staff is courteous but very very lazy when it comes to service (Service in this hotel is pathetic).2. I am not really convinced on the price I paid to stay in this hotel; I found his little expensive vis. a vis. the facilities and services they provided.3. There was no one to receive us at the reception and we had to request the hotel for picking our luggage from the car (ideally this should have been taken care by the hotel without even asking)4. The booking system is a bit traditional. They do not have tie up with many leading websites for room booking as we had to deposit the full amount in their account to confirm the booking. The credit card booking application does not seem to be much secure.My tips to the travellers:1. Go for Valley view plus or Executive room only.2. Try food (especially dinner) at any restaurant in Panchgani market; Most of the restaurant serves good food (try Chinese food as I found it better then the desi food)3. Buy fresh vegetables such as broccoli and carrots from Panchgani market as it is cheap and organic.4. If you are going towards Mahabaleshwar; then don’t buy strawberries from there as you will get good strawberries from Panchgani at a much cheaper rate.5. Carry warm clothes as it is always cold there.I will keep this hotel as an option and suggest it to my friends and family. However; I have heard that there are some other good hotels as well. Will try those as well.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go for Valley view plus or Executive room only.

Review_Content: Ravine is the hotel with the best location in Panchgani.The view from the hotel is breathtaking.The hotel is very well maintained and the staff is very co-operative.The rooms at ravine are beautifully decorated and the comfort in the rooms is great.The hotel is a great value for money and one feels to visit Ravine again and again.

The moment you enter Panchgani; via Wai you get to see the sight of Ravine's property and its wonderful location.It is situated very close to Sydney Point and hence during your stay here you will get to witness breathtaking view of Krishna river valley from its premises. Although A valley facing room will be cherry on the cake; its land facing rooms also wont be much less!! Rooms are quite luxurious and give you a feel of royal ambiance with its interiors. It has a A-la-carte restaurant which serves some authentic parsi;mughlai style food. Although the service you get in here is extremely poor as the restaurant is quite understaffed and its very difficult for them to cope up even when only half of the tables are occupied. It is really disappointing to see especially when they charge you a handsome amount of service charge.So for food you can just drive/walk to the Panchgani market area which is around 1 km away.The staff is really courteous. We were provided a flexibility of extending our checkout by an hour Other facilities like spa;salon;tennis court make your stay quite relaxing and enjoyable. Although swimming pool can be improved if it can be temperature controlled and cleaned regularly. Overall we found our stay at Ravine really memorable and exciting; we have already decided about our stay here when we next visit Panchgani with our parents.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book 2 months in advance to ensure a valley facing room!!

Review_Content: We had a last minute plan to go to Mahabaleshwar so I called up Ravine to see if I could get a room booked. I was informed that I could get reservations on walk-in since it was a lull period for the hotel. Oh; did I mention that I went in the 'off-season' so got a discount of 50%? The staff here is very pleasant and speaks good English; good training shows here. The hotel itself is very tastefully done and has a quaint look and feel. Everything in Ravine spells grandeur. It is very well-maintained and hotel staff is there at your beck and call. Food is relatively cheap (I live in Pune and am used to paying a minimum of 1500 for a meal of 4) and is tasty. All attractions in Mahabaleshwar can be covered from here in one go - max of 6-8 hours although I would recommend this place more for just staying back; getting lost in the grand valley that overlooks the hotel and lounging all day. There's a good spa (though I didn't have time to use it); tennis court and swimming pool here too.This is definitely my Mahabaleshwar stay for years to come.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: If you're travelling in a group of four or more; you must opt for the ground floor premium room...

Review_Content: The best place to relax. and even if u want to njoy ur privacy alone.Serves good food. Have shopping options :)  .... Advantages :1) Excellent Rooms2) you feel fresj once u enter hotel I loved the aroma fragrance they used in their hotel...soothing and very pleasant.3) Best option for family as u have pool ; table tennis; soccer ; snooker etc4) shopping small place for shopaholic ;)5) near to Sydney point6) HOTEL IS ITSELF A POINT in panchgani7) prefer Valley side roomswe were group of 6 so we choose two valley side rooms interconnected best option as you guys can njoy whole nite playing chatting togetherDisadavatages :1) Very costly in the sense they should provide breakfast in their package atleast2) pool is not maintained. i personally dnt go into the pool where chlorine filtration is not set up
Room_Tips: Room Tip: though the duplex rooms are nice but if you have group of 4-6 go for valley side connecting rooms. y...

Review_Content: Very unpleasant stay. We booked 6 rooms. My room had a smaller bed compared to other rooms. The manager first refused to believe it and then he said he said he was unaware abt it and they book room according to the size of the room not at bed size which was very rude and uncooperative to me. So if u r travelling with kid pls look for the bedsize. The restaurant service is very slow u have to wait around an hour for your meal. If u make much query the staff misbehaves and the manager completely ignored it; overall not nice but the view from valley plus room is nice

Really nicely located property; having very good valley view from rooms. Neat; clean hotel with cosy rooms restaurant serving good tasty food. Good property stay and relax. Well mannered and helping staff. Especially Mr. Rathod at front desk is very nice and extremely co-operative.Some suggestions:-Shall offer complimentary breakfast.It will be better if they provide refrigerator; tea-coffee making kettle in a room (Valley View )More room lights for better lux during night to avoid gloomy feel.Better quality breakfast. (Lunch & Dinner preparations are tasty)Change the location of drain outlet in bath area for easy drain out of water during bathing (at present it is just below the tap; so if you are taking water in a bucket it blocks the drain outlet)
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book Valley View or above category room to enjoy and relax during room stay.

Review_Content: Very nice hotel. The rooms are awesome and view is very nice. Everything was very good. Best option to stay in panchgani. I was in this hotel on 2nd and 3rd of october and enjoyed to the fullest. The view from the dining hall is also very awesome. However the food service from dinning is very slow.

This hotel has the best view of the valley and back water. Food is very good. Rooms are not of three star category; but are good. Choose valley side rooms for best view. Amazing is they charge extra if you want air conditioner to be ON.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose Valley side room.

Review_Content: With its strategic location and views to kill for; Ravine offers a great value for money option around Panchgani/ mahabaleshwar. Iv visited twice and plan future trips as well. Only feedback would be to spruce up the food standards which is a bit of a let down compared to even locally available options.

Its a view from the hotel (Valley view room) for which the hotel is worth staying. Hotel is clean and maintained. Rooms are sufficiently spacious and warm. In terms of treatment and ambience I would not rate it high. Bathroom was below expectation. One reason could be its age ( I am not sure if it is an old hotel). I stayed there for two nights and it gave me a good change but I wish if the bathrooms were more clean and warm. Hotel staff were courteous but can be bit more polished. Food was good. Chicken Biryani is worth trying. But I would really want it to serve breakfast complimentary (which is common now days). Location is very apt.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: go for second floor rooms (valley view and plus)

Review_Content: Visited with family....Nice property...well maintained...great location. Helpful staff. Food can be improved a little. They have variety of rooms. Overall it was a wonderful experience. Will definitely opt this one on our next visit.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book well in advance....so that you can opt room of your choice.

Review_Title: “Excellent location but staff spoils the hotel name”
Review_Content: Stayed here for my Husband's Birthday We were checked into a Valley Plsu room .The view from the hotel room is outstanding . The 3 tennis courts are super and the tent accommodations are also interesting . The Spa facility also is excellent . The swimming Pool is in one cosy corner and truely inviting :)). But since it was so cold we dint dare to ;)However the restaurant staff is very lazy n not courteous . They keep telling each table to order once and for all and not to give half orders . They lack hospitality Overall it was superb . Thank you Javed for being so kind as to arrange our stay at a short notice
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose a valley plus room on the second floor ... u will be mesmerized

Review_Content: The main USP of Ravine is its location. Breathtaking vistas of the valley and the meandering lake can be seen from the Valley Plus rooms overlooking Sydney Point. Food is a-la-carte. They do not have a buffet option which is probably the only downside from my point of view as the a-la-carte options are definitely priced on the higher side. Quality of food is good and staff is very courteous and polite. The Spa is also quite good and a good option to de-stress. Away from the crowds at Mahableshwar about a 30 min drive; this resort has a lot of potential to be even better. Definitely recommended for a short 2-3 day stay

Totally excellent location; solid good rooms;good spa;good service;good restaurant; total paisa vasooollllll.....;....Must stay.......................................................................;................ .......

We have been noticing this hotel since last 2-3 yrs while on the way to Mahableshwar.This independence monsoon weekend we stayed for 3 nights in Junior Suite located on 3rd floor.The hotel is constructed beautifully;located on the main road;facing the valley;4 tennis courts;indoor play area;state-of-art gym.The rooms of varied categories and prices are available strictly of p.p basis.No deals available with food.Hotel has a restaurant but can be ignored except the cake & coffee shop.The view from our room 220 was mindblowing.My kid was so in awe of the landscaping;got motivated to be by the window side all of her day.Interesting part of the junior suite is that two out four walls of the room are glass top to bottom with duly ensuring the privacy of the guest.The room is provided with 24 hrs hot/cold water;tea/coffee maker;grand passage;decorative antic furniture;flat screen t.v;queen size bed and a sofa cum bed.Still leaving ample room to move around.The sight and sound of rains splasing on your glass walls is unbeatable.Owning the view for next three days means we did not visit any other point as most offering the same view of the valley.We did hike upto Sydney point climbing the conventional way with the help of a water pipe.Being a veg.eater;we preffered Hotel Rasoi[walking distance towards wai];afternoon tea and snacks @ Lucky bakery[Market is 10 mins walk] cant miss the cheese burger;bun maska;lemon tea;parathas @ akarballys are overrated & can be avoided[unhygeinic];strawbeery icecream @ hilltop is eatable;but dont miss pure hand made icecream @ sydney point sold on cycle.Hotel property is huge and vast with places to picnic in several private canopies made overlooking the valley.Every Penny Worth it...
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Suite rooms with valley view

Review_Content: Panchgani & Mahableshwar are considered as Mumbai common man's Kashmir.These 2 places are not at all organized in terms of decent accomodation (price vs hygiene) & food (quality vs quantity).Ravine fills in these gap!!. Though its modestly high-priced; one should definitely stay once at this place.Advantages:Strategic Location.Clean Hygienic Rooms.Good food.Would Keep your kids busy (Game room)Swimming Pool & Gym. Well Maintained.Cooperative Staff.Ample Car Parking. Free Car wash.Swift Room Service.Disadvantages:No liquor #$#$#$Well-educated/trained staff.I stayed with my wife & 15 month old boy. We stayed in Room # 303. A double-decker bedroom.!! Well maintained.We had a great time & good memory.Next time would definitely stay here. And I would like to recommend others too.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: If you book in advance; ask for valley facing room.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Please accept a huge Thank You from all of us here at Ravine.We are happy to hear you had a great time and a good memory. Your feedback is much appreciated & it surely is helpful to the rest of the Trip Advisor community planning a trip to Ravine.Many Thanks for your recommendations. We all look forward in welcoming you again to indulge in some luxurious relaxation!!Warm Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: I stayed @ Ravine with my family during 14th-17th Aug'14. We were a total of 8 adults and 2 children (both less than 2yrs of age). This was my second experience with Ravine and has turned out to be \tremendously\" satisfying !!Right from the professional yet friendly approach I received for hotel booking via the Pune office; to the room service; housekeeping and the delicious food at the hotel.............. I loved every bit of it :)Because we got late with the booking; we couldn't get valley view rooms; yet the \"east side\" rooms were equally well equipped and managed. The game zone kept me and especially the kids busy .......... although the hotel could do better with keeping a dedicated staff member there (I know this was a holiday weekend with all your staff occupied; but we really wanted to play some staff-supervised games........nevertheless; this is a suggestion for next time )The food at the hotel (restaurant and room service) was absolutely delectable and served well .............. and that includes everything from omlette to chicken sandwich to butter and tandoori chicken .............. my family did delve into the vegetarian cuisine and were quite happy with that too.The location and views from the hotel were unbeatable !! The best part is that I didn't have to drive through any market traffic to reach the hotel; as I was coming in from PuneKeep up the great work Ravine !! I will surely visit again !!"
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book early 1.5-2 months in advance to get valley view rooms ............ that'll really be an ou...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for taking time to leave a review following your recent stay with us. We are over whelmed by your overall positive feedback.We are glad you enjoyed your stay as well as the location. Your positive feedback motivates us to serve our customer even better.We have taken note of your suggestion & will definitely try to implement it. It was a pleasure having you as our guest.. We are looking forward to see you soon!With kind regards;ANISH K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Best place to stay in Panchgani for the view of the valley. Clean rooms.Helpful staff.Well maintained property.Stayed here in June & the weather was a pleasant escape from the Mumbai summer.Like other guests the reservation process & the front reception has room for improvement.Otherwise best choice for a 'peace of mind' vacation in Panchgani.You don't have any other option of a better property in Panchgani other than Keys Evershine in Mahabaleshwar; where we stayed for 2 nights after 3 nights @ The Ravine.
Response_to_Review: Dear GuestThank you for choosing Ravine for your recent stay in Panchgani.We are glad that you consider our property at a good location & appreciating the beautiful valley and various activities.We are overwhelmed by your overall positive response! Thank you so much for the same.Hope to see you soon again in the monsoons.Warm Regards;ANISH | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Location; Location ; Location Ravine Hotel wins on all three counts!The view is amazing we stayed in corner jr executive room which has two glass walls one facing the valley and another facing Sydney point. The mists and river view played hide n seek with each other on one side and the other side had a view of Sydney point which was entertaining . At night we could see lights of vehicles travelling from Sydney point and in the daytime people jogging uphill .The best part was that the room had absolutely no smell of dampness which is prevalent in all hotels in Mahabaleshwar during monsoons ;we have spent quite a few monsoon vacations in Mahabaleshwar .The glass walls were dirty and streaked with cement ( I think they were recently repaired) and the room was also not very clean;there was a broken down refrigerator in the room which was emitting bad odour. We checked in and got housekeeping to clean up and take away the offending fridge and clean up the glass and then had a fantastic time. Housekeeping was responsive ; but you had to ask.The sofa and chairs had cloth covers which were sticky from constant use ;we asked for extra bedsheet and towels and covered them up. There was one complimentary bottle of mineral water on arrival; generally this class of hotels give one or two bottles everyday .Only basic channels were available on the TV . Hot water was always available .The jr executive room also had hairdryer and tea kettle.The food in both restaurant and room service was very good . Restaurant is very crowded with tables close to each other . The room service would deliver uncovered food ; request to hotel is to send covered trays. Room service was on even at 6 am which is great for early risers even though it was supposed to be from 7 am and hill stations are notoriously late risers. Bonus points for proximity to Rasoi Food ville which is a couple of minutes away and serves excellent Gujarati Thali.The wifi worked only in the lobby so we had to come out to the lobby to use it.The first morning we woke up to sunrise .mists and a beautiful vertical rainbow shooting straight down into the river !Definitely recommended for people who love grand views and open spaces .
Room_Tips: Room Tip: the corner jr executive rooms have two walls as large picture windows so you get both valeey view an...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Many thanks for sharing experience on your recent stay with us at. We appreciate your positive and detailed feedback very much.Your feedback is much appreciated and it surely is very helpful to the rest of the trip advisor community planning a trip to Ravine.We are much honoured to know that we exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed every bit of your stay with us. We look forward to welcome you again..Kind Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: We stayed for 4 nights at Ravine. August-4th to 8th . We stayed in valley view rooms which offered a great view of the valley The rooms are average on cleanliness; bathrooms are average. The rooms lack basic amenities like an electric kettle and a fridge...which I guess a three star should provide. The children's play area is very good and my kids enjoyed there. . Overall I would say don't expect too much; however you can really enjoy the view and the hotel is worth for its location.The location of the resort is excellent.We had booked 4 rooms but the hotel could not provide connected or consecutive rooms; we had to stay separated. No room service after 11.00PM was surprising as we were denied milk for small children accompanying us.  Valley view...that's the only thing that excites in this hotel but in monsoon due to fog the visibility is poor so can't really have view of the valley. Overall a pleasant experience

I apologize you felt the cleanliness and maintenance of the bathrooms to be average.
