Review_Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Ravine. The location of the resort is simply superb. We stayed in valley view rooms which offered a great view of the valley and chilly breeze all day long. (you won't even need the fan). The rooms are average on cleanliness; bathrooms are strictly average. The rooms lack basic amenities like an electric kettle and a fridge...which I guess a three star should provide. The children's play area is very good and my kids enjoyed there. Well the staff at the restaurant need to show some more hospitality. They are extremely disinterested in working and can be sometimes really annoying. Food was ok. Overall I would say don't expect too much; however you can really enjoy the view and the hotel is worth for its location.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley view...that's the only thing that excites in this hotel.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for taking the time for sharing your overall experience with us.We are happy to receive your feedback & to know that you found the location of our hotel 'Superb'.However; I apologise you felt the cleanliness & maintenance of the bathrooms to be average.As mentioned by you in regards to the hospitality; I can assure you this is not a common occurrence and on your next visit we would be delighted to show you how Quick & Prompt our staff over here is.We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back at Ravine in the future; it would be a pleasure to have you stay with us once more.With kind regards;AnishRavine Hotel

Review_Content: I had visited this hotel with my friends in the month of June...We had selected Ravine for the beautiful view and proximity to the market.. It was my first time in the hotel; and i had a very pleasant stay. We had booked the Ground Floor Premium rooms and they had a very good view.. The staff is very courteous and helpful. Due to the delayed monsoons this time; we could enjoy the property with a wonderful climate. Overall; i found the hotel worthwhile to visit. However; one thing i would like to mention is the swimming pool was not in very good condition and they had limited Wifi access. However; i would definitely like to visit the property again.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you very much for sharing your experience with us.We are delighted to know that you had a pleasant stay.I have noted your feedback with respect to the swimming pool & the Wifi Service; Shall be discussing the same with relevant departments.The team & I look forward to your continued visits and assure you of our best service & attention at all times.Warm Regards;Anish Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: I was there last year june in this property. Place is excellent. It is at sydney point. Huge property with all facilities you can think of... We were there for 5 days and loved every bit of it... It is a 5Star hotel and we booked it in low season so got good deal of something around 2400 per night. Booked it through their office in Goregaon. We took valley view room. Take room in corner it will have view of entire valley and looks breath taking... We went in rains. it was bit annoying as it kept on raining a lot... Tip: Avoid Panchgani in heavy rain if you like roaming. However if you are travelling to relax it is best time.. Not much tourist and roads are empty. Bathrooms were nice and big; they have shower (No bath-tub).. Housekeeping was nice; they came and did all changing. Restaurants was good.. nice food... not very expensive.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley view corner room. Room has 2 side walls and 2 side of glass. I believe they have only one roo...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Many thanks for sharing your experience on your recent stay with us at Ravine.We are much honoured to know that we exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed every bit of your stay with us.On behalf of the entire team front & back office; I would like to say how much your kind words are appreciated by all of us.I am pleased you enjoyed all of the facilities & services.We all look forward to welcoming you once again to indulge in some luxurious relaxation.With love from all of us;Regards;AnishRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Had stayed for 3 nights with my family n had taken 4 rooms .as it was Eid weekend so was kinda full but got 2 valley side room ; the best thing abt this hotel is the view as its right at the cliff ;during monsoons the whole property is covered with mist n fog which makes it more enchanting .the property includes kids play area with tennis courts n indoor games which makes the kids occupied has a decent spa too.Other good thing abt this hotel is the tariff quite reasonable in the off season compared to other hotels with less amenities. Service I would say they need to work on it ; though it was satisfactory as the property was totally full.Would recommend this hotel for couples n families
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Many thanks for sharing your feedback about your recent stay at Ravine.Your feedback is much appreciated & it surely is very helpful to the rest of the trip advisor community planning a trip to Ravine.Thanks again for your recommendations.We all look forward to welcoming you once again to indulge in some luxurious relaxation.Kind Regards;Anish Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: I will be making my third annual monsoon trip to Panchgani this month; just for Ravine (and those delicious jams and preserves). I just love how Ravine is located away from the buzz of Panchgani and Mahabaleshwar; and situated at a very scenic spot (right next to Sydney point); so you can enjoy a great view even before stepping out of the premises. It’s a great break from the chaos of Lonavala (which you will know too well if you’re a Mumbaikar); and has some of the views of Khandala (although nothing compares to the view from Duke’s).It is a cozy; well-maintained and charming place to stay. The food is costly; but gets a 3.5/5 on deliciousness... They make the most amazing naan! Plus; for those who really want it; there’s a spa. I haven’t been there myself; so no comments on that. They’ve got loads of courts; for basketball; tennis and badminton; so if you’re planning an active trip; you’re in luck. My husband and I chill out in their courtyard with tea/coffee watching the sun set behind the hills every evening we are there. So; all in all; the property and stay are wonderful.Having said that; I too have experienced slack service from the management. It’s like they’ve decided to be on vacation too. For instance; on our last trip which lasted 3 days we had requested the car to be cleaned every day. It was cleaned once. I’ve experienced delayed room service in 2012 (over an hr of delay); but it was quite prompt last year. During the busy seasons; expect them to come half an hr later even if all you call for is a jug of water. If you’re not touchy about these things (and I am not because I go there to laze around and relax); it should be a pleasant trip.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley plus is your best bet for a great view... when you do have a choice! It's difficult to la...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Many thanks for sharing your experience; following your recent stay with us at Ravine.We appreciate your positive & detailed feedback very much.Lovely to hear that you felt \at home\" and that you both enjoyed the physical aspect of the Hotel as well as the way we deliver our service.We are much honoured to know that we exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed every bit of your stay with us.We have taken note of all your inputs and will try to implement and improve our service; as high satisfaction of our guests is our top priority.We all look forward to having the privilege of welcoming you back again soon.Kind Regards;AnishRavine Hotel"

Review_Content: I am currently staying in this resort. Couple of things:Pros1) view is mindblowing2) rooms r really nice3) resort is awesome4) room service is v promptWeird things:1) inspite of being so costly they have not included breakfast in the package. I have stayed in so many 3stars n above across india n abroad; this is the first time BF is not included in such a costly package2) no tea cofee compliment s in the room3) inspite of us requesting multiple times to give us the rooms side by side; these folks didnt bother. V gt 2 rooms on 2 corners of 2 separate floors4) staff at the reception is not as per the hotel standard. They are just not bothered5) gym n other activity areas dont open on weekdays. They open only on wknds that also in the evenin 6-10Though the hotel is good i am not very happy with the staff n their so called policies specially coz its sooooo costly. Might not recommend it to friends
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Many thanks for sharing your experience.We value the feedback of our guests; and we appreciate your overall good review about our property!We will take into account a few of the short comings pointed out by you and will take steps to ensure that you don’t face issues like the ones mentioned. It was a pleasure for us having you as our guest! We are looking forward to welcoming you soon again!Kind Regards;ANISH | Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “I keep coming back to this place atleast once a year”
Review_Content: Ravine has been one of my favorite properties to revisit. I simply like visiting panchgani only to stay with Ravine. They are located in the right place; less than a km away from the market close to the hghway with a beautiful view and variety of activities. This hotel has elegant rooms and all that one requires for holiday. I like spending time watching stars on the cliff terrace. All the sports available and the mini sized pool that barely lets you swim but have that private time with your family or friends. They have a very good spa where one can take a blissful massage and rejuventae oneself also the products in the spa are very good to buy.All in all one of my best hotels that i keep revisiting everytime and it is never enough.
Response_to_Review: Dear GuestThank you for choosing Ravine as always for your stay in Panchgani.We are glad that you consider our property at a good location & appreciating the beautiful valley and various activities.We are overwhelmed by your overall positive response! Thank you so much for the same.Hope to see you soon again in the monsoons.Warm Regards;ANISH | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: We stayed here for 2 nights 3 days for our Marriage Anniversary. We were booked for Valley Plus Room. The view was stunning. The room ambiance was awesome. The room hospitality was average. We were asked for 2nd floor room instead of 1st floor which they said booked for another family to check in whereas at the time of online booking the hotel person said we provide rooms while check in only. This hotel doesnt serve your lunch or dinner in room. They have selected items which gets serve in room. We were booked for Serenity Spa facility for Abhyanga Message & certainly we were expecting the best but it was not worth to the price though again the ambiance was nice. Overall Ravine give you great stay feeling with average hospitality & poor spa experience.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer; Thank you for taking the time to review your stay and the team.We are pleased that you enjoyed your visit. & Congratulations on your anniversary. However; I apologise that you were not impressed by the Spa facility.I hope we will see you again soon.Many thanks;ANISH | Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “If you are not celebrity; DO NOT VISIT”
Review_Content: 1- Location:- Superb location; just came from Hotel. Nice Cliff view2- Service:- PATHETIC; they wont respect you if you are not a celebrity3- Food:- OK; 2/5.Go there enjoy the view; eat outside and dnt expect anything from the hotel staff. The staff is rude and careless. They are not bothered about the common people visiting there... so choose your stay carefully. There are many other options available other then this hotel.One request to everyone; DO NOT GO WITH HIGH EXPECTATIONS.. other than valley view; nothing great about this hotel...Cheers
Room_Tips: Room Tip: You can choose Valley View or Valley Plus.. nice rooms they are to enjoy the cliff; rains or even fo...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;I am Sorry that you were disappointed & felt the need to leave such a poor review.We have noted your feedback & will be reviewing it with relevant departments.Your review does not mention; whether you discussed your disappointment prior to your departure; however; I would welcome the opportunity to do so; if you could please contact me directly at the Hotel.Hopefully; you will give us a chance to redeem your faith at some stage in future.Thank you for your comments.Kind Regards;ANISH | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: I stayed during the onset of late Monsoon 2014.. Highlight is valley view rooms; Scenic surroundings; Staffs are ok; Cleanliness is good; Food is good; Costs not so high; Avoid Spa.. I would rate 3.5/5
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer; Thank you for your positive feedback on Trip Advisor.We are glad to know you enjoyed your stay. Once again; thanking you for the lovely review and hopefully see you again soon @ Ravine.Warm Regards;ANISH | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: We stayed here for three nights earlier this week. It rained a lot and the view from the valley side room was pretty breathtaking. When the rains slowed down or when it was less misty; one could see the beautiful Western Ghats and the Krishna river from the hotel room. I had spend quite a number of hours sitting by the large glass window; reading and enjoying the view.The rooms are equipped with standard amenities; but I was a little surprised that they didn't have an electric kettle and tea/coffee condiments. Bathrooms are clean and have hot water all day long. Housekeeping and room dining services were really prompt and good. My only disappointment was the dining area: fancy and lovely views; but the whole area smelled funny. I had asked the staff about it but they didn't seem to care much. My diagnosis of the smell is that the tables are not cleared out immediately after people leave. Everytime we saw left-over food lying on adjacent tables that are waiting to be cleared. And with the rains (which adds to the dampness of the place); not clearing out tables is clearly not helping the situation. I thought this was slightly unprofessional for a luxury hotel. Food was pretty okay (not awesome) and the staff were careful about our dietary requests. Though way more expensive than other restaurants in the area. Overall; we enjoyed our stay and we will highly recommend this.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: go for the valley side rooms. You will not regret it.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for taking time to leave a feedback following your recent stay with us.We are glad you enjoyed your stay as well as the location. Your positive feedback motivates us to serve our customer even better.We have taken into account a few of the short comings mentioned by you & will take steps to ensure you don't have to face the issues like the one's pointed out. It was a pleasure having you as our guest.. We are looking forward to see you soon!With kind regards;ANISH K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: We stayed in the valley plus room and had an overall good experience. The hotel has everything you can ask for starting from swimming pool; Spa; tennis court to play area for the children. The view of the valley from the room was breathtaking The food quality was good. I particularly liked the masala tea. Overall a good family hotel.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for such a lovely review on Trip Advisor.We are glad to know you had a good experience at our hotel & appreciate each & every aspect of it.We hope to see you again in the coming monsoons; when the climate is at its best. Do plan your trip soon.Warm Regards;Anish KRavine Hotel

Review_Content: I stayed in this hotel on 5th July 2014; did booking online and must say its the Best Hotel possible in Pachgani; the Hotel has amenities like; Swimming pool; POOL Table; Spa; 3 Tennis Courts and the staff is also very helpful. Ample of Parking space; spacious rooms; I went for Valleyside room which had the best valley view. Its great place to be in either family or in couple or with Group.Cons : -> The Room service staff was humble enough but the reception area looked bit messed up. even the staff at reception looked lost at times.-> The Bathrooms were stinking but you can inform service staff to put a room freshener.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Do select Valley view rooms for better sight seeing.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;We appreciate your overall feedback following your recent stay at our Hotel.We will definitely make a note of the ‘Cons’ mentioned & will improvise on the same.Hope to see you again in the monsoons; when the weather picks up.Warm Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: The hotel view is good but the overall experience was ok... We had taken 220 room no. Both sides valley view..The room was good but the bathrooms were stinking.. No fresheners used n the bathing area is very small...N found a rat in the room in the nyt.... N the room was not up to the mark in cleanliness wen v checked in... N they made us wait for a long tym during checkin in which was very annoying...No hot waters in the bathroom... Had to ask for another room....Food was good...spa was awesum....Room service was fyn...The gud thing about this hotel is the locationHad expected a lot from this hotel as going by the reviews... But was not up to the mark..Taking good memories from mahabaleshwar n panchgani
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for leaving feedback on Trip Advisor following your recent stay.We are Sorry to hear about your not so good experience at Ravine. We are in the process of improvement to ensure that; guests get the best service.We are glad to know you found the hotel’s location to be an advantage. We do hope you will give us a chance again in the future to show our true quality of services.Looking forward to see you in the monsoons; when the climate is at its best & even better at Ravine. Warm Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “Heve not received confirmation for Jr.Exe room on second floor”
Review_Content: Dear Ravine hotel Staff;Though I have booked Jr.Executive room on 26th June 2014 last week in advance; I have not received your confirmation for the booking of Jr.Executive room at second floor from where two sided velley view has been seen. I hope you will not disappoint me this time. I have sent three email request for the same but have not received any reply from your hotel staff. I am requesting you again for the same. Kindly reply.ThanksHardik Shah
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Hotel staff is not cooperating upon request for second floor room thought pay in advance. Not so goo...
Response_to_Review: Dear Mr. Hardik;I refer to our telephonic discussion couple of days back; would like to inform you that your booking for Jr. Executive Room has been confirmed for the said dates & we have even sent you an official email regarding the same.Regarding your preference for 2nd floor valley facing room; we have noted your request & will definitely try to offer the same on your arrival. Just to clarify; room numbers are allotted 24 hours before guest’s arrival; as unforeseen circumstance may occur at any time & by confirming the room number we do not want you to suffer at the end. Being our regular guest; it will always be our priority to not disappoint you for any reason. We assure you of giving the room of your choice but days before cannot commit for the same.Hope you would find this response in good faith; for any issues; you are always welcomed to reach me at the front desk.Kind Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Although the tariff hike is justifiable; the ever-rising magnitude of arrogance is just unnecessary. Be ready to be treated like 2nd class crap unless you are somehow connected to bollywood. Got a Tree plus (room facing a freakin tree) in the name and price of Valley plus; even though I booked more than 10 days in advance just for the view. I was told they cant allot rooms coz some film crew might show up and book an entire floor. Do not go here expecting it to be the same as it was a few months or years ago.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for taking time to write about us. We sincerely regret as your experience was not reflective of our usual standards of service. I personally assure you to allot the room of your choice and the best possible service with attention on your next visit. We hope that you will give us another chance to redeem your faith at some stage in the future.All of us wait for your return.With Kind Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Query by email and subsequent booking online followed by confirmation over the phone was well responded. The hotel is located centrally on the main road with a splendid view of the valley from sydney point. The staff received us with a smile and good service. The restaurant service was very fabulous with an added advantage of not serving liquor. All other services in the hotel needs a mention for good services.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Look for rooms with valley view. You can find this on the hotel website.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Thank you for taking the time for sharing your overall experience with us.We are delighted that you enjoyed all of our facilities and services. I hope it won’t be as long till your next visit!Wish to welcome you soon again.Warm Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel; Panchgani

Review_Content: this hotel itself is like a point where you can get just 180 degree view of mountains. But for this you have to select the room with better view then only you will be able to enjoy the beauty of this place. We went there in month of October (bit of off season); but this hotel made our stay joyful and memorable.Pros : - Beautiful location; good rooms; beautiful Tennis courts and nice gardenCons : - After bit of follow up i got my booking confirmation when i booked it online. Hotel staff first didn't provide me right room; after bit of argument i got the right room. Otherwise rooms were nice and later service was also good. Nice balcony outside rooms to enjoy the view.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Select the room with good view to enjoy this hotel fully.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback following your recent stay. We are glad to know our Hotel made your stay joyful and memorable. As mentioned by you in regards to the front desk staff; I can assure you this is not a common occurrence and on your next visit we would be delighted to show you how ‘Courteous & Cordial’ our front desk staff over here is and we will make sure you get the room of your choice.We look forward to welcome you back soon.With Kind RegardsAnish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: It's just perfect..We stayed there for 3 days and wish if we could have stayed longer. It has lot of activities to offer like tennis court; swimming pool; world class gym with all the equipments; spa; luscious garden; beautiful view; delicious food and luxurious rooms to stay in ..The service is too good and staff is courteous..will definitely recommend this place and surely will visit again!!
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;We are overjoyed reading your wonderful experience at our hotel. Also satisfied; that we delivered our best in all ways to make your stay the way you want it to be.Do plan your trip soon & let us know about it as I and we all would be more than happy to welcome you back again.Thank you for your kind recommendations.With Kind Regards from all of us;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Ravine is a decent and clean property with really nice rooms. We (two couples) stayed in the Executive Room (208) (two Bed Rooms) and it was a real treat!!Rooms are really clean; big and loaded with all required amenities; but the most amazing part is the view from each of the bedrooms that would amaze you!Room service at the Hotel is great and you get your ordered food very quickly.Rooms are available with option of AC / Non AC and in such a beautiful weather you will never require an AC; believe me that you will be chilled the moment you open the windows...Sleep quality is awesome and bed / linens were very clean.The only downside I felt is the service within the restaurant at dinner where we were discouraged to order food by staff stating; \please do not order starters sir; it will take more than 30 minutes and we will not take orders in bits but only in one go\" I expect management makes the service in Restaurant much better.Rest everything was perfect and as the monsoons is on the verge to start; I will be back here again very soon!"
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;It gives us a great pleasure to read your wonderful review and to know that you have enjoyed every bit of your stay in our hotel.However; we apologize for the slow restaurant service and assure you that steps have been taken to improve our services and hope that your next visit will be free of complaints.Please do come back and stay with us again in the near future as I and we all look forward to host you soon.With Kind Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: After spending 2 days in Saket Plaza; Mahabaleshwar; we were in serach of a hotel to spend 2 more days in Panchgani. We were 5 families. We went to this hotel to enquire abt room availability. Since the rooms were small and swimming pool was not maintained properly; we decided not to go for this hotel. Since we all were hungry including our childern ; we checked with the restaurant in the hotel if we could have lunch there. Waiter over there told us that we can have lunch .We placed the order for the food and waited for almost 25 mins. After 25 mins we were told that since we are not hotel guests we can not have lunch in the restaurant. After waiting for 25 mins we and our children had to leave the hotel empty stomach. We felt really bad for our kids.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Sorry to hear about your not so good experience in our hotel.We would like to clarify that for bigger families we do have duplex apartments too in our hotel; wherein the entire family can be accommodated. Unfortunately; we were sold out on the day you checked in our hotel; hence; we could not meet your requirements.Furthermore; there was ongoing maintenance with the swimming pool area; which was left un - noticed by you! Since many guests had a dip in our pool. We apologise for the same.We are Sorry for the kids as they were left empty stomach; But to inform you that there is no such condition of not allowing outside guests to have lunch at our restaurant. I apologise; if there has been any mis communication regarding the same! Due to the ongoing season there might have been some loop holes from our side; which we are trying to curb & assure you such mistakes wont happen in the future;We do hope you would definitely give us a chance to show how hospitable our staff over here in Ravine is.Looking forward to see you in the near future..Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Stayed here during the onset of monsoons. One of the most amazing places to stay in Panchgani. The winner was the tennis court which is right at the top of the hill. The restaurant is not that great in terms of of the overall experience. It is understaffed and thus resulting in a poor service. Another factor that puts one off is the frugality of the management. The rooms are par above excellence but I find it hard to digest that our room did not have a ceiling fan and we had to manage with a table fan! Unfortunately; Panchgani was not at its coolest. All in all; a good experience; value for money and stay here for the brilliant view that the hotel offers. Another key tip: Its frequented by celebrities!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The rooms with the valley view are amazing and please opt for the ac
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for your ‘absolutely amazing’ review.We are delighted to read that you enjoyed every bit of your stay and that you were treated and served like ‘royalty’. So much thought; care and preparation goes into our guests stay it is wonderful to be appreciated; and the way you have described your ‘Ravine Experience’ is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day. We have conveyed your positives to the front and back office team and it really does provide true job satisfaction; when our staff is praised with such lovely comments.Thanks again for your recommendations.We all look forward to Welcome you soon in the very near future.With Kind regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Imagine you go to a hill station and there is a famous 'point' to see the beauty of the town; and at the tip of this point is your resort and you get that room which looks over the valley with river; won't it be fun. Ravine Hotel is just that hotel. The view from the rooms towers over every problem you will encounter during your stay. A very decent property near Sydney point is something which you would love. In fact I checked out several other hotels/resorts in Panchgani and none came near this as far as location was concerned. Even the restaurant has a beautiful view so that you can just sit relax and eat your food. Staff of the hotel is helpful but I think they need more training to handle sophisticated travelers. If I have to summarise our stay; these are the points:Pros:Very nice view from your room [you should ask for valley looking rooms]Nicely decorated rooms Nice amenities like tennis court; pool; snooker; swimming; spa etc.Polite staff Cons:Swimming pool was very dirty all the times; they should take care of itreception at the hotel wasn't that great; they could be more politeBed has to be firm and it wasn't comfortable for me for sureDon't know but once you walk towards your room from the lift to any floor; there is some stench smell comes..couldn't find what was that but wasn't very pleasant.But I guess; once you are in the room; you will forget everything cause the view is really breathtaking and you just want to soak in the environment. Will recommend.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Just ask for rooms with a view of valley.

It is wonderful to be appreciated.We have taken into account a few of the short comings pointed out by you and will take steps to ensure that you dont face issues like the ones mentioned.Hope we get a chance to welcome you back where we get a another chance to show how cordial all our staff is.It was a pleasure for us having you as our guest. We are looking forward to welcoming you soon again!With kind regards;Anish K.

Review_Content: we visited last year to panchgani and mahabaleswar from Pune. I would like to highlight that this is the hotel which has the best natural view. we have experience the Sydney point natural view from the hotel window. We have also feel the wind hitting our window .That's really enjoying experience if you dare to experience the nature.Non-veg foods specially Tandoori is good.Staffs are okay .Only thing is you get the reservation in weekend.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank so much for appreciating our property.We are delighted to read your fantastic comments & it gives us a sigh of relief; that we are able to deliver our best to our guests.We look forward to see you again in the coming monsoons.Regards;Anish K

Review_Content: What is good:===========- Excellent location with Breathtaking view of hills; valley and river- V. Spacious and nicely decorated rooms with beautiful architecture and comfortable beddings- Clean and hygienic - Good food- Value for money- Good amenities like tennis; gym; pool; snooker; swimming pool; good children play area; spa etc.What is not good:==============- Liquor is not allowed - Food is at expensive side- Panchgani weather is not as good as that of Mahabaleshwar
Room_Tips: Room Tip: If you are 2 families; you must pick the suite with 2 rooms attached which comes with huge patio wi...

Your positive feedback motivates us to serve our customers even better.We strive to be not just good; but the best. Do plan your trip soon & let us know about it as we would be more than happy to welcome you back again.With kind regards;Anish K

Review_Content: We requested for Jr suite ; on 2'nd floor corner and it was perfect location. I had not imagined such beautiful view from hotel in Panchgani. Rooms are large ; and comfortable. Food is excellent. Staff ; particularly room boys are not trained and overall discipline; behavior needs improvement. Bathroom is basic and fridge and bar not stocked. It is great property ; but needs better maintenance.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: they have tennis courts too;
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank for your feedback following your recent stay at our hotel.We are happy to know you liked our property very much. Few of the short - comings mentioned by you will be taken care & we assure you on your next visit; you will definitely see a change.We look forward to see you soon again at Ravine.Kind Regards;Anish K

Review_Content: Disappointed with the substandard service even though the hotel is the only decent one..exhorbitant room and food rates; no shower curtain; no fridge and no basic amenities and slow service reaponse. The area has better and cheaper options of individual restaurants in the area.The product and services do not justify the rates charged.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Thank you for taking the time to post your review on Trip Advisor.I am sorry to hear your stay was not everything you expected;We are in the process of discussing the next phase of our development which will include all the basic amenities that are required… so watch this space!With regards to the rates charged; we do compare our prices regularly with our local competitors of the same standard and have found that they are competitive. We look forward to host you soon!With kind Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Ravine is a nice property but could be better. A bit confused with this hotel's booking policy- we booked a ground floor premium room (has a mezz floor with a bed/bath) which can easily accommodate 4 adults (we were 2 adults and 2 children (10 yrs and 13yrs)...we had to pay & take one additional bed for some reason. When I inquired with front desk; they mentioned we charge for the kids anyway - well; if you are booking based on the room and not charging for individuals; neither are you providing any extra bed NOR providing any food what's the logic for charging ? Like I said; weird.Only this room has a nice sit out; you can step out and sit in the verandha to enjoy but strangely this was also closed and not opened on request. They claimed; they have closed access from room since last 8 months but no logical answer was provided why so. They mentioned it was due to rats and insects; but they could enter from the open windows as well since it was the ground floor. Would have been a great experience if they had opened this sitout access. The ground floor premium room is best of the lot. You get a view of the mountains from the mezz floor and tennis courts from the ground floor. The valley view rooms are also good and have a great view of the valley; would recommend either one of these rooms depending on group size. Sydney point is right next to the resort and a great place for viewing sunsets.The pool is rather small and usable for kids; adults can just relax but cant swim. They have a play area in the basement with foos ball; table tennis; pool table; carroms...the pool table is chargeable but reasonable cost; rest free. The restaurant has a great view to the valley. In all the three days we were there; there was just two people to take orders and serve...one of the nights it was pretty crowded and we wondered how they would manage. Weekends are usually crowded here. There's no package with food included. Food was good but quite expensive. Couple of bread slices cost 35 rupees....they charge this even with omelettes. With limited manpower; it may make sense to provide buffet services. They have a Spa but didnt get a chance to use it. Saw the spa services menu and it looks quite comprehensive. They charge extra for the AC though the rooms when booked are with AC included. If the rooms are booked with AC included; what's the point in showing it separately in the bill? Maybe it's a good idea for those who dont use it and reduce their bill but it's not made clear when booking. Weird again.Like I said; this resort is nice but with some more \friendliness\" & \"customer engagement\" thrown in; could possibly become one of the best resorts in the area."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Ground floor premium room and valley view rooms are best.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Many thanks for sharing your experience.We value the feedback of our guests; and we appreciate your overall good review about our property!We have taken into account a few of the short comings pointed out by you and will take steps to ensure that you don’t face issues like the ones mentioned. Hope we get a chance to welcome you back where we get a another chance to show how cordial all our staff is.It was a pleasure for us having you as our guest! We are looking forward to welcoming you soon again!With Kind Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Ravine is an overpriced property; where the concept of \Customer is King\" is not bothered withLot of hype; arrogance; right from the time you visit their website. You cannot book online; but need to request them and they shall let you know. When you call them;the attitudeof the guy at the other end is downright rude... As if he is doing you a favor. Oh yes... they are pretty expensive too.. Advantage of hype created over time and no competitionRooms have a great view; but that is the only thing good about them. A/C remote not present; even though you have paid extra for the A/C.When you ask; you get a rude reply that you need to pay first for the services. When I pointed out it was done; they apologized and sent the remote 20 minutes and 2 more calls later. Room service when we ordered some stuff was very prompt though and efficientSwimming pool was not looking clean; though they did offer the facility of warm water in the early mornings for swimming. The restaurant did not have many options in terms of foods or snacks. Very limited; but what was available was of extremely good quality. You got to compliment the chef for the same. Not many activity options thereOtherwise a very unremarkable hotel; charging 6500 a night (very close to the Marriott in Mumbai); but 1/1000th of the ambience and service."

We look forward to welcoming you back soon where I personally ensure you receive the best possible services.Thank you for your comments..Kind Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: This is a hotel with mesmerising view of the valley. Its located at Sydney point; one of the famous attractions of Panchgani. We stayed at the Suite which had two adjoining rooms both with valley view. The property is huge and has many activities within it. There is one major problem though that one has to pay additionally for switching on Air Conditioning. Another negative is the food is very average and nothing to write home about. But nevertheless this is the best property in Panchgani.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Many Thanks for sharing your experience.We value the feedback of our guests; and we appreciate your overall good review about our property!Kind Regards;Anish K | Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “pathetic services with nothing to do in hotel”
Review_Content: Travelling is my hobby and I write about every hotel i visit for my travel. Ravine is unnecessary hype and maybe preferred by people because its the only 2-3 star hotel in panchgani so its kind of monopoly for them. However just 20 kms or 15 mins away is mahabaleshwar which gives immense options of good resports at much cheaper rate and excellent services so i will always recommend people to stay in mahabaleshwar and never at ravine if they dont want to waste money & are looking for good experienceTurn on for hotels 1) Food: The quality and taste of food is excellent however you loose the excitement if waiters dont listen to you and food arrives after one hour2) Spa: The spa services are excellent with well trained staff and amazing ambience and doesnt cost much.Turn off for hotels:1) Rooms: all rooms are differently designed; some big some small etc so you will be lucky enough to get big room otherwise you will feel dissatisfied seeing someone else libving in big room at same price. Valley side view has no view of valley but of the garden in the hotel(i think why its name valleyside and not gardenside). AC will not be working most of the times; TV will have only few channels playing with some or the other error; towels will not be replaced even if you call room serice infinite number of times2) Pool: Pool is a big disappointment. Its only 4 feet deep and so small that if 10 people get into it then even if you move your arm be sure you are going to hit someone. No services are available at pool side may it be food or towels. The pool is in small area and closed from all sides except top so you dont feel much relaxed in such hussle bussle3) Staff: The staff will treat you as if they gave you room in charity and you have to take it in the condition it is. Everytime you visit the reception area; you will see one or the other guest fighting with staff for one or the other issue which is very uncommon even in 2 star hotels. Restaurant has only 2 waiters for seating capacity of over 100 people which means waiter can entertain your order only once in 20-30 mins. Staff tried to cheat us by giving a foam sheet to be used as bed giving the reason hotel is full whereas in reality many rooms were empty. When I argued over same they replaced with a proper extra bed4) Indoor games: Indoor games are on basement in a completely non-maintained area. I would have not imagined a concept of hotel where indoor games are on basement without fans or AC. TT bats are broken; no tools available to play air hockey or european football. The only thing which you could play is snooker which is only 6-10pm that too if you can stand the heat of basement without ac or fan5) Location: Its at the starting of panchgani not near to any tourist attraction or market. There is no grocery or medical shop nearby so you have to take your car 4 km to the market for anything you need. Mahabaleshwar tourist locations are very farI would suggest people not to go by the good reviews written by the travellers as they would have found it good because they would have visited only panchgani(& not mahabaleshwar) where Ravine is the only option. Mahabaleshwar has much better options at much cheaper rates. ravine equivalent hotel in mahabaleshwar will cost you Rs. 2000 only with better services
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Only executive rooms have valley view

Review_Content: My husband heard about this hotel from one of his colleagues. Many film stars also visit this hotel. So we also planned to stay here. Our stay at this hotel was somewhat good and bad too. Good part is that the ambiance of the hotel is good; rooms are spacious enough and best is their room service. Now the bad part; we reached the hotel early so the guy at the reception asked us to wait for an hour. So we waited; but even after 1 hour the room was not ready. We almost waited 1hour 45mins to get the room. When we entered the room; it was smelling bad. Toilets were not cleaned properly; bedsheets was stained! When we asked for room freshener; the guy came with floor mop and with scented floor cleanser. We asked him is there no room freshener? He said we don't have one. They took 1.45mins and did not clean the room properly. I mean such a big hotel with film stars coming to this hotel and such poor maintenance. If you go to restaurant you sit there for 10-15mins and no waiter will come and asks you for order. So room service is best. Also to mention their food is good too.I felt probably if i were a film star i would have been greeted well; my room would have extra clean and I guess rooms would have been available whenever i walked in. In all not a very satisfactory stay; but an okay types stay. I will not visit again.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Select valley facing rooms. Also visit only in winters because a/c is charged in the rooms.

Review_Content: We traveled to Panchagani on 20th April and Stayed in Ravine hotel ; initially our plan was to stay here for one night but looking at the view and overall experience we decided to extent one more day. Though the hotel doesn't provide any special arrangements for birthdays(confirmed by reception staff) the view from the room and the entire property made my day special. Here are the positives and negatives of the Hotel and roomPositive1.Valley plus rooms have awesome view2.The entire resort property is well designed and one can spend time sitting in the premises itself3.Food is tasty4.Reception staff was polite. Negatives1.Restaurant staff have different behavior towards in house guest and outside guests once they know you are in house guest their tone of voice changes ;;its strange but true.2.Food is tasty but very costly 3.They dont serve main course in the room only snacks and starters are available for room service4.There is no doorbell for rooms and the room service staff knocks the door so badly it becomes annoying sometimes. overall I would rate this hotel 7/10 for view and the property.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus rooms have amazing view

Review_Content: We had visited the hotel on 18/04/2014 to 20/04/2012. 4 persons. Ground floor 302 and 303 were available. The room were shown to us. Looked good we chosed 302. While alloting to the room at the reception Mr.Datar were cleary said not refundable. We should have understood then and there that; some issue is there. Once we started staying we understand that their is no ventilation in the room. Rooms were very hot due to no ventilationTo our surprise even the toilets had not ventilation. Outside of the room their is a wall fan which was ensuring that the smell goes in the room. If any one of us used the loo the whole room smells like a Public toilet;.I spoke to Mr.Datar at the reception that room is hot since there is no ventilation and smells.A 3 star hotel there is expectation that these things are explained to us before booking.We would have choosed to take another hotel in that case.We were actually waiting to leave the hotel as soon as possible.

Review_Content: The biggest plus for this hotel is the amazing view that this hotel provides. It is awesome (if you take the valley view premium rooms). I would have rated this hotel higher if I would have found the service better. When we reached after a travel from Mumbai; the restaurant staff seemed rather indifferent to serve. In fact we had to wait for some time before they even cleared the tables for us to sit. That despite; the fact that we had to repeatedly tell them to do so. Granted; we were late; but the attitude of the serving staff was quite cold. That put us off a bit. Though; later during the stay; we did find couple of guys like Kartik and another person; (my apologies for missing out his name; he is from Manipur); who were quite pleasant and seemed quite happy to serve. The hotel has tennis courts/ a basket ball court; so that is quite good if you want to chill out in the hotel itself. In the view there is a common deck for you to sit and enjoy the view of the stars. Food is decent. Did not go to the pool or the spa so cannot comment on the same. Housekeeping and Room service were fast. But yes; the rooms and utilities could do with a lot more refurbishments and upgrade.

Review_Content: The hotel is situated at an amazing place. The staff at the reception were efficient and helpful. Now to the rooms which are nice and clean however; the english comode seems to be a bit high especially for children. There was a bit of a plumbing issue also which was quickly sorted out. The swimming pool was in need of a good cleaning and after a dip in the rather dirty pool we did not want to risk going to the jacuzzi which i think was not working. The observation deck is amazing at sunset perhaps some tea with some snacks there would have made it even more enjoyable but i guess seeing a sun set in its brilliance .. awesome.Breakfast was nice but the service was slow and there was some blotting paper in the curds which we ordered (some quality check needed there as it seems it is something done by many to get a good consistency of curds).If i do go back .. and i will .. it will be for the observation desk especially to see yet another spectacular sunset and a good relaxing massage at the spa.

Review_Content: This hotel is a one-stop destination for a family vacation and relaxation in Panchgani. To start with it has an absolutely majestic view; which includes a view of the Krishna river; Krishna valley and the site where the Krishna and Savitri river merge. It is a very well maintained property. The tent area is well done with some really good flora; outside fireplace and a small beach sand area; among other things. They have an observation deck with a wonderful view of the valley and rivers. This is also a best place to enjoy the sunset. The hotel has good amenities. You gotta love the tennis courts here. Gym room and Game rooms are really good. Nice pool area; though it will be nice to have the Jacuzzi next to the pool to be operational.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Get a room with valley view.

Review_Title: “Excellent view; pathetic service and extremely unfriendly staff”
Review_Content: This was my second trip to the hotel; and must say; the service has deteriorated like anything. The lady at the reception was extremely unfriendly; as if I had done a mistake in choosing the hotel. Since I had paid in advance for a suite room; I had been constantly asking(on phone before the check-in date) if I can choose a room and was continuously refused - can't figure out the reason why. When I checked in; this lady just handed over the keys to me; when I asked if there was any option available - she just replied \that's the only room available\" in a manner - take it or leave it. Incidentally; this was the worst room available I believe - the fridge was stinking; the bed was so soft that if you sit in the corner you will fall down (be ready for a body ache in the morning after a night's sleep); the so called bath tub has a shower panel which was leaking from all sides; you would have to spend an hour to fill water in it due to a pathetic water flow. The room service was pathetic; you have to shout at them to get your room cleaned. The owner and management staff seems to be least bothered about anything happening in the hotel. I just wish the management reads these review to uplift their services - its a great location and awesome view from the room; only if they improve their service and replace those unfriendly staff - this would be a great place to stay."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Suggest you choose a different hotel/resort.

Review_Title: “Located at one of the most picturesque locations”
Review_Content: This hotel was on my \to stay\" list for a really long time. Its perfectly located; their valley plus rooms have a magnificent view that you may not just like to step out. However considering that i and my wife had to visit other locations in mahableshwar and panchgani we opted for the east side room.However if one has time he/she should opt for the valley plus room.Ravine has a huge property with a lot of recreational acitvites; spa; tennis courts; swimming pool; gym; snooker tables and i am sure many moreWe were informed that they have only one restaurant \"Melting pot\".Apparently its only open to house guests.so beware incase you are not staying here you wont be allowed to visit here.The Melting pot faces the valley and one may enjoy the view while eating.the food service is slightly slow; may be that is a way of letting the guests enjoy the viewFood is ok nothing exceptional and is reasonably pricedOne suggestion to the hotel would be to amend their reservation policies. They come across as very stubborn over phone or mail; which is something a client servicing unit should not be doing.Especially since we just walked in and got a room at noon on a saturday; it throws a completely different picture. I am sure during the peak season they must be running a packed house but with change in seasons they need to loosen up on the policiesThe rooms are big and clean and ensure u get the required privacy. Overall a nice place to spend the weekend."

Review_Content: Hotel Ravine .. A Place my wife and i have been going for last 5 years or so .and every time had an awesome and most relaxing time.. As a place panchgani is more of relaxation than sight seeing and if in panchagni nothing better than Ravine .. Nice and courteous Staff; good food;surprisingly nice accommodation at economical price point.Do try to stay at least for a night in the tents; There 5 of them.. and enjoy the jam sessions or endless talks by the Bonfire all night.. I would recommend the hotel to all those who are looking for nice and quite time !! and would Thank you Ravine Team for the time i had ..looking forward for more such stays .. Pratyush

Review_Title: “It made me feel Lion living in the Den....”
Review_Content: Stayed der frm 09 & 10 Feb with family booked executive suite; the valley view was just mind blowing … it was a total paisa wasool hotel. Very clean n quite; the room boys were at their best; the best till I have experienced. Only thing was tat ki reception was not tat responsive we had to remain tem repeatedly evn fr silly things.. Any how it was a nice place to stay frm ma baby to mom evry one enjoyed and made thier trip.. the best were lawns & lift very unique n cool... will be back very sooon; sooooon …HEMANT JAIN - MADURAI

Review_Content: I stayed 3nights last week and was disappointed with what the hotel has turned to as compared to my previous stay since 1999. 1. They have expanded the number of rooms; this has directly influenced the quietness. The corridors are always so noisy and very difficult to get some peaceful sleep. Infact; the valley view plus room for which they charge a premium is bang opposite the sundries room and you would always hear hotel staff conversing and with thin doors it was really annoying.2. The first day I checked in I spend time just getting things fixed; the TV did not work; the shower had no pressure and was chocked; the wash basin had similar problems; there was a persistent could smell in the room.3. They have an additional elevated parking and I can't understand why chauffeur driven cars can't be asked to use this parking and save the one outside the main entrance for self driven cars which makes it so much more convenient for people who drive themselves and move the bags.4. As you first drive in most probably chances are that you would end up driving into the parking and not the hotel entrance. They is no clear sign board that directs you down the slope into the hotel. Most people who first drove in were lost driving into elevated parking area.5. They have a star gazing guy which is great but he operates on a parking slot bang opposite the hotel entrance which is at a premium for guests (considering the hotel owners use few more for their ATVs etc). Cant understand why the star gazing can't happen from the elevated parking are which is usually not busy and offers a clearer view.6. When asked for a universal adaptor; they did not have one. I am sure they have international guests who at some point may need an adaptor and surprised to know thaw did not have any.7. Modern looking shower consoles in the bathroom but not practical. The water pressure is terrible and the amount of water that flows through is not sufficient for a good shower after a long day.8. The booking system is unbelievably traditional. If you called from Mumbai directly to the hotel; you are re-directed to an office in Mumbai who would first ask for your mobile number fro them to call back even before they confirm availability and costs (??). You need to call several time before they mail you the confirmation.I use to love Ravine but following the last week stay; I would never stay here again; its no longer the same.
Response_to_Review: Dear GuestThank you for your review.Trip Advisor is a fantastic tool for our guests to objectively criticize the Hotel; to enable us to improve.I apologize that your experience was below par; that you felt the need to leave such a poor review. We all try so hard and are mortified when we receive any negative reviews.I am sorry to read that you were disturbed by other guests during your stay. I can assure you that regular patrols are carried out on a daily basis by our Night Porter; to ensure any disturbance is kept to a minimum. This is an issue which is not easily controlled but if you had only let us known; we would have immediately rectified the situation; I can assure you this is not a common occurrence.However; we have many different types of room so it is always worth asking to move if something is not quite right and we are keen to ensure guests are comfortable during their stay.I have noted your feedback and will be reviewing it with the relevant departments in the hotel. Our team at Ravine takes great pride in looking after our guests and as such we are disappointed that on this occasion; our high standard of service was not met. Your review does not mention whether you discussed your disappointment prior to your departure however I would welcome the opportunity to do so if you could please contact me directly at the hotel. I hope to meet you soon and am happy to discuss this matter further if you would like to contact me directly at the hotel.Warm Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Idyllic Place to rejuvenate your senses; live your sweet memories and enjoy the thrills of Nature”
Review_Content: I feel great that I choose this place to celebrate my first wedding anniversary!The view the place offers from the room is beyond words. As you walk down the corridor of the hotel; the lighting; decor and smell creates an aura which sets your mood as you step in there. It has two best tennis courts surrounded by extremely well maintained garden; fountains and all. The night offers a great experience sitting on the garden top watching the starry night sky and mountains dotted by small far-away lights. January cold wind does the rest of the magic.For me it a very special day and so it will be the most lingering memory and experience I have.Serenity Spa - must try their deep tissue ayurvedic body massage.....it has remarkable healing effect.Reaching there is also very convenient - driving/ bus( Ravine is a stop for most of the tourist bus)Areas of improvement: service needs improvement; reception desk was not at all welcoming; Melting pot - in house restaurant was pathetic food options; food is tasty though.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus room is the most beautiful and ideal choice
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for your absolutely amazing review.We are delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay and that you were treated and served like 'Royalty'. So much thought; care and preparation goes into our guests stay it is wonderful to be appreciated and the way you have described your 'Ravine experience' is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day.On behalf of the entire team; front office and back of the house I would like to say how much your kind words are appreciated by us all at the Hotel. Im pleased that you enjoyed all of the facilities & services.We all look forward to welcome you back for another relaxing; peaceful stay soon; even if it is just to try a few more of our amazing spa treatments.Thank you once again for all your kind words & suggestions. Looking forward to host you soon in the very near future.With love from us all;Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel; Panchgani.

Review_Content: We had a wonderful stay here. Restaurant is ok and quite expensive. Hotel property is just so amazing.. we didnt mind walking down to the market for a meal. Stayed in one of the valley facing rooms. They have a nice spa and excellent tennis court. Dont forget to carry sports shoes if u wish to play.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. We are obliged to have you stay with us.We value the feedback of our guests; and we appreciate your overall good review about our property; we will take into account few of the short comings pointed out by you and get them worked out.Thanks again for your suggestions. We look forward to welcome you soon again.Warm Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel; Panchgani.

Review_Content: The view from this hotel is fantastic; totally worth the money they charge.. My husband and I had a very pleasant stay as the staff was very helpful. its a 15 min walk from the main market so in a way that was good as the food got digested pretty well. They also have an indoor theatre which was a good entertainer along with the tennis court..Overall a good experience.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for sharing your experience on trip advisor.We are delighted to read that you all thoroughly enjoyed your stay;and found some of our recreational activities to be entertaining.We would love to welcome you soon in the very near future.With Kind RegardsAnish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Good View; Good Rooms; Good Food a little steep but worth it”
Review_Content: Good View.This hotel commands a premium over others in Panchgani and the view alone goes a long way in justifying the price.Good Rooms.Have stayed in the eagle tent for 3 nights; in Mid Jan 2014. It needed some cleaning which the hotel staff were happy to oblige with. The tent offers a nice valley view from its window and a private sit out that has been made on its valley side. Wife loved the whole experience.Good FoodQuality of food served is quite good too. NoteThey do not include breakfast as part of the room tariff.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley view rooms are worth the extra else the hotel experience is incomplete.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for your ‘absolutely amazing’ review.We are delighted to read that you enjoyed every bit of your stay.It is wonderful to be appreciated and the way you have described your Ravine Experience’ is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day. Please do come back and stay with us again in the near future.With Kind Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: This is a nice hotel. Clean rooms / bathrooms; linen etc. So much so that there is an overpowering smell of phenyl in the restaurant. The view from the valley plus rooms is fantastic. Staff is generally cheerful and helpful. Would have given it a fourth star had it not been for the horrible room reservation experience.Another thing to keep in mind is that this is the first hotel in Panchgini when you climb up the ghat from Wai which puts it in one end of the Panchgani / Mahabaleshwar hill station. Away from the hustle bustle of the market area but also means that you have to travel a little extra to go anywhere.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley plus rooms have a great view.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and sharing your overall good experience on trip advisor.We are glad you enjoyed the location and view from the Valley Plus room;We look forward to Welcome you soon in the very near future.With regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with family in Jan 2014. The location is great - not too far from the town (you need to have your own vehicle though) and at the same time; very quiet and peaceful a place to live at. This is located just after you pay the toll fees to enter panchgani; and about 3 kms from the Mapro farm; which is further up on the mahabaleswar road. The rooms (I took the super deluxe ones) overlook the valley; and the view from the window is breathtaking. The rooms are clean and spacious; with all basic amenities. The hotel also has good facilities such as a tennis court; some indoor entertainment etc. The layout of the hotel is nice; with little hidden gems in the property like an artificial waterfall; provisions to have a bonfire etc; which rounds off the overall staying experience. The only improvement I can think of is making the food menu a little more widespread; and try cutting down on the oil levels; which were a tad higher than what I would expect. Overall I would recommend this hotel to stay if you are coming with family.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Take the room on a higher floor overlooking the valley.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine.We are delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay with us.It is wonderful to be appreciated and the way you have described your Ravine Experience’ is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day. Thank you for appreciating our services; room; food and staff. Your words are exceptional; it makes me proud to be the part of this beautiful hotel and team. I have noted your feedback in regards to the food menu and will be reviewing it with the relevant departments in the hotel.Thanks again for your recommendations.We all look forward to Welcome you back in the near future.With kind regards.Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Positives: Good service; nice food (not very spicy) and excellent location.Negatives: very expensive for 31st night and overall service+management is not upto the mark. But if planning for other time then Ravine is very good option for panchgani. All attractions are nearby and within 20kms. Direct road accessibility. Room service is also ok. Found big rat in the room but they said it is not usual and once or twice in the year it happens.We stayed with family in duplex and everyone satisfied.
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Thank you for taking out time to post your feedback on your recent stay with us at Ravine.We are happy to read about all your positive comments & glad that your stay was satisfactory.A few things which you have mentioned; will be taken care off & shall be informed to the senior management.Looking forward to host you soon again.Regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Like i said \Rejuvenate Yourself\". We usually visit Mahabaleshwar every year for a short vacation; and everytime we stay @ Ravine. The check in was very fast as they had all the required documents ready.A refreshing welcome drink was awaiting us .The rooms were quite spacious and nicely done up. Valley View rooms are there for you to have your quite moments and enjoy your tea.The restaurant is very spacious and the food taste & quality is also good.All the staff is very co-operative and helpful.The pool is quite good and the water is clean. Awesome experience; me and my family enjoyed a lot in the resort.Location is excellent; scenic and the Hotel looks clean and well-maintained every time.I'll Strongly Recommend this Place."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Make sure you go for Valley View / Plus Rooms
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for your ‘absolutely amazing’ review.We are delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay and that you were treated and served like ‘royalty’. So much thought; care and preparation goes into our guests stay it is wonderful to be appreciated and the way you have described your ‘Ravine Experience’ is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day. On behalf of the entire team; front and back of house; I would like to say how much your kind words are appreciated by us all at The Hotel. I am pleased that you enjoyed all of the facilities and service including swimming pool.We have conveyed your positives to the front and back office team and it really does provide true job satisfaction .Thanks again for your strong recommendations.We all look forward to Welcome you soon in the very near future.With regards;Anish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Class hotel with valley view and Great value for money”
Review_Content: I had booked a Jr. executive room valley facing; through the contact given on hotel's website and booking was confirmed within 5 minutes. For this pre-booking I had to transfer some amount to hotel's account. After travelling 90 km from pune; we arrived to the hotel. The hotel is situated at the start of Panchagani near to the mountain valley. The hotel premise is pleasant and so is the interior when you enter the hotel. The hotels welcoming staff is friendly; reception is co-operative and we had the room keys in just mere 3-4 minutes at reception. I was thinking that as this is the first honeymoon so everything must be perfect i.e. from selection of hotel and then when entered room it was such a pleasant look and immediately we went to the paper glass wall facing the valley side and that was the moment of \GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY\" :):). Also the room had wonderful bed; sofa set; small fridge;cupboard and a small dinning set to sit out overlooking the Valley. The room service also excellent with quick service and FOOD(especially breakfast and non-veg) is awesome. The overall experience of Hotel Ravine is excellent."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: For a pleasant experience choose jr. executive room valley facing.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for your ‘absolutely amazing’ review.Many thanks for sharing your experience on your recent stay us at Ravine.We are much honoured to know that we exceeded your expectations and that you enjoyed every bit of your stay with us. So much thought; care and preparation goes into our guests stay it is wonderful to be appreciated; and the way you have described your ‘Ravine Experience’ is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day.Thank you once again.We look forward to Welcome you soon again in the very near future.With kind RegardsAnish KadamRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Right!We booked 2 rooms online and after the 24 hour wait; the rooms were confirmed.We then called next day to ask if we could get adjacent rooms; but the operator on the other line said that \it will be on the availability of the rooms and we cannot confirm that; after the initial disappointment right before the trip could start; we got a call from the hotel stating we have an executive room available; which has can accommodate 4 members but will be 490 odd Rs extra; which we obliged.The stay:The moment you enter the room; the view is mesmerising and serene; and you instantly fall in love with itThe food is a little on the expensive side.The reason to rate this review as average is purely on the service elementThe ordeal of getting even the housekeeping staff to clean the room required 5 follow ups and a wait of close to one day as an example.It's a beautiful hotel but the service really needs to raise the bar as it can turn an excellent experience into a turmoil."
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer; Thank you for posting your constructive comments. We are Sorry to know that your stay was below par.I have noted your feedback and will be reviewing it with the relevant departments in the hotel. I am especially disappointed to read about the housekeeping & attention to detail and am sorry that you have left with a average impression.Your review does not mention whether you discussed your disappointment prior to your departure however I would welcome the opportunity to do so if you could please contact me directly at the hotel.We look forward to welcoming you back soon so we can ensure you receive the best possible service and award us with full marks.With kind regardsAnish KRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We usually go away from mumbai on 31st dec ...going by a solitary photo & a stranger's recommendation ; my wife booked 3 rooms here in early sept ... we were really not sure what we were getting into ....should not have worried at all ... pleasant 5.5 hr drive ... excellent location overlooking the valley & the Krishna river basin ... the FRONT OFF was very prompt & helpful [Rathore; Ashwini; Ajay - ever smiling & always THERE for the guests] ... the hotel has 2 sidess - 1row of rooms overlook the road; parking - the other row oveflooks the Valley - obviously CHOOSE the valley side ... 2 categories : VALLEY VIEW & JR ESECUTIVE ... both are spacious & comfy ... the Exec has a fridge & tea/coffee making kettle ... Excellent toileteries in the bathrooms in both ... do not miss the sit out overlooking the Valley ... 2nd floor rooms have a better view than the 1st ...but the BEST part is the FOOD - WOW ! [waiter Nilesh is very good]..the quiet overall service - no'palms sticking out' - prompt room service ..all probably because the owners live on the property & also manage it .... DO GO !!!!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: 2ND Floor facing the valley ... Corner Exec rooms unusually spacious ... Rooms on the side of the Di...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for your ‘absolutely amazing’ review.We are delighted to read that you enjoyed every bit of your stay and that you were treated and served like ‘royalty’. So much thought; care and preparation goes into our guests stay it is wonderful to be appreciated; and the way you have described your ‘Ravine Experience’ is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day. We have conveyed your positives to the front and back office team and it really does provide true job satisfaction; when our staff is praised with such lovely comments.Thanks again for your recommendations.We all look forward to Welcome you soon in the very near future.With Kind regards;Anish KRavine Hotel

Review_Content: I am a regular visitor at the ravine since last six years also i have worked in the hospitality sector at mumbai international airport for 15 years .without any doubt it is one of the best hotel. food is excellent matched by top class room service and fantastic valley view .IF u r lucky u may meet many top bollywood personalities though personally i am not bothered about them. A special mention for Mr Rathod in front office reception avery sweet and helpful person always ready to help. 4/5 points would have given them 5/5 but for the fact dat with this sort of class there is no mini refrigator and no tea;cofee maker and somebody needs to teach the owner to smile atlest to regular guests. tip: a car is must . do have a look at their superb tents . book well in advance to avoid dissapointment as many times they are sold out even during off seasons possibly because of regular film shootings and commercials.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: car is a must kindly book in advance
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback following your recent stay.We are extremely happy to see you as our ‘Regular visitor’ since last six years; which indeed gives us a great assurance about the standard of our services.Thank you for giving Mr. Rathore a special mention; it really does provide true job satisfaction; when our staff is praised with such lovely comments.We look forward to welcoming you back to Ravine soon; where we will ensure you have a mini refrigerator and a tea;coffee maker and award us with full points. With love from us all;Best Regards;Anish KRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “STAY AT THE RAVINE Panchgani's Best Hotel !”
Review_Content: This was my second time at the Ravine Hotel in Panchagni and it won't be my last!! I stayed 2 years ago and the quality hasn't dropped.. If anything it's gotten better!!!The views are amazing ( DO try to book a room with a view.. it's definitely worth it the difference).The Food is AMAZING - My favorites being -…. well everything!The GYM is state of the art - with great quality machines - the best brands and the Personal Trainer is a dear! The family who runs it is lovely and friendly and very worldly and knowledgeable.The Tennis courts are great and there's even one with an amazing view.The tents are being renovated and will offer a \Out of Africa\" experience around a salt water natural pool in the bottom of the garden overlooking the stunning views… There's a man with a huge telescope in the evenings.. and it's wroth looking through it at the Moon as it's an experienced only rivaled by a trip to a big planetarium.I am from NYC and probably one of the only westerners i've ever seen there with a few other friends… but that's the charm of this hotel.. big happy indian families..ok; do maybe bring ear plugs as the indian children seem to be very rowdy til very late in the night… They revamped the boutique and have a lot of trendy things to buy for super reasonable prices!Overall lovely; relaxing; friendly; super value for the money and/... the Serenity SPA has amazing treatments… really adorable spa girls who make you feel right at home with wonderful Aryuvedic treatments and wonderful products you can buy and bring home!If you're' going to the Panchgani area : or if you want a break from the Bombay hustle and bustle STAY At the RAVINE- It won't disappoint!"
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Pick a Room with a view on the ravine.. whatever the difference is; it's WORTH it!
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for staying with us at Ravine and for your ‘absolutely amazing’ review.We are delighted to read that you enjoyed your stay and that you were treated and served like ‘royalty’. So much thought; care and preparation goes into our guests stay it is wonderful to be appreciated and the way you have described your ‘Ravine Experience’ is exactly what we aspire to achieve every day. On behalf of the entire team; front and back of house; I would like to say how much your kind words are appreciated by us all at The Hotel. I am pleased that you enjoyed all of the facilities and service including the gym and spa treatments. We absolutely love it when are guests become our friends; as we are a huge family - our only wish is that all our guests are as lovely as you…Thank you once again for all your kind words and recommendations; we all loved reading it! We would love to welcome you soon in the very near future.With love from us all..Bes Wishes & Regards;Anish KRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We visited Hotel Ravine in the 3rd week of December. This was our 4th trip to Ravine but this is the first time I am posting a review. The view from the Valley View Plus rooms is really soothing and refreshing. We generally make it a point to visit every year as the view of the Krishna river and the valley is breathtaking. The food is really good but slightly expensive. The rooms are neat;clean and well done up especially in the new wing. Room service is also decent. There are 4 tennis courts and a viewing deck used for party purposes. The Serenity spa is also great.This hotel scores over other hotels in Mahabaleshwar and Panchgani for purely location. Hotel staff is courteous and helpful.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the Valley view plus rooms for an expansive view of the Krishna valley
Response_to_Review: Dear Reviewer;Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback following your recent stay.
