We very much value your feedback & appreciate your overall response about our property. Hope to host you soon!! Best Regards;Anish K.Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “Good weekend getaway from Pune and Mumbai”
Review_Content: I had been there in early may 2013. It was a last minute booking that I did directly by making an online payment on their website. Please account for 2-3 days for the confirmation of the booking to come by. On reaching the reception I was cordially welcomed with a soft drink. Teh check in process was smooth and quick. I had booked a Valley Plus room with them. The room was pleasant and had a great view of the valley beyond. The room has a big glass window as one of the walls overlooking the valley. Though i had gone there pre monsoon time; I would think it would be a great view in the rains with the hills lush green. It was not bad either as of now.The food service in the restaurant was a bit slow though cant complain since it has a great view of the valley. Unfortunately; I think the food quality has dropped a lot. In my previous visits to their restautant i simply loved the food there. But not this time around. Its a good idea to order for food in the room too.The hotel has a very good ambience with lots of facilities - pool; children play area; Lawn tennis courts (4 of them); SPA; etc.One thing that I didnt quite like were the huts that they so marvel as their USP. Somehow I felt they were not that well mantained. Also during nights it seemed that the approach to the huts were not well lit - this could be by design since people would want to have privacy. The Birds eye one was a total No No. It was scary to qualify - though i visited in the afternoon; i couldnt imagine how folks would be there in the evenings; etc. Pretty secluded place at that.Otherwise if the idea is to have some bit of fun with children; I would think its an ideal place.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley plus rooms were good. I was in 218 i think.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Many thanks for sharing your experience. We are obliged to have esteemed Guest like you to stay with us. We value the feedback of our guests; and we appreciate your overall good review about our property; we will take into account a few of the short comings pointed out by you; and try to get them resolved. We are looking forward to welcoming you soon again!!Best Regards;Anish K.Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “Very small swimming pool and pool facilities Very badly maintained”
Review_Content: Poolside umbrellas broken. The shower rooms has discarded stuff filled in. The steam room not working & closed. Common pool shower room for men & women. Only one.On rooms- the valley facing exec rooms are very nice.On service - dont expect too much.facilities - other than pool- looks good

The pictures and reviews seemed favourable however; I was utterly disappointed by the callous and uncouth customer service. These guys probably need to start by understanding what hospitality means! The reception (or whoever attends the enquiries) have no clue of what the booking position is. I had called up the hotel desk to enquire about availability and I was assured the same. They insisted on online booking which at best an outdated system which charges the money upfront without any confirmation of availability. If the person running the desk doesn't have clue; what else one can expect of the system. Garbage in garbage out! After charging the money the system promises to send a confirmation within 24 hrs. After the payment; I again called up the desk who repeated the same message. Such is the inefficient system that even after 48 hrs letter there was not any response. When I called up again; one Mr Bahadur (yes I asked the name this time which I know through bitter experience one must everytime you call up this place) for a change accepted that he has no clue what he is doing at front desk. But in his brilliant sense of humour he says that the customer knows who's has a booking why do I need to know. He says that the only hope I have is certain all mighty \Mr Rathod\" (rowdy aptly). I managed to get an audience with this sample after 72 hrs after they took money from me. He rudely informs that there are no rooms for my booking. When I told him about confirmations from front desk he asks me name of the person. As if by knowing the name by some magic new rooms would open up. So lesson for anyone looking to book: ask the name of the person you speak to else that idiot will potentially ruin your holiday. After three calls to Mr \"rowdy\" Rathod; he says the cancellation mail has been sent as if he has done a big favour to me. I am now truely impressed with \"Google's intelligence (which is definitely higher than the Ravine staff) cause it directed that email to its right place \"SPAM\". I dont know when these idiots will refund my money. The whole attitude of the so called manager and staff is unfit for being into hospitality business. So travellers beware when you decide to risk your holiday with Hotel Ravine!"

We had a pleasant 2 night stay at this resort. The resort is located right at the beginning of Panchgani; right on top of the Valley. Most of the rooms have the valley view with crazy breeze blowing the entire time. Around 4 tennis courts for the tennis enthusiasts. Mapro is 10 min away from this place. You can also drive to Mahabaleshwar in 25-30 min. Drive is quite smooth. Go on a weekday if you really want to enjoy the peace and calm.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Ask for the valley view rooms !!
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your wonderful review. It is because of the kind appreciations and encouraging reviews that we receive from Guest like you; we endeavor to give our best every time. Do not forget to visit our Art Gallery on your next visit. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Have visited Mahabaleshwar & Panchgani plenty times in the past; but this was my first time with Hotel Ravine. We stayed here for 2 nights in Valley Plus room & was totally impressed with the view from our room; overlooking the entire valley & dam waters. The restaurant \Melting Pot\" boasts delicious food & valley view thruout; although slightly expensive. Check-in was quick for 1 room; but had to wait for 20 mins for our 2nd room. But it dint really matter much. You may get a glimpse of bollywood celebrities if you are lucky enough. We did see SRK; Dipika Padukone & Rohit Shetty; as the entire cast & crew of \"Chennai express\" were accommodating here. The area where the tents are located is absolutely superb. You spend ample & quality time strolling the entire property. The swimming pool is kinda cornered & not clean. Even the surroundings near the pool isnt maintained too well. The indoor games area looked impressive; but the carrom board & table tennis had problems; viz. rough board; uneven surface. The rooms were decently spaced & above all very clean & so was the bathroom. The bathroom door was partly worn out; but the cleanliness & room view compromises with all minor issues. Very much recommended for families & absolutely VFM... will stay again in future."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley plus room boasts a great view.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your 'marvellous' review and for recommending our Hotel. We are glad to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. It is because of Guests like you; that we ; at Ravine - endeavor to give our best everytime. Thank you once again for bringing the minute issues to our notice. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “dont think any other hotel gives u such an amazing view”
Review_Content: heard a lot abt this hotel some 2yrs back and finally planned it last week.my first visit and was definitly worth it. spectacular view; nice interiors; good service; and large and well maintained property to name a few.will defntly visit again . keep it up guys u deserve a thums up.thanks for making my trip a memorable one. all d best..
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your wonderful review. It is because of the kind appreciations and encouraging reviews that we receive from Guest like you; we endeavor to give our best everytime. Do not forget to vist our Art Gallery on your next visit. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Ravine is really the palace of winds...lovely interiors...helpful staff and beautiful views. Parking is at 2 levels and is ample. We drove to Panchgani from Pune and the hotel lies just before you enter the Panchgani city and immediately after the city checkpost. It was the rainy season July 2012 and we stayed in the East Side Room. Unfortunately there was no great view from the room. However; when you keep the windows it brings in lovely winds inside which refresh you immediately. The other side has an amazing view of the valley and the hotel is located at the foot of Sydney point. The only issue was the hotel did not allow food inside the rooms. The staff was a little confused about this policy. Else; it was one of the best budget hotels I ever visited.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Make sure you stay in the Valley Side rooms to get a breathtaking view and lovely fresh air.Talk...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your 'excellent' review. Apart from the beautiful view from the rooms; we also have a mesmerizing view from our Restaurant 'Melting Pot' ; and so to encourage our Guests to enjoy this view we do not provide meals in the rooms (only snacks available). We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: this is my hotel of choice when in Panchgani for location location and space. This was our second visit and though the experience was at par with the last; there is a lot of scope for improvement. Firtsly i think the management truly needs to freshen up the hotel; its rooms and amenities provided. (Wondering what the rooms where the big stars stay look like) . The spa is at par with many five star spas in Mumbai. The staff sometimes gets too bogged down by the stars which they cater to and ignore the rest ; but still they do a good job. The restraunt serves good food. But there are options like Jaffer Bhai's ; Lucky Cafe and Starwberry Inn. But the staff at the restraunt is really attentive . The childrens park is excellent. The flora and fauna well kempt . The star gazing through a 1000 mm telescope in the night with a local person (dont remember his name) who is so enthusiactic about the space is a must do. Truly would like to see some change in the overall ambeinec of the hotel next time i visist and visit i surely will ! All the best!

I had been to Ravine for the last 3 days. It's a hotel that is at a very good location. They have nice little rooms overlooking the valley and it is a pleasant sight when you wake up. The stay was not one of the best ones but maybe I would rate them at 6.5 on a scale of 1 to 10 with 10 being the best.This hotel must have been a very good hotel in its prime but now I feel it is just a shadow of what it must have been earlier. The food; though expensive is just \OK\"; though when you have a Jaffer bhai's Delhi Durbar just around the corner who will eat here. They had those normal problems that you have with a poorly managed hotels; for e.g. problematic flush that works only when twisted in a peculiar style; lots of used bed sheets; towels kept in the corridor etc. Hardly any attention to detail ;for e.g as I had my son with me and an extra bed was required and though informed well in advance; we had to call them to set it up; extra bathroom accessories were not kept etc. I was there when SRK; Deepika and Rohit Shetty were also staying here and so obviously the focus was more towards them. I was surprised that they were giving super attention to one junior extra - (normally acts as a dark monster in films and gets bashed up by the hero every now and then). While at the breakfast table no one even came to take up the order while all the waiters and other staff were busy clicking picture with this monster and I had to leave the hotel and have breakfast some place else.It might be slightly better if there are no film actors around. Please confirm before going.The best place in the hotel was their Spa. It was a very nice experience and me and my wife really enjoyed it. I recommend you try it once."
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your positive review and recommending our Hotel. Though our Hotel is very popular ; our services remain the same for all our esteemed Guests. We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you during your stay and assure you that you would not have to face these issues again. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We had a superb stay at Ravine; pleasant staff; good food and ambience.very relaxing; should plan to go back in peak season. Was disappointing that paragliding was banned. We request that safety measures be deployed at the earliest and to start the service soon.Jayashree
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Bathrooms have to be more spacious; but they are clean and very well maintained
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your Positive review. We are glad to know that you have enjoyed your stay with us. Although; due to unfortunate incidents; paragliding has been shut down. But we do have other entertainments at our Hotel Ravine; where one can watch a movie in our Movie Theartre or play indoor/outdoor games. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We choose to stayed at wooden hut (Eagle's Tent 505) thinking of a different experience. View from the hut was amazing. It was nicely clean and bathroom was fairly clean as well. There was a small fire place next to hut and a sitting area. Food at hotel was good. Hut was equipped with TV which was mostly showing free channels. Service was poor we ordered for fire wood at 7 pm which we couldn't got till 9 pm.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your positive review. We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you during your stay with us and assure you that you would not have to face these issues again in future. Thank you for bringing this matter to our notice. We look forward to welcome you soonWarm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Stayed in valley plus room at this hotel; which has the best view. The service is at par. Food except for breakfast is mind blowing compared to other eateries at panchgani. Hotel property is old but very well maintained. The best part of this hotel is its versatility; hats off to the owner for such an amazing sense of planning. It offers u all entertainment under 1 roof & a variety of rooms to choose frm. Visited in march & the crew of upcoming movie Chennai express was also staying in the hotel at the same time. Meeting Shahrukh khan and Rohit Shetty was an icing on the cake. Would definitely come here again soon. I would recommend them to start an annual membership program.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Undoubtly go for valley plus rooms.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your 'Superb' review and ratings to our Hotel Ravine. We are very glad to know; that once again; we have succeeded in serving the best to our Guests. We look forward to welcome you again during the Monsoon Season; which again; reveals another beauty of Panchgani.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “An old hotel in a good location”
Review_Content: Ravine is an old hotel near Panchgani having good views.preferred by lot of bollywood stars.its a paradise for Tennis lovers as it houses 5 world class tennis courts. However it lacks a lot of basics.the toilets in the rooms do not have an exhaust.the bathroom is very basic.The rooms have old box tv which do not work. If at all you are fortunate/unfortunate that a bollywood star and their crew is staying there; the differential treatment will be highly visible and may possibly be a nuisance for other hotel guest.the hotel is a 30 minutes drive from Mahabaleshwar

i travelled with my family to panchgani and stayed at this hotel just for 24 hours;as ours was a short trip..we got an room with an excellent view;probably the best.staff and service was excellent. had the opportunity to use the spa;the therapies and therapist were reallly good;professional...The best thing about this hotel is its location and the view one could get...The rooms were well maintained.They certainly need to improve on the food aspect;it is nothing to write home about. I would say the food was average. but if you just overlook this one aspect;i would rate this property as absolutely great place..would definitely recommend and plan to visit again for a longer duration.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your Amazing review and ratings and for appreciating our services provided. At Ravine; we endeavor to perk-up our services towards our Guests consistently. We look forward to welcome you back again soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We stayed her from 3/13 to 3/15; really enjoyed the nice view and good food at restaurantThis is one stop shop kind of hotel; you have everything (tennis courts/ gym/ swimming pool/kids play area/ tents/ SPA/ conference halls) you need to lay back and enjoy.Frequently visited by film shooting; you might get to shake hands with who's who of Bollywood
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book Valley view/ Valley plus/ Jr. Executive to have great view of mountains and river Krishna
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your wonderful review and rating. We are obliged to have guest like you; who inspire us to give our best in serving our valued guest. We look forward to welcome you soonWarm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: The property is really old...but the restaurant view and the view from the rooms is to die for. So is the food here. The room rates are pretty decent for the kind of location..but the terrible condition of some of the bathrooms is the worst and probably the only bad thing about this place.The rooms facing the valley have such an excellent view. More so the location is just at the entrance of Panchgani..so you are not in the fish market called Mahableshwar.The garden facing rooms premium ones ..have a nice little covered lawn which is almost like your own private area..is just awesome if you arent so keen on the view.Overall great value for money...most of the celebrities and film shooting crew on a tight budget stay here...so you will occasionally see their human forms also.All in all a great place. The restaurant is Veg n Non Veg but they also serve some great Jain Punjabi Food.All in all can keep going here..
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The garden side rooms - 2 pairs of connected rooms are the best if you want to enjoy the lawn. Its a...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your 'Marvellous' review. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve ourselves to cater your needs. We are glad to know; that once again; we succeeded in our services towards our Guests and look forward to welcome you again for another ‘Breath-taking Experience’Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Our stay in Hotel Ravine for four days was very pleasant and a very good experience. The location of the hotel is so beautiful that it offers many picturesque views from the huge area that the property consists of. The rooms were spacious and clean and offered great views. We had an added pleasure of having SRK and Deepika staying at the same time in the hotel.... Only the food is priced high and is not so good... that department needs to be improved pronto...it is advisable to eat out. Otherwise; great place and would definitely like to stay there again!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Corner suites have more room and better views....avoid tent accomodation
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your wonderful review. We are glad to know that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us; while cherishing the Ravines of Panchgani. Your helpful opinions are always welcomed as we endeavor to enhance our services towards our esteemed Guest.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: my review is late but i have to share with tripadvisor family...i have stay in this resort 3 times all in mansoon ..last time i visit this property in sep 2012 and stay in premium duplex with my wife and 2 grownup children....from chek in to chek out every thing is perfect staff is very good n poilte i want to mention 2 names specially 1st mr rathod and 2nd mr ganesh (waiter) very help full n always try to make ur stay comfortable....ONLY thing they have to improve in food taste (food is ok) but not up to the mark.....over all beautiful resort and best in panchgani.

Review_Content: good place. nice room. a lot of film stars come and stay here and we were lucky with SRK and deepika.its a cosy hotel and food is fine. we enjoy going on weekends. their food is priced high and not that great though .we wanted to extend a day and they never got back to us. eat out if possible.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: take the valley facing rooms

We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you during your stay and assure you; you would not have to face these issues again. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve our services towards our Guests.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: The only one plus point for Ravine is their Room decor and ; view from the valley side/Plus rooms..thats it; reception is welcoming; but not warm and smiling enough..smile is somewhat not present in Ravine; though i do not complain regarding their service ; but a hotel with smiling staff definitely is my first choice..also ; it appears they are quite obsessed with the visit of the suprestars of bollywood..may be thats one reason they know they have class; and that reflects ..also ; in the restaurant \melting Top\" everything is so highly priced; atleast 3 times higher ; a plain omplette for 70 rs/-?? also they do not allow outside food; drinks ..Melting Pots food is good but not excellent; also 3 Gulabjamun (of diameter 2 cm) costs 90 rupees?? we had a lot of kebabs; and they were good..we wanted to extend a day ; and the person at the desk said he would inform us if available; but never did..it seems they are pretty confidentabout their ongoing reservation..i personally like smiling people; 80% of the staff in Ravine do not smile; did not try the Spa so cant tell..they are prices around 300 to 2500 more or less...near ravine; at 1.5 km walking dtstance; there is Panchgani Market; where you will get more options for lunch; dinner; sizzler etc..all have atleast 50-60 rs price lower than that of Ravines own restaurant Melting pot..we are now in Mahabaleshwar Shreyash; where 80 % of people are very warm and smiling... smile makes your holiday ultimate...so if you do not bother regarding warm smile; over priced food..but want to have the most spectacular room view available in panchgani..Ravine is the place...in off season room rent were half (around 2200 -2800 rs)..but in season its just twice...post monsoon is the season by the way...room service was quite prompt...respected privacy..but cant bring food;drinks to your room....they will definitely take it seriously; Ravine has a terific spectacular view from the rooms..but its not for me..who also likes to cherish holiday in a warm; smiling enviaronment....So all in all; great room view of the valley..rest of everything; nothing special; and something over over priced too..Also the beds were very very very soft; and it hampers sleep quialuty..."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley plus ; it is a room where you get view of the complete valley; in valley side room you will g...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your review and bringing these matters to our notice. At Ravine; ; we constantly endeavor to improve our service and hospitality. Please be assured; we will ensure that you feel more welcome the next time you are visiting our “Home” Hotel. We are training our staff to provide more smiles per hour… :)Warm RegardsGeetaHotel Ravine

Review_Content: It was a great time we spend in hotel. Loved the concept of duplex rooms. Quick room service n total hygine. Film stars too stay here n if u are lucky then u can see thm in front of u. And the best part is tht its near to market still away from noise.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: We stayed in 310.... duplex room with private balcony n private way to swimming pool.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guests; Thank you for your helpful review. We are glad that you could utilize the best out of our services provided. We would like to recommend to try out our cozy Tents; which is now opened up for our valued Guests till May. We look forward to welcome you soonWarm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: A friends positive recommendation about Ravine Hotel in Panchgini made me to surf more about the place and call them up for reservations for my upcoming March2013 holidays. I ended up calling them on the +91 2168 241060. I was answered by a rude and uncivil voice at the other end. The call was placed at around 14pm which is neither too early in the day nor too late. Not that time really discounts such a terrible response. The person was insensitive and unconcerned. I asked to check for rates; availability and arrangements. He was absolutely cold and kept insisting on me mailing them the requirements. When I insisted that I need to speak to some person who can really help me plan my holiday; the call connection went blank! Now I am in two minds!!!
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for bringing this matter to our notice. At Ravine; we constantly endeavor to improve our service and hospitality; Comments like yours; help us improve and alert us of issues we can improve on. Once again; Thank you for your honesty and Candor. Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We booked this hotel after rave reviews about the view from its rooms and were not disappointed. Although we went in February and the ravine it overlooks wasn't very green; it still is a beautiful view to have when you wake up in the morning and during monsoons it sure will be beautiful. Other than this hotel's staff was good and service was prompt. All facilities are available although of average level. All in all hotel is worth the money and ensures a pleasant stay. Also; hotel's restaurant cooks delicious food; one don't need to eat anywhere else.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Junior executive rooms have wall-size windows on two sides and have great view.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for positive review and for appreciating our services. Yes; most of the rooms at our Hotel do have 'Breath-taking' views. We are obliged to have guest like you; who inspire us to give our best in serving our valued guest.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: I visited Panchgani in second week of Feb-13 and my friends suggested Ravine to stay. The best part of the hotel are rooms which are having excellent view of the valley. However; room size is bit cramped....but view covers all other shortcomings. There are very few options to eat out near the hotel and the restaurant is quite overpriced. Another problem is there is no room service for serving food in the rooms and one has to go down even for having a cup of tea. Hotel is having excellent tennis courts....however other indoor sports are not well maintained by the staff. Overall i liked the place only due to valley view from the room...............
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your positive review. As seen; most of our rooms have the views of the beautiful valley. We also have an 'Amazing' view from our restaurant; where one can enjoy not only the view but also the ambience & music along with food; and so we do not provide meal service in the rooms. Thank you for bringing the other matters to our notice. It is because of guest like you; we at Ravine; constantly strive to improve our services.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We stayed in the Valley View Plus room for 2 days. It was a wonderful experience with panoramic view from the room. The staff were very friendly and helpful. One experience that I would like to highlight is that I needed a kettle in my room and the guests staying valley view plus room are not provided with it. Nilesh got us a brand new kettle to my room in no time. Really appreciated. It was my wedding anniversary and luckily we got to see the King Khan. Staying in the hotel; you will definitely get some surprises. One thing that can be improved is the variety of food in the restaurant. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and family. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your 'Amazing' review. We are indeed; overwhelmed; with your response towards our service to you.Your helpful opinions are always welcomed as we endeavor to enhance our services towards our Guests.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Visited in Second Week of Feb 2013.Visited Panchagani for the first time with family and Ravine Hotel was undoubtedly the best possible choice i could have made.Visited in feb; though not in winter; the weather was pleasant enough for the stay.Rooms; Service; Location; Food.. Name it and you will get the best you can think of.Chose this hotel through the reviews on Trip Advisor and glad that i have chosen this hotel.Pros: Chosen Valley Plus Room (Was offered for 1st floor;i insisted on the second floor; was lucky that it was available). The View is just the way shown on the Site (Check out the Photos).The Service is prompt.The Staff was very cooperative. ( Had read a lot about the behaviour of certain staff in the other reviews; i didnt come across any such person).The Food @ Melting Pot is Good. (Charges on higher side!)Tennis Court; Game Zone; Play Area; Garden; Gymnasium etc available.Spa Service is Excellent.Ample Parking Space.Improvements Required.1. Tea / Coffee Maker in the Room.2. Refrigerator in the room.3. Bath Tub.4. Unlucky to find the Jaccuzzi and Swimming Pool not for Use.Though the above are add ons; and can be overlooked for the rest of the services offered.Do visit the following places during your stay @ Panchgani:1. Mapro Garden - Visit in the Morning - Before 10 am to avoid rush and to enjoy the fresh Strawberrys.Strawberry and Ice Cream is the Best Serving Here. Dont miss it !2. Amusement Park; there are couple of them: Visited On Wheelz; Good Place for Kids to enjoy.3. Boat Ride @ Krishna River - Wai - Dont Miss it ! Visit early Morning or early Evening. This is an unforgetful experience. Overall an excellent Choice of Location and Hotel and Looking for visiting this place again.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Should Stay in Valley Plus on the Second Floor !
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your 'Superb' review.. We are indeed; overwhelmed; with your response towards our service to you and would like to specially thank you for your recommendation to; not only visit Ravine; but to also explore the ravines of Panchgani.Your helpful opinions are always welcomed as we endeavor to enhance our services towards our Guests.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Hotel is good; room tariff is not as per their website.”
Review_Content: It was a pleasant stay at Hotel Ravine.Hotel is nice in terms of location and good in terms of service.But quite strange is that the way they charge you. As per information on their website (http://www.ravinehotel.com/tariff.php#) if you check in at 5.00 A.M. they charge you for a half day.In my case I checked in at 6.00 A.M. Saturday morning and checked out at 9.45 A.M. Sunday morning so as per their website they were supposed to charge me for 1.5 day but somehow they charged me for 2 days.Request them to update their website if they have any different rules for Saturday and Sunday.Thanks;Mahesh
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley side would be a good option.

Review_Content: I was in ravine in last year's monsoon season(July).Din't get the valley plus room but still one could have great views from various points inside hotel compound.Weather was just great ....windy;foggy;misty.Service was good but food was costly.My suggestion is try ur best to get valley plus rooms so that u can enjoy the best offering of this hotel and that is LOCATION.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Always go for valley plus rooms........
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your helpful review. We are glad to know that you have enjoyed your stay with us. On your next visit; we would like to recommend you to try out our Tents which is available only from November to May. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Perfect destination to relax among the winds...”
Review_Content: Had been to this tranquil place as a part of our 1st anniversary celebration. Thank you Tripadvisor for your honest reviews. As mentioned by fellow reviewers; the location just wins over everything else. Service was superb right from booking till check-out. We were at Room No.209 (Valley Plus).The serenity spa is worth visiting with it's various treatments (though everything mentioned on their list was not available as the particular staff was not present). Secondly; the Melting Pot Restaurant is awesome with the quality and taste of food (though it is a bit on the expensive side). The do have small Swimming pool; Gym & Games room (they charge for games except TT & Carrom). The Art gallery on top floor is worth noticable.The only problem we had was due to the renovation work. The continuous noise of drilling throughout the day which disturbed the otherwise peacefull afternoon & it did'nt stop even after requesting to the reception twice. Overall a nice experience & recommendable.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: 2nd Floor Valley Plus Rooms are recommendable for overall view.

At Ravine; we endeavor to perk-up our services towards our Guests consistently. We look forward to welcome you back again soonWarm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Good Property.Value for Money.Only Food was Expensive and Slightly Spicy Food.They Have Tennsi Court and BAsket Ball Court.They have Game room also Swimming Pool.Ample Car parking is availabale.Good Property.Value for Money.Only Food was Expensive and Slightly Spicy Food.They Have Tennsi Court and BAsket Ball Court.They have Game room also Swimming Pool.Ample Car parking is availabale
Room_Tips: Room Tip: All rooms are Good.We stayed 4 Bed Room.Two Bed at Topfloor in same room
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your positive review. We are glad to know that you have enjoyed your stay with us with your family. We look forward to welcome you back again soonWarm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Panchgani is one of my fav hill station destinations. Staying at Ravine hotel with its amazing view is the cherry on top of the cake. I checked in on a Monday and all the valley side rooms were full. However managed to get the valley plus room on floor 2 on my second day. As usual great view and the recent renovations to the hotel have made it even better. A special mention about the serenity spa. Good therapy and even better therapists. All in all a beautiful and relaxed stay. Keep it up guys ! Highly recommended for a quick getaway.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley plus rooms on the second floor.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest Thank you for your 'Splendid' review. We are indeed; overwhelmed; with your response towards our service to you and would like to specially thank you for your recommendation to; not only visit Ravine; but to also explore the ravines of Panchgani. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm regardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: The hotel is located right at the entrance of panchgani so to say and its at sydney point. The view from the rooms facing the valley are better than the points themselves. its cozy and comfortable with all eminites that we desired. The staff was friendly and the service was prompt. The best part was the spa and the \Blissful back\" message and the fact tht we got to meet madhuri dixit there was an icing on the cake. Its a place to go to if you need a break from busy life ; especailly for mumbaikars; me being one knows wht u must be feeling. They have tents too for those who like to be a bit closer to nature than i do. Its a nice view again and unlike the names they are actual wooden cabins. My fav one is the eagle's cabin which has a barbeque spot n the best view of the valley. A tent for four is also available for the family. Its best to check out their site for pictures and these pictures dont lie. In short its a great place to be at an affordable price and an amazing view.. well worth every penny. I have recomended this place to all my frnds already and i wld definitely recomend it to anyone who wants to go to panchgani."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley side rooms are all fantastic but do book in advance cause the hotel was full even during mid...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your ‘Mesmerizing’ review and for recommending Hotel Ravine. Yes; Panchgani is a place where one would be lost in its Beauty. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. It is because of esteemed Guests like you; who encourage us to give our best of the services to our Guests. We look forward to welcome you back again.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: The hotel has a great view. I see that the owner is hands on but there is still a lot of improvement that can be done. Our room had great view. But there are 2 things which really through me off. 1) I found bed bugs on my bed at night. 2) they have an a/c in the room but not remote and when you call for remote you are told that its chargebale 600/- a night. No doubt its winter season and you really don't need but I would have liked to be told while checkin timeRegarding food frankly I didn't bother to try since I had read other reviews.The hotel has been developing but I feel there is no consistency. A lot more can be done in maintaning the place. I would still give it another try just for the location.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your positive review. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve our services for our esteemed Guests. Thank you for bringing these matters to our notice and we assure you; you would not have to face these issues again in future. We look forward to welcome you soon.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: What a location. Breathtaking view from the room. Like a dream come true. Really enjoyed our stay. Ample space to chill out with excellent facilities. The restaurant food is reasonable and Excellent. Reception staff were cooperative. Only drawback : no kettle for tea/ coffee; cost you nothing but makes our life easy especially during early mornings. Otherwise all fantastic.Awesome hotel.Will definitely come back.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your positive review. We are glad to know that you have thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve our services and your suggestion has proved valuable to us. We look forward to welcome you back again soon for another 'Breath-taking' experience.Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “The Ravine at Panchgani The Perfect Holiday Getaway in The Lap of Nature”
Review_Content: For the said budget; I wouldn't say it is ONE of the best hotels but in fact; The Best one at Panchgani-Mahabaleshwar. Will also give it bonus points for the breathtaking mountainous view it offers of Panchgani from its suites. Firstly; the suites are par excellence and well maintained. The food is even more appealing with its versatile menu and awesome taste from a chef whom you'll want to take home.. Without further sounding overrated with praise; I'd like to share some videos of this amazing property; with the surrounding scenic beauty captured in every detail. Check it out for yourself: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mjf71nl8MkA
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for writing a ‘Marvelous’ review about us. We are glad that you cherished and enjoyed your stay with us with your family. It is reviews like these which revitalizes and enlivens us; at Ravine; to deliver our esteemed guests; the best we can.Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Don't you just hate it when you are at a restaurant or a lounge and you get really shoddy service because everyone is engaged in entertaining a VIP/celebrity who happens to be there at the same time. 'Give him/her all the VIP treatment you want but please not at my expense'. Something similar occurred during our stay at Hotel Ravine.We were 2 couples and an infant and we stayed there for 3nights and 4days; our last night there happened to be the Christmas eve. SRK; DP & the production crew were staying at the hotel. The first few days were uneventful. However; on Christmas Eve; it all began. To start with; they cordoned off the entire garden/ kid's play area in the evening; saying that it has been reserved for their private party. That leaves you with very little option but to return to your rooms. We were planning to start early next morning to beat the city traffic (I was driving) on the way back. But then their private party started. Music which started at around 10pm went on till 2am in the night! (Even Goa shacks shut earlier) This was accompanied with a lot of 'karaoke' howling. (C'mon this is a family resort or so I thought). We called twice at the reception to atleast request them to tone it down; but with no luck. Then our friend's infant got cranky with all the noise and disturbed sleep and it turned out to be a very groggy Christmas morning and a tiring journey back for us. The next day when I wanted to convey my angst to the owner; I was told at the reception that he doesn't have time for such small things. Talk about hospitality business! (After a lot of insistence; I finally did get to speak to one of the owners. To his credit; he did apologize for it) Everything else about the stay was overshadowed by this...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; unfortunately this was one of the times at the Ravine; that the good times “did” get out of hand; it was supposed to be a quiet get together for the Crew of Chennai Express to relax and enjoy Christmas together; unfortunately the crew did not end the entertainment at a decent hour. The management ensures that the hotel is a family venue and we don’t take issues like this lightly. It was brought to the owners attention and in future events like these will be planned carefully so that Our Main Stars “our guest” get what Ravine is known for “Good Service and Relaxation”.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: The view (photograph added) as mentioned repeatedly; is really great. Have stayed at Ravine many years back and it was nice to note that they have re-done all the rooms. Lovely stone+wood combination in the rooms. Super clean too.A special mention about the booking process..It was the long Christmas weekend and they have a policy of booking the room for a minimum of 2 rooms during such a time. But; noticing that we were returning visitors - they made an exception and allowed us to book for just 1 day.The hotel compound is spectacular. Apart from the regular rooms; they have wooden cabins perched in the valley below. They've built an artificial pond with sand which gives it a pretty cool feel. The pond needed to have been cleaned though; some guests were using it to dispose off packets of biscuits and wafers.The Spa is really great. The 'blissful back' massage was fantastic. Complete value for money.What was a major let down was their restaurant 'Melting Pot'. One of the main reasons for us to come back to the Ravine was their restaurant. This time around it was really really disappointing. It lost the cozy abode-in-the-hills feel about it and the new decor completely lacked character. The tables were rather huge and they are not meant for couples or groups of 2-3. The waiters had a disappointing attitude - almost as if they hated working there. None of them were smiling. The food too was not up to the standards we'd experienced before.If you love a leisurely game of Tennis; then Ravine is definitely the place for it. They have 4 tennis courts here! Tennis is/was a huge passion of the owners. Their sons player professional tennis. I wonder if they also have a Tennis club associated with the hotel.Note:WiFi - Available only in the lobby. Wish the rooms had WiFi connectivity too; as 3G (Vodafone at least) coverage is absent in the Panchgani/Mahabaleshwar area.To sum it up; a near perfect weekend getaway for people from Mumbai and Pune.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: I don't know anyone who would want to stay at the Ravine and not want a room with a view of the...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your ‘Marvelous’ review. We are currently in the process of upgrading the WiFi connectivity at our Hotel; which would cover all the rooms. Your helpful opinions are always welcomed as we endeavor to enhance our services and we are truly obliged to have Guests like you; who inspire us to give our best to our valued Guests.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: Pluses : a. View View View. b. Efficient room service c. Good room furnishings and layouting d. 4 tennis courts in the clouds.. e. Good reception ( check in and check out service). Be Careful About / Can be improved:  a. No Internet Connectivity / wi-fi at rooms b. Breakfast and other meal menus (more options can be provided). c. Overheard conversations from the adjacent room through a common door( locked ofcourse)Surprises- Some celebrity check-ins.. ( anyone you can think of)- Electricity issues on Tuesdays render a lot of facilities unavailable ( incl Television)
Room_Tips: Room Tip: choose the valley plus rooms for a complete view.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your 'Wonderful' review. We are glad to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. Since our Hotel is very popular amont the Celebrities; one can often see them here throughout the year. We are currently working on upgrading the Internet Connectivity/WiFi ; which will be avilable in all rooms. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniece caused to you during your stay with us.Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Content: After a surprise dinner on my bday; my wife gifted me this surprise holiday at the Ravine. I must say this Resort is a real treat for the eyes and mind. Views from the room and the overall property are unparalleled. There are several different varieties of rooms on offer including tents. Tents look extremely comfortable but our pick was the room as it had better views. Try to get one on the 2nd floor & you ll be able to see the winding river completing a postcard picture scenery.Well being a 3 star hotel; it has its cons. The glass windows in the rooms should be cleaned regularly as it was the only thing that spoilt the fantastic view. Mattresses and some other upholstery were showing signs of age and should be replaced in the near future. We stayed in the Junior Executive Room which was recently done up; especially the bathroom; but even then the shower panel was not working smoothly.Meals are not included in the stay prices and food is on the expensive side; considering the taste & quality of the food. The kitchen staff does a good job of serving; for e.g. the Chicken Pahadi Tikka we ordered was served in a sizzler plate on a bed of caramalized onions; the taste was only above average.Nevertheless; I would give a big thumbs up for the staff & the hotel owners for being honest and upfront in all communication. When we were shown the tents; we were clearly told the pros & cons; time to serve food in the room was told on placing the order and it always came at least 10 minutes earlier than promised.Highly Recommended and worthy of my first review on TripAdvisor! On checkout; the Reception does ask you to post a review if you enjoyed your stay :)
Room_Tips: Room Tip: 2nd Floor rooms; Try any of the suites; really spacious!For a camping out experience go for the te...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your 'Splendid' review. We are indeed overwhelmed with your response for our service towards you and would like to specially thank you for reccomending our Hotel. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve on our management and we assure you; that you would not have to face these minor issues again. Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Good place to stay; BAD reception desk.”
Review_Content: Stayed: 3rd Dec 2012 to 6th Dec 2012Pros : Good Location; Neat and Clean Rooms; 15 mins walk from main market; service staff was hospitable and prompt. Good Proximity to spots worth visiting.Good facilities like Carrom; Games; Tennis ; Swimming and Gym.Cons: Pathetic attitude of Reception Desk; Bad Food but you have many options in Panchgani; mahableshwar for food so that can be taken care of.TV is as good as not there as channel selection is not watchable at all.Biggest Put Off ; Workers are cleaning the huge windows in the room next to you; making hell lot of noise. The management has not even provided them with safety nets or strapped the workers as they are working on 2nd floor on a very narrow space outside the windows.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus on Second Floor
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your helpful review. We were in the process of upgrading the cable system to TataSky this is a large and time consuming task this upgrade will provide better service to our clients; hence all the channels were not available. Also the workers were in the process of installing Saftey hooks/anchor point on all our outside ledges; to make it secure for them to clean and maintain the windows. Thank you for bringing the other matters to our notice and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenient caused. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve on our management and we assure you; you would not have to face these issues again. Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Content: we stayed here for 2 days the Hotel is just wonderful with great location and view. Far from Market Rush its just near the check post when u enter Panchgani (via pune). Very Well Maintained Neat; clean and Properly furnished Rooms and lot of Amenities they have 2 courts of tennis which is an added advantage along with swimming pool;etc. A lot of things for kids.View from Room was just awesome Facing the Valley try to get the Rooms facing the valley on the 2nd floor.Room Service is good and very helpful. In house restaurant serves Good Indian; Chinese food.There is no Shops or Hotels besides hotel Ravine so also a plus point; Sydney point as at walking distance.Though 22 km far from Mahabaleshwar But a good option to stay far from the rush of Mahabaleshwar and price is low when compared to other 3 star hotels of Mahabaleshwar.Its one of the best
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go for Valley Facing rooms
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your 'Astounding' review about us. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve ourselves to cater your needs. We are glad to know; that once again; we succeeded in our services towards our Guests and look forward to welcome you again for another ‘Breath-taking Experience’.Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Content: It was pleasure to stay at Ravine Hotel... Amazing Experience... Location for this Hotel is very nice..service also good... other amenities too...We had selected the valley plus room. The room was small but decent. The best part about the room was the large glass window facing the valley. The restaurant food was good and service was excellent. The restaurant provides good view from the its sitting area ! but its quiet expensive... Panchgani Market is just 1km away from this hotel... If u want to visit this Hotel; u must have ur own car!! coz this hotel is far from Mahabaleshwar ( 22 Km ). But I Highly recommend this hotel...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your positive review and recommending our Hotel. Your helpful opinions are always welcomed as we endeavor to enhance our services towards our Guests. We look forward to welcome you back again soon.Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “The only highlight of our Panchgani trip”
Review_Content: Me and my husband went to panchgani on 3rd Dec 2012. This was our first trip to panchgani and i must say it was not very exciting . We were little dissapointed after seeing some of the points and the market. This hotel came as a good surprise .We had lunch at the restaurant of this hotel . The food was good and service was excellent. The restaurant provides good view from the its sitting area ! I highly recommend it .
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your positive review and for recommending our Hotel. We would like to inform you that we also have a Travel Desk in the Hotel Lobby; where; one can hire taxi/car and visit around the Famous places in Panchgani & Mahabaleshwar. We assure you; you would not be disappointed on your next visit.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Decent place to stay at Panchgani with excellent view”
Review_Content: We had been to Panchgani in october and after looking up the reviews online; we decided to stay at the Ravine hotel. We had selected the valley plus room. The room was small but decent. The best part about the room was the large glass window facing the valley. The view is the only thing that makes the room worth the price. The restaurant also offers an excellent view of the valley. The food was good and service at the restaurant excellent. We had our 6 month old with us and the waiters at the restaurant did their best to make us comfortable. The hotel has its tennis courts; so for the tennis enthusiasts that is another plus point.One negative that I can think of - at the time of checkout; we called the reception 2-3 times asking them to send someone to the room to carry the luggage down. However nobody turned up. If this point is ignored then all in all; a decent place to stay at Panchgani.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the valley plus room as it offers excellent view of the valley
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your 'Great' review and for appreciating our services. . We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you during your stay with us. At Ravine; we endeavor to perk-up our services towards our Guests consistently. Thank you for bringing these matters to our notice and we assure you that you would not have to face these issues again in future.Warm RegardsGeetaRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We stayed at Ravine for a couple of days and had opted for the Valley Side Rooms ; The Valley plus rooms have better views but you can enjoy those from the restaurant and also from a huge sit out that is on the cliff.The room was small; cozy; comfortable. It was a little run down; with the paint in the bathrooms peeling off and the equipments are also dated.We did not any Tv reception; there were only a couple of channels which too weren't clear.On repeatedly requesting for the same were informed that the whole of Panchgani was facing a Cable black outThe food in restaurant was good; but the service was excruciatingly slow. Room service; although was prompt and attentive.They have a tie up with Jaffer Bhai Delhi Darbaar ; from where you can call in your food Choose this property if you want to enjoy the spectacular view and relax in quiet solitude. If you want the hustle bustle and the crowds; head to Mahabaleshwar 20kms away
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;Thank you for your positive review. Due to technical reasons; the cable services were out of services for some days; which happened to be during your stay. We have now installed the Tata Sky services at our Hotel and so we assure you; you would not have to face this issue again. We have also renovated certain rooms where there were paint 'peel-offs' due to heavy rains here. Thank you bringing these matters to our notice. We look forward to welcome you back again.Warms RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Title: “Good Property but terrible room reservation systems”
Review_Content: We booked two rooms in Ravine; from 16th November 2012 to 19th November 2012; we did this booking through Hotel's website. After online payment through debit card we didn't receive any confirmation from the hotel or any kind of mail.. after 48 hours; when contacted the reservations; they took almost three days to send mail that they booked the rooms in our name and also mail didnt have proper confirmation details. So we contacted the Hotel and confirmed ; they said the printout of mail will work during check inn.I would like to mention two persons here who gave this confirmation but didnt respond during our check in at the Hotel.Mr. Barucha from Pune booking office and Mr. Aamir from reservations.When we checked in Hotel on Nov 16th; the reception personnel's said that our booking is not confirmed and they didnt recieve our payment.When we showed that email printout; they blindly said that it must have mailed erroneously as its just booking confirmation but not payment confirmation. We were shocked to hear that we did not make payment and during that time;We didn't had enough funds to pay them full amount for the stay Somehow with great efforts; we got the bank statement of debit card from the Bank manager( who in general cases does not give bank statements without passbooks) and showed them that we did payment long back. They checked their bank statements and found that we did payment almost a month back. The Response we got later was terrible and sily that \ due to some mistake in checking bank statement they could not confirm our payment\".Due to this silly mistake of theirs we were in mental agony for almost 2 days and did not have any peace of mind which we required during holiday.We suggest to all future holiday planner to confirm the hotel booking; rooms; payments and other required things categorically before planning to head to The RAVINE.Other wise The Ravine is a very good property to stay with average service and pathetic systems."
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; firstly we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused to you during your stay with us. We too are human and sometimes errors are made by us as well. It is unfortunate that this happened on your booking and it caused undue stress.; We assure you; you would not have to face any such issue during your next stay with us. We learn from our mistakes and ensure that this does not happen to our other guests as well. Thank you for bringing these matters to our notice and we look forward to welcome you back soon.Warm RegardsGeeta Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “An Amazing Surprise for My first Anniversary”
Review_Content: Amazing Place with Flawless beauty of nature...A must visit hotel of Panchgani..Interiors are superb.It is a treat to your eyes.Food at Poonam's is adviceable at Panchgani market..and guys if ur gujarati..u can go for Gujarati thali at Purohit's Lunch home;At 14 Degree also u can feel the warmth of the place.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley View room or Tents
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your positive review and for recommending our Hotel. It is because of Guest like you we endeavor to give our best everytime. We will look forward to welcome you back again.Warm RegardsRavine Hotel

Review_Content: We travelled as couple to celebrate first wedding anniversary at Ravine in nov 2012. The hotel was too good with so many entertaining points. We stayed for 2 nights...and travelled to see mahabaleshwar on 3 rd day...there was nothing special to see in mahabaleshwar some points like echo point; aurther seat; needlepoint etc...but to be true the third day was no much fruitful. We spent the first 2 days entirely enjoying the ambiance of Ravine...it is just amazing........the valley view from room was just breathtaking...Room on 2nd floors give perfect view...we stayed in Room No 215..The staff was wonderful and attended us well. The melting pot restaurant also gives u breathtaking view and the tasty food...room service is very good...but costly.....it will b entertaining for kids too...Indoor games and gym was also nice..swimming pool also has good location...two things they could do 1) provide electric kettle in room and 2) place dust bins in garden to avoid litter here and there.....U will get iron box /hair dryer on request. that is nice....rooms r well maintained...amazing.....Go to Mapro gardens just 7 kms away from hotel and enjy various taste of products. Also food you can have from Panchgani just 1.5 km from hotel ...small hotel named poonam served us tasty food at much reasonable rate and we walked to Panchgani to enjoy the ambiance...go to table land and sydney point just 1.5 km from hotel...by walk u will enjoy to see these points....I think this is the best hotel and only 3 star hotel in panchgani with calm and pleasing ambiance.......there r mulberry trees near tennis courtsl...enjoy the rich antioxidant fruit with freshness early morning....
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley rooms on 2nd floor......we stayed in rom no 215
Response_to_Review: : Dear Guest; thank you for your Amazing review and for appreciating our services provided. At Ravine; we endeavor to perk-up our services towards our Guests consistently. We look forward to welcome you back again soon.

Review_Content: Stayed here from 9th till 11th Nov....the view(from the pics on the hotels website after looking thru Tripadvisor) was the main reason I booked this hotel and to say that the view was astounding is an understatement...I travelled with my wife and my 4 years old daughter...My daughter enjoyed the kids park and play area which was a plus point too...However the hospitality from the staff needs improvement as at times the room service staff and the housekeeping staff were very disinterested...The extra effort to make the guest feel comfortable was totally missing...They even charged me extra (Rs.500/night) for a mattress for my 4 year daughter...The light fixtures in the room were not working and were fixed only after we checked in and brought it to their notice...The sheets were stained and the furniture dusty....The cable TV wasn't working either for our entire stay...Besides the amazing view; the in-room experience was not worth mentioning....Its the Location and the view we paid for.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Its all about the view so book the valley plus rooms.

Review_Content: The view from the hotel window is really very nice. You see Krishna River and its beautiful valley. You can also see Dhom Dam which is on this river. The room has a big glass window and a coffee table-chairs near it. You can relax and watch beautiful sun-set from your room.The hotel has a small natural landscaped garden. They also have tents where you can stay - but you cant use tent from June-October due to rains. It must be nice experience to stay in those tents overlooking valley. This time when we went to Panchagani- Mahabaleshwar; I was not sure if I will be able to walk and explore a lot due to my pregnancy. So I wanted a place where I can relax at hotel itself. It was a good choice. The hotel is around 30 kms from Mahabaleshwar and 5 kms from Panchagani. It's on main road. The hotel has 5 tennis courts; a spa and a restaurant. a couple of negative things - hopefully they will get rectified.. The food was with limited variety and not so great but OK. There are no much options nearby. When we were in hotel; there were some tennis matches going on and the players were put up in the same hotel. It was very noisy due to this and we were disturbed couple of times at night due to some boys staying in nearby rooms. It would have been better if the staff would have been more polite. We used to get blank calls due to some problem in their phone system. On complaining the staff was reluctant to do anything or even to say sorry about the trouble.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Ask for Valley View Rooms - preferably on 2nd flr. 1st flr is also ok
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your ‘Amazing’ review. We are glad to know that your stay with us was ‘relaxing & comfortable’ and happy to inform you that the Tents are now open for stay; as the monsoons have passed. We regret for the inconvenience that you had to face; during your stay. We assure that during such times (Tennis Matches & Phone-Line issues) we will take measures so that you or our other guest do not face these issues in the future. Thank you once again; for bringing these matters to our notice.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Its not about Ravine. Its about Panchgani.A neat 3 hours drive from Pune landed me in Panchgani. And I am glad I chose Panchgani over the hyped Mahabaleshwar to stay overnight. Ravine was a natural choice having read so much about it; courtesy Trip Advisor forums. Situated near the Sydney Point; Hotel Ravine is set truly in nature's lap. We chose the Valley Plus room and the glass window opened up to the mesmerising beauty of nature. Yes; its Panchgani. Bliss.Ravine is a 3 star hotel and the facilities are adequate considering the remote location. The room seemed good for the price although the gigantic sized spider webs were not good for the eyes. Room Service Department- Are you listening ?The food at restaurant was good to taste but appeared overpriced. How I wish they included the breakfast in the room tariff ! The main turn off for me was that the Wi-Fi did not work from the room..the signal was only at the lobby level. The resort has multiple facilities- Tennis Courts; Spa; Kids zone etc. The hotel also provides car hire services for sight seeing through an outsourced travel desk and I availed it to my satisfaction. Overall; Ravine is a good place to stay. The hotel staff also appeared professional. With expectations limited; this is a treat for nature lovers. Recommended.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus rooms are a must !
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your ‘Mesmerizing’ review and for recommending Hotel Ravine. Yes; Panchgani is a place where one would be lost in its Beauty. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are currently in the process of adding more Wi-Fi Routers; where are esteemed Guests can utilize this service even from their Rooms. So; we assure you; the next time you visit us again; you will find the Internet working (minus the Spider-Net) in your Room.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Our stay at Ravine was made really memorable by the wonderful attitude and service offered by the manager-in-charge; Mr. Rathod. Right from the time I had booked online; to communicated via email with him till the time we decided to cut short our stay by a couple of days because of a sudden change in our plans...he was always a joy to interact with. The hotel is good with decent food and service offered. The lawns are a true joy. The only areas of improvement I can think of for this are that there should be breakfast included in the package and secondly; at such a scenic place; I missed having a balcony to sit and enjoy the beauty from.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: We had stayed in the Valley View Plus room which had a great view of nature
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your Positive review. We are glad to know that you had a Memorable stay with us. It is because of esteemed Guests like you; who encourage us to give our best of the services to our Guests. There are ‘sit-outs’ made in the lawn near the Tennis Court; where one can not only enjoy the Scenes of the Valley during the day; but also sit back and gaze at the Galaxy above; at nights.Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: beautiful place; nice gym; spa; tennis court - main attraction of Panchgani; what is more - during my staying there - i saw Salman Khan - such an expierience knowing that he is one of the top star in india
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your positive response. We are glad to know that you had a ‘relaxing’ stay at our Hotel and look forward to welcome you back again for another ‘Breath-taking’ experience. Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: I recently visited Panchgani and stayed at this hotel.I would rate this hotel as 4/5 although they themselves claim to be of 3 star standard because it was a real value for money deal in the off season.The hotel boasts of a huge property beside Sydney Point in Panchgani and the calmness and the serenity is the main attraction here. We stayed in the Valley Facing rooms(214 & 215) which offer s spectacular view of the valley. The rooms are not very big but very cosy and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They were very promt with check-in and providing me with my requests at anytime during the day.The resturant packs some awsome meals but yes it comes at a price. The resturant may turn out to be costly but the food is good. The hotel has a 'On Request' movie theatre;a spa and a gym for indoor activities and it has a good tennis court for outdoor activities. The swimming pool was non functional when we went but i guess i wouldn't have used it anyway. Since the property is very big so there are parts which are not maintained well but the usableable parts are kept clean. The roof top over the side of the hotel near the cottages offers a grand view of the canyon and you can enjoy the setting sun from there. This hotel is meant for nature and peace lovers. So if you are looking for a break from the hustle and bustle of city life ;this is the place to be.I felt that the rule for online booking during weekends should be made more flexible. This Hotel(along with other hotels in the region) only allows 2 or more days of reservation during online booking for weekends. I guess they should also allow single day booking to give more flexibility to customers with short visit schedule.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Rooms 209 to 215 are the best as they provide good view of the valley.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your ‘Splendid’ review. We are indeed; overwhelmed; with your response towards our service to you and would like to specially thank you for your recommendation to; not only visit Ravine; but to also explore the ravines of Panchgani. Also; it is because of the hush-rush during peak season; we do not take online booking just for 1 day for the Weekend. Although; you can book your room for 1 day by ‘Walking-in’ at the Hotel (if rooms are available). Thank you for understanding us and we look forward to welcome you back soon.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: We stayed at the Junior Executive Room on the first floor of the hotel. The view both from the room and the property is breathtaking. The property is situated on the edge of a hill with a beautiful view of the valley. They have nice points to take pictures. It was amazing to see the clouds descending the valley sitting in our room. The room was big; clean and furnished with a sense of class and style. The restaurant has an amazing view too. The ambience; food quality and hygiene was excellent; though I was somewhat disappointed with the taste. The staff at the hotel are very courteous. I would recommend this hotel for anyone going to Panchgani/Mahabaleshwar.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your appreciation and the helpful review. Yes; many rooms in our Hotel do have a ‘breathtaking’ view of the Hills & Valleys. We look forward to welcome you back again soon for another ‘Mesmerizing’ experience during the Winters.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: I went with my parents to Panchgani for two days and decided to stay at the Ravine Hotel after looking up hotels on the Internet. My parents wanted to stay in Mahabaleshwar but I insisted on staying in Panchgani as its very peaceful and more scenice than Mahabaleshwar; and they were not disappointed. We had a breathtaking view from the hotel room and the service of staff was excellent. They were all courteous and efficient. We went on a monday and got a 50% discount on off season rates.. which was a good deal. We got good value for the money paid and were completely satisfied with the choice of the hotel. We will recommend this place to all our friends & family and will only stay at the Ravine when we visit Panchgani next.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your positive review and for recommending our Hotel. We are glad that you & your family enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to welcome you back again; soon.

Review_Content: Ravine is the first Hotel when you enter Panchgani. Its location is amazing. It looked like a new property.Lobby:It has a small but decent lobby/reception area.Rooms:They have clean; well maintained and classy rooms. Bit small though.I went for Valley side which had amazing valley/lake view.There was a queen bed; lcd; dinning table with 2 chairs; wardrobe with electronic locker.The loo was clean and modern.Recreation:The lobby area further has a shopping arcade; pool/snooker; gym and a mini theater.It has a small outdoor swimming pool.Hotel has 2-3 tennis courts; basketball court and open children play area.Spa:They have a well maintained spa called serenity spa.I went for ayurvedic pizzichil massage and it was totally worth it.Restaurant:They have a spacious restaurant which is bit expensive but I found the food there better than most of places in Mahabaleshwar.They don't have a bar but you can have drinks in your room or request them to put tables along the pool side.Service:The staff is very courteous and friendly.I would certainly recommend this hotel for anyone going to Mahabaleshwar/Panchgani.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go for valley view or valley side rooms
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you so much for your ‘Marvelous’ review. We are glad to know that you have utilized and appreciated all our services provided. Also; the Tents are now available for stay; as the rains have passed. We look forward to welcome you again for the coming season.Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: We stayed there for 2 nights -3 days we were 3 families with Kids; Very beautiful scenic hotel with a great service & friendly staff. I would make sure next time visiting panchgani Ravine Hotel will be my only place.The Rooms are fantastic we had a valley view room it was just fantastic.They are very clean & well Maintained.The restaurent downstairs is excellent only downside is the taxes which brings the prices up otherwise its good.Kids enjoyed the Outdoor play area with lot of swings & see saw. The indoor Game room is also good with all the different games.Front Desk manager Mr Rathod was very kind & helpful. Overall a Great Hotel well worth the price.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Look for Valley view rooms they are a bit more but well worth the price.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your positive review. It is because of the kind appreciations and encouraging reviews that we receive from Guest like you; we endeavor to give our best every time. Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: I m a frequent traveller to Mahableshwar n this is my first time to stay in panchgani; some of my friends has told me if u want to stay in panchgani stay at hotel Ravine its best hotel & i tried this hotel.Hotel Ravine is really fantastic; the valley view rooms are too good; all rooms are neat & clean; all linens are clean & bathroom was very neat no smelling.Food is very tasty & hotel staffs are very cooperative; huge parking; neat swiming pool and tennis court with very good valley view from the hotel as well as from the tennis court.Next time when ever i visit Mahableswar i will stay at Hotel Ravine Panchgani & i advice u all to stay at this hotel but before going confirm ur hotel booking. Hatts off to This Hotel. Farooq Patel
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley View on second floor
Response_to_Review: Dear Mr. Patel;Thank you for your ‘outstanding’ review. We are obliged to have esteemed Guest like you to stay with us. Yes; now since the Season has started; we would advise to kindly pre-book the rooms well in advance.Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 3 days in Septmber 2012; during monsoon. Hotel is located at sydney point and it has amazing view. Rooms are big enough for family and they are clean. Food was another plus point. We dined at few other restaurants in nearby vicinity but food here was just too good as compared to other restaurants. Room service was excellent. They have big game room and good size children park. Overall experience is awesome; right from booking it through check out. I would highly recommend it for families and couples & would definitey visit it second time.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for writing a ‘Splendid’ review about us. The real beauty of Panchgani with a mesmerizing view from Ravine; will be seen now; from October-Febuary; since the rains have passed. And; not-to-forget; the best season to enjoy Strawberries too. We await for you to visit us again.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: We stayed on a short family holiday in Valley Plus rooms and were very happy with the hotel and service. The Valley Plus rooms offer great view of the valley (we stayed in 210-11) - a must for Panchgani! Food was good in the restaurant - we had almost all our meals here - Chinese was definitely the best of all the cuisines! The spa is nice and comfortable - best to book early in the day as it tends to get filled very quickly! Room and general service was nice - very comfortable check-in and check-out process. Important to mention those who are tennis enthusiasts - the hotel has four courts - gear up if you are interested! For others; there's a small sports room on the ground floor with table tennis; carrom etc - a good time pass on a rainy evening if you want to stay indoors! Highly recommended - definitely the best option in Panchgani!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus rooms on 2nd floor are highly recommended!
Response_to_Review: Dear Guests; Thank you for your helpful review. We are glad that you could utilize the best out of our services provided. We would like to recommend to try out our cozy Tents; which is now opened up for our valued Guests and look forward to welcome you soon.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: The location of this hotel is it's biggest asset. We took a valley view room and the view was simply breath taking. The staff are cordial and helpful. The aloo paratha is must try in the restaurant. The travel desk was helpful. In the room however we found small cockroaches but the house keeping was prompt to come with pest repellant. We were little upset because the sink stopped working one day but again the prompt service saved the day. The hotel has beautiful nooks and corners to be explored. The play area for the kids and the walk upto the sydney point amidst the mist was simply awesome.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Take the valley view room
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your positive review. We apologize for the inconvenience caused to you during your stay with us. At Ravine; we endeavor to perk-up our services towards our Guests consistently. Thank you for bringing these matters to our notice and we assure you that you would not have to face these issues again in future.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “A place to chill out every week ends”
Review_Content: The overall experience was really awesome...specially the rooms were having a very good breath taking view...the crew there was also very much friendly..the best season to visit this hotel is monsoon;the hotel all over gets surrounded by fog which itself is very extraordinary experience...the only thing that tastes bitter is that these people don't serve in to your rooms... Remaining all is good infanct good plus plus..
