Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your positive review. Yes; we do have breath-taking views not only from the rooms but also from our Restaurant; as you must have noticed. We want our Guests to enjoy this view as well; and so we do not provide meal services in the rooms. Also; we do have a Juke-box in the restaurant; where you can listen to songs of your choice (from old to the latest); So one can enjoy the meal + view + song = Memorable stay!!Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: This was our second time at the Ravine and hence my second review about the property. We stayed here for two nights and had booked 4 rooms for Saturday and Sunday i.e 7th and the 8th of July. To start off with; we had booked 4 rooms so we obviously wanted them to be together or atleast close to each other especially since we had booked in advance(almost a week ago).But we had been unfortunately allotted 2 rooms on the first floor (121;122) and 2 on the second floor(203;204) which was kind of inconvenient. They have this strange policy of not discussing the room numbers at the time of booking and you get a standard and an almost robotic answer from their reservation staff( Rajni) saying ‘’ we will see what we can do’!! almost bordering on sounding rude. Talking about staff;as mentioned by some other people in their reviews; the less you interact with them; the better. They almost never have a smile on their face or look welcoming. Coming to the rooms; 3 of the four rooms allotted were alrite except room 204. The bed in this room deserves a special mention. The bed frame in this room is probably 2/3rd size(or less) of the mattress that had been placed on it ( in terms of width) making it very saggy when you sit on either side and you could almost fall off the bed while sitting or sleeping as there is no bed under the mattress on the sides!! A call to the reception and the housekeeping staff come up to ‘’investigate’’ almost not acknowledging the problem and seemed completely surprised that such a thing could happen ; which I found hard to believe. Spent the next 15 minutes trying to adjust the mattress towards the exact centre of the bed frame and supposedly thats all they could do at that point!! No apologies ; no offer to change the room...absolutely nothing!! Kindly avoid this room or atleast check the bed before you decide to take up this room.Checkout was uneventful except for the fact that we had to take the luggage downstairs ourselves as no staff showed up even after requesting twice .To sum it up; Ravine is a beautiful property with very very good location only spoilt by the people who are running it. Do not expect prompt service or a pleasant smile and you will be alrite.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that our staff was unable to assist you during your stay with us and have rectified the issues mentioned in your review. We hope you do understand that at times when the Hotel is ‘Full’ & during ‘Peak Season’ ; it is a bit difficult to have the rooms changed. But we do try our best to try and fix / rectify the problem asap. We assure you that during your next stay with us; you would not have to face these or any such issues again. Once again; thank you bringing these matters to our notice.Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: The best thing about the hotel is its location. True to it's name; it is located just on the edge of a ravine and offers some real beautiful views. Restaurant food is good and offers many options for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.Service is one area where there is a lot of scope for improvement. Staff should be more courteous and there should be someone manning the restaurant to ensure that people are alloted tables in an orderly manner.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go for the Valley Plus or Valley Side rooms. These are the rooms that offer the best views.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your positive response. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve on our management and staff .. Once again; thank you bringing this matter to our notice.Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Ravine is the best hotel in Panchgani ! It has the best rooms; with a breath taking view of the valley and very good amenities. I used the game room; movie theater and my wife visited the spa. It was a lovely experience. The restaurant served a sumptuous fare; although I felt it was on the expensive side. The service was quick and efficient. While it certainly is no 5 star; but it does try to raise the bar and succeeds ! Have visited the hotel twice; stayed in Valley Plus rooms and had an amazing experience on both the occasions. Would definitely recommend it.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Room number 109; 209 and 110; 210 have the best view.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your wonderful review. We are glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay at Ravine. We are obliged to have guest like you; who inspire us to give our best in serving our valued guest.Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Fulllllll of nature !!!!; Hygenic;Fabulous Spa center;delicious food and nice tennis court........Enjoyed a lot with my husband and had a great time !!!!!Everyone should visit to hotel RAVINE atleast once in their life. Many people they stay in hotel for visiting panchgani ; but Visit pachgani because of RAVINE.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your ‘Splendid’ review. We are indeed; overwhelmed; with your response towards our service to you and would like to specially thank you for your recommendation to; not only visit Ravine; but to also explore the ravines of Panchgani.Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Nice location; excellent views. Stayed in Executive room with valley viewGot two interconnecting rooms; excellent for a family of 4+Appriciable Decor. Good value for money. Can stay here and travel to Mahableshwar.If breakfast is also included in the room package it would have been great.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: If you are travelling with family you can chosse interconnecting rooms with valley view on the top f...
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your ‘Refreshing’ review. We are happy to know that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us. Your helpful opinions are always welcomed as we endeavor to enhance our services towards our Guests. Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: A stay at Ravine hotel has always been an overwhelming experience. I remember during the mulberry season you can just stroll around the place and gather a basket full of mulberries. Its simply beautiful may it be the view; the location and the various amenities the hotel offers. A stay at the ravine can be defined as a place you would always go back to only to experience it in different seasons
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your ‘Astounding’ review about us. we look forward to welcome you back again for the next season (Winters) and not-to-forget; for the most awaiting season of the year; the season for the ‘King’ of berries; Strawberry!!Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “One of the best places I have been to!”
Review_Content: Me and my family had one of the best holidays in December 2011 at Ravine Hotel. The view from the rooms is breathtaking; the staff is extremely friendly and caters to all of your needs with utmost efficiency and the service is second to none. To sum it up; everyone who visits Panchgani should look at none other than Ravine for their stay. 4.9/5 is what I would rate this place overall (Since 5 would be a perfect score and nothing in life is perfect)!!!
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for the wonderful review and rating. At Ravine; we constantly strive to improve ourselves to cater your needs. We are glad to know; that once again; we succeeded in our services towards our Guests and look forward to welcome you again for another ‘Breath-taking Experience’.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “Beautiful Property But Very Bad attitude and horrible manners”
Review_Content: The Bombay booking office Sahara and Rajani of Panchgani desk are extremely rude. They are very defensive and insulting to the extreme. There are here; a lot of other people who have complained on the same grounds.The property location is excellent and is made well. However the maintenance is poor; service mediocre and the manners are terrible. If you ever have the misfortune of coming across them (the chances are very high as they seem to be senior there) It will definitely ruin you holiday there.The hotel would definitely benefit by doing away with those 2 bad apples.

What a beautiful property ! However; it is very unfortunate that the management is so poor that it spoils the entire experience of one's holiday !! From rude reservation staff to untrained front desk and housekeeping; it all forces one to believe that it was better to choose another property. Rajani; the reservations staff is very arrogant and unprofessional. They don't even send an email to confirm reservations and treat guests as if they are doing a favor by accepting a reservation. On reading other reviews; we realized that we were not the only one who came across such behavior. Even after sending a written complaint; they do not bother to revert. They are very disrespectful with their guests making them feel insulted !! There are much better properties in Panchgani and Mahabaleshwar where one can enjoy their holiday. Please do not stay at Ravine !!!

During the monsoon months; panchgani and mahabaleshwar are the two beautiful places to visit.I choose to stay at the Ravine hotel; after going through the reviews posted about the hotel; I also choose the room facing the valley. It was really amazing; the huge glass facing the valley was clearly visible. It looked more like a painted canvas.The hotel has a restaurant; the food was good. Apart from that; there is a Spa; tennis courts and other indoor games to unwind. But; that would not be necessary as you would only head to panchgani to relax.Overall a good hotel; if your moving to panchgani in monsoons. Ravine hotel is a good place to stay.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus would be the best room
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest; thank you for your excellent review. Yes; our Valley-facing rooms are truly amazing; as it leaves one ‘speechless’. Talking about Painted Canvas; we also have an ‘Art Gallery’ in our Hotel; where you would find some beautiful paintings. We look forward to welcome you back soon.Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Ravine Hotel in Panchgani is the place to stay away from hustle bustle crowd. The hotel property is enormous with options to staying in a tent as well (not during the rains). The hotel staff is very friendly and take care of all your needs. The rooms provide an awesome view of the valley. For the camera friendly guests; its the perfect place to click your portfolio with an awesome backdrop. During the rains; sit back and enjoy the fog building up with a cup of coffee. The main attraction of Mahabaleshwar is just 20 minutes away. For the adventurous; go for a paragliding session and get your dose of the adrenalin. The best room to stay is the Valley Plus...the best view. Ravine will ensure you have a peaceful yet refreshing vacation :)
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus rooms offer the best view :)
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your positive review. We are overwhelmed by your review and happy that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us. we look forward to welcome you back again in the coming season(Winters); where you would be astounded to see the real beauty of Panchgani.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: One of the best hotels i have ever been in Mahabaleshwar-Panchgani. To start with; the location of the hotel is simply great and very easy to find. The Hotel has very good parking space and beautiful entrance lobby. We opted for the Valley facing rooms and as the name suggests...the rooms opened up into Deep Valley. Looks like the room is just on the edge of the valley and it was all greenary outside....the fanatastic view through the window gives you all the money's worth......We visited during the monsoons and the climate was terrific...It was all fog everywhere and the experience was great....The hotel has well maitained swimming pool but we didnt use since it was already cold.They have Jaccuzi but it was not operational at that time.There are two big lawn tennis courts behind the hotel and very well maintained club house. The Gym is very well equipped.The Hotel staff is very helpful. They have a mini theatre where they play movies on demand...So you can watch your favourite movie with your loved ones while getting a private theatre feeling.The food taste and variety is good and service is very fast. The only concern is that hotel is costly and it should be considering the amenties they provide. I would always recommend this hotel if you want a royal holiday feeling....For budget travellers; there are other cheaper options...
Room_Tips: Room Tip: always go for valley facing rooms
Response_to_Review: Thank you for the ‘Splendid’ review. Yes; our Valley facing rooms do have a breath-taking view which leaves one ‘stunned’. We regret you could not enjoy the ‘Jacuzzi’ by the poolside as it was under maintenance during that time; but please note that we do have Jacuzzi’s at the SPA that are available year round.. We assure you; you will always have a royal service and provide you with the enhanced amenities.Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: I had booked 4-bed room which had independent balcony of approx. 400sq ft. That too for very reasonable price. I already had started feeling special and lucky.Food was good; location is excellent; game room; swimming pool and 3 tennis courts are all good too. They also have small indoor movie theater which you can book for very small amount and watch movie with your family (they have hundreds of movie CDs to choose from).Service was not a problem at all. Resort is very beautiful as well.Next time I visit Panchgani; I am going to book exactly same resort; Ravine.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go check rooms before finalizing on one; there are rooms where you get to see beautiful valley from...
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your wonderful review. We are obliged to have guests like you; who; with their reviews encourage and instigate us to give our best.Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “Good rooms ; great view with a few issues”
Review_Content: Been there with my wife; we checked online and choose the hotel for the option of a swimming pool and spa. We liked the rooms; had an amazing view. They have an ac and non ac option ; charged 600 extra for the ac; don't like this at a time when all hotels have the ac option at no extra charge. Decided to go to the spa; got an instant appointment. The spa experience was amazing ;well trained therapists. Then we decided to go to the pool & were shocked to see was shut ; were really disappointed. That pool was one of the reasons for which we choose that place. Would have appreciated it if they informed us abt it when we were checking in. Other wise the food was good ; rooms very clean and amazing view ; very comfortable beds . It did get bit stuffy and hot at night due to poor ventilation in the room.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your positive reviews. Yes; an AC is seldom used in a place like Panchgani; and so we have kept the options of AC and Non-Ac. We regret that you could not use the swimming pool; as it was under maintenance at that time. We shall endeavor to keep our guests informed about such mattersWarm Regards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: We visited this hotel for 3 nights .Location was perfect; however beware of terms such as \valley side \" rooms; as i found out this mean; you will only have a side-view of the valley. Hotel has great views from the rooms;and the restaurant.The hotel;has very god open spaces;with terrances; and kid areas; and is well maintained.They also have a min auditorium;where magic show was held for kids. Swimming pool has not been working it seems for a long time.It is too small;to accommodate all hotel guest; and I feel; even though it had been working ; it would have been too congested for use. The linen and the towels in the room; were very old;and hope they replace it with new linen.I also hope this property adds a lavish buffet breakfast ;to its menu; as a part of the deal; to make it one of the best hotels in and around Panchgani /mahabaleshwar."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Check our the room description more accurately; with the actual views !
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your review. We deeply regret that you could not use the swimming pool during your stay with us. wWe do have a buffet option for corporate or big groups if needed Thank you for bringing to our notice about the Linen; we endeavor to ensure that each room is up to the mark and will review why you were faced with such an issue.Your review has been helpful to us and we look forward to welcome you for another ‘Amazing’ experience.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: We visited this hotel sometime around Aug2011.First of all booking is easy. Had pre-booked online. And locating the place is also very easy as it is the first one as you reach Panchgani. The views are amazing..the valley view rooms give u a spectacular view and u wud simply feel like lazing around the place. The spa is good..Some good massages (both AYurvedic and Thai). The food at the Melting pot restaurant is also good..They looked like short of staff though when the tables were full; but the existing people tried to cater to all the diners ! I wud say the view and the spa are the only good things from a hotel perspective. Food is good..not excellent. Swimming pool is small and not at all in a usable condition. Overall; a nice place if you have a day's stay and you just wanna enjoy the valley and roam around Mahabaleswar and Panchgani !
Response_to_Review: thank you for your positive review. We; at Ravine; leave no stone unturned when it comes to serving our Guest and so we apologize that you could not use the Swimming pool during your stay. We assure you that while your next stay with us; you would not only embrace the beauty of this place but also enjoy our enhanced amenities.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Stayed at Hotel Ravine for 2 nights and 3 days with family and friends from May 24th to May 26th 2012. Due to peak season we could not book any hotels in advance but on reaching this Hotel 2 Jr. Executive Rooms were available which were allotted immediately to us.The check-in was very smooth and we hardly had to wait.The Jr. Executive Rooms are valley facing and open to a backside garden where you can sit and relax with family and friends. Since we had kids with us we agreed to pay the extra money for ac but found out on the first day that even in May no ac was required.The Jr. Executive Rooms are interconnected so only offered if you book 2 rooms. I would suggest families looking for 2 rooms to opt for this. The swimming pool was small but clean and the kids enjoyed the different rides available in the kids play area.The food at the hotel was also very good; and they organized a magic show which kids and adults both enjoyed.Overall a very nice hotel at competitive rates; would love to stay there every time I am at Panchgani.

Stayed there for two nights with my family. Excellent hotel; very reasonable rates.Go for the valley view rooms which offer panoramic view of the valleys and superb wind. The gym is definitely far better than what I have seen at bigger and better hotels. Staff was friendly too.
Response_to_Review: Dear Pashmima; Thanks you for your wonderful reviews. We are happy to know that you had an ‘Excellent Holiday’ with us and we look forward to welcome you back again to Ravine; for another Amazing experience.With warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “Worst Hotel Staff in Celebrity Visited Hotel”
Review_Content: I went to Hotel Riviera; Panchagani in Feb 2012. I found this hotel on the internet and was pretty impressed by guest testimonials and celebrity visits to this hotel. If A listed celebrities are visiting this hotel; one would think this is a best hotel in its category. I pre-booked the room and went to the hotel for check in on my arrival at Panchagani. When I entered the hotel and met the receptionist; everything looked good. But when I experienced the hotel staff service; it was terrible; cheap and very embarrassing. They were trying to enter room without knocking on the door which is very unprofessional. This was worst thing that how can this hotel staff behave like this? Except this; hotel was fantastic; rooms; and views from the hotel are fantastic. Location is great. Food was poor and expensive and was not that fantastic like money spent.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Do not check in before checking the room personally on the spot.
Response_to_Review: Dear Guest;We are extremely sorry for the embarrassment you had to face due to some of our staff. We have taken this matter seriously and we constantly strive to improve and train our Staff to serve you the best we can.Thank you for bringing this matter to our notice through your review. We assure you; we would make your next holiday the most ‘Comfortable’ and ‘ a Splendid’ experience with us.Regards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “Fresh air on the sun deck is all i'd remember!”
Review_Content: We stayed @ Ravine from 21st-24th May & had the valley plus room with a breathtaking view of the mountains. Location is great. The room was undoubtedly lovely but lacked comfort. The master bed was too uncomfortable; the dunlop mattress was a nightmare to sleep on; if the other person moves the whole bed shakes. The extra single bed was so old that it made creaking sounds when i moved. We didn't get peaceful sleep for ALL 3 NIGHTS! The swimming pool is VERY SMALL & unfortunately the filtration system wasn't working; so we couldn't use it. The games room is nice; i enjoyed playing table tennis & the slot machines are useless; don't go for it. Tennis courts are good; but they charge Rs 150 for 30mins. Spa is too costly; not worth 1 bit. The sun deck is AMAZING; the fresh air & coolness of this place during peak summers was exhilarating. FOOD - VERY EXPENSIVE. I fell sick the 1st day after eating the food; it was tasty but very unhygienic due to all the flies. There are way too many flies around this hotel. Room service is good but the food was bad; we had to return it. All in all it was expensive but ok. Although i wouldn't visit again due to hygiene issues; unless no option left.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley Plus room on the 1st floor!
Response_to_Review: We have thoroughly reviewed your feedback and feel that we owe you our deepest apologies for the inconvenience that has caused. Please bring such matters to our attention during your stay the next time you are at Ravine; we shall try our best to accomidate Guests and if possible change the mattress so that you get a comfortable nights sleep. At Ravine; we are very serious about our customer’s satisfaction and we work hard to get to the bottom of any customer complaints. The hotel is actively working to improve service levels and your feedback has proved to be invaluable. Thank you for your feedback and bringing these matters to our attention. We look forward to welcome you back soon.Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Stayed at Hotel Ravine; Panchgani for two nights on 21st & 22nd May 2012. It was a very good experience. We all enjoyed the stay very much. Kids had a great time at the play area and game room. In a nutshell:1. The location is fantastic; and overlooks the valley. We didn't really even need the A/C although it was peak summer.2. The rooms were great; the ambience; cleanliness was great. 3. Room service was also great.4. The play area; game room; tennis courts - excellent.5. The only dissapointment was the swimming pool - it's very small; and unfortunately for us; the filteration system was not working; so we couldnt enjoy that.6. The staff is professional and courteous.7. The food was also very good - we had one dinner there.8. It's very peaceful - away from the maddening rush of the 'holiday' crowd during peak season!
Response_to_Review: Thanks you for writing wonderful reviews about our hotel. We are sorry that you missed out on enjoying the swimming pool; as it was under service due to filtration problems. We assure you that your next Holiday with us; would be the best experience you ever had.With Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: We stayed at the Ravine for 2 nights and had booked five rooms( not hillside view) as we were 5 couples on a short vacation from mumbai with kids aged 4. Let me start of with the bad part first.As mentioned in other reviews ; they do charge Rs600 extra for Airconditioning which i was completely unaware of until i requested for the Ac to be switched on.After agreeing to pay for it ; they said they will send someone over shortly to switch on the Ac.It took them forever to send some one to do the needful and when the staff finally arrived; he seemed to be carrying half a dozen AC remotes with him and didnt know which one worked with this particular Ac. Finally after trying each one; it turns out that none of them actually work and he somehow managed to open the front panel of the split unit and switched it on manually.With the Ac now switched on we were happy but only for a short while as the AC was set at 24-25 degrees which wasnt cooling the room at all and the room temperature was the same as before. A call to the reception and was promised that they will hunt for the correct remote so that the temperature of the Ac could be adjusted but needless to say that never happened.In the end we spent the night with a non functional Ac unit.Next day morning when i complained at the reception; they surprisingly found the correct remote and the second night was stress free.They waved off the charge for the first nite Ac ( rightfully so) and we ended up paying for one nite.It appears that the Hotel is severely under staffed;be it the restaurant or any other request.Everything takes for ever to be done.The food at the restaurant was ok but a bit on the expensive side for all it was worth.And it does take forever for your food to arrive.Service is very bad because they r severely understaffed and u almost feel sorry for the waiters who seem to be doing their best.At dinner time ; the restaurant was completely packed full as i believe there was a film crew who had checked in but there was just one waiter to manage a restaurant full of almost 80-90 people.It was chaos to say the least.The rooms are strictly ok and could do with better upkeep.We could see a few cob webs here n there and the curtains did have some stains.Now for the good part.LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!! Thats what its all about.The Location of this Hotel is fantastic.The view from the restaurant is breathtaking and from your room too if you have opted for the valley side room.You could just sit there all day.The hotel is very easy to locate too.They have a decent play area for the kids ; swimming pool and 2 tennis courts. My daughter had a lovely time there and so did the other kids and thats what matters in the end.All in all we had a good time at the ravine and yes i will return again simpy because you just cant beat the view from the hotel but next time i will be more prepared mentally to accept their short comings which we may experience.I sincerely hope that the hotel takes notice and does something about it.
Response_to_Review: Dear Sir; Thank you for your sincere review on our hotel and bringing this matter to our attention. We apologize for the annoyance/inconvenience that this may have caused to you. We; at Ravine; are actively working to improve our service levels and your feedback has proved to be invaluable. We assure you that you will not come across these issues again in future and we will be prepared to welcome you for another Amazing Experience.Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Gone with family for an ultrashort holiday. Decided on it on the spur of the moment as it is the first hotel when you enter Panchgani. Was recommended by someone though. Was not sure whether room would be available in the peak season. Experience was good; room was great; very spacious and well laid out facing the tennis court and the valley. The only drawback was the extra bed provided was very creaky and the mattress was very uneven and lumpy. We had dinner in the restaurant; the food was good but the chicken was very hard and seemed undercooked. Overall; its a nice place to stay in though a bit pricey; also the restaurant. They charge extra for the AC which was surprising though you hardly need it. The property is well situated and huge. Takes time to explore especially around the tenting area. Nice place and would recommend it and like to visit it again. Room service is not very good.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the valley facing rooms on the upper floors.
Response_to_Review: Dear Sir;Thank you for your Positive review for our hotel. We look forward to welcome Guests like you; who; inspite of facing some minor issues during your stay; still recommend us. we assure you that your next stay with us would be worth the amount and time you spend with us. Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: Ravine has got a nice view and a good location but its just about that. The rooms are not well equipped with proper facilities compared to the money thay charge for the rooms. If you are looking for a hotel with good location and just about ok food; you might not be dissapointed but truly dont expect more.The staff is uncourteous. Though they say they belong to the hospitality industry; they are nothing close to being hospitable.Special mention to the manager Ms. Rajni; dealing with whom can easily be said to be the worst experience ever.Thanks to her; would not intend to revisit Ravine

Fantastic location - great view from restaurant even if you miss out on Room facing valley (as we did - by 5 mins!) Well organised; clean; efficient staff. Only (small) drawbacks - when busy the restaurant has no \queue\" system so if you are waiting outside and someone else walks in then they can grab the next vacant - if \"your\" waiter is not there to stop them. Also rooms not totally soundproof so can hear people (children shouting) in the corridor. Recommended and will visit again."
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book in advance and choose room with view
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your positive review; The management will definitely take your suggestion to work on a system; to improve the seating system at the restaurant; Your review is valued and we look forward to welcome you again! Warm Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “Hotel with large property on hill side”
Review_Content: Hotel Ravine is an awesome place to slip over for a holiday for a day or 2. It has got huge expanse over the hill with a beautiful valley view on one side.2-3 tennis courts suffices the urge to play on valley side. Small but good swimming pool; large area for kids to play make it sufficient for all age groups to relax and enjoy.Food varirty is limited; but good. It charges 600/- extra for ac; this looks to be a down side. Its property is very large; so one can have a very beautiful valley view early in the morning or late evening with cool breeze.The spa experience is also amazing .Local market is around 1.5 kms away so one can go to the market to enjoy freshh strawberrys.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your wonderful review. Yes our tennis courts are tempting and one cannot resist to play on them; We are glad to know that you have thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to welcome you back again for another amazing holiday. With Warm Regards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Its a good halt if you looking for location @ panchgani or between Mapro Garden and Mahabaleshwar. Amenities includes : Swimming pool;Theater;Restaurant;Pool tables. Frequently visited by Stars(as shown on screensaver at Reception). We paid 4500/- during Mid April for a room with 2 beds;duplex format (2 couples/4 person occupancy). Market is nearly 2km away; and most attractions within 5km radius.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Duplex room format is useful for 2 families to stay under one roof.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your feedback and we are happy to hear that you have listed us as the best property in Panchgani; We apologize for the slow room service during your stay and assure you that steps have been taken to improve our services and hope that your next visit will be free of complaintsRegards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Had being to this hotel in Panchgani for summer chillout along with the family. It's a excellent Hotel; very good rooms; perfectly clean. Family rooms are in duplex format with children room on the first floor attached to the parent room. Location is very perfect. You can enjoy evening sunset in the mountains from the hotel itself. You get perfect view of the Dhom Dam valley on down side. Half the Salman Khan starrer Dabhang flim was shot on Dhom dam backwaters. May the Dabhang part II shooting is also expected on the same location hence you have many photographs of the entire Dabhang crew on this hotel web page as they had stayed in this hotel during the shoot.But irrespective of the stars; It's a very good hotel. Gym as well as swiming pools are well maintained. It's a perfect place for family with chindrens. Place around is very silent away from the busy streets. Sydney point is just behind this hotel. I would surely be visting this hotel again in later part of the year.
Response_to_Review: it gives us a great pleasure to read all your wonderful reviews and to know that you have enjoyed every bit of your stay in our hotel; we are expecting the Dabbang part2 team very soon and Ravine is Bollywood’s hotspot for all shooting schedules. We thank you once again and look forward to having you with us again. Regards;Ravine Hotel

Review_Content: Had been to Ravine a few years back (Dec 2009).The property is very big and they have a lot of facilities like the swimming pool; tennis court; disco etc.They also have tents; if you want a unique experience.The rooms are clean; the washrooms are very clean. The linen as well towels etc provided are also very clean. The room is not very spacious though.They have a valley facing restuarant. though we did not eat at the restuarant. Room service was a little slow; we had to remind them about the order also the menu for room service is very limited.The valley facing rooms have an excellent view and is worth the price you pay for it.All in all a very good proprty and I would say the best proprty in Panchgani.

Ravine offers excellent location. It is in the valley itself. The service was excellent. Hotel team was humble. Food at its restaurant was amazing. I especially liked the availability of baby high chair which we could use for my son. I will suggest the hotel to have more baby high chairs.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Select valley view rooms. Although it is Panchgani; take air conditioned room except in winter.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your wonderful reviews and your positive feedback motivates us to serve our customers even better; we strive to be not just good; but the best. We would also arrange to have more baby chairs for our: “Little guests” as mentioned by you.Regards; Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “Great views; nice rooms; better food would make it excellent”
Review_Content: Went for a long weekend and were only able to get garden side rooms as the hotel was booked full ... sadly for us. We picked a garden view room which wasnt bad as the window forms one complete side of the room so its nice and bright. The room has a reasonable amount of space and is well maintained. Toothbrushes dont form a part of the standard toiletries provided. The hotel itself has a ton of facilities - game room; 3 tennis courts; swimming pool and a spa. We used the TT table for a bit and was fun. For tennis you can rent the rackets/balls - shoes are a must!! The view itself is to die for ...you can see staright down the valley along with the river from the garden ..they have a nice sit out area on top of the hall they rent out for marriages and you can enjoy a nice quiet sunset from there... the same view is available from their dining room as well. Breakfast isnt part of the room tariff and left us a bit wanting. The taste was average and frankly a bit too expensive with breakfast costing more than dinner. We had Indian food for dinner and it was very nice ; the Chinese again left us wanting. FYI for alcohol enthusiasts - the hotel doesnt have a bar and does not serve any hard drinks.The location is the biggest plus of the hotel...its a 15min walk from the city center and the first hotel as soon as you enter panchgani.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley view rooms are the ones with the best views
Response_to_Review: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and your positive reviews motivate us to improve our services further. We will take steps to improve the quality of breakfast and it’s value for money. Please note we provide Standard Toiletries free of cost on request.Regards; Ravine Hotel

Review_Title: “What a treat: a lovely hotel created with passion”
Review_Content: The Ravine Hotel is amazing.The hotel itself is beautiful and the service is very good. The reception did take a long time for our checkin which was a bit annoying; but overall; no complaints. The hotel has great restaurants and you don't feel like leaving the hotel. I didnt get the chance to use the pool but I did take a massage at the spa its was amazing i love it. And of course; the location; right next to The Valley it was really awesome; we can clearly see the clouds. Sure i will visit Ravine Hotel once again
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go For Valley Plus Or Garden Side
Response_to_Review: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and thank you for the wonderful reviews sent by you. We hope to see you back soon.

Review_Title: ““Clean; spacious and laid back - excellent holiday location””
Review_Content: This was my Second trip to Panchgani; this time with school friends. Panchgani has tons of hotel - literally. And selecting one was really tough. Frankly; I wasn't sure how good Ravine would be till we actually arrived there. Ravine is away from the busy Panchgani Market. On the way to Wai. Market is at a 15 minutes walking distance. Travel Desk arranged taxis for us. So we moved around with ease. The resort location is off the Panchgani / Mahabaleshwar area. So do expect to travel a bit. Ravine is a Huge Hotel. Rooms are clean. Bed is comfortable. Bathrooms are spacious and clean too. The staff was helpful too.The swimming pool is in the corner of the resort. Our kids enjoyed it and we too had fun splashing water around.We were very happy with our stay at Ravine Hotel overall - except one big thing - the restaurant. Other people have said this in earlier reviews; We would certainly like them to improve their breakfast as a good breakfast can set for a good day ahead.The taste of other ordered food from the restaurant too was just acceptable. We preferred to have our meals outside and had much better experience outside.Other than that; it was a memorable trip for us and Ravine Hotel provided an excellent laid back; clean and comfortable space for us to unwind after crazy days or night outs!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley plus is best room according to me

Review_Content: Horrible Booking Executive at the Mumbai office called Sarah. No greeting and zero decency/politeness/professionalism. Had called to plan my holiday at Ravine for 14th-15th April but was greeted with a rude and uncouth lady charging me of having called them earlier to take information. This was my first call and obviously the very first impression of the hotel. Shocked that a star hotel has untrained; unprofessional staff who have no sense of communication and decorum. Horrible!

Review_Title: “V.Good Ambience coupled with a great Valley View”
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Velly + or the Outside Camping
Response_to_Review: We are pleased to hear that you have wonderful memories of your stay at Ravine Hotel. Your positive feedback is very encouraging and motivates us to better ourselves even further to extend our services to the entire satisfaction of all our guest ; looking forward to your visit again. Best Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: have been comming here for 7 years now loads of changes in the hotel since just keeps getting more beautiful.this place refreshes me and makes me feel alive good staff good food n good owners p.s- try their biryani n also the chocolate cake
Response_to_Review: It gives us great pleasure to read all those good reviews sent by you. We wish to inform you that we equally enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to having you with us againWith best regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Content: I have been here between 6th - 8th Feb 2012.The Climate was good.Had opted for valley side room which gave a good view of the valley..the rooms are well maintained.The Hotel surroundings are cool with a lot of photography spots.The only negative points are they charge for internet at their lobby.Also the food at restaurant is much costlier and not a value for money.The sad part is paragliding has been banned recently as our tour guide narrated.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Valley side and Valley plus are more or less the same to check the scenic beauty of the valley; but...
Response_to_Review: Thank you for your feedback and we are happy to hear that you had a pleasant stay with us. Please note the following points1. We only charge for internet café in the lobby; Wi-Fi is totally free of charge if you have your own device. 2. We will take step to improve the quality of the food served in our Restaurant and make it- Value for Money3. Paragliding has been ban in Panchgani by the government and the police department for safety and security reasons; so we are unable to help you in this regards. However please do contact the Hotel and we can arrange to provide you with some of the reputable Instructors in Panchgani. Thank you also for rating us as high as a five star property .We are a three star certified property and with the support and patronage of the loyal clients that we have built over the years we will very soon rise to the level of 5star category.With Regards;Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “Good stay but can improve on food”
Review_Content: Bit higher on the cost though looks like the best location. The food is not that great nor its value for money. They have beautiful location with good lawn tennis courts. Recommended if you need luxury with higher cost.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose Valley Side or Valley Plus; there's hardly any difference.
Response_to_Review: Thank you for the feedback; however most of our guest do feel that we are very reasonable when compare to other hotels in panchgani and Mahabaleshwar. Your remark on the food is noted and measure will be taken to make it value for money.Regards; Ravine Hotel.

Review_Title: “Nice hotel with a good view and cozy rooms”
Review_Content: The Hotel is located at the Sydney point and has a lovely view from its large wall sized window. The bed & the room are very cozy and pleasant. Food at the restaurant is okay. The game room is not maintained at all.
Response_to_Review: Dear Koyel;Thanks for your review and photos of our hotel; we are extremely sorry for the game room as it was closed for renovations.Hope you will enjoy our game rooms also on your next trip to Panchgani.

Review_Title: “Ok Hotel Great Facade even Better Location”
Review_Content: The Hotel is right below Sydney point; just after the tourist tax collection. The parking is a bit cramped space for about 15 cars. It’s a two storied building.  I had informed the hotel that I would be arriving late. Checking in was not a problem at all. The lobby is nice and big with the restaurant at the rear. I had booked a valley side room and my expec tations were high. I was put up in Room No.206. The room was strictly ok. Very basic amenities and no wardrobe; you get a small ‘box’ below the Television to put in your luggage; the bottom of this box is taken up by a large Godrej electronic safe box (10x6x10). Most of your luggage stays on the floor; dressing table or on the center table. Lucky I was carrying only one duffel bag. The room had a split air-conditioner and a fan The wash room is ok; warm water 24 hrs which is a blessing. One more point to note; the room has a connecting door to Room 205. It seemed to me; they open up the doors for a big family; not a great room to stay in if you are a honeymooning couple. Next day morning I woke up and was anticipating a fabulous view of the valley while sipping my cup of tea. I opened the curtain which are full length and hide the fact that there are no full length French windows. The windows have a barricade wall inside which is 4 feet tall. No chance of looking at the valley while sipping tea. Look at the clouds. If you are staying here during summer you will have a very sunny stay. If you stand at the window you have a fabulous view of the river Krishna and the valley. You can also see the tennis courts from the rooms. We ordered teat Rs.25.00 per cup. Tea not great! Order the Kettle at Rs.50 it’s worth the money. We decided to take a tour of the hotel this is what I found. - The gardens are ok and the swimming pool not worth taking a dip. - The tennis courts are great - There is an Art Gallery which was closed during our visit - A mini theater - Gym ok - A restaurant After a days worth of shopping at Mahabaleshwar we came back tired. My wife did not want to go down to the restaurant to eat so decided to order room service. Big disappointments here; first they only serve starters and snacks in the room. We ordered a few starters and cold drinks. We informed room service to clear the plates and the service guy came the next morning. The food is so-so; the chicken crispy tastes like chicken chilly and the masala papad was soggy by the time it was delivered. For food you have to go down to the restaurant. One other thing I observed that drinking water takes its own time to come. I have stayed at different hotels and noticed that they always a jug of water with room service and take the old one out. The water was only replaced once and that too on request. The restaurant has one of the best views of the valley. The best place to sit and have a cup of steaming coffee and enjoy the scenery. The only plus point of this hotel is the restaurant. Sad that the restaurant is closed to non guests; I would have stayed somewhere else and come to the restaurant for my Tea. Over all a very normal hotel with very Ok service and a restaurant with a great view.

I spend my new year there; the first look and entrance is the best of its kind in panchgani; I face many issues in the hotel few of them are as below :1) Stoppage of water supply2) No hot water flow3) Reminders for the order give in Room4) Late Room service5) Not listening to us over phone; keeping before we finish5) Difference in the knowledge of room service. Reception people says toothbrush is free and room service people say same is chargeable6) New year party was very bad. It was better if starters were served out sideitself. There was no checking is who purchased the pass and not even in theResturant. I have invited a guest from Pune who purchased the pass fromcounter mr Romil but he and his fiancée were not checked at all for food also.Early close up of party. Food available till 12.30 am only. Food was tasty butnot available onetime7) Soft spoken is missing with majorly all the staff exact the housekeepinghead (blue shirt guy) Every spoke rudely as they are doing favour to us.8) In room fresh hill air circulation is less need window slidersOVER ALLVERY BAD EXPERIENCE. I WAS RECOMMENDED BY ARBAAZ KHAN (FILM ACTOR) AND NOWREALLY NOT IN MOOD TO VISIT THIS HOTEL INSTEAD WILL VISIT RAMSUKH OR KEYS.BEST THING OF YOUR HOTEL1) VALUE FOR MONEY2) FOOD IS EXCELLENT3) PROPERTY VIEW IS GOOD
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The hotel got few categoryValley view plus gives your straight view of the valleyvalley view giv...

Review_Content: Stayed at this hotel during my visit to Mahabaleshwar-Panchgani in June 2011. Overall a pleasant experience. The rooms were well maintained; the staff were cordial; the location was scenic and good value for money. Some of the amenities like pool room; badminton court etc was not made available to guests even at a price - I assume they are non-operational.

The service of this Hotel is just horrible; the staff was rude; stubborn and not at all accommodating it seemed they do not care about the customers I was totally pissed off with this service and hospitality.
Response_to_Review: Dear sir; Can you kindly elaborate on what problems did you face and what make you to write such a bad reviews to us. Your reply is appreciated.

Review_Content: Hotel Ravine has an excellent location advantage...but everything else is horrible...staff at front desk are not friendly...waiters at the restaurant are ill spoken...and makes you feel very un-welcome!!! Not much for the kids to do...
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Since one should go here only to enjoy the location...stay in their tents...

Review_Content: Hotel Ravine is strategically placed in panchgani; with spell bounding valley and mountain views from the rooms. The rooms are very spacious and very well designed. The entrance lobby is good and gives a feel of warmth. A recommended place for stay in panchgani for sure.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose the valley facing rooms

Review_Content: We were planning for a trip to mahabaleshwar and panchgani in the rainy season. Though off season it was a different kind of experience. We were advised to stay in panchgani as the rainfall is less here compared to mahabaleshwar. And watta stay we had just because of the hotel. The view from the room is just mind blowing. I would rank this as one of the best hotels i have ever visited just because of the view. Also the service was good enough. Rooms have good amenites. Food is a bit expensive here.

Rooms are bit pricey and they are strictly non-negotiable but the service; location as well as the quality of food is more then excellent. Room interior : They have wonderfully designed rooms (even though they are bit small; but you will never make out). Have LCD wall mounted TV and very well painted walls. Perfect lighting and floor to ceiling windows opening to breath taking view of the valley.Restaurant: Bit costly but the food quantity is good enough for one ..or may be sometimes two (depends on the appetite) ; I tried masala chai and I was thinking if that could be shared by some one else ;)Transport: Easy to locate; thats prominent the moment you enter Panchagani. No use to hire a taxi from the hotel to move around Panchgani and Mahabaleshar.. just a small walk and you will reach a market from where u can get a cab on negotiated price. Location: Sydney Point; Wai-Panchgani Road; Pin 412805 (Ravinehotel.com); 02168-241060

We have been traveling to Panchgani many times and this was the second time we stayed at this hotel. Our stay was Quite Pleasant and comfortable it should be rated as one of the best hotels with excellent view of the valley. The restaurant staff is a bit rude but overall it can be overlooked with all the benefits that you get staying at this hotel

This is one of the hotel of international standard. Rooms are very nice and clean and overall the services meet the international standards. The restaurant we feel was little costly. But the view from restaurant is worth a watch. Unfortunately we could not get the valley view room. But with the price charged in the off season; it was value for money....................................................................................

Review_Title: “one of the best views in panchgani”
Review_Content: The rooms here are cosy with one of the best views in panchgani; the view is of the entire valley right in front of you. Rooms have almost all modern amenities and only the most exp rooms have bathtubs. Running Hot water trough out the day. They don’t have a buffet breakfast at all and breakfast is payable extra and in alacarte and I must say it is very expensive but the view from the restraunt is totally worth it. When ever I went the pool was closed; they also have a spa which is very nice. Located very convieniently also to the main market which is a 2-3 mins drive. i have also stayed in the lovely tents that they have ( shut during the monsoon ) and they also arrange for a bonfire if they are informed well in advance. they also have a gym; a games room; and a mini theatre which also has to be booked in advance and also quite a good collection of hindi/ english movies.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: have stayed at this hotel many times infact; have loved the location for the view from the rooms fac...

Review_Content: we were travelling in a big group and stayed here for 2 nights. it is a good value for money option. the valley view is really great ! the staff was courteous n helpful though the services were slow. prob shortage of staff ; it being off season.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: valley view corner rooms offer a very good double sided view

Review_Content: Ravine has amazing view from 2nd floor overlooking the steep mountain drop on one side; the tennis facility and courts are very good. The viewing area is nice and very comfortable. The service is bit of a let down; the restaurant is okay. In all; good value for money. They had a organized huge telescope for gazing at night sky.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Take room on 1st or 2nd floor

Review_Content: Very Arrogant Management. They show as they do not need customers. All this change has been lately. I have stayed here may more that 10+ times. Have recommned it to many friends and family members. Was a very coordial Hotel to stay. Excellent fodd; location etc.But this visit I repented staying here.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Take valley facing rooms

Review_Content: superb hotel; big time surprises with the overall property. one can just go nowhere and keep staying in the hotel.....the stay will be memorable. we were a group of 13 and the best part is the ground floor cottage rooms...wow!!! the restaurant serves super fresh food; gr8 service and unexpected corners of the hotel leave ur jaw dropped; especially the beautiful tennis court area n poolside area!! must must stay whenever in panchgani!!

It was a booking done based on the website of Hotel Ravine and I must give credit to the entire hotel management for an excellent stay.The hospitality was very good; room was neat and clean; no tips; room services were good; food was excellent and the money paid was worth every penny.Two things that need improvement are 1. accomodation for Drivers - My Driver refused to stay as the place was not clean and 2. poor lighting at the entrance. Thanks to Mr Jagannathan; the Manager in Charge; we had a great time. I would strongly recommend this hotel to any tourist. Satheesh & Radha

a perfect weekend getaway with family and friends....we were a group of 4 headed to ravine hotel panchgani. it is without a doubt the best accomodation to stay at in all of mahabaleshwar and panchgani. all the more worth it if u can make a trip during the weekdays since the prices are relatively cheap. we had booked the ground floor valley room and must say it is perfect for 4 people. probably a little renovation here and there would help. but all in all on a scale of 10..would rate it at 8. food is expensive so its better to head out for meals. also its a good idea to have ur own vehicle since food joints are atleast 1-2 km away and mahabaleshwar is about 17-20 km away. the ground floor valley room has two TV's so thats a huge plus point; although its unlikely that one will have time to watch TV since the hotel has an outstanding gaming parlour and a state of the art gym. evenings can be spent playin pool; TT; tennis or air hockey. For the fitness freaks theres a full fledged gymnasium that can easliy boast of the latest equipments. The hotel has a viewing gallery which gives a breathtaking view of the lake and the entire valley. Since its located at Sydney point the view is to die for. One can sit for hours on end and take in the natural beauty and fresh air. On the flipside; hotel could have been much better if the upkeep and maintenance been more up to date. Some minor details like spanking clean linen is something that is expected if a hotel claims to be a 3 star property. But unfortunately one has to pester the hotel staff to get the same changed. Overall experience was great and highly recommended. On a given opportunity would definitely go back and stay at ravine.

Review_Title: “Great Hotel but Book in advance when going in the monsoons”
Review_Content: 8-9 friends of decided to spend our long weekend in Mahabaleshwar / Panchgani during this monsoon and stayed at Panchgani since it would be convenient to Mahabaleshwar which was not too far away as well and more so the Mapro factory - which has food to die for. We stayed here for 2 nights. The unfortunate part was that we had not pre-booked the room and got only 1 deluxe valley view room and the other had to be a regular room. Thus we managed. The rooms were good and the staff was helpful. Pre-book the rooms in advance since it gets pretty sold out during this period. We pretty much ate out most of the times except maybe the last nights meal before we left and that was good. Also; the indoor games kept us busy. The only negative was the spa. My suggestion would be to check the treatment rooms before you get excited to use them. Even though the same Spa is there at Brightland; but the treatment rooms are far better there than here. Had a bad spa experience. But overall since it was with friends; not bad.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The deluxe valley view rooms are good. Pre-book to get the best rooms.

Review_Content: The huge plus that this hotel has is the 'SUPERB VIEW'. I think its the best in Panchgani. Another plus are the well manitained tennis courts. I think they have 5 tennis courts!! The rooms at the hotel were decently clean but i think they are a little jaded and 'OLD STYLE'. I think the rooms need renovation. All in all a good property to stay in Panchgani.

Review_Title: “Great view from valley side room but lower at cleanliness.”
Review_Content: Nice hotel with one of the great valley views to offer in Panchgani; Mahabaleshwar. Two kilometers before the Panchgani market and very near to Sydney Point. Hotel offers some in-door activities but I recommend personal car for taking rounds here and there. A little expensive on holidays and weekends but overall nice experience to stay. Would like to recommend others.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Second Floor valley side rooms like Jr. Executive and Executive suites are nice.

Review_Content: the stay was great and i will be back soon. The view from the valley front rooms are breath taking you can see the beautiful Krishna river. They even provide tents; there are 4 tennis courts; a very well equiped gym for the fittness addicts.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The rooms are very spacious beautiful wooden furniture perfect with an earthy look.

Review_Content: Ravine is a great place to stay in Panchgini indeed! I have stayed here on three occasions in the last 5 years. Albeit; there is an up side and a down side:Up side: Great view; Melting Pot (hotel restaurant) offers great food and great view; clean; well maintained; plenty of parking; last minute room available for as low as Rs. 2420!Down side: These are really just small little things that keep a otherwise great place from being perfect - No coffee/tea maker in the rooms; bathroom fittings although of good quality and maintenance can use better fitting; no alcohol served in the restaurant
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Even if they are full when you call before hand; its worth it to try for a last minute booking (in c...

Review_Title: “Will be back for sure. Food too expensive. No complementary breakfast.”
Review_Content: This hotel is located at one of the best locations and is just at entrance of panchgani city from Wai side. Valley plus is indeed the best choice for it provides the best view of Krishna valley. Cleanliness in the room was very good. Bed; television; were good too. But no freshner in bathroom. No requirement for AC though each room has one. The kids playing area; valley viewing deck; games room are great but when we went in june 2011 the swimming pool was not greatly maintained and hence had tons of flies.They have a very good facility for movie viewing for the family for just rs 200 per movie in a small theater hall with a wide variety of movies.Bournvita in room would cost about 85 rs in room and plain tea 40 rs per cup which is very pricely and not too great for taste. We found out some LUCKY bakery and restaurant in main town near the circle for some amazing brune bread (lots of variety of fresh bread) along with great tea and coffee. Stomach full of this breakfast costed us 80 Rs.This lucky restaurant is 1 km drive form ravine towards the city.No complementary breakfast; and the steep high pricing of food in the Ravine Restaurant were a turn down.Try purohit thali near the lucky restaurant and its not a miss. Extremely famous Jaffer bhais Delhi Darbar is also recently opened in panchgani for delicious biryanis and kababs.Ravine is indeed the palace of the winds. Not to be missed. Sidney point is just very very close to the hotel. Sitting in your room viwing the valley and the beautiful view; sipping a cuppa is far more comfortable than the agony of pricey food. Dont miss it.

Review_Title: “Must read - Very bad experience... (got an injury and 7 stitches on my hand)”
Review_Content: Must read - Very bad experience... (got an injury and 7 stitches on my hand) When the rooms were taken as ac rooms... There was no ac remote given or provided in the room... So we couldnt even start ac.. Complained thrice for the ac remote; but ac remotes were not delivered.... The shower area is so small that even 1 person can't stand or sit to have his/ her bath. The glass sliding doors which are given for bathing area are not working properly and not even fixed properly; I was having bath and because of the water was too hot I turned the cold water faucet that time by mistake my hand slightly touched the glass and the sliding glass came off on me... I got hurt and it started bleeding... When my father went to complaint.. The manager took it so lightly and he said it is just a toughened glass... Nothing to worry... But I was bleeding heavily... They didn't even have a doctor their or he didn't even call any doctor for that... When we went to doctor we checked everything that time we saw 5 injuries and for 1of the injury I had to take 7 stitches...very bad management....

Hotel location is awesome. Panchgani & Mahabaleshwar is all about valleys and the various points of views. This hotel is on such a place where you can get all the views without going anywhere in the city.Reception staff is not so helpful and friendly. Neither are they adjusting. Restuarent is bad and service is delayed and horribly tiring though room service was much better. We did not get a room cos we went last moment without any prior bookings. Being a peak season we still managed to get the tents and now I know why they were not taken. because the tents are located at valley edge and it was so windy (hopefully only on the day we visited) their that the roof of teh tent keeps going up-down & guup guup all night. We couldn't manage to sleep much but the weather was so awesome that we didn't feel tired at all. Don't take tents if you love your sleep though. But its a pleasure to stay in them. Also we roamed about & checked a lot of hotels around the place but this was the best hotel at the rate offered.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Take tent if you love views.

Review_Content: hotel ravine is one of the modern hotels in panchgani its a 3 star property. we had booked 2 valley plus rooms fr 2 nights pro's-Amazing view the roms are overlooking the valley -good rooms neat and clean -the hotel has got lot of facilities i.e gym;tennis court;spa;videogames;choldren play area;movie room etc Cons-Carry your own booze as they dont serve liquor in the hotel-They dont serve food in the room only starters -The food is expensive
Room_Tips: Room Tip: book the valley plus rooms they are the best room

Review_Content: We decided to drive down to Panchgani from Pune and stay there for 3 days before the Summer Season. We chose the Ravine Hotel on account of its location (just besides a valley). One has to book in advance during season time. Overall; it was a fairly good experience. The rooms are good considering that not too many hotels in Panchgani are large; the food at the restaurant is superb and there is enough to do at the hotel when one does not want to roam around the hill station or the points. It is better to get to the restaurant for any of the 3 meals a little earlier to get the best tables facing the valley; and your food on time. Other facilities used by us included the tennis courts (hardcourts); swimming pool and trampoline. The pool is nice; the courts can be used when not too sunny; and the kids freaked out at the trampoline with nets surrounding it. Parking facilities are there in the hotel; though a little congested in case there is a heavy rush. Also; Sydney point is very close from where one can get a good view of the valley and Panchgani lake.For people who love early morning or early evening walks; distance from the Hotel towards the Panchgani market takes about 30 minutes; and is besides the road. On the way; there are many places where one can get a great view of the Krishna river flowing through the hills.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Preferable to take a room facing the valley

Review_Title: “Good location but let down by staff”
Review_Content: Very good location but was totally let down by staff... understand that June is a peak season but they were not letting us check out even a minute after 10 am.... was disgusted with their attitude... also we were told the rooms have AC but after wanting to turn it on at night; we were told there is additional 500 charge for it... we were furious at that time but helpless.... overall a decent stay.. with average food in the restaurant
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Please chk if you can turn on the AC in your room

Review_Title: “Nice little hotel with amazing views & decent activities.”
Review_Content: Ravine is one of the few good hotels in Panchgani. You have to visit in the right season. If its cloudy; rainy & misty then there's no better place than Ravine. The valley facing rooms offer outstanding views of the huge valley. The rooms are of decent size & decent interiors. The bathrooms are small but manageable. Although the doors need some renovation but overall its fine. The food is alright (not as bad as some other reviews). They have tennis courts; swimming pool & indoor games for time passing. The service is quick & prompt. Overall I recommend this hotel in Panchgani. But little on the expensive side.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Room has to be valley facing at Ravine.

Review_Title: “not ery good ; but not very bad”
Review_Content: i stopped over at panchgani on my way to goa ; stayed at ravine for 2 nights ; i was given the valley facing room ; which was on the 2nd floor on the hotel and there was no lift ; and our common room with frnds was booked on level -1 ; so we had to go up 4 floors everytime we had to go to the room ; the valley facing rooms are match box ; service is slow ; the bathrooms are not very great ; some of the rooms had a good bathroom and some had real bad ones ; so its a lucky draw situation ; the view is breathtaking from the valley facing room and the property is big and has 5 tennis courts ; so tennis lover can head there ; the games and entertainment section is good too ; they dont serve lunch and dinner in the rooms ; very selected food items for room service and the hotel is low on staff ; so wait till the hotel staff attends to u

We were two young couples travelling together with two kids aged under 3. The location of the hotel is awesome; and that is what made us choose that place during an earlier trip to Panchgani. The rooms were well appointed and cosy. Room service was ok; travelling with two kids we expected room service for meals as well; which was not given. The restaurant downstairs; overlooks the valley; so a splendid sight. Food quality; and portions are not that great; especially for the price you pay. Judging by the food served; it seems like the kitchen is not run by professional chefs. Service is slow; but then again; this is hill-station; so we should not be expecting a city-like efficiency.There is a better restaurant Cliff Inn next door; which serves actual restaurant-like food; with tandoor etc and seems more professionally managed; even thought it is attached to its own resort. . i have read many reviews on tripadvisor.com regarding the poor experience of some travellers while interacting with the owner of Ravine; Panchgani.Narrating from my experience; whilst checking out; a young man at the reception asked us if we enjoyed our stay; we gave him honest feedback; with a sugestion that they could look into the bed size which we found was smaller in some rooms (in one of the two rooms we booked; the couple and the 3 yr old child found it a bit uncomfortable to sleep on a smaller bed). Whilst the young man took the feedback as intended; a very senior looking manager standing nearby perhaps overheard and felt offended; and rather unkindly told us that these beds were meant for couples so don't expect to accomodate a child on the same bed. Strange words from someone in the Service Industry. It would have been better to stay quiet rather than respond like this. Our last words to him were \this is our feedback; take it or leave it\"; !!"

Review_Title: “Not so good not so bad. But food was bad”
Review_Content: We were travelling with another couple to this place. Well the owner was at Desk and with a Big Mac machine with all bollywood actors pics as screen saver. No wonder why the owner was showing attitude. We first thought of checking out the tent rooms. They were worst and smelly. Very unhygienic. The waterfall near to this place was stale and stinking.We decided to get the rooms. the rooms are either valley facing or not facing and accordingly priced. We decided to take non valley facing rooms since valley facing rooms were occupied. The room interiors were good but had some leaky pipe just outside our window which made lot of noise.At night we had dinner. It was horrible. Found few human hairs in it . The tables seemed from old flop hindi cinema.The overall place is was OK and I think the owner can start delivering the value for money.

We've stayed at Ravine for 4 nights this April and it was a very plesant experience. The location of the hotel is terrific and you can just laze around with a book or enjoy the indoor games without any need to look outside for entertainment. The atmosphere is very relaxed and the Childrens park is very well maintained. watching the sunset from the hotel is a very peaceful experience.The only thing to bear in mind is that you are on a holiday so likewise make allowances for the service which is not as fast as us city folks would expect. Service is rather slow and laid back but polite none the less.The food at the restaurant \Melting Pot\" is really tasty; authentic and of good quality. It is a little expensive but that is off set by the consistently good quality. We tried all the cuisines available and were happy with all the preparations.The most striking thing about this hotel is the honesty of the staff. I had forgotten my Fast track watch behind. Initially i had thought of writing to the hotel but dismissed the idea as i was not expecting my watch back. Within 3 days of check out the hotel proactively called me up and informed me that they had sent the watch to their Mumbai office and i could collect it from there. Kudos to the honesty of the staff.All in all this was a very good experience at the hotel"

It has been the worst experience till date with this hotel. Before I start with the worse; lets get to the good things. The Good: The location / view is excellent;the tennis courts are well maintained and the Spa is value for money. And this is where it ends. The rooms were quite clean and the room was was cozy. The Bad: The room service is horrible with people not attending for more than hour. We were waiting in the pool for about half an hour before any one could get us few towels. We had to wait for an hour for Tea in the room and when it arrived it was cold. The food is less than average I would recommend you to avoid add try other hotels. The swimming pool was unclean with dead flies floating in the pool. The Ugly: Booking rooms in Ravine was an horrendous experience. First they said that they would be able to give me 2 rooms of my choice as rooms were available and I need to book over the internet. I did the same in the next half hour and was supposed to receive an email within 24 hours. Did not receive anything for 48 hours and then an email saying that their Amex Card machine is not working and if I can provide them with another card they would be able to go ahead an book. I reply to the email within minutes for which I get a reply saying that the rooms are not available as they have been given out to people who had actually sent a request after me. Later I called up and spoke to a senior who offered us two rooms for 18K with an email confirmation of the same. But to our horror when we went for final settlement the bill had become 25k. They said they had calculated the same by mistake which is acceptable but when they accused that we knew about the tariffs and we purposely did not mention it to them it got to me. The experience was disgusting and hope no one has the same ever. It spoilt the whole holiday which had been so much of fun till that point.

Review_Title: “Great views and layout; but service needs some serious make over.”
Review_Content: We planned to stay at Ravine for a weekend of peace and calm. It was far from that. There was a wedding across the road and the music blared from afternoon to late into the night. We requested to the reception to tell them to reduce the sound and they just laughed it off. It was only after a person message to the owner's son did they send someone across and actually got them to reduce the volume.The reception staff needs a lot of brushing up in hospitality.The hotel itself had a stunning location with wonderful views of the valley. We stayed in a Jr. Executive room on the second floor. The hotel does not have a guest lift and hence we had to trudge up a steep staircase. The room itself was large and spacious and well appointed. However ; there were large mosquitoes and no provision to get rid of them. Also the air conditioners have this bright eerie blue light which glows all night and makes it impossible to sleep.The shower area was extremely squeezed and we had difficulty getting in breadth wise.We ordered room service and found the food to be inconsistent. On the first day lunch was fabulous and so was the breakfast the following day. However; the day of check out half the items on the menu were not available and overall the service was terrible. For example; the waiters would barge into the room without knocking; the bellboy was missing on checkout and the front office staff; the lesser said the better.Overall; the hotel is would be considered a little steeply priced for the service but would justify the cost by the amenities around the property which include tennis courts; a swimming pool etc.We researched other hotels in Panchgani during that stay and found Ravine to be the best in terms of room comfort but lacking highly on service and hospitality. A point to note. The outpost camping tents seem to be promising and we would try them out in the cooler season; assuming the service improves and people here on tripadvisor here have something good to say about it before we go.

My husband and I stayed at Ravine for our anniversary weekend and what a great experience we had!Based on the reviews on TripAdvisor; we chose one of the Valley Plus rooms and were so glad we did; because the view from the room was excellent. The room and the bathroom were clean with good facilities. Service was prompt and efficient and the staff was courteous. The size of the room was quite small given the tariff. However; the view more than made up for the smaller size.Another plus I would like to mention is their restaurant. The food was simply amazing although we felt the prices were a little steep for the portions they served. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone! Thanks a lot for the experience.

I travelled to Panchgani during Christmas 2010 and stayed at Ravine. First thing one would notice about it is its awesome location. It is one of the best you would find in whole Panchgani. We stayed in a Valley side room and the view from the room was mesmerizing. I must say that the hotel rooms are exactly same as shown in pictures on their website. I believe they have renovated their rooms and entire hotel completely. Ambiance of the lobby and the restaurant is lovely. Hotel Staff is friendly and helpful. Room service was prompt. Food is on the expensive side but the preparations were good.I would love to go back to Panchgani just to stay at Ravine.

Review_Title: “Nice Hotel with great restaurant and indoor games”
Review_Content: Ravine is a very nice hotel if you want to spend time in calmness of Panchgani. It has lots of indoor games; which ensures that you will not feel bored. The restaurant serves great quality of food. All in all; its a value for money.

Beautiful view. Breathtaking. Worth the money.Good food. highly priced. Not one of the tastiest ever.. just above average.They did serve us in the room with limited options first and on one occasion; with actual full menu available in the restaurant.The attendant who guided me to the room didn't even offer to pick up even a single bag from my hands.I was loaded with three bags and two bags with my wife holding my son.In such situation they made us climb lot of steep and difficult round shaped staircases. Anyone even through humanity would have offered to take at least one bag from my hand. There was service elevator available from inside room. It should have been offered in such miserable and painful climb.This cold attitude was mainatained even at the time of check out.Overall the service was of \take it or leave it..\" \"as is where is basis.However; everything else is overpowered by the ambience and terrific view from Valley Plus room.Recommendation is \"go there with cool head; strong shoulders (to carry things upwards); and lot of money..\""

I have been visiting Panchgani almost every second year and Ravine was a hotel about which I had heard great reviews from family and friends. So this time around I decided to book it for my 2n/3d stay with my friends.The location of the resort is undoubtedly one of the best you can have in Panchgani & Mahabaleshwar. We took the Ground Floor Valley View Room as it were 3 people in all and the room can accommodate upto 4. The interiors of the room are very well done including the furniture and the bathroom.
