Their pricing is exclusive of A/C use; so ensure you calculate the total cost accordingly. Add to this; the room was continuously stinking from the time we checked in and post complaining for 2 days is when they realized that their sewage system wasn't working properly. The room service was very irregular.We visited the place during the off season and hence I would say that we almost got our money's worth.The food is really good. However; the price is a bit steep and the quantity they serve per plate is marginal and unsatisfactory. When it came to services and amenities; the hotel was a total disappointment. All their services had weird timings restrictions including the pool; game room; billiards. Now when I go for vacation; I prefer not to get up at 7 in the morning so that I can play a bit of billiards. On questioning the front desk for an explanation for such timings; all I got was a complaint card which ofcourse was returned blank by me as I knew any feedback would be a waste. The hotel did not have any staff at the managerial position and when asked to speak to a higher authority i.e. the owner (who stays in the hotel itself I guess); I was told to wait as he was in a meeting. For 2 days and a couple of follow ups; I did not hear from the owner. I am guessing his meeting went on for a bit too long.Keeping that aside; the overall experience was very unsatisfactory specially due to the illogically hotel policies and un-cooperative staff.

I usually see Indian people go out on a complete bashing spree when they review anything. Although my experience was bitter overall for the amount of money I paid. I really do love this place. Let me list out whats what.I had to pay the highest possible price (on-season lasted till a day more when I checked in.) They were generous enough to offer 30% overall discount on stay. Also the 10% luxury tax was waived off.The hotel cannot be called a 3 star property; it has to be viewed as a quaint family owned property and it should cater to that market. I loved the bed and valley view room that I stayed in. Also the furnishings in the room were (relatively) tastefully done.The bad things :A/C Charges ExtraWiFi in lobby never worked even after repeated requests.Arrogant elderly man at reception; the others were very warm and friendly;TV of bad qualityInconsistency in luxuryNo room serviceExpensive Spa (relative)I would definitely stay there again even though I had a bad experience; my family and I have been going there for years and years. And you have to try out the butter kulcha at the restaurant its to die for. This place can be so much more I am not giving up on it yet.

The only good thing about this hotel is the scenic views that it gives. Apart from that everything is the worst. They claim to be 3 star property; but it is not at all near to that. everything in the hotel closes down by 10.30 PM; and you wont get anything after that - even tea; coffee or colddrinks ! The reception is utterly slow and takes long time to get things done from them. The policies of the hotel are pretty weird - like game room only available from 7pm to 10pm (thts the time we are always outside; - game room is most needed in afternoons); food not served in rooms; etc. We had booked a Valley Plus room; but on our arrival it was not ready. We agreed that we would downgrade to valley side room which was ready that time. Much to our amazement; the hotel was not ready to adjust the balance amount into our total bill . Not getting the room ready was our mistake ? !!! Also On phone; we were told that people who rent a room would also get access to the bonfire place along with the tent owners. But after paying for the room; they simply denied saying anything of this sort !!!!The worst part of the hotel is the owner... he was the most rude and arrogant person I have ever met in my life. He was not ready to even listen to our problem. He kept blaming us for not been intuitive enough. He even said he doesn't care and the system here is like this; and cannot be changed.It was the worst experience ever for me; with any hotel - I ever stayed in.

Review_Title: “Excellent Hotel - But Keep Away From Tents !!!!”
Review_Content: We visited Hotel Ravine in December for two nights. The booking was done through the Bombay Office. Mr Bharat in the Bombay Office was very efficient in guiding us through the phone for reserving two Executive Rooms for us; being a family of 4 ! The hotel is ideally located; overlooking the valley and the Krishna River and just a stone throw from the Sydney point.The Executive Rooms was simply mind blowing !!! Awesome view with all the amenities. The room keeps one enchanted through the day and this is simply one of the best you can get anywhere ! Each Executive Room actually has two rooms; each with a King size bed and attached bath and TV's and identical views. The bath has a bathtub. Both rooms have 36\ LCD TVs and are well furnished. The rooms also give breathtaking views of paragliding as the view provides a closeup of the glidepath while taking off and landing. The hotel has a small pool - best avoided in winters as the water is ice cold and a game room too. Most of the video games are non operational. However; there are two pool tables available. Also table tennis facility is available but with broken rackets and peeling table. Yet; my girls had their share of fun too ! Game coins (Rs 5 each) can be purchased from the reception. I found the restaurant to be very good - a tad expensive but well stocked; maintained and with smart service. We had dinner from the hotel restaurant on all three days and quite relished the fare provided. Preferred to have our Breakfast and Lunch from other hotels during sight seeing. Free Wi-Fi is accessible in the hotel lobby. We visited the 'serenity' spa on all three days. The Spa provides a wide variety of services. The Aromatherapy is particularly good. The staff is courteous and gives good service. For Hotel Guests; an additional 15 % discount is given on the advertised rates. Couldn't visit the gym though ! The hotel charges different rates for Mon - Thur and Fri - Sun. Based on the first two days fabulous experience; we decided to extend our stay by another night - and had to settle for Kings Tent in the outpost (which is about 10 m below the main hotel building) as all Executive Rooms were booked out for the weekend. Kings Tent is advertised as a Luxury Tent (4 occupants) - but is best avoided if you are traveling with the family in winter ! The tent has a kingsize bed and two additional cots which are tucked under the main bed. Each and every equipment inside the tent has been chosen to give the 'rustic' feel - starting from the old black switches; to the copper pots and mugs in the bathroom and the table / chairs made of logs - however the ancient videocon television/ broken remote and the aged telephone instrument looked out of place in the so called luxury tent. The nights are quite chilly and the tents offer little warmth. The bath tub in the tent gave creeps with little 'crawlies' roaming about. If traveling alone or for adventure; tent may prove interesting - but considering that the kings tent and the executive rooms are comparatively priced; the tent offers poor value for money. Yet at the end of the day; its a great hotel with a great spa; great view; great rooms and great food ! The room service can definitely improve to live upto the three star rating."

Stayed at Ravine with my family. We booked 4 rooms and had 4 little kids with us. The hotel location is spectacular; but the spectacular bit ends right there! The service was the WORST POSSIBLE ever! We could not decide between who was worse amongst the lot: the extraordinarily rude and obnoxious owner; the ruder restaurant staff; or the not so timely room service staff. The rooms were sub-standard; with no hot water for an entire day. Never got anyone to attend to it even after hours of filing the complaint. The bed in my in laws room broke at midnight! The showers had no pressure. I still think we would have endured it all; had it not been for the owner who was barking at almost every customer who walked in through the door. Not to mention he fleeced us of 3000Rs for a tent which we never stayed at or even got the keys to. I think Ravine is overhyped and a terrible experience owing to the people there.

Review_Title: “A great place to relax and enjoy picturesque Panchgani”
Review_Content: I stayed in Ravine Hotel for a weekend trip to Panchgani; with my family members. This hotel is truly a marvel. Beautiful view of valley; great ambiance and equally good restaurant is what you can expect here. You will enjoy every bit of your stay. This hotel is frequently visited by celebrities. The best part is you can enjoy the best of hospitality in Panchgani at a very very decent price. It has a decent kids play area as well. I would definitely recommend it to whomsoever looking for a good hotel in Panchgani/ Mahabaleshwar

to start with mahableshwar is a beautiful place ...the long drive is so beautiful ......the hotel is very nice .....the rooms are awesum;They are charged on a higher side though......however all the rooms have different views and are beautiful in a different way.It is usually chilly thorough out the year. the in house restaurant is nice over looking a valley where u can do paragliding.if u have the bucks arnd 4500 a day make sure u stay here its really romantic and peaceful..Especially in the nights it gets really spooky cold and foggy......

I went to ravine inn to spend the weekend on my birthday. went there with my family. I had researched some bit while booking hotels as i wanted to make sure that the hotel which we stay are good as my family was me. I could book the hotel online via credit card ; which is great. the hotel is just 10 mins away from the market; 15 mins walk to the market area (which i dont prefer) but I took my car so that was not an issue. the entrance lobby is good and clean. had posters of aamir khan and other bollywood celebritites that had also visited the hotel. we had booked the main valley facing rooms so on entering the room i was happy to find a great view. The view that it offered was gr8. the room had other usual facility like LCS tv; nice decor and good bathrooms. there are tent options that you can utlise but i prefered the valley facing rooms over the tent. there is a basement games room; a tennis court in the hotel; which is good. i played some pool which is located at the basement. coming to the food; i didnt find much on the menu and whatever was there wasnt too good (atleast for the value) so I would suggest you have a car with you; you can go to market and have good food. in the night; hotel had arranged for a paid view of stars through the telescope.overall the experience was good; and barring the food; i like the hotel and would like to visit it again with my family.

We stayed @ Ravine for a couple of days in Sep 2010. Though it was a off season; Ravine was full of guests...The hotel is situated right on Sydney Point Panchgani and the view from its Valley Plus room is truely breathtaking...Initially we had planned to stay in Valley side room but as it just gives you glimpse of the valley; we shifted to valley plus room..Positives of this hotel includes1). welcoming and friendly staff and the reception 2). excellent location3). Well designed & Equipped rooms4). Nice Food5). Panoramic view of valley from the roomFollowing are the things I was not happy about...1). Overpriced food @ their restaurant 'The melting Pot'2). Small sized Swimming Pool3). The fixed glasses in the room reduces ventilation a bit (I would prefer sliding windows)But all in all it was wonderful experince @ Ravine - truely a palace of the winds....

First time here at the Ravine; amazing views; rooms were clean;however service was not as good as other hotels in the area; response was very slow. The other major issue was the Serenity Spa which offered spa services. We went for a steam and found the temperature very high at 50 degrees; after complaining; the management would not accept that it was too high which was very dangerous-and we still did not obtain a refund or proper apology-so don't use this spa at all....!

Review_Title: “Survive the Food and You Will survive Ravine”
Review_Content: For the first time I actually saw the room which was exactly the same as the picture showed up on the Website of the Hotel and was impressed to see the same.Ravine is located right at the doorstep of Panchgani and has fantastic view from each of it's rooms. The place; the environs are just fantastic and anything wrong being said about the hospitality they offered would also be incorrectBut when the hospitality; good rooms and good view ends; that is where the HORROR named the Restaurant starts. The food is over-priced; over appreciated and pathetic. There is nothing good to mention about it. From the basics of Cottage Cheese to the Chinese Delicacy everything was Inedible. Have food there in-case you would wanna come back to your home for a week long Constipated Stomach or Diarrhea. It is just freaking not worth eating. Short and simple advice; if in Panchgani - Mahabaleshwar; Stay at Ravine but DO NOT EAT at Ravine.

Panchgani: Ravine HotelWe booked our hotel for a weekend stay. We were a family of 6 with one couple so we booked a Vally Plus room for couple and Ground valley for the other four people. The rooms were nice and the aesthetic was good. The cleanliness of the room was also good. Our stay was a pleasant stay. The hotel is located on a hilltop overlooking the valley. The rooms were spacious. Would highly recommend this hotel.

I had visited this hotel in June 2009. It was great. I took a suite room. It has a stunning view of the valley. At that time major renovation was going on. By now i hope it has completed. Lookiing forward to stay again.

Very comfortable place very picturous and loads of adventure from para gliding to treking to mountain climbing around. Absolute value for money.... If you want to spend time with yourself in peace this is the hotel.....

This hotel has recently been renovated; and they have done a splendid job. The best part of the place is the view. We got a corner room that overlooked Sydney point. It gave us the best view of the sunsets. The rooms were spacious and clean. The floor to ceiling windows offered spectacular views throughout the day. The shower cubicle was very narrow so you have to squeeze in it.They also have some private cottages located near the cliff edge (with adequate safety precautions). They are luxurious and secluded...ideal for couples. They also have a nice sit-out area from where you can look at the valley.There are two tennis courts; an indoor game center and a spa at the hotel. We tried out their spa. The massage was good (not great). It can be tried after a long day of sightseeing.Just next to the hotel; on the cliff; operators provide a chance for paragliding. If you are afraid of heights; you can sit out in the lawn and watch other paragliders sail by over the valley. The hotel staff at the reception were friendly; and gave us directions and map for sightseeing. The restaurant offers good food; although it is priced slightly higher than expected. They have limited room service...only certain items can be ordered in rooms.Overall; definitely value for money; and an excellent getaway.

This hotel has a great location to offer. Overlooking the valley with a view of the river & dam below. It is spectacular when the clouds are low and meets the hotel; especially during the monsoons.It's location is right opposite the Panchgani toll stop when coming from Wai. Service; food & rooms are average. One has to drive down to go to the market. Not within walking distance. If the mgmt. can spruce the hotel; I am sure that it will be great value for money.I stayed there since I had business in Panchgani and with my own car; did not have to worry about transportation. Rooms on my floor had other guests who were just terribly loud and noisy with kids running all over the floor. Quite a racket. Pretty annoying. I even complained to the front desk but they did not seems to be able to do anything. I wish they offered buffet breakfast. Rooms are all without any meal plans.Stay there only for the location or if you have no other choice available in Panchgani. I would definitely suggest staying in Mahableshwar if you are on a holiday and visit Panchgani for day trips.
splendid in all ways; best value for money they made my trip the most memorable the restaurant is the best good food

Wow what a place. My family planned a very impromptu trip of going to panchgani for ONLY a day. I decided to book this place in advance but the lady from mumbai was pretty rude saying they only do bookings for 2-3 days and that all rooms were full. I still however went to panchgani without any bookings and when directly to this hotel and voila I was able to get the second last room available. The rooms have a good valley facing view but this is only for couples. Maximum four people can stay in a bunker kind room. for 6 and more there are tent structures so no room. Hotel has its own pool and the tents have their own pool so thats good. Food is very expensive.... The place is 2 kms before you enter Panchgani from wai near sydney point. The view of the valley in the night is simply mindblowing. Not sure how many hotels in panchgani can provide that.
3 Star Hotel; Most popular hotel visited by Bollywood

Hotel Ravine is located on Sydney Point and has a lovely ;completely unobstructed view of the valley below.The Hotel is a big property and has 3 tennis courts as well as a gaming arcade with pool tables and video games.There is also a lovely open air terrace which overlooks the valley.We had gone on the Xmas weekend and so the rooms were quite eexpensive as compared to normal days.The food is slightly expensive and there are no coffee/tea makers in the rooms which was a bit surprising.The staff was helpful but the personal touch was missing due to the xmas rush.On the whole the place is quite decent and worth a stay at Panchgani-probably one of the better hotels there.

It was a awesum place to be..food was good; room service was excellent.simply every thing was good..a must visit place..it was a yr back since i visited this place...but its still fresh in my mind..would surely give a visit again..

This place is wonderfully located overlooking the valley.It has spacious rooms and wholesome food on the menu.A very clean hotel and fits perfectly in the budget !!Though a little far from Mahabaleshwar;it is worth spending the extra time driving up and down !!!!

I can say with absolute conviction that no hotel or even resort in Panchgani can beat Ravine’s amenities; classy service and of course; its superb location. Food is good and you shall be spoilt for choice. In-house restaurant is well-appointed and has great ambience. Amenities include adventure sports like paragliding and kite surfing. Give it a try; unless of course you are scared of heights. Great place to spend a relaxed weekend.I really enjoyed this panchgani trip with my friends and at cool hotel ravine.

Hey I have a wonderful experience last weekend while in Ravine; Just wanted to say what a fantastic time me and friends in Ravine.We cannot thank you enough for all your help and advice from beginning to end.\May I give you my heart felt thanks for a wonder weekend ; one that we will most probably remember for ever more. Every moment of our time at the Revine was faultless.\"Hotel Ravine delivered an excellent friendly service and were more than happy to help out with any requests. The husky tour and snow mobiling were fantastic and truly memorable!I work in the travel advertising industry and I can honestly say I have never come across a company that provide such a helpful; friendly; personal service and I would not hesitate in recommending Artic Discovery and the Lapland experience to anyone Thank you so much and we look forward to our next tour. \"We hoped for calm and comfort and found so much more. The tranquil and peaceful surroundings along with enjoyable company were wonderful and we were really appreciative of all the efforts of the Chef Ð what wonderful fare and service we enjoyed \" thank you .\"Thank you for a very enjoyable weekend at your excellent hotel. We were able to spend time with friends in a relaxed atmosphere; having been made very welcome by yourselves and your staff. We found the hotel extremely comfortable and the Ôlittle extrasÕ you provide make all the difference. We look forward to visiting again.\" We shall certainly be back and I shall be recommending you to everyone I know. Once again; very many thanks; and look forward to being with you again in the not too far distant future.\"  Therefore; have to tell you that this weekend was everything we all had hoped for and more. In fact it was one of the most memorably fabulous weekend we have ever had ! The whole experience was as exciting for us. We have some really lovely photos for the family album and special memories; so a big thank you from us all!"

Review_Title: “Hotel with the best view in town; but nothing else ...”
Review_Content: I visited Panchgani with my spouse and parents and droppen into Hotel Ravine without any prior booking. I was informed by the hotel that they do not accept prior bookings for 1 night stay at the hotel during weekends. As a hill station the only thing that you can enjoy in Panchgani is the amazing view of the valley; the cool climate and strawberries. My decision to select the hotel was purely on account of availability of a good view. I was lucky to get one Valley View Plus room as a walk in customer. I guess I would have walked out if I was not getting that room category. The rooms were descent and the service was good; but it was nothing amazing or spectacular. But the view definitely was ...!! The food sucks and the menu offers only chicken and paneer (cattage cheese); and the preparations were nothing to rave about. But the view offered from the room covers for all deficiencies the hotel may have. I would suggest that travellers only stay in this hotel if they get a valley view plus room and have their meals outside in some of the heritage hotels in the vicinity.

This a beautiful hotel; and the best thing about it is the location -- its situated in lush gardens; at the very edge of the valley and overlooks an amazing view. Its a pleasure to just sit in the dining -room ; or at your bedroom window; and gaze out ! The rooms are clean and well -furnished ; and the staff was reasonably efficient -- though a little slow. There was a good restaurant; too; though we found the prices a bit on the higher side -- I guess we were paying that little bit extra for the view !!The only drawback was that there was a lot of construction activity going on; so our peace was disturbed by the sound of hammers and drills at odd hours. However; we were assured that this was only temporary ; and that the renovations would be completed very soon.Paragliders swooping around outside our windows provided an extra thrill -- the hotel is a centre for pargliding also !All in all; we had a great time and would certainly return here.

Panchgani is a very quite place and it is difficult to find any thing which will make you experience an adrenaline rush. Recently they have started paragliding here and although it may get you excited but it will not be until a glider system failure; till you can experience the mad rush in your head which you can easily get if you decide to stay at this hotel. Situated at Sydney point with a beautiful view of the valley; the hotel staff and owner are all ready to give you the biggest shake ups. They are very relaxed and very high on attitude. Being relaxed; they like you also to relax and wait for the hours for even the basic services. The fact is the guests here are mostly travelers who may not visit the place more than once; so it does not matter to the staff what impression they all carry back. Service is the last thing you can expect from them. The rooms are good but things work on their own mood here. No lifts to take you up; but the highest rates to bring down the load on your money bag. The food is expensive and takes its own sweet time to come.Try this hotel only if you want to experience being thrown out in the middle of the night for asking for a jug of water.

The hotel is conveniently located near the entry point to Panchagani (from Wai) and offers a magnificent view of the valley. The facilites are top notch which include tennis court; amphitheatre; full fledged Gym and host of electronic games for kids. Besides the staff is also very co-operative. For adventure tourists; the management can also help organise para sailing which is quite popular of late. The hotel is also quite popular with film / TV celebrities and if you are lucky you might meet someone (We were lucky to meet Vidya Balan)The only disadvantage was that the hotel does not offer any package deal. As a result we had to hunt for good places (which are not that many around the place) for luch and dinner. The hotel has a restaurant that offers Chinese and Continental cuisines but the food is relatively ok.

I visited this hotel with my family during the monsoon season. We visited the hotel directly and made the booking. This hotel does not negotiate at all.The location of the hotel is great about 10 mins drive from the table land from 5 mins from sydney point in panchgani.The view from the valley facing rooms is amazing and offers you great view of the koyna valley.The rooms are decent with limited furnishing. The bathrooms are compact.The hotel as a restaurant; lawn; tennis court; pool; carrom facilities. The food is good.

Review_Title: “A blot in the name of hospitality”
Review_Content: We were given a different room to the one we required/described. Please do not go by the photgraphs that were given in the website. The hotel is completely different than the one shown on their website and is utterly gibberish. The hotel rates itself as a 3-star property but I don't think it should be rated a 1-star. The bathrooms are badly maintained; the mattresses are very dirty and so are the towels. There is no concept of a thing called service. And the promoter of the hotel has the audacity to tell the customers; if you complained to him; \to take it or leave it\". I have never heard of this in my entire travel life. I did not taste the food there as they could not even get a cup of tea right. In addition; the food is very expensive - probably they rate themselves a 3-star so that they can charge 5-star rates. Overall; not worth a visit. Please go there at your own risk."

Last time we went there the romms looked beautiful and the food was excellent.This time the rooms were in bad shape; though food continues to be the same.There was also some renovation going on.. if the rooms and the bathrooms are renovated then this will again be the best place to stay in Panchgani

We really regretted staying here. There is a lot of work going on and if you have young children; you MUST be very careful because there was welding going on in the path to the garden. The restaurant does not serve any alcohol. The food is mediocre at best. Our room was on the 2nd floor (ground-first-second) and the elevator was turned off. The walls of the staircase were dirty and you won't feel like touching them for support.The room was ok; but the bathroom was a horror. The sink was cracked and water leaked onto the floor. The view was valley facing and very nice. Great sight to wake up to everyday. Parking was a hassle. One night; we came back to the hotel at 11:30; and the lot was full. The guard managed to squeeze our car into the space in front of a tunnel which led to the valley. The staff don't understand hindi or english very well. Swimming pool--Closed. The only redeeming point was the view; but then there are a lot of other places with the same view. Don't stay here.
good place to spent quality of time with ur loved once.

Review_Title: “Nightmare in Ravine - thieves!!! Dont visit the hotel”
Review_Content: Hi -Its a terrible place - full of thieves; pls avoid at all costs. The owner is rude. Our cellphone was flicked by the employee of the hotel and owner refused to cooperate and even didnt call the cops.Avoid at all costs!!!

We returned from Panchgani last week (jan 19-22/2009)and i can close my eyes and still feel the fresh mountain air flowing through my lungs. But have to come out of my slumber cos i know we are back again in very polluted mumbai. I stay in thane and me & my wife travelled on one pleasantly cold monday morning for our 3 nights 4 days trip to panchgani & mahableshwar. The journey was fantastic since i took along my car and reached panchgani in exacly 4hrs.15min (including 30 minutes spend at a roadside eatery) at hotel ravine.Oh..it was my first experience of panchgani and ofcourse Ravine.So how do i think the hotel is??? Well they call themselves 3 star hotel and truth be told the hotel stays true to that.It is indeed 3 star with all the necessary amenities. But the major attraction apart from its 3 star status is its location. A stunning view from the hotel of deep ravines; picturesque hamlets and a flowing river all make for a paisa vasool (vfm...value for money) getaway. We saw many foreigners staying at the hotel in this off-peak season (try it cos rates are almost 50% less in off season) so i cannot imagine how crowded it must be in the peak season.The service was good and the staff was also very helpful. The hotel is clean (yes even the bathrooms are spotless) and airy because of its beautiful location. One big plus is the magnificent view the hotel restaurant offers with endless mountains; deep gorges and the stunning krishna river which keeps you reminding you are actually seated on edge of a mountain. Any negative points? yes; lack of ventilation in the bathroom (needs an exhaust) and yes the very pricey hotel restaurant. But i can overlook the fact that the target customers are foreigners for whom per dish will hardly cost 4 USD . Cheap for them. Convert that to indian rupees and we start comparing with every normal indian eateries we go to!!! So do not fret; try the panchgani market area which is 1.5kms away from here for normal indian & chinese food. Again; there is ample parking space and it is also near to the panchgani market area. So you cannot go wrong on this....if you plan to make a trip to panchgani give Hotel Ravine a try....you won't be disappointed. Abhijit Kale

Review_Title: “Totally avoid the place for at least 6 months!!”
Review_Content: They are undergoing major construction work. We thought we had booked 2 valley facing rooms but were given valley side views. The bathrooms in the lobby stank. There is work going on everywhere. There was a large drill going on at 7:30 pm when we walked in. The elevators were also not working. The bathrooms in the room we were shown was wet and given that there are rains now; they were all muddy. And the straw that broke the camels back was the attitude of this guy at the front desk who had this \holier-than-thou\" attitude and that he would never cheat anybody. That is how we felt when we landed up there cause nobody mentioned anything about renovation etc. What a waste cause they really have a great location and could have done so much with it. Anyways; bottom line we walked out of the place (2 families with a total of 4 kids in tow) in spite of the manager charging our credit card for Rs 2300 as some sort of cancellation fee which we will dispute! That guy needs a serious attitude adjustment to succeed in the hospitality business."

We had a terrible experience. We were robbed while we were sleeping in the room at night of all our money; totally Rs 8000/- including the money in my husbands wallet and my wallet and my mobile phone was stolen. There is absolutely no security and the hotel manager on informing about this terrible incident was least interested to really help us. He refused to come to the police station when called by the cops. He told us he would have the staff searched but I don't think he ever got it done as all the staff was busy doing their respective work; \So who was being searched?\" and when we were at the police station getting the complaint written he told us over the phone not to come back to the hotel as nothing was found from the staff as they has been searched.When we got this printed in the newspaper he commented that he searched the staff in front of us and we were not satisfied which is a total lie.We were robbed of most of our money and the manager had the audacity to serve us with a bill of 286/- for snacks that we had ordered. He had no courtesy to waive it of as a gesture of decency and customer service after all we had been robbed in his hotel."
Reviewer:Roohul AmeenThe hotel is magnificent with incredible service and the Valley View from the room is just Fabulous; definetly we shall visit again...

A great hotel with breathtaking views. We stayed in a family room and the rooms were quite spacious. The views from the room window were beautiful. The meals at the restaurant was quite tasty and the bonus that comes with the hotel is the stars you get to meet there if you are lucky. We met some bollywood and hollywood stars at the hotel. Our stay was well worth it. We were there during the winter months and we caught some film shootings happening around as well. The hotel doesnt have a bar so if you're looking for a drink the hotel staff can arrange to bring one for you from the markets. I would highly recommend this hotel as its the only decent hotel in panchgani.
We had an excelent stay.....great staff who were real warm and friendly. Go just after the rains the best time to see the greenery. Will visit again soon.

Review_Title: “One of the best govt. run Hotel RTDC Vinayak”
Review_Content: Best hotel for all. Lookwise very good; well maintained; beautiful garden in front of hotel; nice place for children to play; good seating arrangement; comfortable rooms and clean tents; delicious breakfast & food ; co-operative staff; very good service; Very good staff also; especially Mr. Rathod and Mr. Babulal Meena; they are very co-operative and suggest best advice too. Mr. Babulal Meena is very enthuciastic and energetic person; result oriented person. He is also helpful to book safaries. If u need any type of help regarding hotel and safari booking he will definately help u without any hesitation.

Review_Title: “Good stay; but hotel need to pay a little more attention to some areas.”
Review_Content: Our stay at RTDC VINAYAK at Ranthambore was memorable due to good service and behaviour right from the reception desk to the group d staff.The Suite room was well maintained and toiletries; towels; bed linens were upto the mark. The suite has 2 bathrooms and 2 sitting rooms and 1 big bedroom with Good balcony. Although the spread in breakfast and the dinner (buffet system) were good but Lunch was really poor. They were charging good amount per head for that in MAP plans. The lunch must be improved at any cost.The Souvenir Shop inside the building is really good containing variety of dress materials; caps/hat; and gift items.Note: We saw tiger T24 USTAD. (male) on safari on 6th of October.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose Suite room no 108. (only 1 suite room is there)

Review_Title: “Excellent location.. Good service.. Friendly n helpful staff... But price should be lesser...”
Review_Content: Property n room condition is old.. Should be maintained well.. Tent was torn from many sides.. Bedding n cot was not good.. Bathroom was clean but many small insects.. May be due to proximity to jungle... Charges are in the higher side w.r.t infra.. Service n location are definitely commendable...

I find the place to be just ok. It is a government run hotel near a jungle in a smalll city; and is not expected to be excellent ;-)In bathroom u will find two nirma soaps and clean towels. Decor is ok and is nothing expensive.Food menu is limited and mostly tastes okay to good. Nothing lavish or extraordinary.Bed is comfyPricing is neither cheap neither costly;100% payment to be done for booking thru the website; which is strange.They manage to book a safari at minimal extra cost in advisable zones in the last hour. So it seems they have good contact as we visited when there was maximum rush in the park.ALL hotels are located on the same 5 km stretch of Ranthambore road. The road lacks proper transportation. The whole city also dsnt has any nice place to do shopping or eating out. Hence most hotels offer MAP plans. So in the end there is nothing to do inside the hotel and in the city; other than a safari. SUGGESTED ITINERYReach in time; do a safari; stay overnight; do another safari and move

I have visited Ranthambhor National Park between 9-11 May'14. The RTDC hotel is a decent place to stay specially if you are looking at value for money and your main purpose is to visit the tiger reserve and safari. All staff and employee are very helpful with nice behavior. The place is in between railway station and ranthambhor park gate. Safari can be arranged from the resort itself but advisable to book it online. Food buffet spread is limited but taste is excellent. They have a bar as well. Rooms are very clean and spacious. The lawn outside is also nicely maintained. Overall nice stay.

I and my family are regular visitors to Ranthambhore National Park since last 3 years almost once in a month. And always we used to stay in VINAYAK only. Everything in the hotel is perfect for wildlife experience. Rooms are neat and clean with all required amenities. Food quality is excellent. Staff is now quite familiar with us as we are regular visitors to the hotel. But every time when we visit here; we found them more energetic and helpful. The best thing for the hotel is the proximity to the jungle. We use to book a room and a tent on our every visit. You can see the wild life just behind the hotel as the hotel is on the edge of jungle. If you want to feel the real jungle; then you must stay in tents which are camped on back side of hotel; very near to jungle. It is going to be awesome experience especially in night when you can hear a lot of wild life noises. But beware the nights in the month of Dec and Jan is very cold.I had recommended a lot of guest and friends of mine to stay here only. And I and my family will stay at Vinayak only when ever we visit Ranthambhore.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: In summers; book ground floor room and in the month of Oct; Nov; Feb and march try the swiss tent.

Review_Content: This Hotel was recommended to me by one of my friend. At first was hesitating to book at this place. However; went ahead with the booking. Was really surprised and amazed by the service. Decent Hotel with Very Good Location; Good Food (Taste); Nice & Friendly Service. The booking procedure was a bit complicated; however; they helped me from the Hotel with the booking step by step. This is something I did not expect taking in account the number of phone calls I made. Once the booking was done. They also helped me with the Safari bookings. The Hotel is also out of town so no shops in or around.Surely to Visit this Hotel again...!!! Also Thanks to Mr Rajkumar who helped me the most...!!!

We stayed there for 2 nights and it was a satisfying experience. The rooms were spacious and well maintained. The staff were courteous and cooperative. One can book the jungle safari through the hotels. The vehicle will pick you for the safari from the hotel itself and later drop you there. The room tariff included breakfast and one meal-mainly the dinner. The quality of food was good and dinning area was clean. A nice place to stay if one is planning to visit Ranathambore.

This was my fourth stay in Hotel Vinayak and it has improved in every manner. We reached the Hotel around 2 PM and were served with a great north Indian Food with awesome taste which made us forget 5 Star Hotels and Dhabas. Rooms are spacious with extra sleeping space at the window. The front garden allows the guests to enjoy the lawns for relaxation. The Hotel is superb and is within a traveler's pocket. Will again stay in this RTDC property whenever I visit Ranthambore.Note - Do have Palak Paneer and Tawa Chappati for Lunch.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: First Floor in Winters.

Review_Content: Vinayak was overall a satisfactory experience. Staffs were responsible. Food was excellent. They served buffet breakfast and dinner. Menu was pretty good. Rooms were clean. During my next visit to Ranthambore I would surely stay here.

Me and my wife went to this guest house maintained by RTDC during April this year. We stayed on ground floor. The room was clean and big. However when we went there a huge rush of tourist and the staff seemed not up to the mark to handle such a huge crowd. Also we booked the safari online. But you have to show them the receipt at counter and they will finalize the booking. However some seats can be bought from the Hotel staff itself. So the manager was more keen to satisfy them than people who booked online. Also the behaviour of the staff was rude sometimes.The food was good but it was buffet only. No option of choosing from menu. Overall you get okay experience on a limited budget.

Okay; so here we were again; after one year; and must I say that we were absolutely happy with our stay at RTDC Vinayak. There is not a single soul from the hotel staff who wouldn't stop to speak with you and/or is ready to help you with anything that is within their ability. Food is still nice; albeit a bit oily; rooms are clean; linen is clean & crisp; and staff is ever-ready to help (even with your safari bookings). And to top it all; it is extremely great value for money. I'd highly recommend this place... and yes; during my next Ranthambhore trip; I'll stay there.

We checked into the hotel during our visit to Ranthambore National Park in April 2014. The hotel is very good. We had booked one family room. The room was clean and so was the bathroom. The food is good and the hotel staff is very helpful. We arrived late from morning safari but we got breakfast also.However; the family room should be equipped with atleast 2 nos. of bathroom. The AC provided is not matching with the size of the room and in April heat; the AC becomes ineffective. The water supplied is also very hot and the authorities should take steps to have cooler water supply to the rooms.The quality of food provided is really good. Dinner is generally buffet and included in the room tariff. The dinner hall was clean and plates provided were equally good.Overall it is a good budget hotel.

We stayed at Hotel Vinayak for a night. The hotel offers you some nice views of forest. We checked in at around 230 pm and they promptly arranged safari for us from hotel itsel( with a nominal extra charge). Pakodas served in eve were mind blowing. Dinner and B/f as part of package were also good. Overall a good value for money accomodation!Mr. RajKumar there is always keen to share his two decades of experience and knowledge on Tiger. We got lucky spotting a Tiger on Route no. 3 as well.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: we stayed in Ac room on first floor and they had nice views to offer( No balcony though)!

Review_Content: One of the reasonably priced hotels; safe and clean. Stayed in a deluxe AC room under the Modified American Plan( morning Tea; Breakfast and dinner). The staff was extremely homely depicting the true traditions of Indian and especially Rajasthani hospitality. The room was neat and tidy with all points working. The food was ok (if you have Indian taste buds) they should keep traditional rajasthany food in the menu

One of the reasonably priced hotels; safe and clean. I stayed alone as a single woman traveler and found it quite a safe place with friendly staff. The food was good. Only thing I was disappointed was with the hotel not being able to provide a cup of tea before the morning safari. Another disappointment was that the hotel staff was burning dry leaves in the premises and creating pollution when they had plenty of ground to create pits and decompose it in an environment friendly way. Hope RTDC will issue suitable instructions to its staff.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: I chose the one on first floor which provided a good view of the forest behind the hotel and had an...

Review_Content: Stayed in a deluxe AC room under the Modified American Plan( morning Tea; Breakfast and dinner). The staff was extremely homely depicting the true traditions of Indian and especially Rajasthani hospitality. The room was neat and tidy with all points working. The food was great (if you have Indian taste buds) and took away the disappointment of not sighting a tiger during the two safaris undertaken. Overall a pleasant stay and highly recommended. Would recommend that one does the booking online to avoid last minute disappointment. The jungle safari too should be booked well in advance if one wants a gypsy (we had to manage with a canter....anyways themore the merrier). Please carry mosquito repellants to the resort.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: For a family of four ; would recommend an AC deluxe with extra beds (@ rs900-oo per head)

Review_Content: We were 3 families who visite ranthambore in January & after checking several hotels we came across this RTDC which had Swiss tents available. This was the only hotel where we got good rates compared to the other ones where the prices were way to high. We checked the rooms & decided to book Swiss tents.Bed is not very comfortable & its just iron beds which have been placed with dunlops on top of it. Bathroom was clean though.Unfortunately they did not provide any heater & in night it became terribly cold & even with our sweaters; jacket & blanket we felt very very cold.The tent was very basic with just a bed & a chair.Outside the tent they had 2 chairs placed just to sit & enjoy your morning tea.Food though was really tasty & staff was helpful.They arranged a bon fire for us & also got us safari tickets booked in last moment.Overall for those who like adventure can plan to stay in the tent. What the price you pay it is good value for money.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: In January go for rooms in the building rather than tents as it becomes really terrible at night.

Review_Content: Our stay at RTDCVinayak was one of the best in the forest. We booked family room. very spacious.Simple clean; airy and well maintained. Each room has an attached bathroom; they are clean; with all faucets & geysers working fine. The room where we stayed has a terrace which offers a decent view and is a good spot to check out birds. The staff provides superb service and hospitality. We're tired and reached around 1600 hrs but they're eager to help; they offered to collect our boarding passes for the safari for a minimum amount.We wanted something to eat and kind of food they delivered is really awesome. Pakoras; omeletes; chai and sandwiches on order whenever you want. Bar is equipped. It's a great forest stay for those who loves nature and peace.

stayed at the hotel vinayak in January 2014. We had booked Swiss tents and it was exceptionally cold. The Staff was courteous enough to provide extra blankets. They make all arrangements for the safari at Ranthambore Park very easy (even though we had booked it online beforehand). Food was excellent but limited fare; the staff are very courteous and every meal was enjoyable.Its just 2 km from the Park entrance and you have a lot of birdlife in the hotel grounds itself.If you are looking for a comfortable; no nonsense; comparatively cheap stay at Ranthambore then Vinayak is the way to go.I will surely go there if i visit ranthambore again.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Don't go for the tents in December and January. Rooms are a better bet in the cold

Review_Title: “One of the best govt. run accomodation”
Review_Content: Like the title reveals; our stay at Vinayak was undoubtedly one of the best at any government run hotel in the country. Located about 2 kms away from the main entry of the Ranthambore National Park the hotel has a sunny garden with blooming bougainvillea; some chairs and a couple of swings. There are rooms on the ground and the first floor; all of them simple clean; airy and well maintained. The ones on the ground floor also have a lovely seating space near the window which turned out to be our group's favorite. Each room has an attached bathroom; they are clean; with all faucets & geysers working fine. There's also a terrace which offers a decent view and is a good spot to check out birds.The staff provides superb service and hospitality. Eager to help; they will help you book your safari (though that's best done online in good time through the http://tinyurl.com/prjbnu5 ); they collect your boarding passes for the safari for a minimum amount; help arrange a jeep for a visit to the fort or pick-up and drop to the railway station. The best part; they all have tons of tiger tales.Coming down food. It's good. They offer buffet for breakfast and dinner (which is included in the room rent) and a la carte otherwise. Pakoras; chai and sandwiches on order whenever you want. The place also has a bar.It's a great budget stay for those who are looking for a decent place to sleep after their safaris in the forest.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: The rooms on both the floors are nice; through ones on the first floor offer a good view and might h...

Review_Content: Gave them a poor rating on the last trip (May 2013); so will take this one as an improvement...What's Good: Service remains hospitable; They're willing to go the extra mile; Food is reliably goodWhat's Not: Had a massive corporate crowd and hence refused to do ala carte service which meant the same boring buffet food over 3 days; windows could use thicker curtains in winter to insulate it betterLet's see how it goes in May 2014

People who visit Ranthambore generally are looking for a quiet nice sleep after their day trips in the forests. For someone looking to do this and then spend a quiet evening without putting too much strain on the budget; Vinayak is a place to be in.Being a RTDC Hotel; it has all the stamps of a classic Govt. undertaking. However; the staff at the reception is very courteous. They have rooms on the ground and the first floor; however; the place is the Swiss Tents at the back. They are lovely and come with all basic amenities. Excellent if a large group is travelling.In the evening; there is a campfire and cultural show if there are enough people there. The food is homely but heavenly. Breakfast is fresh and wholesum. They even packed us a lunch hamper for our jungle safari the next day. They can also make arrangements for your jungle safari.!!!!..All and all; a fairly decent experience.

Alright; we have been proved wrong. Not all Govt. run place means it lacks hospitality. And nor does it imply that rooms will be unkempt with leaks and creaks all around. RTDC Vinayak was a breath of fresh air with open lawns; well-ventilated rooms; crispy linen; all switches working and brand new geysers. We stayed there for two nights and had occupied five rooms. Few rooms were at the ground floor and a couple on the first. There is an additional common open terrace for the rooms in the first floor. The food; though fixed menu buffet; had adequate spreads for breakfast; lunch and dinner. The non-veg dish was really yummy.Even the hotel staff wasn't grumpy at all. They ensured that facilities are well provided; right from the safari booking assistance; special food requirements; to even organizing cultural programs. All that were provided; might not have the finesse; but no dearth of effort. If someone really wants to visit Ranthambore for the wild life; more than the dip in the pool; suggest you put up with RTDC Vinayak. They provide the best value; for the money you spend. And ofcouse they wish you well! The manager and front office folks said we will see spot a tiger and we did!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Try the rooms on the 1st floor; they have better privacy and an open terrace.

Review_Title: “Very nice place with relaxed environment and great service/staff”
Review_Content: Overall we really enjoyed our stay. The place is quite relaxing with a nice lawn out front; and a nice outdoor seating area in the back. We thought it might literally be in the forest given that it is RTDC; but it is at the end of a line of hotels before entering the forest - but this is fine. Food was fresh and excellent; staff and service was very gift; and they have a nice gift shop also.Our first night did not go that well - it was quite cold outside and the heater didn't work and we only had blankets but no quilts. But the next day they fixed all of this immediately; and our remaining two nights stay went well. Electricity does go occasionally; but nothing major.We really enjoyed our stay and appreciated the service and the relaxing environment - hope to stay here again sometime.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: 201/202 are nice since they are next to an open seating area facing the lawn

Review_Content: Location is good; just on the edge of the buffer zone of the Ranthambhore National Park. Rooms are ok; cleanliness is also good. Staffs are very good and helpful. If you have the online safari booking voucher; you just need to to give it to the reception desk along with the money and documents. They do the rest and the safari gypsy will pick you up from the hotel itself.Buffet dinner and breakfast served as part of the package rates are also good.A very good choice for all budget travelers.

Stayed in the non-A/C room of RTDC Vinayak hotel for 3 Nights.Breakfast and Dinner were included in the room prices. The Hotel is basic; but nice.Staff is friendly and helpful; food served is generally routine; and breakfast is generally repeated.Breakfast contains Toast; butter; jam; omelets; pastas/pohas; puri bhaji tea and coffee.Dinner contains chapatti; 2 options of vegetable dal and rice + sweet (sheera) and 1 non veg . dish.The hotel is best priced; clean; bathrooms are also clean with hot water greaser.Rooms have a small television set with cable connection. Staff is helpful; arranges safari visits for a small fee like all hotels in Ranthambore.Has a nice lawn outside. Closed dining area along with the option to sit outside in the open. There is a provision for bon fire outside dining area.Would recommend stay and will surely return here.

Review_Title: “Not so good; Not so Bad either.”
Review_Content: As a Nature admirer; I and many of us always prefer resort/hotel which is surrounded by Nature. This is where this hotel DISAPPOINTS you. It is located on the main sawai madhopur road; so you will be always surrounded by lots of vehicles. Secondly; this hotel shares its boundary with a Fateh Public School; means you will be always surrounded by the noise of children. SO; WHERE IS THE FEEL AND MOOD OF THE JUNGLE?????????? Before booking this hotel; I had read reviews about it; but unfortunately I did misconception its review with Hotel Castle Jhoomar Baori. My Fault.Nevertheless; the service and food was good. We stayed in Swiss Tents; accommodation and basic facilities were good. In a nutshell; consider this hotel if you are in a tight budget.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: \Swiss Tents on the south side are quieter\""

Review_Content: We were assigned the rooms in the ground floor. The rooms were very basis. Felt they were overpriced for the quality of the room. The property is a decent one. I would suggest to take up a tent instead of the rooms. Please book your safari in advance and only in the route 1 to 5; you can book your safari on-line. The hotel staff are courteous and nice but all are above 40/50 years.They actually never informed us that they have booked us the safari ride in route 6. Avoid the front or last rows of seats if you hire a canter.Hotel staff was very helpful in terms of arranging pick-up and drop through bigger Auto rickshaw (we paid the ride though)
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Take the tent rooms.

Review_Content: Stayed here with my toddler and husband for 3 nights. The staff is courteous and helpful and the food is nice. The location is also good; but that is where the good things about this hotel end!We stayed in their Non Ac room 2 nights and in the Swiss tent for 1 night. On first day itself; somebody was watching through the bathroom window! The window could not have been completely closed; as the latch was broken. Horrible experience and spoiled the mood for the whole trip. The stay in the Swiss Tent; was the worst experience of my life! Awoke to witness a rat sitiing on the pillow. Even the bags; were invaded by rats! The staff informed us; that this is a common feature as the rats come in frequently from the nearby jungle. The tent was shabby; torn and extremely cold; with very poor lighting. No television; no cupboards. Not worth even one-third; the price charged for it. Overall; the hotel is best avoided; if you are a woman or a family with children.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Definitely avoid the Swiss Tents.

Review_Content: Had stayed at Vinayak during the Republic Day weekend;with wife and daughter.Reached there at around 5am and was glad to find someone at the reception at that hour!The hotel was full and since our booking started only from 12pm ... had to wait in the dining hall till a room got vacated.Would appreciate the fact that inspite of being govt run ... the staff was helpful and didn't say NO for the kitchen;though only tea/coffee and bread-butter were served;which was good enough to keep us warm.As with all Govt properties ... the hotel is located very well ... just outside of Swai Madhopur and not too far off from an entry gate of the National Park.The hotel shares its boundary with the Vanyavilas!The hotel has some 10odd tents also ... which seemed to be neat! But the tent was freezing at 8ish ... which we took to kill time while waiting for a room to be vacated.We infact enjoyed the sun outside the tent which was more than welcome relief from the Jan chill!We finally checked in at 9 and the room was decent with minor irritants here and there but then keeping in mind the Govt tag ... you can and should ignore them;lest to make the trip go sour.But yes... when pointed out to a couple of things which needed replacement;the same were managed promptly!Breakfast and dinner being a part of the package were buffet only ... were decent enough but only 1 non-veg item in Dinner was a bad hit.There was bonfire in the evening just outside the dining hall which was enjoyed by almost all guests present there.One can go to the terrace of the hotel from where the hills in the back are visible and so is another hotel asmongst the hills only run by RTDC.All in all ... its a decent Govt run property with decent rooms and food ... and a very well maintained lawn in the front.Had booked for the safari online;but one can make arrangements thru the hotel reception itself. The forest dept used to have the booking office earlier in the hotel compound only ... which has since been closed.But do keep in mind that since the hotel is amongst the last one towards the park ... the canter comes rather full with other visitors picked up enroute.And if can manage the cost ... preferably should take jeeps with lesser no of people as with 14/16 other people scrambling for glimpses ... it can be a big let down.And add to it the noise the vehicles make ... no wonder the sightings are sadly becoming rare!

Review_Title: “A good place to stay with family and children”
Review_Content: I agree with what Gaurav has reviewed about RTDC Vinayak hotel. One can spend 2-3 days with family. Go to see the Ranthambore Tiger Reserve forest; visit Dastkar; a NGO; totally run by village women who make beautiful handicraft things and relax and play in a beautiful green lush lawn of the hotel..

Being a Rajasthan State Govt Hotel; location is good. Connections to Forest officers is good. This is must to figure out tiger sightings and take the safari to the right zone.The hotel price includes breakfast and dinner; the food is closer to home made so it is good.If you are on a day visit; it is a good hotel. For longer trips you would like to live in better luxury where wifi; electricity backup works. Hotel cleanliness is ok. Bedsheets are ok but don't expect a Hilton.Staff is helpful in providing right information.

Hi;The hotel charges are above average (3000/- starting excluding taxes). However the rooms; quality; service etc. are quite below the mark. 1. The rooms are very old fashioned (poor flooring; old marble tiles in the bathroom)2. Hot water managed to come through only after a brief fight with the staff and then a brief struggle by the staff with the plumbing.3. Finally the icing on the cake. We had an additional un-invited guest partner -> a rat; which was respectfully called as 'Chachundar' (called 'shrew' in English) by the staff upon we complaining. Additionally all stories were concocted stating that it has been living there for many generations and cannot be driven out easily. Also the fact that the animal was worshipped by the locals. Hence it was our extreme fortune for having shared a room with the creature.4. A lot of money is fleeced without proper receipts (safari; local gypsy; local auto etc.) 5. Food -> no choice and have to eat what's cooked. Dripping in oil; poor in quality; cleanliness and taste.My point is only that for Rs.3000/- excluding taxes; we expect something much more than the above.The general Tripadvisor ratings prompted us to choose this hotel. However it has turned out to be a total let down. Need to be careful next time (even with Tripadvisor ratings)Regards;Srinivas Bhat
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Never select rooms from the ground floor. We believe the rooms above are of better quality.

Review_Content: Its a RTDC hotel; so location of the hotel is good. Its close to the National Park. Behind is the jungle and you can hear birds in variety. Good clean hotel. Service staff are good and co-operating. Food was very good; I must say. They arrange the trip to National Park and guide in every possible way. I stayed in this hotel two times and both the times my experience was good.

Review_Title: “good; clean rooms; with wildlife right at doorstep; good staff and good food”
Review_Content: spent two nights here; AMAZING. we saw more animals here than at the wildlife park!! the rooms were clean but on the third floor (fair bit of climbing on steepish steps). the food was great and the staff was helpful in providing vital information. We even saw a tiger here and none at the park!!! must stay here and the prices are very reasonable!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: closer to the roof gives a good view of the mountains and even wildlife if you're lucky; but clo...

Review_Content: I had a brief stay of just one night over the weekend. Though the quality of food is just above good; the service is excellent. The manager and staff are courteous and helpful. They get the things done for you and you can focus all your attention on; what else; TIGER. This place is worth every single penny.

I visited the Ranathambhore National Park in Dec'12 and stayed in RTDC's Vinayak Hotel. I visited the place again in June and decided to stay there; so as to be on the safer side... and I was completely delighted! Food quality has improved by several degrees! It was very tasty and with so much less oil. The service aspect also improved quite a bit. Linens and rooms were very (crispy) clean.... and that made it even more delightful. Rest of the things remain - RTDC Vinayak is just 2.5 kms away from the Ranthambhore National Park's gate; and is situated in a very quiet surrounding. You can also enjoy nice walks near the hotel. It is easy to spot wildlife from the hotel itself. The Reception is very helpful in getting information and safari bookings. No room service.

The review is for Winter Season.Our group went to Ranthambore in December.Go for this place for:1. CheapDirt cheap even in season time.2. CleanAll the rooms; toilets and surrounding area are clean3. LocationBeautiful location surrounded by trees and forest4. Food The cook at this place is amazing. The mutton dish that this guy makes is top class. That's what we were gorging on5. Service and StaffThe Service and the staff are the USP for this place. They have helped us in every single way they can to serve us. We had gone in the period when the Gujjars had blocked the rail and roadways. The staff sent a vehicle for us to the station to pick us up and let us stay there giving us 50 % of the rooms price.Tents are a amazing place to stay. For families the rooms are quite nice.The hotel provides you with the vehicles for safari and of course don't miss the stories of the manager about tigress T-18.At the night we had arranged a Folk group around the campfire. Picture this 6 deg .. Open Place .. Different people... Campfire and Rajasthani Folk Songs and dance.Highly Recommend this place
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Family outing - any roomFriends - Only Tents.This recommendation is for Winter Season

Review_Content: Stayed here for 6 nights this year as part of an annual visit; but it may have been the last... The service from the staff and general hospitality was top notch as usual..Was stunned to see 2 additional charges of Rs. 700 each added to my bill on the last morning .. One was for a double occupancy of a room mate that had left earlier in the day and the management was informed about it being a single occupancy well in advance.. Secondly was for some additional meal charges that were not incurred... Had no choice but to pay as this unpleasant surprise was brought up with less than 20 minutes to go for my train (Yes; I did try asking multiple times to settle this the previous evening but everyone was MIA)Not something you would expect from a place that you've been a repeat patron to on 9 occasions; but that's life I guess :(
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Pay online; print different vouchers for different dates when single / double occupancy may create a...

Review_Content: I got a very good deal at this place . We had taken a A/C family room and the room was huge . There is only 1 family room and was nice and clean.It costed us 4600 for 5 ppl with breakfast n dinner. it is one of the safari pick up points

Thanks to the reviews and the ranking at tripadvisor; we decided to stay at this hotel and had an excellent time. The location is nice; the rooms clean (we stayed in the AC rooms) and comfortable. But the best part was the service we received. Having stayed in a lot of RTDC properties earlier in Jaisalmer; Jodhpur; Jaipur and Mount Abu; it was really an unbelievable service level that we saw here. With small kids; we made many requests; hot milk; cold milk; non spicy food etc etc and the staff was always ready to help with a smile. In fact they specially made Rajma chawal for a buffet dinner to cater to the young ones in the hotel. The grounds are well kept and have some play area for the kids. For 2 days that we stayed there; except for the morning safari; we didn't need to step put of the hotel. In the evenings we would step into the ground for a couple of hours of playtime. Even though the hotel is surrounded with forest area; we didn't find mosquitoes in the rooms. For the price you pay here; the hotel is so worth it. Recommended for budget travelers with kids.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: AC rooms on the ground floor are comfortable.

Review_Title: “Brilliant experience with Swiss tents and perfect location for jungle experience”
Review_Content: Brilliant experience with Swiss tents with all basic amenities within budget. These tents are located in hotel premises itself and you can see the jungle from the tents. Even I saw deers and few small animals from the boundary. Very safe; clean and very good service. Recommended.

This hotel is located at a distance of about 5 kms from sawaimadhopur railway station. It has A/C; Non A/C Rooms and swiss tents in season from Oct. to Mar. The tents have a patio in front; spcious and attached with western toilet set and shower. Running hot and cold water.The food is quite good. The Tarrif includes breakfast and dinner.The service is prompt and excellent. The staff is polite co-operative and helpful.The front desk staff arranges safari and taxi for sight-seeing on your request. Being RTDC Hotel the tarrif is most reasonable.The hotel has in-house shop for handicrafts; artificial jwellery and is most reasonably priced.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose a Tent in season or A/C rooms in summer

Review_Content: spoiler alert: the hotel is low in luxury..but if you are not in pursuit of luxury; this is perhaps no better choice in ranthambhore..i had stayed once in their ac room and once in the swiss tents..tents were a steal; clean; but noisy and cold..rooms are cozier but average in comfort..food is homely and cheap..staff is courteous and helpful..property is spacious with a nice lawn..i didnt feel cheated or overtly charged for anything;;in my 4 safaris so far; i have been unlucky;;will be visiting ranthambhore again and going to vinayak for sure...

During out trip to Ranthombore we stayed in this property of RTDC. It is really a pleasant experience. Room was clean; so as bathrooms. The staffs were really helpful. The front desk arranged for our park safari. Food was very tasty. From the room window we could see a part of jungle. Some peacocks were also visible from it and my daughter became very excited. Only one point of concern - As out room was a non AC room; the AC cabinet was seen very poorly covered with a cardboard which was somewhat awkward looking. However this is really a small point; and my family really enjoyed the stay here. It is a very good budget option for Ranthombore travelers.

Review_Title: “good value for money with nice staffs”
Review_Content: after a long Rajasthan trip with three RTDC hotel experiences Vinayak was like a real retreat..we opted for a nonA/C room and it was well beyond our expectation considering other RTDC hotel non A/C rooms...big room with clean linens; toilet; a small covered balcony facing the jungle where we could see peacocks and deer at stones throw distance. the staff both reception and restaurants was helpful and welcoming..food was good..best RTDC experience so far
Room_Tips: Room Tip: rooms on the first floors with jungle view

Review_Title: “Everything you need for a clean efficient budget stay”
Review_Content: RTDC Vinayak provided a clean; comfortable room for two nights; which I had booked online. On arrival late at night; I was greeted by the very friendly and helpful manager who not only checked us in; but did all the paper work for our National Park safaris within minutes. This service is provided free of charge and saves a lot of running around. Our room was on the first floor which has a nice terrace overlooking the front lawns where one can relax. The rooms themselves are very decent; although the furniture and TV showed its age. It is a budget hotel after all; and you spend most of the time in the jungle; so this should not distract from your visit. Our room windows opened out to the back of the hotel; which is the boundary of the National Park. At night; I was awakened by the roar of a tiger; and next morning locals told us of the kill it had made a kilometer or so away near the main road to the park. The food here is very decent; and you can have your breakfast after you return from your morning safari. The staff will be happy to provide a wake up service with tea to help prepare for the early morning start for the safari. The jeeps turn up at the hotel to pick you up. The hotel also has a private souvenir shop selling wildlife themed hats/caps/tshirts; books; DVDs etc. The prices were cheaper than what the vendors charge you at the entrance to the National Park. Internet access for guests is provided free if you ask nicely to use the reception PC. ON our previous visit to Ranthambore; we had stayed at the RTC Castle Jhoomar Baori which is much more expensive as it is classified as a heritage property; but staying at Vinayak was equally pleasant and satisfactory.

We rented couple of swiss tents.The beds; the linens; inside the tent; bathrooms were really really dirty. Tent floors were dirty and broken. It gets really cold inside the tents. Surroundings were also not very clean. Food was good and the night bonfire and cultural program was good.

i hv stayed there with my family from 3 jan 2013 to 6 th jan and i feel excited to stay in this RTDC HOTEL VINAYAK ;;; the rooms are clean and big ;;;;the staff is well mannered and very helpfull; always ready to help;;;;;;;the food is superb feels like having in home only ;;;;;;; LOCATION IS GREAT TOUCHING JUNGLE WALL ;;; ; I WILL STAY IN THIS HOTEL ONLY ON MY NEXT TRIP TO PARK ;;;;;;;my all the best wishes to all staff member of hotel vinayak fo looking us so well

RTDC's Vinayak Hotel is a good accommodation option - it is just 2.5 kms away from the Ranthambhore National Park's gate. Its surrounding is very quite - you can enjoy nice walks near the hotel. One Tiger's territory is just beside the hotel; and if you are lucky; you may spot it. Food is good; with veg/nonveg choices; but they use a lot of oil. Rooms are clean and beds comfortable. The Reception is very helping in getting information and safari bookings. No room service.

Review_Title: “Look for a better Option if you can !!!”
Review_Content: The RTDC Hotel is a very basic hotel with simple amenities; Don't have any high expectations from them. Look for a better Option if you can. if you you are looking for some comfort or style its the wrong place.

Stayed for 2 nights in April 2012 with family. Had booked a suite which was large enough for three of us. Suite was at first floor with a large terrace next to it; used for seating out in the evenings. Hotel is well located and had provided us with reasonably good room service. Nothing luxurious about this hotel; but was truly value for the money we paid.National Park is very near and staff helped us in arranging for the safari. Recommended for families as a budget hotel; if looking for luxury there are more choices nearby.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Look for rooms on the first floor.

Review_Title: “Value For money place for great Wildlife”
Review_Content: Close to the Park. Rooms are nice; spacious; clean and with all amenities. Food is very spicy. The staff are welcoming but a bit laid back like all government hotels. Nice lawn in front. Cultural program & bonfire organised in the evening. Early Morning and evening safaris organised by the hotel. The wildlife is superb.

I do not normally write hotel reviews as I cannot be bothered; but I thought that I would make an exception for the Hotel Vinayak.I stayed there with my girlfriend for two nights at the end of June 2012 and the hotel had very little positive aspects to it; especially when considering the price you are paying for it. Our room was infested with ants (big Indian ants; remember) which were all over the floor and scaling the toilet seat as well. The room besides the ants; was acceptable. The food was far from nice; although the breakfast was OK. They were helpful with organising safaris but this was also expensive. All of these aspects are commonplace in quite a few budget hotels in India and although they are not what you want your hotel that you're staying at to be like; you come to expect it when travelling India on the cheap. Except the Vinayak isn't especially cheap and the worst experience of all was one of the drunk staff members trying to force his way into my room in which my girlfriend was lying on the bed in; half-naked. All the while the staff member was laughing his head off and leering away.

Actually visited this property 4 times since my last review and felt it was time to move them up from Average to Very Good.. Here are the reasons why..Rooms continue to be maintained very well. While the pricing has gone up almost 250%; they have also increased their levels of upkeep marginally well...Good efforts put in by the management to create a small waterhole at the back of the property.. We spotted a Fox and numerous birds over here right from our balcony..Food continues to remain great value for money.. Just don't appreciate the over priced buffet breakfast which is forced as part of the package... Has less value for money when you come back from a morning safari with only half an hour before it wraps up..Service is as good as it gets for this price.. Some of the staff are very pleasant; others a bit cranky.. You should avoid a few and not expect Four Seasons kind of service here :)

Review_Title: “Not surprised this is number one ranking”
Review_Content: We negotiated a good deal in this pleasant hotel. We had chalet. The restaurant is good offering buffets. The second night the buffet was outside. The service was very pleasant and attentive. We arranged two safaris from the hotel and were recommended to take the canter rather than the jeep on the basis that the canter is cheaper; higher and you see just as much. The pool is pleasant and clean.Lots of mosquitoes in the evening. Not much doing in Ranthambore; but the cleintele were friendly and international and we had a great time.The owner was delightful and remembered our names.They change money here too.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: When we went; the main hotel rooms seemed very hot so we opted for a chalet. Do check the aircon

Review_Content: Vinayak is a good option for Ranthambore. It is located away from all the other hotels so is relatively more peaceful.The kitchen staff was often reluctant to serve dinner early (served after 8.30pm). We had made online bookings for the safari and were a little confused about how we would pay the fee for the canter/guide (that was not charged while making the online booking).You are expected to pay this fee very early in the morning at the Ranthambore Office (located about 5-6 kms away from the hotel). If the fee is not paid on the morning of the safari; the Park authorities cancel your online booking.The most convenient way to handle this is to get in touch with the reception staff. They take about INR 405 per person (330 for the petrol canter; 25 for the guide... and the remaining is a commission I guess!). This way you don't have to go stand in the queue at 5.30am :)
I and my 6 friends stayed in swiss tents . They were very comfortable . Loved and enjoyed every bit of it . Unforgettable
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Book swiss tents in winters . Cool and cosy

Review_Content: this was a lovely hotel in a lovely town but it wasnt quite up to par. The rooms were cheap though and needed a lot of work and maintenance. They had hot water on a cold morning and that was a huge plus! The breakfast was nothing to write home about.

This RTDC hotel gets 5 stars from me because in addition to being clean; friendly; cheap; with spacious rooms; friendly service and the room service with tea at odd hours; we spent a wonderful time on the roof watching the stars. For the first time in my life; I saw the milky way; and I can thank Sawai Madhopur and the Ranthambore National Park for that experience.The other wonderful and hair-raising thing that happened to us during our stay in this hotel was this: after our nice dinner and tea; we star gazed for a long time and then went to our room to sleep. In the middle of the night; we woke up from the sound of -what we thought was- an angry cat doing more than just purring in the night.
