Because we were tired; we didn't give it much thought and went back to sleep. I even thought I heard the cat just outside our room door. Good thing I didn't open the door to check. In the morning; when we put the two and two together; we realized that was no mere house cat at our door. We were in the middle of Ranthambore National Park... What were we thinking?Anyway; that little incident got us quite happy and excited. Thank God there are some tigers left in Ranthambore. And we thanked our lazy rear ends for convincing us to not get up; open our door and shoo that \cat\" away in the night.Breakfast in the morning was WONDERFUL. We asked for Alu Parathas and they were absolutely fresh & Delicious. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Ofcourse; it helped that we were the only ones in the hotel that night!"

Review_Title: “Slightly dated; with a 'Dad's Army' feel; but great.”
Review_Content: We arrived on NYE and were given a whiskey as entered - loved it already! Very beige and dated but the rooms were clean; running hot water; friendly staff and breakfast and lunch were included in the price. They can arrange safari's from the hotel; which is very close to the park boundary too. Don't expect a sleep in - some people wake at 5:30 am to go on safari and the corridors are noisy. But you're not here to sleep in anyway; the tigers are beckoning!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Ask them for a room away from groups/families as it can get noisy very early.

Review_Content: A bit far away; is one of the last stops on rhanthambore road near the oberoi vantage vilas. Otherwise a great place to relax with friendly service and spacious rooms. 2600rps for a double suite with ac.Do not book a safari for balas (zone 8). There are few animals there... Best is zone1-5 the main park; or 2nd is kundal (zone 6). I did kundal and saw 2 tigers (was very lucky)!!!

Review_Title: “A functional hotel which can be made better”
Review_Content: There are certain things which goes for the Hotel: - the location is very good. Its very close to the jungle and provides a beautiful backdrop from the terrace - the staff is courteous and helpfulAnd then there are things which can certainly do with some improvement: - biggest among them is food. very basic fare available. Items on menu are not available at all times and the taste can also definitely be improves - the stay can be made more comfortable with modernising the rooms and bathrooms a bit (one plug point is simply not adequate in these days of multiple gadgets)That said; the hotel has to find ways of making the travellers stay more interesting. Ranthambore doesnt have anything besides the national park (and the fort / temple). If the traveller has missed the safari in one of the mornings / evenings of his stay; the hotel should provide some options to make the his time spent worthwhile. It can be a nature trail; some activity; spa anything. But right now; its just a room and food available and any extra time spent can become boring.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Have heard swiss tents are not very comfortable but havent tried them personally.

Review_Content: the location is the best part about this hotel. its dead on in the park. The food was simply ok; actually it was below par. The rooms were small; but comfortable. It is a very good property but needs a fair amount of maintenance. they helped us with our safari tour when we missed ours on day 1; very helpful that way

Review_Title: “Hotel Vinayak was a very decent hotel”
Review_Content: I stayed at the Hotel Vinayak with my family in Sep 2011. Clean AC rooms. Decent helpful staff. Swiss tents are a option but not very secure due to the cloth flap door (the bathrooms attached to the Swiss tents are good and clean). Food was decent and tasty. Biggest (and only) problem was that for any change to the Safari booking; getting local transport to the Forest Booking office sowntown was a painful thing to arrange. If you do booking the safari online from before; the Hotel sends a chap on your behalf to do this; so it is not very troublesome in that case. BUT if you have to make any chages to a online booking; then you have to do it yourself and it becomes very difficult to do. Got very good tips on wildlife viewing spots. A definite good choice for stay in Ranthanbore. S.Kar
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Rooms on the first floor have more sun coming in. All rooms have a bay window bed with a mattress an...

Review_Content: Plus- strong RTDC network- nice; peaceful location- restaurant facility available- hotel has a nice souvenir shop for shopaholics- arranged for our Safari trip-free buffet breakfast- luxurious tents- big facilityMinus(-)- too spicy; oily food- exorbitan

Review_Title: “Best place to start the Jugle Safari!”
Review_Content: I stayed at this hotel for four days during my visit to the Ranthambore National Park. From check-in till check-out; the hospitality was at its best here and though I was alone; the staff were so friendly that I didn't feel I was travelling alone! I loved the food and they customize and cook anything we need even though it is not on the menu! The room was very clean but the only thing that scared me were the wall lizards outside the room. Though they can sneak inside the room during summer months. There is a huge lawn/garden in front of the hotel to enjoy a nice evening breeze! Overall it was a great stay here and would definitely go back during my future visits to Ranthambore!
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Always book well ahead and choose the AC room during summer.

Review_Title: “\ COMFORTABLE & GOOD TO STAY IN RANTHAMBORE IS.....\"”"
Review_Content: HOTEL VINAYAK ONLY;HERE I VISIT RANTHAMBORE FOR LAST 7 SEVEN YEARS AND MY EXPERIENCE TO STAY IN BCOZ OF GOOD STAFF LIKE RAJKUMARJI; BABULAJI;JAGATBHAI; DAVID THE CHEFF AND ALL .The restaurant cheff david make is simple and good the food is decent in taste and serving size and a decent place to stay where the experience suits the budget or the other way around.

Review_Title: “Best Place to be for wildlife Enthusiast”
Review_Content: I have been visiting Ranthambhore for past 20 years and for all these year i have been staying at RTDC hotels. I have been staying at RTDC Vinayak since it started. I have always felt homely; because of all your need are taken care. services regarding food; rooms safari bookings are always handled nicely. Rajkumarji has always taken care of all our need and he always take care of each tourist personally; Manager Mr. Soni; babulalji; jagatsingh; Bajran and David the cook are always ready to help you. I would recommend RTDC Vinayak to all nature lovers and wildlife entusiast. Good service; food and good value for money.

I am visiting Ranthambhor since last 26 years twice in a year.I had started staying in vinayak Hotel when It was having only 4 rooms.Now It is a big Hotel.Raj kumar is a person who has worked hard to flourish this Hotel.He is a very hard working person.At present other staff members are also very co operative.Babulalji;Jagatsing waitor;David cook; Manager sahab all are nice person.They all are taking good care of the guests.I love this Hotel and will continue to stay in vinayak in future.I fill homely atmosphere at this Hotel Because of It's Present staff.Now all facilitys at this Hotel are improved.

Review_Title: “Second trip to Hotel Vinayak in the Month of May'11”
Review_Content: This time I found an issue with the airconditioning ofthe hotel rooms...The window a/cs fitted in all the rooms are not placed in appropriate d.irection; which led to ineffective air condintioning in hot summers.I was there for a single night stay this time on 20th of may'11.

Review_Title: “BEWARE OF MR RAJKUMAR HE IS A RUDE MAN”
Review_Content: Dear all iam Gujarat and i stayed at Vinayak RTDC Ranthambore it was bad experience the behaviour of staff `was very bad they were drunk most of the times and There is a man called Rajkumar he is the booking clerk and he is very much opportunistic he asks for money from the customers he speaks bad about all his staff like Mr.Babulal Meena and Mr.Soni he says babulal is a thief and Mr Soni is a old man healso speaks bad aboout all guests . I was heartbroken ;he promises false safaris and takes money against the saffaris no receipt is given to the customer he is a corrupt man he eats all the money .The food is alos very lousy and it was not at all tasty .Mr Rajkumar should be transferred elsewhere heis not worth staying at that hotel they also make false bills they charge alot of taxes. I will never go back to Vinayak how can Rajasthan Tourism keep up like this . Its a sad episode.

Definitely budget hotel; i.e. very inexpensive but average rooms (govt maintained). The service was great though; lots of attendants. Location is ideal for safari (last pick up; first drop off). Be sure to take a blanket for early morning safari; mighty cold with wind-chill. No wifi connectivity; but manager allowed us to use his computer for a bit. Outdoor area was very nice; peaceful and green; so be sure to eat meals outdoors. Overall good value for money.

Over all nice experience; with value for money preposition in mind; staff was helpfull in general. Mr Babu lal ji Meena at the reception/office was very helpfull in particular for arranging National park visits (safari) in tatkal quota as reservations for park visits(safari) are the the first and utmost important and the trickist part of this trip which are available online only through www.rajasthanwildlife.in as Regular Quota reservations where all sold out and tatkal quota (very few seats) which is available online just for few hours the previous day in between 11.00 am to 5.00 pm for next day morning safari and 7.00 pm to next day morning 9.00 am for the evening safari.Food in general was ok; but had too much of garlic in it's preperations which can be avoided by informing the kitchen very well in advance for your any special requirements.

We booked this hotel after seeing reviews on tripadvisor. Initially we booked swiss tents ; just for getting an experience of staying in a tent house. Since was turning cold in December; we called up the hotel to check if it would be fine to stay in a tent. They responded positively saying that it is not very cold yet.So we booked swiss tents through the RTDC site. On reaching there; we also did not feel too cold. But suddently in night the tempratures dropped ; and even 2 blankets were not enough. In the morning we booked rooms which were available. One non-AC and one suite. Swiss tent is good experince only when it is not too hot or too cold. Swiss tents do not have any TV. Rooms were comfortable and nice. We did not have any problem second night that we stayed there. Restraunt is fine. they do not have everything that is listed on the menu. But they cook on special request. My daughter stomach was upset; we asked them to prepare khicdi for us and they agreed. Really nice and friendly staff.

this is not at all a good hotel. Old swiss tents which are shabby. food is as bad as it can get and worst is false assurances time and again. Only thing good is that this being a govt hotel and still nobody wants to rip you off on money. My vote for this hotel is still a BIG NO

Hotel's staff is very helpful (quite unlike other govt. run hotels). Stayed in Swiss tents; these are small but clean tents with attached Lat-Bath. Garden area is good and one can spend time there in evenings as well as early morning..Food is ok. Breakfast for Rs 210 isn't worth; but there are no options. Ranthambhore Park is beautiful; covered Zone 3;5 and 6 is 3 safaris...still couldn't see tiger due to rains (in November) But all zones give a really different picture of forest...just awesome...

Hotel Vinayak... is really the best value for money in ranthambore... tents for the ones who want to enjoy the jungle life... for 800 bucks.. really great.. Best food in restaurant.. with facility for campfire.. great garden... and best location...Trust me this is a real value for money space... one should be really try this to believe it...

Visiting Ranthambhore is more about wanting to photograph Tigers than experience creature comforts.After paying a bomb for Tiger Moon Resort on our previous trip; we decided to try RTDC's Hotel Vinayak and came away reasonably satisfied.The rooms are standard and have no aesthetic appeal. Comfortable beds and decent amount of space to move about the room. The location of the rooms; overlooking the Aravalli Hills; is the most amazing part and you may be lucky to see Vultures soaring overhead and making best use of the warm currents of air.The restaurant is simple and the food is decent in taste and serving size. Stick to the Indian curries though; our attempts at trying out their Chinese cuisine wasn't very appealing.All in all; a decent place to stay where the experience suits the budget or the other way around. Don't take it up if you want to enhance your stay with one of the lodges that offer a more cultural and appealing experience.

Review_Title: “we recommend to stay at vinayak resort ranthambhore”
Review_Content: we had an excellent trip at Ranthambhore a part from safari we were provide a good service at vinayak resort at Ranthambhore . As we were in group of 21 people were take good care by resort staff. food was excellent; room& tents were clean good water supply good views of mountains from top. peacock right in front of our tents. good sight seing from room. in short good service & good stay at vinayak resort... we in fact recommend readers to stay at vinayak resort & enjoy the hospitality of vinayk resort. staff .one thing we forgot to mentioned they also arrange for canter& gypsy for safari & forts visit on request.

Vinayak is a good basic hotel. It is clean and affordable. The food was excellent - home made Indian style without the extra greasiness that is found in most hotels. The staff were nice and made for a pleasant stop over in Ranthambore.
a good hotel in the ranthambore national park and worth staying in. gives exactly the feel of wild life.

We were 2 couples and checked in on the 7th Dec 09. We had booked 2 standard rooms well in advance from Mumbai. Its pretty cool this time around the year and you dont even require fans during afternoon leave alone ac's. The lawn; lobby and the rooms are really neat; clean; decent and well looked after if you caompare to any private hotel. We checked in at noon and after just freshing up ourselves headed for the safari which is a wonderful experience. We had our dinner in the same hotel and to our suprise it was really well made though it serves veg & non veg we got a oppertunity to check out their kitchen as we were hesitant being jains. We were really amazed to see the cleanliness maintained in the kitchen though it wasnt like the one of a five star but it had maintained basic cleanliness. The food is amazingly simple and satisfying. They even allowed us to cook Maggy noddles in their kitchen. next day we again went for the safari in the early morning at 5.00 am and on returning we had a grand breakfast courtsey some one else (dont know who exactly) but it was good; grand and filling with many veg options. Though they dont have a wide spread menu their food is satisfying for our taste buds. They also book canter seats for your safaris and also arrange for taxis if you feel like oaming locally. Overall we had a great experience in Ramthambore & Hotel Vinayak. The hotel has a charm of its own. Ps They also have Tents.

Situated at govindpur; dhenkanal; sneha hotel nd resort is one of the best budget hotels i've ever stayed at. The hotel has restaurant facility and food can be served to your room too if you like. Room service is excellent; the hill view is stunning and the food is just awesome. Rooms are quite spacious. The bathroom is big and most importantly; everything is neat nd clean. Overall; i got a first class experience that can fit in my wallet.charges-rooms-800-1200 per night.food-standard restaurant prices.The only drawback is that there is no market nearby; so go packed and take everything you need. Still; in case of any emergency; the service will be happy to help.

Review_Title: “Mr M Boro; Guwahati ....excellent stay at dhenkanal a small town in odisha”
Review_Content: last month i had to travel to odisha in an official tour. i was forced to stay at a small town in odisha due to some unavoidable official job. i was wondering where to stay as i dont hav any idea abut the place and people. I did not find any difficulties to locate a good hotel ... Sneha Hotel ...on NH side bcoz of its location. when i enter into the hotel .. i find the hotel staff are very polite and helpful... in fact they help me to visit to some nearby tourist spots...food was excellent....all the varieties like south indian/noth indian/Chinese was available and served with a smile. my 3 days stay was very pleasant stay. it was quite affordable stay at dhenkanal. my thax to all staff of the hotel. next time i visit odisha definitely i wil com and stay here.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: all the rooms are spacious and in excellent condition

Review_Content: Nice hotel with nice view. Awesome room with awesome facilities. The hotel have restaurant onsite and too food quality is good. The rooms too big with descent facility. Had a great experience at my stay.The food is A+ quality and the rooms are spacious.

Pleasantly surprised by the amenities offered by this boutique hotel. The food is A+ quality and the rooms are spacious. The location is conveniently located by national highway and outskirts of the city - so you don't have to enter the city and deal with the heavy traffic. The service is awesome and the staffs are very polite.- AB
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Go for the hillview side rooms. You can see a nice view from your room windows...

Review_Content: Stayed at this hotel on my long drive back to Cuttack. Had a great experience at my stay. The location was easy to find; the staff were friendly and professional; the room was clean; and the area seemed safe. The menu has a good variety to choose from. I ordered room service couple of times; there was a slight delay in getting my food; but that was a non-issue since the food was absolutely delicious. The cafe also offers a good choice of snacks both packaged and freshly prepared.

I had gone with my wife to Hotel Leela on Feb 10 for leisure. I had a very good time there as the service was very niece and if it comes to hospitalisation it is excellent. It made us to come again and again.

If you are in Tiruvannamalai you obviously are not looking for western luxury. I stayed one night in March. It was clean enough; the bed was reasonably comfortable; the air conditioning worked fine; the room was quiet enough (early morning noise from the staff; normal in India). The restaurant was quite good. The location is on a quiet street; a 5 minute walk from the temple complex; ATM around the corner. I had no hot water; so a cold shower.

Review_Title: “Its very enjoyment travel with trishul hotel.”
Review_Content: It is a very nice experience when i was in Trishul hotel in tiruvannamalai; paisaa vasool experience; specially the room service and food is very nice. it is very near to temple.rooms are very nice. i like to prefer this hotel only.

We stayed at this hotel on 14/01/2014.We booked the hotel through internet and once the rooms are confirmed by the management through mail it is hassle free to get rooms upon reaching the hotel.The rooms are cozy and room service is also good.The TV inside the room is outdated and the channels are not that clear and mostly Tamil channels are only available.They have a restaurant and a bar and a small parking space for cars.The food is good in the restaurant.Chicken chettinad;chicken masala;chappatis and netthily(a kind of fish) fry were good.Complimentary breakfast is provided which is included in room tariff.The spread for the breakfast is quite good(bread;idly;upma;dosa;idiappam;pongal;vadai) and also was tasty. Arunachala temple is less than 5 minute walk from this hotel.Ramana mahirshi ashram is about 3-4 km from this hotel.An auto from Tiruvanamali bus stand to this hotel will cost around 30-40 Rs.Book your room through internet before arrival

It is a very nice experience when i was in Trishul hotel in tiruvannamalai; paisaa vasool experience; specially the room service and food is very nice. it is very near to temple.rooms are very nice. i like to prefer this hotel only.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: AC rooms are very good

Hotel_Name_City: Urumbi Hill Palace Plantation Resort Idukki
Review_Title: “Unpolluted nature which refreshes your body and mind !!!!!!”
Review_Content: Urumbikara; a place where you find total solitude... no mobile... no shops... no TV....no motor vehicles.....no plastic ........ and its really depict... at least some part of our nature is still remain unpolluted. The hospitality and food at Urumbi Hill Palace was very good. Couple of days stay here will definitely recharge you. If you go with family with small children; you should keep snacks for your little ones as no shops are available at the top. But you will get good food as per your early orders. They makes food for you only. Plantation visit; trekking; view points like Madama Kulam; Suicide point; water falls etc are beyond explanation.
Room_Tips: Room Tip: If you like to have a sleep with the sounds of a water falls prefer rooms near water falls. (Rs. 300...

Hotel_Name_City: Urumbi Hill Palace Plantation Resort Idukki
Review_Content: Absolutely a haven for true nature lovers.....mountain side; waterfalls; plantation; trekking routes; great climate coupled with good service.....You will need to engage a 4 wheel drive Jeep from the bottom of the mountain in Yendayar (Near Mundakayam; Kerala) if you don't have a 4x4 and the drive up (about 8 km which takes close to an hour) is thrilling. Finally you reach a beautiful 5 room Resort nicely perched atop a mountain about 3000+ ft above sea level. The resort is spectacularly furnished predominantly with antique collections a the sweet sound of a waterfall beside it. Around the property are expansive Tea and Cardamom plantations as well as well laid out trekking routes which can take you up to 4500+ ft. The property is managed by Mr. Sebastian and his family who apart from being patient and courteous also ensure that you are served with good food especially local Kerala delicacies. No TV's; Fans; AC and limited mobile coverage means that you are almost cut off from civilization. They also offer Barbeques; Grills; camp Fires ...etc as well as a Jeep Safari for those interested. To top it all check out the sunset picture I have uploadedAll in all....a great destination which I definitely want to return to.....A lovely place to unwind....
Room_Tips: Room Tip: Choose a Room by the Waterfall with a sitout facing it and a Fireplace within

Hotel_Name_City: Urumbi Hill Palace Plantation Resort Idukki
Review_Content: The ambience and the climate over there tells it all. The energy level at that place. The places we went for Jeep Safari is beyond explanation. The most beautiful and energised place. The water falls;the rivers all has a story to tell. The service part has to be experienced.
